Optimization problem formulation; optimization using calculus of variations; linear programming; nonlinear optimization; global optimization; generalized optimality criteria and dual methods; sensitivity analysis; multilevel and decomposition techniques; shape and topology optimization.Formerly numbered Engineering Mechanics 641. Maximum Credits: 3

A E 644.course_description: A E 644 - Turbulent Flow  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): A E 515  and A E 550 .Nature of turbulence based on simple flow observations and a theoretical basis for interpreting and predicting the behaviors of specialized turbulent flow problems. Maximum Credits: 3

A E 651.course_description: A E 651 - Theory of Elastic Stability  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): A E 310  and graduate standing in aerospace engineering.Stability of elastic systems. Differential equations of stability by summation of forces and moments, and by the variational method. Applications.Formerly numbered Aerospace Engineering 727 and Engineering Mechanics 727. Maximum Credits: 3

A E 670.course_description: A E 670 - Optimal Control  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): A E 320 , E E 420 , or M E 330 .Applications in aerospace engineering to include Hamilton-Jacobi-Bellman equation, maximum principle, optimal control of dynamic systems, and parameter optimization. Fuel-optimal, linear quadratic optimal control, and time-optimal problems. Maximum Credits: 3

A E 671.course_name: Non Destructive Evaluation: Theory and Application
A E 671.course_description: A E 671 - Non Destructive Evaluation: Theory and Application  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNO - Letter (No Cr/NC) Prerequisite(s): Upper division or graduate standing.Introduction to the fundamental principles and applications of Non-Destructive Evaluation (NDE) techniques for aerospace structures. To focus on ultrasonic and infrared thermography inspections; additional topics may vary. Experimental laboratory demonstrations will support in-class lectures.

A E 676.course_description: A E 676 - Advanced Astrodynamics  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC - Letter (Cr/NC OK) Prerequisite(s): A E 320 or equivalent course.Advanced topics of astrodynamics, focusing on the two-body orbital problem, spacecraft maneuvers, Kepler’s problem, Lambert’s problem, orbit determination, N-body methods, special perturbation techniques for solving Keplerian and non-Keplerian problems, Space Domain Awareness (SDA), and efficient algorithms for orbital propagation and navigation.

A E 678.course_description:
A E 678 - State-Space Flight Control  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): A E 440  with a grade of C (2.0) or better, or instructor consent for students with non-SDSU undergraduate degrees.
 State space methods of analysis and design of continuous and discrete-time linear systems. Coordinate transformations, controllability, observability of continuous and discrete systems. Lyapunov stability analysis. Detectability, pole placement, stabilizability. Minimal order observers. Aircraft and spacecraft flight control system analysis and design.
  Maximum Credits: 3

A E 696.course_description: A E 696 - Advanced Topics in Aerospace Engineering  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Advanced topics in aerospace structural mechanics and design to include non-linear elasticity, plasticity, analysis of plates and shells, fracture mechanics, thermal stress analysis, fatigue analysis, non-linear aeroelasticity, advanced topics in finite element methods, structural optimization and reliability analysis.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 12Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

A E 731.course_description: A E 731 - Aeroelasticity  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): A E 611  and A E 620 .Fluid-structure interaction and its static and dynamic effects on airplanes. Unsteady aerodynamics, static aeroelastic instability (divergence), aileron reversal, sweep effects, doublet lattice method, dynamic aeroelastic instability (flutter), computational dynamic aeroelasticity using NASTRAN.Formerly numbered Engineering Mechanics 731. Maximum Credits: 3

A E 797.course_description: A E 797 - Research  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of graduate adviser.Research in engineering. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

A E 798.course_description: A E 798 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of staff; to be arranged with department chair and instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 3Maximum Credit Statement: three units applicable to a master’s degree.

A E 799A.course_description: A E 799A - Thesis or Project  Units: 3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): An officially appointed thesis committee and advancement to candidacy.Preparation of a project or thesis for the master’s degree. Maximum Credits: 3

A E 799B.course_description: A E 799B - Thesis or Project Extension  Units: 0 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Prior registration in Thesis or Project 799A with an assigned grade symbol of RP.Registration required in any semester or term following assignment of RP in Course 799A in which the student expects to use the facilities and resources of the university; also student must be registered in the course when the completed thesis is granted final approval. Maximum Credits: 0

A E 799C.course_description: A E 799C - Comprehensive Examination Extension  Units: 0 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Completion or concurrent enrollment in degree program courses.Registration required of students whose only requirement is completion of the comprehensive examination for the master’s degree. Registration in 799C limited to two semesters. Maximum Credits: 0

A E 661.course_name: Introduction to Static and Dynamic Aeroelasticity
A E 661.course_description: A E 661 - Introduction to Static and Dynamic Aeroelasticity  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Fluid-structure interaction and its static and dynamic effects on airplanes. Aileron reversal, doublet lattice method, dynamic aeroelastic instability (flutter), static aeroelastic instability (divergence), sweep effects, unsteady aerodynamics; computational dynamic aeroelasticity using NASTRAN.Formerly numbered Aerospace Engineering 731 Maximum Credits: 3

A S 100A.course_name: Heritage and Values of the United States Air Force
A S 100A.course_description: A S 100A - Heritage and Values of the United States Air Force  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and four hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): Reserve Officer Training Corps membership, or those eligible to pursue a commission with instructor consent.Overview of Air Force basic characteristics, missions, and organizations. Laboratory to include applied principles of motivation, organizational behavior, participative group management in solving problems, and time management.

A S 100B.course_name: Heritage and Values of the United States Air Force
A S 100B.course_description: A S 100B - Heritage and Values of the United States Air Force  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and four hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): Reserve Officer Training Corps membership, or those eligible to pursue a commission with instructor consent.Overview of Air Force basic characteristics, missions, and organizations. Laboratory to include applied solving problems, and time management.

A S 101A.course_name: Heritage and Values of the United States Air Force
A S 101A.course_description: A S 101A - Heritage and Values of the United States Air Force  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Overview of the United States Air Force to include basic characteristics, missions, and organization. Maximum Credits: 1Note: Open to non-minors who wish to explore the Air Force.

A S 101B.course_name: Heritage and Values of the United States Air Force
A S 101B.course_description: A S 101B - Heritage and Values of the United States Air Force  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Overview of the United States Air Force to include basic characteristics, missions, and organization. Maximum Credits: 1Note: Open to non-minors who wish to explore the Air Force.

A S 200A.course_description: A S 200A - Team and Leadership Fundamentals  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and four hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): Reserve Officer Training Corps membership, or those eligible to pursue a commission with instructor consent. A S 100A  and A S 100B , or concurrent registration in A S 101A  and A S 101B .Lecture includes development and foundations of cadet leadership for the individual and team. Laboratory to include applied principles of motivation, organizational behavior, participative group management in solving problems, and time management.

A S 200B.course_description: A S 200B - Team and Leadership Fundamentals  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and four hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): Reserve Officer Training Corps membership, or those eligible to pursue a commission with instructor consent. A S 100A  and A S 100B , or concurrent registration in A S 101A  and A S 101B .Lecture includes development and foundations of cadet leadership for the individual and team. Laboratory to include applied principles of motivation, organizational behavior, participative group management in solving problems, and time management.

A S 201A.course_description: A S 201A - Team and Leadership Fundamentals  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): For AFROTC cadets: Completion of A S 100A  and A S 100B , or concurrent registration in A S 101A  and A S 101B .Overview of the United States Air Force to include basic characteristics, missions, and organization. Maximum Credits: 1Note: Open to non-minors who wish to explore the Air Force.

A S 201B.course_description: A S 201B - Team and Leadership Fundamentals  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): For AFROTC cadets: Completion of A S 100A  and A S 100B , or concurrent registration in A S 101A  and A S 101B .Overview of the United States Air Force to include basic characteristics, missions, and organization. Maximum Credits: 1Note: Open to non-minors who wish to explore the Air Force.

A S 233.course_description: A S 233 - Field Training Unit  Units: 2-3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Required for advanced cadets, military orientation, and flight familiarization. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Credit granted for field training camp on basis of individual student application with approval of Aerospace Studies department chair.

A S 300A.course_description: A S 300A - Leading People and Effective Communication  Units: 4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Three lectures and four hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): Reserve Officer Training Corps membership, or those eligible to pursue a commission with instructor consent. Completion of A S 100A  and A S 100B , or A S 101A  and A S 101B  and A S 200A  and A S 200B , or A S 201A  and A S 201B . Coursework may be waived for prior enlisted service cadets.Lecture includes advanced experiences and skills in communication, leadership and management in supervised environments. Laboratory to include coordinating and organizing activities, exercise group planning, leadership development, management and problem-solving skills. Maximum Credits: 4

A S 300B.course_description: A S 300B - Leading People and Effective Communication  Units: 4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Three lectures and four hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): Reserve Officer Training Corps membership, or those eligible to pursue a commission with instructor consent. Completion of A S 100A  and A S 100B , or A S 101A  and A S 101B  and A S 200A  and A S 200B , or A S 201A  and A S 201B . Coursework may be waived for prior enlisted service cadets.Lecture includes advanced experiences and skills in communication, leadership, and management in supervised environments. Laboratory to include coordinating and organizing activities, exercise group planning, leadership development, management and problem-solving skills. Maximum Credits: 4

A S 400A.course_name: National Security Affairs/Preparation for Active Duty
A S 400A.course_description: A S 400A - National Security Affairs/Preparation for Active Duty  Units: 4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Three lectures and four hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): Reserve Officer Training Corps membership, or those eligible to pursue a commission with instructor consent. Completion of A S 100A  and A S 100B , or A S 101A  and A S 101B  and A S 200A  and A S 200B , or A S 201A  and A S 201B  and A S 300A  and A S 300B . Coursework may be waived for prior enlisted service cadets.Lecture includes roles of military officers in American society and complex political and social issues facing military professions. Laboratory to include coordinating and organizing activities, exercise group planning, leadership development, management and problem-solving skills. Maximum Credits: 4

A S 400B.course_name: National Security Affairs/Preparation for Active Duty
A S 400B.course_description: A S 400B - National Security Affairs/Preparation for Active Duty  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Three lectures and four hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): Reserve Officer Training Corps membership, or those eligible to pursue a commission with instructor consent. Completion of A S 100A  and A S 100B , or A S 101A  and A S 101B  and A S 200A  and A S 200B , or A S 201A  and A S 201B  and A S 300A  and A S 300B . A S 400A . Coursework may be waived for prior enlisted service cadets.Lecture includes roles of military officers in American society and complex political and social issues facing military professions. Laboratory to include coordinating and organizing activities, exercise group planning, leadership development, management and problem-solving skills. Maximum Credits: 4

A S 499.course_description: A S 499 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of Aerospace Studies department chair. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6

AFRAS 101.course_name: Introduction to Africana Studies: Social and Behavioral Sciences
AFRAS 101.course_description: AFRAS 101 - Introduction to Africana Studies: Social and Behavioral Sciences  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Interdisciplinary introduction of African American thought and behavior. Subject areas include social systems, economic empowerment, self development, family dynamics, use of power, cognitive styles, interethnic communication and international relations. Review of relevant literature in social and behavioral sciences.Formerly numbered Africana Studies 101A. Maximum Credits: 3Note: This course satisfies the ethnic studies [ES] requirement.

AFRAS 102.course_name: An Afrocentric Response to Generational Trauma
AFRAS 102.course_description: AFRAS 102 - An Afrocentric Response to Generational Trauma  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Generational trauma to African Americans resulting from Black Lives Matter movement, Jim Crow, Maafa, and Reconstruction. Physiological, psychological, and social impacts of generational trauma. Wholeness and healing. Maximum Credits: 3Note: This course satisfies the ethnic studies [ES] requirement.

AFRAS 120.course_description: AFRAS 120 - Composition  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Satisfaction of the SDSU Written Communication Assessment requirement. (See “Graduation Requirements ” section of catalog.) Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required.Designed to develop and enhance composition and reading skills. Focus on writing skills that contribute to academic growth and development. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Not open to students with credit in a higher-numbered composition course or AMIND 120  or CCS 111B  or LING 100B  or RWS 100  [or ECL 100 ] or RWS 105B .

AFRAS 140.course_description: AFRAS 140 - Oral Communication  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Practice in speaking, critical listening, reasoning and organizing. Theory and techniques of communications used to evaluate the effect they have on the lives of Blacks and others. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Not open to students with credit in CCS 111A  or COMM 103 .

AFRAS 170A.course_description: AFRAS 170A - Afro-American History  Units: 3 GE-AIGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC American history from a Black perspective. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Satisfies the American Institutions requirement in American history and United States Constitution. This course satisfies the ethnic studies [ES] requirement.

AFRAS 170B.course_description: AFRAS 170B - Afro-American History  Units: 3 GE-AIGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC American history from a Black perspective. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Satisfies the American Institutions requirement in American history and California government. This course satisfies the ethnic studies [ES] requirement.

AFRAS 200.course_name: Intermediate Expository Writing and Research Fundamentals
AFRAS 200.course_description: AFRAS 200 - Intermediate Expository Writing and Research Fundamentals  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Satisfaction of the SDSU Written Communication Assessment requirement and AFRAS 120  or AMIND 120  or CCS 111B  or LING 100B  or RWS 100  [or ECL 100 ] or RWS 105B . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Test scores or verification of exemption; copy of transcript.Development of intermediate expository writing skills and application of practical research principles. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Not open to students with credit in AMIND 225 , CCS 200 , LING 200 , or RWS 200  [or ECL 200 ].

AFRAS 240.course_description: AFRAS 240 - Africana Intellectual Thought  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Major theories and theory-makers and production of a global black intellectual tradition. Thoughts and writings of major black leaders as they relate to liberation, struggle, resistance, and cultural production. Maximum Credits: 3Note: This course satisfies the ethnic studies [ES] requirement.

AFRAS 260.course_description: AFRAS 260 - Africana Literary Study  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Oral and written literature produced by people of African descent. How Africana people use language to communicate their history and culture. Basic literary vocabulary, techniques, and theories for the non-specialist. Maximum Credits: 3Note: This course satisfies the ethnic studies [ES] requirement.

AFRAS 296.course_description: AFRAS 296 - Experimental Topics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Selected topics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

AFRAS 300.course_description: AFRAS 300 - Afro-Brazilian Community, Culture, and Identity  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Culture, history, and the social institutions of Brazilians of African descent. Economic and political standing in Brazil’s contemporary urban and traditional rural societies. Maximum Credits: 3

AFRAS 305W.course_description: AFRAS 305W - Writing in Various Settings  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Satisfies Graduation Writing Assessment Requirement for students who have completed 60 units and completed General Education requirements in Communication and Critical Thinking. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Test scores or verification of exemption; copy of transcript.Compose effective texts for a wide range of situations in and out of the university. Adjust textual elements for specific audiences, purposes, and settings. Enhance critical reading and writing skills by exploring how content contributes to meaning and effectiveness. Maximum Credits: 3

AFRAS 315.course_name: Martial Arts and Wellness Culture of Asia, Africa, and African Diaspora
AFRAS 315.course_description: AFRAS 315 - Martial Arts and Wellness Culture of Asia, Africa, and African Diaspora  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): AFRAS 101  or ASIAN 101 Global practice of martial arts and sports examined through an African lens. African Diaspora. Asian cultures. Intersectionality of martial arts and sports as tools for self-defense, traditional healing, and well-being. Maximum Credits: 3

AFRAS 320.course_description: AFRAS 320 - Political Economy of African Diaspora  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Political economy of urban growth, development, and redevelopment in African diaspora, examined in historical and contemporary contexts. Race and class inequality and conflict; effectiveness of public and private sector decisions and programs. Maximum Credits: 3Note: This course satisfies the general education cultural diversity requirement.

AFRAS 321.course_description: AFRAS 321 - Black Political Participation in America  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Afro-American political life and development in the United States. Interaction between Afro-Americans and various actors, institution processes, and policies of the American system of politics and governance. Maximum Credits: 3Note: This course satisfies the general education cultural diversity requirement.

AFRAS 322.course_description: AFRAS 322 - African American Political Thought  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Political and social thought underlying principles, goals, strategies developed by African Americans in struggle for social development and human rights. Focus on twentieth century thought. Maximum Credits: 3Note: This course satisfies the general education cultural diversity requirement.

AFRAS 327.course_description: AFRAS 327 - Critical Theories in Africana Studies  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Major historical and contemporary theories and thinkers that have defined and continue to define discipline of Africana studies. Comparative analyses of diverse voices and perspectives. Maximum Credits: 3Note: This course satisfies the ethnic studies [ES] requirement.

AFRAS 331.course_description: AFRAS 331 - The Black Family  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Structure and functions of the Black family in contemporary American society. Maximum Credits: 3Note: This course satisfies the ethnic studies [ES] requirement.

AFRAS 332.course_description: AFRAS 332 - Black Women: Myth and Reality  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Images of Black women in America and how those images have been distorted. Maximum Credits: 3Note: This course satisfies the ethnic studies [ES] requirement.

AFRAS 333.course_description:
AFRAS 333 - Black Women’s History  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Completion of the General Education requirement in Communication and Critical Thinking, I.2. Written Communication.Black women’s experiences during enslavement and Jim Crow. Struggles of liberation and the shaping of American society.
  Maximum Credits: 3

AFRAS 341.course_name: Cultural Patterns and African American Identity
AFRAS 341.course_description: AFRAS 341 - Cultural Patterns and African American Identity  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Prerequisite(s) recommended: AFRAS 101 .Impact of social institutions on African American identity and cultural patterns. Maximum Credits: 3

AFRAS 351.course_description: AFRAS 351 - Black Religions and Spirituality  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Same As: REL S 351   Major Black religious and spiritual responses and expressions in Africa and Black diaspora, including creation of institutions to support and advance religious and spiritual matters. Maximum Credits: 3Note: This course satisfies the ethnic studies [ES] requirement.

ACCTG 201.course_description: ACCTG 201 - Financial Accounting Fundamentals  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Theory and practice of accounting applicable to recording, summarizing, and reporting of business transactions for external reporting and other external uses. Asset valuation; revenue and expense recognition; various asset, liability, and capital accounts. Maximum Credits: 3

ACCTG 202.course_description: ACCTG 202 - Managerial Accounting Fundamentals  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Minimum grade of C in ACCTG 201 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Selection and analysis of accounting information for internal use by managers. Using financial information for planning and control purposes. Maximum Credits: 3

ACCTG 296.course_description: ACCTG 296 - Experimental Topics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Selected topics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

ACCTG 325.course_description: ACCTG 325 - Intermediate Managerial and Tax Accounting  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ACCTG 202 . Approved upper division business major or minor or other approved major. Not open to accounting majors. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Theories, practices, and concepts to provide planning and control information to decision makers; tax considerations that impact managerial planning and decision making. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Credit may not be applied to accounting major.

ACCTG 326.course_description: ACCTG 326 - Intermediate Financial Accounting  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ACCTG 202 . Approved upper division business major or minor or other approved major. Not open to accounting majors. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Theories, practices, and concepts needed to satisfy the decision making requirements of external users; financial reporting for enterprises engaged in international trade of business. May not be taken for credit by accounting majors. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Credit may not be applied to accounting major.

ACCTG 331.course_description: ACCTG 331 - Intermediate Accounting I  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to accounting major, minor, or certificate. Minimum grade of C in ACCTG 201  and ACCTG 202 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Concepts and methods underlying financial statements (including IFRS introduction). Note: Not open to students with credit in ACCTG 325  and ACCTG 326 . Students in the ACCTG 331 classes are required to attend an Accounting Major Orientation in mid-September after the add/drop deadline. It is usually organized on a Friday morning and the students will be given a one-lecture release during that week. We highly encourage students to attend in person and remote attendance will be accommodated.

ACCTG 332.course_description: ACCTG 332 - Federal Income Taxation  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Minimum grade of C (2.0) in ACCTG 331 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Concepts and methods underlying taxation of individuals and business entities. Note: Not open to students with credit in ACCTG 325  and ACCTG 326 .

ACCTG 333.course_description: ACCTG 333 - Accounting Information Systems  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Minimum grade of C in ACCTG 331 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Accounting information systems for internal and external decision making.Formerly numbered Accountancy 322. Maximum Credits: 3

ACCTG 334.course_description: ACCTG 334 - Intermediate Accounting II  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Minimum grade of C in ACCTG 331 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Financial reporting issues; preparation and use of financial statement information.Formerly numbered Accountancy 322. Maximum Credits: 3

ACCTG 390W.course_description: ACCTG 390W - Reporting Techniques for Accountants  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Minimum grade of C in ACCTG 331 . Satisfies Graduation Writing Assessment Requirement for students who have completed 60 units and completed General Education requirements in Communication and Critical Thinking. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Test score or verification of exemption; copy of transcript.Advanced preparation of written and oral reports with application to professional needs of accountants.Formerly numbered Information and Decision Systems 390W / Management Information Systems 390W. Maximum Credits: 3

ACCTG 409.course_description: ACCTG 409 - Field Study in Taxation  Units: 1 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Credit or concurrent registration in ACCTG 325 , ACCTG 332 , or ACCTG 503 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Income tax preparation in the field. Follows procedures of IRSVITA Program. IRS instruction followed by faculty supervised fieldwork. Student must be available for special IRS tax school. Maximum Credits: 3

ACCTG 431.course_description: ACCTG 431 - Auditing  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Minimum grade of C in ACCTG 333  and credit in ACCTG 390W . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Audit of financial statements in accordance with generally accepted auditing standards; ethics in auditing.Formerly numbered Accountancy 421. Maximum Credits: 3

ACCTG 432.course_description: ACCTG 432 - Cost Management  Units: 4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ACCTG 333  with a minimum grade of C and B A 323 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Use of accounting information and data analytics to facilitate business decisions; cost management and ethics in managerial accounting.Formerly numbered Accountancy 421. Maximum Credits: 4

ACCTG 496.course_description: ACCTG 496 - Selected Topics in Accountancy  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of department chair.Selected areas of concern in accountancy.  May be repeated with new content with consent of department chair. Maximum Credits: 6Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

ACCTG 498.course_description: ACCTG 498 - Investigation and Report  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor and senior standing.A comprehensive and original study of a problem connected with accounting under the direction of one or more members of the accounting staff.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6

ACCTG 499.course_description: ACCTG 499 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6

ACCTG 501.course_description: ACCTG 501 - Advanced Financial Accounting  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ACCTG 334 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Advanced financial accounting topics. Partnerships, consolidations, foreign currency transactions and financial statements, accounting for derivatives and hedging, accounting for bankruptcy and reorganizations. Maximum Credits: 3

ACCTG 503.course_description: ACCTG 503 - Federal Taxation of Individuals  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ACCTG 201  and ACCTG 202 . Approved upper division business major, business minor, or other approved major. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Taxation of individuals, including income, deductions, credits, social security taxes, and property transactions. Maximum Credits: 3

ACCTG 505.course_description: ACCTG 505 - Fraud Examination  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ACCTG 431  or 626. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Skills and tools for auditors, consultants, tax professionals, managers. Techniques and technologies for fraud investigation and interviewing. Case analysis, research of public records, ethical decision making for accountants. Service learning project. Maximum Credits: 3

ACCTG 508.course_description: ACCTG 508 - Accounting for Not-For-Profit Organizations  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Minimum grade of C in ACCTG 326  or ACCTG 331 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Principles of modified accrual accounting in state and local governmental units, hospitals, colleges, and universities. Budgetary accounting, appropriations, encumbrances, internal controls, and auditing procedures. Maximum Credits: 3

ACCTG 522.course_description: ACCTG 522 - International Financial Reporting  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ACCTG 334  and satisfaction of Graduation Writing Assessment Requirement. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Accounting convergence, IASB-FASB joint projects. US and international financial reporting issues and standards. Maximum Credits: 3

ACCTG 530.course_description: ACCTG 530 - Ethics in Accounting  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ACCTG 331  or ACCTG 620 .Ethical reasoning and implications for accounting professionals; ethical decision process and professional judgment; professional codes of conduct from the AICPA, IMA, IIA, etc.; the professional accountant’s role in corporate governance and ethical management; audit responsibilities and fraud, including legal and regulatory obligations; current ethical issues facing the accounting profession.Formerly numbered ACCTG 630. Maximum Credits: 3

ACCTG 596.course_description: ACCTG 596 - Contemporary Topics in Accounting  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Business major approved by the Fowler College of Business and consent of instructor.Contemporary topics in modern accounting.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

ACCTG 620.course_description: ACCTG 620 - Financial Measurement and Reporting  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 640 .Measurement concepts and mechanics to translate global business transactions into principal financial statements using U.S. and international accounting standards. Revenue recognition, operating assets, investments, debt and equity financing, compensation, EPS, and cash flows. Maximum Credits: 3

ACCTG 621.course_description: ACCTG 621 - Accounting Information Systems  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 640 .Application of accounting information systems to attain organizational objectives, improve planning and control at all levels of the organization. Systems analysis, design methodologies, tools, control frameworks and use of technologies in information systems. Maximum Credits: 3

ACCTG 624.course_description: ACCTG 624 - Business Entity Taxation  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 640 .Concepts and methods underlying federal income taxation of business entities. Maximum Credits: 3

ACCTG 625.course_description: ACCTG 625 - Managerial Analysis and Financial Reporting  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 670  and ACCTG 620. Measurement concepts and mechanics to translate global business transactions into management and financial reporting information. Cost control and budgeting, inventory, operational assets, leases, deferred taxes, and strategic analysis.

ACCTG 626.course_description: ACCTG 626 - Auditing and Assurance Services  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ACCTG 620  and ACCTG 621 .Duties, responsibilities, and ethics of the auditor; auditor’s reports and procedures for evaluation of financial statements. Compilation and review standards for assurance services provided to non-public companies. Maximum Credits: 3

ACCTG 650.course_description: ACCTG 650 - Accounting Research and Communication  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ACCTG 332 , ACCTG 503 , or ACCTG 624 .Identification, organization, and integration of diverse sources of authoritative literature to reach a conclusion and communicate an accounting or tax decision. Maximum Credits: 3

ACCTG 651.course_description: ACCTG 651 - Seminar in Corporate Tax  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Credit or concurrent registration in ACCTG 650 .Corporate tax problems involving distributions, liquidations, reorganizations, redemptions, personal holding companies, accumulated earnings tax, and thin capitalization. Maximum Credits: 3

ACCTG 654.course_description: ACCTG 654 - Seminar in Partnership Taxation  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Credit or concurrent registration in ACCTG 650 .Partnership and S corporation tax laws related to formation, operations, distributions, and liquidations. Flow-through entities in small and medium sized business environments.

ACCTG 655.course_description: ACCTG 655 - Tax Planning for Individuals  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Credit or concurrent registration in ACCTG 650 .Selected complex tax laws related to individuals and sole proprietorship businesses, sales and exchanges of property, tax deferred transactions in property, accounting periods and methods, and personal deductions. Maximum Credits: 3

ACCTG 656.course_description: ACCTG 656 - Multijurisdictional Tax  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Credit or concurrent registration in ACCTG 650 .Tax law in a multistate and international context. Multijurisdictional concepts for tax planning. Maximum Credits: 3

ACCTG 657.course_description: ACCTG 657 - Accounting for Income Taxes  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ACCTG 620  and ACCTG 624 .Financial accounting for income taxes under generally accepted accounting principles. Accounting methods for Federal income tax and accounting purposes. Maximum Credits: 2

ACCTG 659.course_description: ACCTG 659 - Seminar in Taxation Topics  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Credit or concurrent registration in ACCTG 650 .Contemporary theories and practices in taxation.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

ACCTG 660.course_description: ACCTG 660 - Seminar in Accounting Theory  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ACCTG 620 .Theories and concepts underlying global financial reporting. Professional research of authoritative pronouncements issued by the FASB, SEC, and other accounting regulators. Topics include accounting standards setting, measurement, market efficiency, disclosure, earnings quality, professional judgment. Maximum Credits: 3

ACCTG 661.course_description: ACCTG 661 - Seminar in International Accounting  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 640 .Current financial reporting practices of business entities engaged in international activities; theories and concepts that underlie development of accounting standards to include cultural and professional dimensions, accounting clusters. Maximum Credits: 3

ACCTG 663.course_description: ACCTG 663 - Financial Statement Analysis  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 640 .Illustrative cases and problems to analyze methods for communicating information about financing and operating activities of corporate firms, and techniques for evaluating the information. Maximum Credits: 3

ACCTG 670.course_description: ACCTG 670 - Seminar in Assurance Services  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ACCTG 431  or ACCTG 626 .Selected conceptual issues in assurance services. Maximum Credits: 3

ACCTG 673.course_description: ACCTG 673 - Accounting Information Systems (AIS) Development  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ACCTG 621 .AIS theories, databases, and internal controls in designing, maintaining, and enhancing business processes and systems. Hands-on experience to develop skills with EXCEL, ACCESS, and/or other integrated systems.Formerly numbered Accountancy 575. Maximum Credits: 3

ACCTG 675.course_name: Seminar in Accounting Information Systems Audit and Control
ACCTG 675.course_description: ACCTG 675 - Seminar in Accounting Information Systems Audit and Control  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ACCTG 673  or MIS 687  with a grade of B or better.Risk assessment and management in accounting systems, including impact on clients’ business and audit functions, external and internal auditor issues, internal controls in computerized environments, issues related to Sarbanes-Oxley Act, and application of computer-assisted audit techniques (CAATs) using current audit software. Maximum Credits: 3

ACCTG 680.course_description: ACCTG 680 - Seminar in Managerial Accounting  Units: 3  Managerial cost accounting concepts and procedures, including budgetary planning, cost control, advisory functions, measurement of divisional profitability, product pricing, and investment decisions.

ACCTG 681.course_name: Seminar in Regulation and Corporate Governance in Accounting
ACCTG 681.course_description: ACCTG 681 - Seminar in Regulation and Corporate Governance in Accounting  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 640 .Social, ethical, and behavioral science theories influencing design and operation of corporate governance systems, topics include environmental and regulatory factors that influence, motivate, and control managers and employees. Maximum Credits: 3

ACCTG 696.course_description: ACCTG 696 - Seminar in Selected Topics  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Intensive study in specific areas of accountancy.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 12Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

ACCTG 705.course_description: ACCTG 705 - Forensic Accounting  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ACCTG 620 .Application of forensic accounting techniques using data analytics to discover fraud anomalies. Maximum Credits: 3

ACCTG 729.course_name: Seminar in Current Issues in Accounting and Auditing
ACCTG 729.course_description: ACCTG 729 - Seminar in Current Issues in Accounting and Auditing  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ACCTG 620 .Contemporary theories and practices in relation to changing accounting environment.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

ACCTG 790.course_description: ACCTG 790 - Analytics in Accounting  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Advancement to candidacy.Problem diagnosis, information analysis and evaluation, and decision making for contemporary issues in accounting information systems, auditing, financial reporting, management accounting, and taxation. Preparation for comprehensive examination for students in the M.S. degree in Accountancy under Plan B. Maximum Credits: 3

ACCTG 797.course_description: ACCTG 797 - Research  Units: 3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Advancement to candidacy.Research in the area of accountancy. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

ACCTG 798.course_description: ACCTG 798 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of staff; to be arranged with department chair and instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

ARP 201.course_name: Introductory Statistics and Research Design for Education
ARP 201.course_description: ARP 201 - Introductory Statistics and Research Design for Education  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Satisfaction of the SDSU Mathematics/Quantitative Reasoning Assessment requirement and consent of instructor.Understanding, interpreting, and applying educational research. Basic research design, sampling, distributions, reliability, validity, descriptive statistics, inferential statistics, hypothesis testing, tests of significance, and evaluating an education research report. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Students with credit or concurrent registration in the following lower division courses will be awarded a total of four units for the two (or more) courses: Administration, Rehabilitation and Postsecondary Education 201; BIOL 215 ; CIV E 160 ; ECON 201 ; LING 270 ; POL S 201 ; PSY 280 ; SOC 201 ; STAT 119 , STAT 250 .

ARP 296.course_description: ARP 296 - Experimental Topics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Selected topics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

ARP 380.course_name: Principles of Adult and Vocational Education
ARP 380.course_description: ARP 380 - Principles of Adult and Vocational Education  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Principles, practices, scope, and functions of adult and vocational education. Maximum Credits: 3

ARP 382.course_description: ARP 382 - Directed Teaching  Units: 2-4 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): ARP 380 .Systematic observation, participation, and teaching under supervision in an occupational subject matter area. Maximum Credits: 4Note: Application to take this course must be made in preceding semester.

ARP 397.course_description: ARP 397 - Problems in Education  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Class study of specially selected problems in education. Maximum Credits: 4Note: Does not apply to pattern requirements for credentials. Credit earned in this course not applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

ARP 496.course_description: ARP 496 - Experimental Topics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Selected topics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

ARP 596.course_name: Topics in Administration, Rehabilitation and Postsecondary Education
ARP 596.course_description: ARP 596 - Topics in Administration, Rehabilitation and Postsecondary Education  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Selected topics in Administration, Rehabilitation and Postsecondary Education.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units of 596 applicable to a bachelor’s degreeNote: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

ARP 601.course_name: Psychiatric Rehabilitation and Co-occurring Disorders-Law and Ethics
ARP 601.course_description: ARP 601 - Psychiatric Rehabilitation and Co-occurring Disorders-Law and Ethics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Bachelor’s degree.Evidence-based practices for individuals with psychiatric disabilities and co-occurring disorders within the context of law and ethics. Maximum Credits: 3

ARP 607.course_description: ARP 607 - Applications of Rehabilitation Technology  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to rehabilitation counseling program or consent of instructor.Provide rehabilitation professionals with knowledge and skills to assess assistive technology needs of individuals with disabilities and match those needs with appropriate adaptations, equipment, and/or resources to expand employment and related quality of life opportunities. Maximum Credits: 3

ARP 608.course_name: Assessment for Psychiatric Rehabilitation and Co-occurring Disorders
ARP 608.course_description: ARP 608 - Assessment for Psychiatric Rehabilitation and Co-occurring Disorders  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Bachelor’s degree.Assessment of individuals with psychiatric disabilities and co-occurring disorders within the context of the recovery model. Maximum Credits: 3

ARP 609.course_name: Seminar in Rehabilitation: Policy Developments in Cognitive Disabilities
ARP 609.course_description: ARP 609 - Seminar in Rehabilitation: Policy Developments in Cognitive Disabilities  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to graduate program in rehabilitation counseling or Cognitive Disabilities certificate program.Working with persons with intellectual disabilities, autism spectrum disorders, brain injuries, and learning disabilities. Impact of these factors and how to work effectively as clinicians, administrators, and policy makers. Maximum Credits: 3

ARP 610.course_description: ARP 610 - Educational Leadership  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Concepts and techniques of leadership, analysis of the factors and practice of individual and group leadership as applied to educational and related environments. Maximum Credits: 3

ARP 611.course_name: Program Development and Evaluation in Postsecondary Education
ARP 611.course_description: ARP 611 - Program Development and Evaluation in Postsecondary Education  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Process of program development, change, improvement and evaluation for postsecondary education. Covers instructional programs, curriculum development, and student services programming. Includes designing instructional strategies to meet student learning needs. Maximum Credits: 3

ARP 612.course_name: Skills, Resources, and Programs in Cognitive Disabilities
ARP 612.course_description: ARP 612 - Skills, Resources, and Programs in Cognitive Disabilities  Units: 3-12 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to graduate program in rehabilitation counseling.Cognitive disabilities through community-based and classroom experiences with individuals with cognitive disabilities, families of persons with cognitive disabilities, and professionals that support the cognitively disabled. Acquired brain injury, autism spectrum disorders, intellectual and learning disability.Formerly numbered Administration, Rehabilitation and Postsecondary Education 744. Maximum Credits: 3Maximum Credit Statement: twelve units applicable to a Master of Science degree in rehabilitation counseling.

ARP 615.course_name: Seminar in Multicultural Dimensions in Rehabilitation Counseling
ARP 615.course_description: ARP 615 - Seminar in Multicultural Dimensions in Rehabilitation Counseling  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to graduate program in rehabilitation counseling.Issues, insights, and techniques for improving effectiveness in working with culturally diverse individuals with disabilities and their families. Focuses on insuring culturally appropriate and relevant rehabilitation services including full community integration. Maximum Credits: 3

ARP 620.course_description: ARP 620 - Student Affairs and Student Success  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Historical roots, diversity of institutions and students; philosophical foundations of the field and student success, guiding values, key legal principles and theoretical bases; functional areas within student affairs, their evolution, purpose, professional associations, standards, and current issues. Maximum Credits: 3

ARP 621.course_name: Theoretical Foundations of Student Affairs and Student Success
ARP 621.course_description: ARP 621 - Theoretical Foundations of Student Affairs and Student Success  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Major theoretical foundations of student affairs, including student personnel point of view, student development, and student learning imperative. Maximum Credits: 3

ARP 622.course_name: Intra and Interpersonal Communication for Student Success
ARP 622.course_description: ARP 622 - Intra and Interpersonal Communication for Student Success  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Four major domains of communication and leadership: interpersonal, intrapersonal, small group, and organizational dynamics. Addresses assessment of techniques and intervention strategies for each domain. Maximum Credits: 3

ARP 623.course_name: Seminar in Critical Leadership Issues in Student Affairs
ARP 623.course_description: ARP 623 - Seminar in Critical Leadership Issues in Student Affairs  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Current topics and issues critical to effective leadership in student affairs, academic mission of postsecondary education and creating a supportive learning environment for students. Maximum Credits: 3

ARP 624.course_name: Advising and Coaching for Student Success
ARP 624.course_description: ARP 624 - Advising and Coaching for Student Success  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Developmental relationships in postsecondary education. Major advising and coaching theories. Applications, competencies, and practices to support student success. Maximum Credits: 3

ARP 631.course_name: Seminar in Teaching in Postsecondary Education
ARP 631.course_description: ARP 631 - Seminar in Teaching in Postsecondary Education  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Teaching process in postsecondary education addressing syllabus construction, lesson planning, using technology in teaching, and infusing multicultural education into courses. Assessing student learning through authentic evaluation techniques. Maximum Credits: 3

ARP 645.course_description: ARP 645 - Assessment in Rehabilitation  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to graduate program in rehabilitation counseling.Broad-based perspective on assessment approaches involved in mental health, student disability support rehabilitation counseling practice, and vocational rehabilitation. Theory and practical applications of achievement, aptitude, ecological, intelligence, learning disabilities, mental health, neuropsychological, personality, and work samples assessment. Selected sections offered as distance education.Formerly numbered Administration, Rehabilitation and Postsecondary Education 645A. Maximum Credits: 3

ARP 646.course_description: ARP 646 - Career Development  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to graduate program in rehabilitation counseling.The construct of career development specific to disability and rehabilitation counseling to include career development assessment, interventions, and theory. Selected sections offered as distance education.Formerly numbered Administration, Rehabilitation and Postsecondary Education 645B. Maximum Credits: 3

ARP 648.course_description: ARP 648 - Group Dynamics in Rehabilitation  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to graduate program in rehabilitation counseling.Theory, dynamics, process and leadership function as applied to group work in rehabilitation. Development and application of group leadership skills/techniques for adjustment, support, skill training, self-directed groups, organizational problem solving and team-building groups in rehabilitation. Maximum Credits: 3

ARP 660.course_name: Theory and Process of Counseling in Rehabilitation
ARP 660.course_description: ARP 660 - Theory and Process of Counseling in Rehabilitation  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Counseling theories, approaches to and techniques for counseling, and research concerning counseling effectiveness. Maximum Credits: 3

ARP 680.course_name: Seminar in Administration, Rehabilitation and Postsecondary Education
ARP 680.course_description: ARP 680 - Seminar in Administration, Rehabilitation and Postsecondary Education  Units: 2-6 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Study of administration, rehabilitation, or postsecondary education in a specialized field, such as a postsecondary institution, and subject fields, or designated services. Field experience when appropriate.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

ARP 684.course_description: ARP 684 - Rehabilitation Foundations  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Background and legislation related to vocational rehabilitation, consumer services, role and function of rehabilitation counselor as a professional. Orientation to community rehabilitation agencies. Maximum Credits: 3

ARP 685A.course_name: Medical and Psychological Aspects of Disability
ARP 685A.course_description: ARP 685A - Medical and Psychological Aspects of Disability  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Open to rehabilitation graduate students and practitioners.Interface of the individual and the environment covering disabilities from the perspective of each disability viewed in terms of functional capacities and rehabilitative services needed. Maximum Credits: 3

ARP 685B.course_name: Medical and Psychological Aspects of Disability
ARP 685B.course_description: ARP 685B - Medical and Psychological Aspects of Disability  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Open to rehabilitation graduate students and practitioners.Interface of the individual and the environment covering disabilities from the perspective of each disability viewed in terms of functional capacities and rehabilitative services needed. Maximum Credits: 3

ARP 687.course_name: Job Development for Individuals with Disabilities
ARP 687.course_description: ARP 687 - Job Development for Individuals with Disabilities  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to the graduate program in rehabilitation counseling.Determination of employment and community integration needs of individuals with disabilities. Theories and techniques are presented through case study methods. Strategies focus on continuous surveys and readings focus on employment needs and opportunities for individuals with disabilities. Maximum Credits: 3

ARP 696.course_name: Advanced Topics in Administration, Rehabilitation and Postsecondary Education
ARP 696.course_description: ARP 696 - Advanced Topics in Administration, Rehabilitation and Postsecondary Education  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Twelve units in Administration, Rehabilitation and Postsecondary Education.Intensive study in specific areas of Administration, Rehabilitation and Postsecondary Education.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 12Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

ARP 708.course_description: ARP 708 - Human Development and Disability  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Developmental theories with implications of living with a disability. Ecological approach to human growth and development across the lifespan. Psychological, social, and spiritual aspects of individual and family response to disability and chronic illness throughout the lifespan. Maximum Credits: 3

ARP 710.course_name: Seminar in Organizational Development in Disability and Postsecondary Systems
ARP 710.course_description:
ARP 710 - Seminar in Organizational Development in Disability and Postsecondary Systems  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Completion of at least 24 units leading to Master of Science in rehabilitation counseling or enrollment in Rehabilitation Administration Certificate.Principles of organizations, perspective of change within systems, and its impact on disability and postsecondary administrators, employees, constituencies, consumers, and leaders. Principles of program evaluation, planning, and change within the context of the organization’s community environment. Selected sections offered as distance education.
 Formerly numbered Administration, Rehabilitation and Postsecondary Education 710A. Maximum Credits: 3Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

ARP 711.course_name: Seminar in Program Development in Disability and Postsecondary Systems
ARP 711.course_description: ARP 711 - Seminar in Program Development in Disability and Postsecondary Systems  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Completion of at least 24 units leading to Master of Science in rehabilitation counseling or enrollment in Rehabilitation Administration Certificate.Mechanics of proposal writing and grantsmanship to include the fundamental components of grant propsals and researching funding opportunities. Proposals for community-based programs and nonprofit agencies that address the needs of a target population to include underserved and underrepresented groups. Selected sections offered as distance education.Formerly numbered Administration, Rehabilitation and Postsecondary Education 710B. Maximum Credits: 3Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

ARP 730.course_description: ARP 730 - Seminar in Adult Learning  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Patterns and implications of life-long learning. Emphasizes adult learning principles and styles, effects of adult development changes on learning, and teaching techniques in adult education programs. Maximum Credits: 3

ARP 740.course_name: Advanced Seminar in Administration, Rehabilitation and Postsecondary Education
ARP 740.course_description: ARP 740 - Advanced Seminar in Administration, Rehabilitation and Postsecondary Education  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Study of a selected area in administration, rehabilitation or postsecondary education, such as educational law, finance, supervision, personnel procedures, etc.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Maximum Credit Statement: nine units applicable to a master’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

ARP 743.course_description: ARP 743 - Fieldwork in Rehabilitation  Units: 3-6 Grading Method: CNC - Letter (Cr/NC OK) Prerequisite(s): Admission to graduate program in rehabilitation counseling.Orientation to the rehabilitation process including organizational goals, operating strategies, responsibilities and ethics, employee role expectations in partnership with consumers and service providers. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a Master of Science degree in rehabilitation counseling.

ARP 744.course_description: ARP 744 - Practicum in Rehabilitation  Units: 3-12 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Admission to graduate program in rehabilitation counseling.Clinical supervision within rehabilitation systems as it relates to outreach and referral, career development, counseling, and caseload management. Maximum Credits: 12

ARP 745.course_description: ARP 745 - Internship in Rehabilitation  Units: 3-9 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Completion of at least 24 units leading to Master of Science in rehabilitation counseling.Supervised internship in rehabilitation setting which involves application of rehabilitation counseling experiences. Maximum Credits: 9Maximum Credit Statement: nine units applicable to a Master of Science degree in rehabilitation counseling or enrollment in the Rehabilitation Administration Certificate.

ARP 747.course_description: ARP 747 - Equity-Minded Approaches for Student Success  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Current theory and practice in meeting needs of diverse learners. Leadership and administration of educational organizations as political, complex systems requiring consensus-building dynamics in a multicultural society. Maximum Credits: 3

ARP 755.course_name: Governance and Policy Development in Postsecondary and Disability Systems
ARP 755.course_description: ARP 755 - Governance and Policy Development in Postsecondary and Disability Systems  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Development and examination of relevant policy and impact of politics in governance and administration in postsecondary and disability-related systems; control functions of federal, state, and local agencies; influence of lay citizens and special interest groups; roles of judiciary, employee organizations and students. Maximum Credits: 3

ARP 760.course_description: ARP 760 - Internship in Postsecondary Educational Leadership  Units: 1-6 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Internship for prospective educational leaders. Released time may be required.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

ARP 798.course_description: ARP 798 - Special Study  Units: 1-6 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor; to be arranged with department chair and instructor.May involve fieldwork. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

ARP 801.course_name: Seminar in Community College History and Development
ARP 801.course_description: ARP 801 - Seminar in Community College History and Development  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to educational leadership doctoral program.Mission, functions, organization, student characteristics, and problems with community college operations. Future trends in community college operations and need for new leadership and research opportunities. Maximum Credits: 3

ARP 810.course_name: Seminar in Community College Law and Finance
