Four units applicable to a bachelor’s degree.Note: Not open to students with four units of credit in GEN S 200. Maximum four units of GEN S 200 and B A 210.

B A 299.course_description: B A 299 - Special Study  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of department chair and instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6

B A 300.course_description: B A 300 - Ethical Decision Making in Business  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Approved upper division business major or another major approved by the Fowler College of Business. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Theoretical concepts and dimensions of ethics in business decisions. Ethics of decision alternatives using different approaches and philosophies, with application of an integrative ethical decision model to cases from various business subdisciplines. Maximum Credits: 1

B A 310.course_name: Foundations of Business in a Global Environment
B A 310.course_description: B A 310 - Foundations of Business in a Global Environment  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Approved upper division major.Introduction to the program of study leading to the Bachelor of Science in Business Administration. Integration of various business disciplines to accomplish strategic goals. Presentation of the concept of global awareness, one of the fundamental pillars of global competency necessary in today’s business world. Maximum Credits: 1Designated Global Learning Course (GLC).

B A 311.course_description: B A 311 - Lavin Entrepreneur I Seminar  Units: 1 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Admission to Lavin Entrepreneur Program.Lavin entrepreneurs will be introduced to entrepreneurship as a potential path for future career development. Students will begin developing entrepreneurial competencies, professional networks, and be introduced to the basics of ideation, opportunity recognition, and business model development. Maximum Credits: 1

B A 312.course_description: B A 312 - Lavin Entrepreneur II Seminar  Units: 1 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): B A 311 .Lavin entrepreneurs will continue building their entrepreneurial competencies and mindset, utilizing entrepreneurship frameworks for business opportunity assessment, ideation, and feasibility analysis techniques in ventures, and how to interact and negotiate with strategic partners. Maximum Credits: 1

B A 323.course_description: B A 323 - Fundamentals of Finance  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Approved upper division business major, business minor, or another major approved by the Fowler College of Business. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Objectives of financial management. Financing the business enterprise. Internal financial management. Introduction to the cost of capital, valuation, dividend policy, leverage, international finance, and the techniques of present value and its applications. Sources of capital.Formerly numbered Finance 323. Maximum Credits: 3

B A 350.course_description: B A 350 - Management and Organizational Behavior  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Approved upper division business major, business minor, or another major approved by the Fowler College of Business. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Human behavior at individual, interpersonal, and group levels including effect of organization structure on behavior. Emphasis on managerial roles, historical evolution of management, ethics, and behavior in multicultural contexts.Formerly numbered Management 350. Maximum Credits: 3

B A 360.course_name: Introduction to Operations and Supply Chain Management
B A 360.course_description: B A 360 - Introduction to Operations and Supply Chain Management  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): STAT 119  or ECON 201 . Recommended: MATH 120 . Approved upper division business major, business minor, or another major approved by the Fowler College of Business. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Managerial concepts and quantitative methods associated with the design, execution, and management of operations and supply chain systems.Formerly numbered Management Information Systems 302 / Information and Decision Systems 302. Maximum Credits: 3

B A 370.course_description: B A 370 - Marketing  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Approved upper division business major, business minor, or another major approved by the Fowler College of Business. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Function of marketing in organizations and society. Strategic marketing planning in domestic and global settings to include marketing concepts, consumer behavior, market research, product planning, pricing, distribution, promotion, and influence of the external environment on marketing decisions.Formerly numbered Marketing 370. Maximum Credits: 3

B A 400.course_description: B A 400 - Business Honors Seminar  Units: 1 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Admission to the Fowler College of Business Honors Program.Current issues affecting local, national, and global business environments. Maximum Credits: 5

B A 401.course_description: B A 401 - Business Internship  Units: 1 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Approved upper division business major, business minor, or another major approved by the Fowler College of Business.Internships with business firms, non-profit organizations, or government agencies. Work done under joint supervision of intern organization and academic supervisor. Maximum Credits: 4Maximum Credit Statement: four units with new content.Note: Not applicable for credit in the major.

B A 402.course_description: B A 402 - Exploration of Business Career Development  Units: 1 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Upper division standing in the Fowler College of Business.Prepare students for careers after college and transition from college to career. Personal preparation and analysis of identification of best career options for each student. Maximum Credits: 6

B A 404.course_description: B A 404 - Small Business Consulting  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Approved upper division business major; B A 300 , B A 310 , B A 323 , B A 350 , B A 370 ; B A 360  or MIS 301 ; and consent of instructor.Counseling of existing small businesses. Application of principles from all fields of business administration. Maximum Credits: 6

B A 410.course_description: B A 410 - Fowler Scholars Seminar II  Units: 1 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to and enrollment in the Fowler Scholars Program.Understanding, applying and critiquing ethical business theories as well as examining personal branding and corresponding narrative. Leading both project teams and guest speaker topics.  May be repeated with consent of instructor.  Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: Six units with consent of instructor. Six units applicable to a bachelor’s degree.Note: Not open to students with six units of credit in GEN S 400. Maximum six units of GEN S 400 and B A 410.

B A 411.course_description: B A 411 - Lavin Entrepreneur III Seminar  Units: 1 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): B A 312 .Lavin entrepreneurs will focus on implementing learned entrepreneurial competencies into refined business models, refining start-up opportunities through customer iteration and development. Understand data metrics, successful customer interaction, and pivoting the business model toward success. Maximum Credits: 1

B A 412.course_description: B A 412 - Lavin Entrepreneur IV Seminar  Units: 1 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): B A 411 .The final deliverable of this capstone course in presenting an iterated business model canvas to potential investors. Lavin entrepreneurs have the potential, knowledge, and tools to launch a company, bring their viable business opportunity to life. Maximum Credits: 1

B A 458.course_description: B A 458 - Management Decision Games  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor. Approved upper division business major; B A 300 , B A 310 , B A 323 , B A 350 , B A 370 ; B A 360  or MIS 301 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Integrated managerial decision making within a dynamic environment through the use of business games. Maximum Credits: 3

B A 496.course_description: B A 496 - Selected Topics in Business Administration  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of department chair.Selected areas of concern in business administration.  May be repeated with new content with consent of department chair. Maximum Credits: 6Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

B A 498.course_description: B A 498 - Investigation and Report  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Senior standing and consent of instructor.A comprehensive and original study of a problem connected with business administration under the direction of one or more members of the Fowler College of Business staff.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 3

B A 601.course_description: B A 601 - Organizational Behavior for Executives  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Role of the manager in designing organizations for effectiveness with emphasis on organizational theory and organizational behavior. Maximum Credits: 3

B A 602.course_description: B A 602 - Statistics for Business Decisions  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Statistics and production operations management. Data analysis, central tendency and variability, probability, distributions, sample inference, association analysis. Applications in engineering, manufacturing and service, and an overview of decision theory, queuing, total quality control, and project management. Maximum Credits: 3

B A 603.course_description: B A 603 - Executive Financial Accounting  Units: 2 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to M.B.A. for Executives program.Accounting procedures and judgments underlying corporate financial statements; ability to read and analyze these statements; make inferences about financial stability, likelihood of success, and other important attributes of various business entities. Maximum Credits: 2

B A 604.course_description: B A 604 - Executive Managerial Accounting  Units: 2 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to M.B.A. for Executives program.Accounting information for internal decision making purposes to include cost measurement, capacity management, activity based costing, activity based management, production costing, quality costing, pricing, CVP analysis, budgeting, performance evaluation, transfer pricing, and compensation. Maximum Credits: 2

B A 605.course_description: B A 605 - Managerial Marketing  Units: 2 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC The marketing function in an organization. Managerial activities of marketing including market analysis, target market selection and design of the organization’s marketing program. Maximum Credits: 2

B A 615.course_description: B A 615 - Strategic Financial Management  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Provides a framework for financial decision making. Covers relevant modern theory and emphasizes role of finance in corporate strategy. Topics include financial analysis and planning, investment, capital structure and dividend decisions and valuation and corporate restructuring. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Not open to students with credit in Business Administration 665.

B A 616.course_description: B A 616 - Competitive Analysis  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Competition in typical unregulated product or service markets. Competitive forces in such markets, and impact of these forces on economic profits, rates of return, and relative market-shares of competing firms. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Not open to students with credit in Business Administration 653.

B A 626.course_description: B A 626 - Business Economics  Units: 3  Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Microeconomic and macroeconomic environments of business. Assessing and forecasting the impact of market structure, economic climate, and governmental policies on pricing, operations, and competitive strategy. Note: Not open to students with credit in Business Administration 653.

B A 627.course_description: B A 627 - Marketing  Units: 3  Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Role and function of marketing in the organization and society. Planning, implementation, and evaluation of marketing strategies and programs.Formerly numbered Business Administration 655. Note: Not open to students with credit in B A 370 .

B A 628.course_description: B A 628 - Operations and Supply Chain Management  Units: 3  Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Managerial concepts and quantitative methods associated with the design, execution, and management of operations and supply chain systems.Formerly numbered Business Administration 662.

B A 640.course_description: B A 640 - Financial Reporting and Analysis  Units: 2 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Financial accounting in profit-directed organizations. Concepts, frameworks, terminology, and tools used to understand and analyze the financial consequences of business activities. Maximum Credits: 2Note: Not open to students with credit in Business Administration 625.

B A 641.course_description: B A 641 - Business Ethics and Corporate Responsibility  Units: 1 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Decision-making strategies; principles, rules, and values that ground ethical behavior in the world of business. Maximum Credits: 1

B A 642.course_description:
B A 642 - Statistical Analysis  Units: 2 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Applications of statistics for problem solving and managerial decision-making.
 Formerly numbered Business Administration 652 and Business Administration 623. Maximum Credits: 2

B A 643.course_description: B A 643 - Managerial Economics  Units: 2 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Microeconomic environments of business. Assessing and forecasting impacts of economic climate, governmental policy, and of market structure on competitive strategy, operations, and pricing. Maximum Credits: 2

B A 644.course_description: B A 644 - Operations and Supply Chain Management  Units: 2 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Managerial concepts and quantitative methods associated with the design, execution, and management of operations and supply chain systems. Maximum Credits: 2

B A 645.course_description: B A 645 - Marketing  Units: 1 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Foundational concepts and development of marketing strategies and plans.Formerly numbered Business Administration 627. Maximum Credits: 1

B A 649.course_description: B A 649 - Business Analytics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Same As: MIS 649 . Prerequisite(s): B A 642  . Business analytics techniques for predictive modeling and customer segmentation. Applications include churn management, business experiments, cluster segmentation, and market basket analysis.Formerly numbered B A 749. Maximum Credits: 3

B A 670.course_description: B A 670 - Managerial Accounting  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 640  Budgeting, cost control, job costing, overhead allocation, and reporting. Maximum Credits: 3

B A 671.course_description: B A 671 - Legal Environment of Business  Units: 2 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Sources of law. Procedures and ethics associated with implementation of law. Law of torts and intellectual property. Agency and employment, business organizations, contracts and sales, negotiable instruments and banking. Maximum Credits: 2

B A 672.course_description: B A 672 - Managerial Marketing  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 645  Identification, understanding, and resolution of marketing issues in organizations. Theoretical and quantitative tools within a decision-making framework to inform organizational strategic directions. Maximum Credits: 3

B A 673.course_description: B A 673 - Organizational Behavior and Leadership  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Study of individuals and groups within an organizational context. Topics include leadership, individual differences, organizational design, group processes and characteristics, organizational processes and practices; and influence of these on individual, group, and organizational effectiveness.Formerly numbered Business Administration 624 and Business Administration 651. Maximum Credits: 3

B A 674.course_description: B A 674 - Financial Management  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 640 .Explore role of finance in a shareholder value based framework. Financial analysis and planning, investment, capital structure, financial markets, capital raising and capital disbursement decisions, valuation, and corporate restructuring.Formerly numbered Business Administration 629. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Not open to students with credit in Business Administration 665.

B A 676.course_description: B A 676 - Strategic Thinking  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 672  and B A 674 .Environmental, industry, and organization analysis; strategy formulation and implementation. Long-term multifunctional environmental and organizational managerial issues from the viewpoints of top managers.Formerly numbered Business Administration 630. Maximum Credits: 3

B A 695.course_description: B A 695 - Introductory Business Consulting Practice  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 640, B A 641, and credit or concurrent registration in B A 642, or instructor approval. Students who do not satisfy the prerequisites must obtain instructor approval to register for the class.To introduce graduate students from diverse backgrounds to the consulting methodology and to introduce skills such as structured thinking, advanced analysis, and designing primary and secondary research, and visualizing and presenting data. Students will gain an authentic consulting experience.   May be repeated once with consent of instructor.  Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: Six units with consent of instructor; six units applicable to a master’s degree.

B A 700.course_description: B A 700 - Business in the Global Environment  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Evolution of multinational corporations, management of organizations in global environment, and marketing and management implications of competition in international arena. Maximum Credits: 3

B A 701.course_description: B A 701 - Executive Entrepreneurship  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Entrepreneurial approach to business. Concepts, theories, and techniques for organizing and managing an entrepreneurial venture. Maximum Credits: 3

B A 702.course_name: Social Responsibility: Legal and Ethical Environment of Business
B A 702.course_description: B A 702 - Social Responsibility: Legal and Ethical Environment of Business  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Role of the manager in dealing in a socially responsible and ethical manner with internal and external constituencies. Maximum Credits: 3

B A 703.course_description: B A 703 - Strategic Management  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Corporate and business level strategic decision making. Topics include industry and environmental analysis, strategy implementation, strategic planning systems. Case descriptions of actual company situations serve as basis for analysis and recommendations. Maximum Credits: 3

B A 705.course_description: B A 705 - Marketing Strategy  Units: 2 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Development, implementation, and evaluation of marketing strategy and plans. Role of marketing planning, analysis and control; contributions and implications of marketing to corporate strategy. Strategies for attaining competitive advantage. Contemporary marketing planning tools and techniques. Maximum Credits: 2

B A 707.course_description: B A 707 - Executive Seminar in Negotiations  Units: 2 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to M.B.A. for Executives program.Negotiations principles in managerial contexts. Concepts, skills, and simulations of negotiation processes. Maximum Credits: 2

B A 709.course_name: Seminar in the Global Financial Environment
B A 709.course_description: B A 709 - Seminar in the Global Financial Environment  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Develops understanding of world economy and illustrates impact of financial environment on decision making process of business managers. How corporations respond to changing economic forces and/or historical governmental policies. Maximum Credits: 3

B A 710.course_description: B A 710 - Executive Leadership  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Theoretical and empirical literature pertaining to study and assessment of leadership skills. Process of organizational change and development. Maximum Credits: 3

B A 711.course_description: B A 711 - Seminar in Contemporary Challenges  Units: 1-5 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Challenges facing managers of organizations in modern society: organizational, human resources, operational, economic, environmental, political, international, and technological issues. Maximum Credits: 5Maximum Credit Statement: five units applicable to a master’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

B A 780.course_description: B A 780 - Field Studies in Business  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Completion of M.B.A. core.Application of business concepts to real world organizations. Students work under supervision of a faculty member to perform a project utilizing theories and principles from previous business coursework. Maximum Credits: 6

B A 790.course_description: B A 790 - Directed Readings in Business Administration  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Preparation for the comprehensive examination for students in the M.B.A. for Executives program (Plan B). Maximum Credits: 3

B A 794.course_description: B A 794 - International Business Development Practicum  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Advancement to candidacy.Strategic analysis of business opportunities. Problem definition, data collection, analysis, and prioritization of solution mechanisms. Preparation for comprehensive examination. Maximum Credits: 3

ART 798.course_description: ART 798 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Arranged with school director and instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 9Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to the M.A. degree; nine units applicable to the M.F.A. degree in art.

ART 799A.course_description: ART 799A - Thesis or Project  Units: 3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): An officially appointed thesis committee and advancement to candidacy.Preparation of a project or thesis for a master’s degree. Maximum Credits: 3

ART 799B.course_description: ART 799B - Thesis or Project Extension  Units: 0 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Prior registration in Thesis 799A with an assigned grade symbol of RP.Registration required in any semester or term following assignment of RP in Course 799A in which the student expects to use the facilities and resources of the university; also student must be registered in the course when the completed thesis or project is granted final approval. Maximum Credits: 0

ASIAN 100.course_name: State and Society in the Asia Pacific
ASIAN 100.course_description: ASIAN 100 - State and Society in the Asia Pacific  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Social, political, and economic foundations of Asia Pacific societies. Emphasis on diversity of Asian cultures, their relationship with each other and within the global community. Maximum Credits: 3

ASIAN 101.course_description: ASIAN 101 - Asian Thought and Cultures  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Intellectual and cultural underpinnings of East, Southeast, South, and Central Asia, from ancient to present, by means of a comparative overview of philosophies, religions, literatures, architectural design, visual and performing arts, highlighting continuing influence of tradition in contemporary Asian societies. Maximum Credits: 3

ASIAN 102A.course_description:
ASIAN 102A - Politics, Power, and Asian America  Units: 3 Foundations - Ethnic Studies [CSU F]Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Asian American perspectives on politics and power. Considers activism, political participation, and laws related to Asian Americans. Ideals of the U.S. Constitution and its political institutions and processes. Note: Satisfies the American Institutions requirement in American history and United States Constitution. This course satisfies the ethnic studies [ES] requirement.
 Back to Top | Print-Friendly Page (opens a new window)

ASIAN 102B.course_description: ASIAN 102B - Asian American History  Units: 3 Foundations - Ethnic Studies [CSU F]Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Asian American histories from the Gold Rush, Railroads to World War II to present day. Immigration patterns, resistance stories, Constitution, Asians and Asian Americans in California. U.S. history from an Asian American perspective. Note: Satisfies the American Institutions requirement in American history and California government. This course satisfies the ethnic studies [ES] requirement.

ASIAN 103.course_description: ASIAN 103 - Introduction to Filipino/Philippine Studies  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Introduction to Filipino American Studies to include culture, economics, history, governments, laws, and the artistic, intellectual, philosophical, political, and religious foundations for these structures. Maximum Credits: 3Note: This course satisfies the Ethnics Studies [ES] requirement.

ASIAN 104.course_description: ASIAN 104 - Korean American Experiences  Units: 3 Foundations - Social and Behavioral Sciences [CSU D]Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC An overview of Korean American communities, identities, issues, and cultural productions. Highlights the diversity of Korean American experiences, examining variations across race, gender, sexuality, and social class, among others.

ASIAN 110.course_description: ASIAN 110 - Elementary Conversational Chinese  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Same As: CHIN 100  Introductory conversational course for students with little or no previous background in Chinese. Focuses on daily tasks that one may encounter when first going to a Chinese-speaking community. Develops elementary listening and speaking skills needed for accomplishing these tasks. Maximum Credits: 3

ASIAN 111.course_description: ASIAN 111 - The Mindful Brain  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Asian perspectives on contemporary and traditional forms of mindfulness practice. Physiological, psychological, and socio-cultural benefits assessed in terms of neuroscience and philosophy. Maximum Credits: 3

ASIAN 264.course_description:
ASIAN 264 - Asian American Film and Media  Units: 3 Foundations - Arts and Humanities - Arts [CSU C1]Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Asian American experiences told through film and media. Independent films, documentaries, experimental, and social justice films.  Note: This course satisfies the ethnic studies [ES] requirement.
 Back to Top | Print-Friendly Page (opens a new window)

ASIAN 296.course_description: ASIAN 296 - Experimental Topics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Selected topics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

ASIAN 300.course_description: ASIAN 300 - Asia’s Global Future  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Survey of contemporary Asia Pacific region and future prospects, politically, socially, and economically, as historically grounded in cultural and philosophical roots. Maximum Credits: 3

ASIAN 301.course_description:
ASIAN 301 - Gender, Sexuality, and Asian Americans  Units: 3 Explorations - Social and Behavioral Sciences [CSU D Upper Division]Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Feminism, gender, and sexuality in the lives and experiences of Asian Americans. Interdisciplinary, intersectional, theoretical, and applied approaches. Note: This course satisfies the ethnic studies [ES] Area X requirement.
 Back to Top | Print-Friendly Page (opens a new window)

ASIAN 320.course_description: ASIAN 320 - Asian Environmental Issues  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division standing.Major Asian environmental issues such as acid rain in China, dams on Mekong Delta, deforestation, and biodiversity conservation in Southeast Asia, population density in Bangladesh, overpopulation in China and India, and impending failure of Green Revolution. Maximum Credits: 3Note: This course satisfies the general education cultural diversity requirement.

ASIAN 321.course_description: ASIAN 321 - Korean Civilization  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Same As: KOR 321   Prerequisite(s): Upper division standing.Development of art, religion, philosophy, political, social institutions through different periods in Korean history. Humanistic dimensions of the Korean mind, traditions, heritage. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Taught in English. This course satisfies the general education cultural diversity requirement.

ASIAN 351.course_description: ASIAN 351 - Chinese Philosophy  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Same As: PHIL 351   Philosophical traditions which have shaped the intellectual life and culture of China. Emphasis on foundational texts surviving from pre-Han China. Maximum Credits: 3Note: This course satisfies the general education cultural diversity requirement.

ASIAN 353.course_name: Language and Social Interaction in China
ASIAN 353.course_description: ASIAN 353 - Language and Social Interaction in China  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Same As: CHIN 353   Stereotypes and empirical findings of the relationship between language use and social behavior in China. Confucianism and Cultural Revolution; personal relationships and hierarchical structure; characteristics of Chinese language and interaction; politeness in everyday social encounters in China; cultural miscommunication. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Taught in English.

ASIAN 361.course_description: ASIAN 361 - Eating Asian America  Units: 3 Explorations - Social and Behavioral Sciences [CSU D Upper Division]Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Explore the people, practices, and dishes that make up contemporary Asian American food. Determine the important role that food plays in maintaining Asian American communities, cultures, and identities.  Note: This course satisfies the ethnic studies [ES] requirement.

ASIAN 380.course_description: ASIAN 380 - Japanese Culture  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Same As: HUM 380  and JAPAN 380 . Significant works of literary, performing, and visual arts to include array of artistic trends, cultural phenomena, historical developments, and socio-political discourses throughout the nation’s long and tumultuous history. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Taught in English.

ASIAN 421.course_description: ASIAN 421 - Asian History since 1600  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Same As: HIST 421   China, Japan, and India, with case studies on Philippines and Vietnam. Comparative Asian responses to Western imperialism, nationalism, revolution, and war. Diverse Cold War paths; contemporary problems and prospects. Maximum Credits: 3Note: This course satisfies the general education cultural diversity requirement.

ASIAN 422.course_description: ASIAN 422 - Asian American Experiences  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Same As: HIST 422   Prerequisite(s): Upper division standing.Experiences of Asian/Pacific Islander Americans to include immigration, colonialism, imperialism, exclusion, citizenship, labor, family, community, gender, popular culture, refugees, multi-racial tensions, globalization, and resistance. Maximum Credits: 3Note: This course satisfies the ethnic studies [ES] requirement.

ASIAN 425.course_description: ASIAN 425 - The Vietnam War  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Same As: HIST 425   The Vietnam War from a global perspective. The war’s evolution in Vietnam and Indochina as well as its implications on socialist nations, the Third World, and the West. Maximum Credits: 3Note: This course satisfies the general education cultural diversity requirement.

ASIAN 430.course_description: ASIAN 430 - Contemporary Korean Culture Through Media  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Same As: KOR 430   Prerequisite(s): Upper division standing.Contemporary Korean culture and society as reflected in various modes of media (news, drama, film, instructional technology). Korean culture in neighboring countries and beyond. Historical perspective to modern Korean culture. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Taught in English. This course satisfies the general education cultural diversity requirement.

ASIAN 458.course_description: ASIAN 458 - Asian Traditions  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Same As: REL S 458   Prerequisite(s): Six units of Asian-content courses or upper division standing.Social, cultural, economic, and political traditions of South, Southeast, and East Asia; how they functioned in theory and practice prior to twentieth century. Maximum Credits: 3Note: This course satisfies the general education cultural diversity requirement.

ASIAN 460.course_description: ASIAN 460 - Contemporary Issues in Filipino-American Communities  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Same As: FILIP 460 . Prerequisite(s): Upper division standing.History of Philippines and Filipino immigration to US. Current issues in Filipino American communities to include labor, health, gender and sexuality, race relations, family culture and parenting, youth and the elderly, ethnic identity and empowerment. Maximum Credits: 3Note: This course satisfies the ethnic studies [ES] requirement.

ASIAN 480.course_description: ASIAN 480 - Asian Leadership Models  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division standing.Asian philosophies of leadership to include conflict resolution, decision-making, definitions of a leader, education, and thinking styles. Applications of theoretical structures in business and economics, government and diplomacy, negotiating war and peace, and pedagogy. Primary ancient and contemporary texts from Asian cultures. Maximum Credits: 3

ASIAN 490.course_description: ASIAN 490 - Study Abroad in Asian Studies  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division standing. See Class Schedule for additional prerequisites.Selected topics in Asian studies. Courses taught abroad in Asian countries through a program approved by Center for Asian and Pacific Studies to include SDSU faculty-led courses in these countries.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units of which three units may be applicable to General Education.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content and geographic location. This course satisfies the general education cultural diversity requirement.

ASIAN 496.course_description: ASIAN 496 - Experimental Topics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Six units of Asian-content courses.Selected topics in Asian studies.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units with new content.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

ASIAN 499.course_description: ASIAN 499 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): At least six units of upper division work completed toward the major or minor in Asian studies and consent of the instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6

ASIAN 596.course_description: ASIAN 596 - Selected Studies in Asian Cultures  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Topics on various aspects of Asian studies.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units of 596 applicable to a bachelor’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

ASIAN 797.course_description: ASIAN 797 - Research  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Research in one of the aspects of Asia Pacific studies. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

ASIAN 799A.course_description: ASIAN 799A - Thesis  Units: 3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): An officially appointed thesis committee and advancement to candidacy.Preparation of a project or thesis for the master’s degree. Maximum Credits: 3

ASIAN 799B.course_description: ASIAN 799B - Thesis Extension  Units: 0 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Prior registration in Thesis 799A with an assigned grade symbol of RP.Registration required in any semester or term following assignment of RP in 799A in which the student expects to use the facilities and resources of the university; also student must be registered in the course when the completed thesis is granted final approval. Maximum Credits: 0

ASTR 101.course_description: ASTR 101 - Principles of Astronomy  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Discover the universe: planets, stars, galaxies, and our place in the cosmos; the Big Bang; how stars shine; comets, meteors, nebulae, the Milky Way; black holes and other exotic objects. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Not open to students with credit in ASTR 201 .

ASTR 109.course_description: ASTR 109 - Astronomy Laboratory  Units: 1 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): Credit or concurrent registration in ASTR 101  or ASTR 201 .Demonstration of astronomical principles through observations with astronomical instruments and analysis of astronomical data. A nighttime field trip to Mount Laguna Observatory is required. Maximum Credits: 1

ASTR 201.course_description: ASTR 201 - Astronomy for Science Majors  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Satisfaction of the SDSU Mathematics/Quantitative Reasoning Assessment requirement.Directed toward students with a strong interest in science and mathematics. Understanding the night sky, introduction to the solar system, star formation and evolution, extrasolar planets, nature of the Milky Way and other galaxies, origin and fate of the universe. Maximum Credits: 3

ASTR 296.course_description: ASTR 296 - Experimental Topics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Selected topics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

ASTR 303.course_name: A Walk Through the Stellar Graveyard
ASTR 303.course_description: ASTR 303 - A Walk Through the Stellar Graveyard  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Completion of the General Education requirement in Foundations of Learning II.A.1. Physical Sciences and in Foundations of Learning II.A.4. Mathematics/Quantitative Reasoning.Deaths of stars and their exotic corpses to include black holes, neutron stars, and white dwarfs. User-friendly introduction to Einstein’s relativity theories, gravitational waves, and warped space-time. Maximum Credits: 3

ASTR 310.course_name: Astrobiology and the Search for Extraterrestrial Life
ASTR 310.course_description: ASTR 310 - Astrobiology and the Search for Extraterrestrial Life  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Completion of the General Education requirement in Foundations of Learning II.A.1. Physical Sciences or II.A.2. Life Sciences.Extraterrestrial life in our solar system and other planetary systems; formation of stars and planets; UFOs and SETI; origin and evolution of life on earth; life in extreme environments; cosmology and structure of universe. Maximum Credits: 3

ASTR 320.course_description: ASTR 320 - Solar System Astronomy  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ASTR 201  and PHYS 197 , PHYS 197L .Structures of the planets; their surfaces, atmospheres, and satellite systems; asteroids, comets, and meteoroids. The Sun, its structure, energy production, and influence in the solar system. Life in the solar system. Maximum Credits: 3

ASTR 350.course_description: ASTR 350 - Astronomical Techniques  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ASTR 201 , MATH 342A , and PHYS 197 .Astronomical observation and optics. Data acquisition and reduction for modern astronomical instrumentation including photometry, direct imaging, and spectroscopy. Techniques for obtaining precise measurements and determining measurement uncertainties. Maximum Credits: 3

ASTR 440.course_description: ASTR 440 - Astrophysics of Stars  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): PHYS 354 . Recommended: PHYS 360 .Lives, interior structures, and physics that determines how stars work. Stellar atmospheres and spectrum of light that emerges from stars. Maximum Credits: 3

ASTR 450.course_description: ASTR 450 - Extragalactic Astronomy  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ASTR 201  or equivalent; MATH 150 , MATH 151 ; PHYS 195 , PHYS 196 , PHYS 197 .Review of basic astrophysics; flux and intensity measurements, blackbody radiation, the astronomical magnitude system, interstellar extinction, and distances determinations within the galaxy; morphological properties of galaxies; stellar populations; extragalactic distance indicators and the cosmological distance scale; introduction to cosmology. Maximum Credits: 3

ASTR 496.course_description: ASTR 496 - Experimental Topics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Selected topics.  May be repeated once with new content. Maximum Credits: 3Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

ASTR 498A.course_description: ASTR 498A - Senior Project  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): A student’s academic program must demonstrate that they are on track to graduate within one academic year.Selection and design of individual projects. Maximum Credits: 1

ASTR 498B.course_description: ASTR 498B - Senior Project  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Six hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): ASTR 498A .Individual research project culminating in a final written report. Maximum Credits: 2

ASTR 499.course_description: ASTR 499 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6

ASTR 510.course_description: ASTR 510 - Exoplanets  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ASTR 350  and ASTR 440 , or PHYS 350  and PHYS 354  with minimum grade of B-, and consent of instructor.Extrasolar planet detection; mass and radius determination; transits and eclipses; orbital dynamics and transit timing variations; internal and atmospheric characteristics; the exoplanet population and formation scenarios. Maximum Credits: 3

ASTR 596.course_description: ASTR 596 - Advanced Topics in Astronomy  Units: 2-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Selected topics in astronomy or astrophysics.  May be repeated with new content upon approval of instructor. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units of 596 applicable to a bachelor’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

ASTR 610.course_description: ASTR 610 - Binary Stars  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ASTR 450 .Visual, spectroscopic, and eclipsing binary stars. Review of observational techniques. Methods of orbital analysis with applications emphasizing determination of fundamental stellar properties, such as mass, radius, temperature, and luminosity. Implications for stellar evolution. Maximum Credits: 3

ASTR 620.course_description: ASTR 620 - Galactic Structure  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ASTR 450 .Survey of basic observational data for determining structure of Milky Way Galaxy. Includes luminosity functions, stellar distributions, solar motion, stellar populations, kinematics and dynamics of general and peculiar stellar motions. Maximum Credits: 3

ASTR 630.course_description: ASTR 630 - Stellar Atmospheres and Interiors  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ASTR 440  and MATH 342A .Gas thermodynamics and equations of state. Production of stellar continuum radiation and spectral lines. Theories of radiative and convective energy transport. Interior structure and evolution of stars. Maximum Credits: 3

ASTR 650.course_description: ASTR 650 - Galactic Structure and Evolution  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ASTR 680 .Stellar and gaseous structures of the Milky Way and external galaxies. Properties to include chemical evolution, color distributions, luminosity functions, mass-to-light ratios, scaling relations, and surface brightness profiles. Dark matter halos, gravitational collapse models, and hierarchical structure formation. Contents and physical state of interstellar and circumgalactic media. Maximum Credits: 3

ASTR 670.course_description: ASTR 670 - Foundations of Modern Cosmology  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ASTR 680 .Big Bang nucleosynthesis, cosmic microwave background, early universe, expansion dynamics, extragalactic distance scale, largescale structure, Newtonian and relativistic cosmology. Observational constraints on cosmological parameters and equation of state. Maximum Credits: 3

ASTR 680.course_description: ASTR 680 - Astronomical Techniques  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ASTR 350  and ASTR 450 .Basic methods of data acquisition and analysis. Emphasis is given to CCD direct imaging, spectroscopy, and photometry. Direct experience with telescopes and instruments at Mount Laguna Observatory, as well as with the department computing and image processing facility. Maximum Credits: 3

ASTR 797.course_description: ASTR 797 - Research  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Research in one of the fields of astronomy. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

ASTR 798.course_description: ASTR 798 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of staff; to be arranged with department chair and instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

ASTR 799A.course_description: ASTR 799A - Thesis  Units: 3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): An officially appointed thesis committee and advancement to candidacy.Preparation of a project or thesis for the master’s degree. Maximum Credits: 3

ASTR 799B.course_description: ASTR 799B - Thesis Extension  Units: 0 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Prior registration in Thesis 799A with an assigned grade symbol of RP.Registration required in any semester or term following assignment of RP in Course 799A in which the student expects to use the facilities and resources of the university; also student must be registered in the course when the completed thesis is granted final approval. Maximum Credits: 0

AUD 696.course_description: AUD 696 - Selected Topics in Audiology  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing.Intensive study in specific areas of audiology.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 12Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

AUD 700.course_description: AUD 700 - Hearing Science  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to doctoral program.Nature of sound and applications to hearing and speech, including acoustics, structure, and function of auditory system, and perception of sound. Maximum Credits: 3

AUD 701.course_description: AUD 701 - Clinical Practice I  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  One unit represents three hours per week.Prerequisite(s): Credit or concurrent registration in AUD 705  and AUD 710 .Applications of clinical procedures to patient assessment. Includes computer-based simulated cases, clinical observations, and supervised patient care involving diagnostics and hearing aid evaluations at the on-campus audiology clinic.  May be repeated. Maximum Credits: 3

AUD 702.course_description: AUD 702 - Clinical Methods Lab  Units: 1 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  Two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): Concurrent registration in AUD 701 .Practice in tests and methods used in audiological clinical practicum.  May be repeated. Maximum Credits: 3

AUD 705.course_description: AUD 705 - Diagnostic Audiology I  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): Admission to doctoral program.Theoretical bases and technical experience necessary to perform basic audiologic assessment, including otoscopy, puretone, masking, speech, and immittance measures, testing and patient counseling. Hands-on experiences with different tests and equipment. Maximum Credits: 3

AUD 710.course_description: AUD 710 - Hearing Amplification I  Units: 4 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  Three lectures and two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): Admission to doctoral program.Hearing aid components and signal processing, electroacoustic analysis, prescriptive techniques, verification procedures, hearing aid orientation, follow-up and troubleshooting. Maximum Credits: 4

AUD 711.course_name: Audiologic Management for Hearing Loss and Tinnitus
AUD 711.course_description: AUD 711 - Audiologic Management for Hearing Loss and Tinnitus  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Principles of audiologic management through the frameworks of international classification of function, multicultural communication, and patient centered care. Delivery of hearing loss and tinnitus management services to adult, geriatric, pediatric populations. Maximum Credits: 3

AUD 712.course_name: Research and Evidence-Based Practice in Audiology
AUD 712.course_description: AUD 712 - Research and Evidence-Based Practice in Audiology  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to the doctoral program.Research methods and scientific writing in audiology/hearing science; critical evaluation of research; evidence-based practice in audiology; research proposal development. Maximum Credits: 3

AUD 713.course_description: AUD 713 - Audiology Research Methods  Units: 1 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  Two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): AUD 712  with a grade of C (2.0) or better.Practices in data management. Analyses and research writing for audiological research. Maximum Credits: 1

AUD 715.course_description: AUD 715 - Diagnostic Audiology II  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): AUD 705 .Advanced procedures, including video-otoscopy, cerumen management, multiple component tympanometry, tests for 8th nerve, non-organic, and central involvement, and calibration. Principles and procedures for otoacoustic emission measurements (OAEs). Pathologies as they relate to audiologic measures. Maximum Credits: 3

AUD 720.course_description: AUD 720 - Auditory Evoked Potentials I  Units: 4 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): AUD 700  and AUD 705 .Theoretical and clinical aspects of auditory evoked potentials, specifically otoacoustic emissions and their measurement, electrocochleography, and auditory brainstem responses. Maximum Credits: 4

AUD 721.course_name: Clinical Case Studies and Staffings I
AUD 721.course_description: AUD 721 - Clinical Case Studies and Staffings I  Units: 1 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Concurrent registration in AUD 701 .Presentations and discussion of clinical cases and issues relative to clinical practice. Students’ clinical experiences are discussed relative to medical and audiological assessment and management. Maximum Credits: 1

AUD 725.course_description: AUD 725 - Pediatric Audiology  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): AUD 700  and AUD 705 .Development of normal and abnormal auditory behavior, behavioral and physiological testing of infants and children, hearing screening for pre-and school-age children, educational audiology, auditory processing disorders, counseling of patient and family, and assistive listening devices. Maximum Credits: 3

AUD 795.course_description: AUD 795 - Research Practicum  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Admission to doctoral program and consent of instructor.Participation in specific faculty research activities. Research methods and objectives of a specific research laboratory. Data collection and analysis. Maximum Credits: 3

AUD 798.course_description: AUD 798 - Doctoral Special Studies  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Admission to doctoral program and consent of instructor. Individual study in field of specialization.  Maximum Credits: 3

AUD 800.course_name: Advanced Evoked Potential Measures and Audiological Instrumentation
AUD 800.course_description: AUD 800 - Advanced Evoked Potential Measures and Audiological Instrumentation  Units: 4 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and four hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): AUD 710  and AUD 720 .Advanced concepts and hands-on experience with different audiological instruments and measures to improve diagnostic skills in interpreting and performing behavioral and physiologic tests. Calibration instrumentation and techniques. Critical thinking, problem-solving, and reasoning skills pertaining to equipment testing parameters and use. Maximum Credits: 4

AUD 801.course_description: AUD 801 - Clinical Practice II  Units: 1-2 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  One unit represents three hours per week.Prerequisite(s): Open to third year doctoral students and consent of instructor.Diagnostics and hearing aid evaluations/fittings in the on-campus audiology clinic.  May be repeated. Maximum Credits: 3

AUD 802.course_description: AUD 802 - Clinical Precepting in Audiology  Units: 1 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): AUD 701 .Effective precepting, determining appropriate teaching styles to maximize clinical learning, including timely and positive feedback regarding clinical progress and assigning grades. Identifying need for remediation and developing effective programs to target deficient skills.  May be repeated. Maximum Credits: 3

AUD 810.course_name: Seminar in Amplification Research and Technology
AUD 810.course_description: AUD 810 - Seminar in Amplification Research and Technology  Units: 2 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Amplification, advances in hearing aid analysis, selection and verification techniques, advanced hearing aid signal processing strategies, programmable and digital technology, sensory aids for special applications. Maximum Credits: 2

AUD 812.course_description: AUD 812 - Counseling and Communication in Audiology  Units: 2 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Principles of culturally competent clinical communication for audiology care. Empathy, the four-habits model, shared decision making, trust. Methods from nursing and medicine. Discussion with parents of children with hearing loss and adults with audiology related concerns. In-class role play, reflection. Maximum Credits: 2

AUD 815.course_name: Communication Disorders Across Lifespan and Cultures
AUD 815.course_description: AUD 815 - Communication Disorders Across Lifespan and Cultures  Units: 2 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Communication processes and disorders from infancy to elderly, including phonetics, phonology, speech, and language. Prepares audiologists to recognize a variety of communication disorders, and to learn how to apply screening instruments, in culturally sensitive ways, and to make appropriate referrals. Maximum Credits: 2

AUD 830.course_name: Seminar in Contemporary Topics in Audiology and Hearing Science
AUD 830.course_description: AUD 830 - Seminar in Contemporary Topics in Audiology and Hearing Science  Units: 2 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Open to third year doctoral students.Audiology and hearing science. Reading and critiquing journal articles and data emerging from research laboratories. Maximum Credits: 2

AUD 831.course_description: AUD 831 - Field Clinical Practice  Units: 3-6 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  One unit represents four hours per week.Prerequisite(s): Open to third year doctoral students and consent of instructor.Supervised practicum in one or more approved community agencies.  May be repeated. Maximum Credits: 6

AUD 835.course_description: AUD 835 - Psychoacoustics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to doctoral program.Psychophysical concepts underlying clinical audiology. Psychoacoustic abilities of individuals with normal hearing and sensorineural hearing loss. Practical experience in conducting psychoacoustic tests. Maximum Credits: 3

AUD 840.course_description: AUD 840 - Auditory Evoked Potentials II  Units: 2 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): AUD 720 .Advanced techniques in measurement of otoacoustic emissions and later auditory evoked potentials. Otoacoustic emission level dependence, group delay, and suppression; middle latency and steady-state responses, cortical auditory evoked potentials (N1- P2), and auditory event-related potentials (MMN, P3). Maximum Credits: 2

AUD 845.course_description: AUD 845 - Hearing Conservation  Units: 1 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): AUD 700  and AUD 705 .Hearing conservation programs in various settings. Current research on occupational noise exposure and hearing loss and workers’ compensation coverage of hearing loss. Maximum Credits: 1

AUD 871.course_description: AUD 871 - Externship in Audiology  Units: 10 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Advancement to candidacy.Full-time clinical externship at approved agency. Continuation and intensification of clinical experiences with reduced amount of direct supervision culminating in ability to work independently. Maximum Credits: 30

AUD 891.course_description: AUD 891 - On-Line Integrative Clinical Seminar  Units: 2 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Advancement to candidacy and consent of adviser.On-line discussion of clinical experiences and interesting cases. Maximum Credits: 6

AUD 897.course_description: AUD 897 - Independent Research  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of adviser.Research in audiology or hearing science. Maximum Credits: 3Maximum Credit Statement: three units applicable to the audiology degree.

AUD 899.course_description: AUD 899 - Doctoral Project  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): AUD 712  and advancement to candidacy.Individual investigation and preparation of the doctoral project for the audiology degree. Maximum Credits: 3

BDA 572.course_description: BDA 572 - Python Scripting for Social Science  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Same As: LING 572 . Prerequisite(s): Upper division or graduate standing.Python scripting for social science data. Statements and expressions. Strings, lists, dictionaries, files. Python with unformatted data (regular expressions). Graphs and social networks. Spatial data and simple GIS scripts. Maximum Credits: 3

BDA 594.course_name: Big Data Science and Analytics Platforms
BDA 594.course_description: BDA 594 - Big Data Science and Analytics Platforms  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Same As: GEOG 594 . Prerequisite(s): GEOG 104 , CS 100  or CS 150  and CS 150L ; and GEOG 385 , SOC 201 , STAT 250 , or graduate standing.Big data science to include analysis, data collection, filtering, GIS, machine learning, processing, text analysis, and visualization. Computational platforms, skills, and tools for conducting big data analytics with real world case studies and examples. Maximum Credits: 9

BDA 600.course_description: BDA 600 - Big Data Analytics Capstone Seminar  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): BDA 572  [or LING 572 ], BDA 594  [or GEOG 594 ], B A 642 , MIS 686 .Capstone course to integrate data analytics knowledge. Big data problems and research challenges. Student teams conduct group projects and present findings. Maximum Credits: 3

BDA 602.course_description: BDA 602 - Machine Learning Engineering  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): GEOG 104 , CS 100 ; CS 150  and CS 150L ; or equivalent computer programming course.  GEOG 385 , STAT 250 , SOC 201 , or equivalent statistics course.Prepare data, extract features, build machine learning models and deploy them to production. Maximum Credits: 3

BDA 603.course_description: BDA 603 - Smart Cities and Sustainability  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing. Undertakes a problem-based approach by analyzing, comparing, and contrasting a problem relative to the UN-Sustainable-Development-Goals through the use of big data analytics in smart cities and developing practical big data application tools that can be used by city-professionals.

BDA 696.course_name: Advanced Special Topics in Big Data Analytics
BDA 696.course_description: BDA 696 - Advanced Special Topics in Big Data Analytics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Advanced special topics in big data analytics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

BDA 797.course_description: BDA 797 - Research  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Research in one of the fields of big data analytics. Maximum Credits: 3Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

BDA 798.course_description: BDA 798 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Consent of staff; to be arranged with program director and instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 3Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

BDA 799A.course_description: BDA 799A - Thesis or Project  Units: 3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): An officially appointed thesis committee and advancement to candidacy.Preparation of a project or thesis for the master’s degree. Maximum Credits: 3

BDA 799B.course_description: BDA 799B - Thesis or Project Extension  Units: 0 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Prior registration in Thesis 799A with an assigned grade symbol of RP.Registration required in any semester or term following assignment of RP in Course 799A in which the student expects to use the facilities and resources of the university; also, student must be registered in the course when the completed thesis is granted final approval. Maximum Credits: 0

BDA 799C.course_description: BDA 799C - Comprehensive Examination Extension  Units: 0 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Completion or concurrent enrollment in degree program courses.Registration required of students whose only requirement is completion of the comprehensive examination for the master’s degree. Registration in 799C limited to two semesters. Maximum Credits: 0

BIOMI 568.course_description: BIOMI 568 - Bioinformatics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Same As: BIOL 568 . Prerequisite(s): BIOL 366 .Bioinformatics analysis methods and programming skills. Practical bioinformatic software for sequence analysis, bioinformatic algorithms and programming fundamentals. Maximum Credits: 3

BIOMI 596.course_name: Special Topics in Bioinformatics and Medical Informatics
BIOMI 596.course_description: BIOMI 596 - Special Topics in Bioinformatics and Medical Informatics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Advanced selected topics in bioinformatics and medical informatics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree. Credit for 596 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

BIOMI 600.course_name: Methods in Bioinformatics, Medical Informatics, and Cheminformatics
BIOMI 600.course_description: BIOMI 600 - Methods in Bioinformatics, Medical Informatics, and Cheminformatics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Same As: CS 600 . Prerequisite(s): Three units of calculus and graduate standing.Computer, mathematical, and engineering techniques for bioinformatics, cheminformatics, and medical informatics.
