The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): CJ 300 ; sophomore, junior or senior standing; upper division major status; only open to Criminal Justice, Interdisciplinary Studies in Three Departments, Public Administration, and Social Work majors. Constitutional legal theories and principles, especially the Fourth, Fifth, Sixth, and Eighth Amendments to the Constitution, as they affect criminal justice procedures and practices. Maximum Credits: 3

CJ 431.course_description: CJ 431 - Field Study in Local Corrections  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): CJ 300 ; senior standing; upper division major status; only open to Criminal Justice and Interdisciplinary Studies in Three Departments majors; 18 years of age; no convictions or pending charges.Structure, function, and mission of local prisons and jails. Legal authority under which accused and convicted offenders are detained. Prison life, prison culture, gangs, and survival behind bars. Lives and careers of correctional staff. On-site visits. Maximum Credits: 3

CJ 496.course_description: CJ 496 - Selected Topics in Criminal Justice  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Selected current topics in criminal justice. Maximum Credits: 6Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

CJ 497.course_description: CJ 497 - Investigation and Report  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): CJ 300 ; senior standing; only open to Criminal Justice majors; Graduation Writing Assessment Requirement completion.Using library, Internet, and empirical research. Analysis of current criminal justice policy issues. Maximum Credits: 3

CJ 498.course_description: CJ 498 - Internship in Criminal Justice  Units: 2-6 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): CJ 300 ; senior standing; only open to Criminal Justice majors; instructor approval.Students are assigned to various government agencies and work under joint supervision of agency heads and the course instructor. Participation in staff and internship conferences. Maximum Credits: 6

CJ 499.course_description: CJ 499 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Twelve units of upper division criminal justice and consent of instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6

CJ 510.course_description: CJ 510 - Contemporary Issues in Law Enforcement  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC - Letter (Cr/NC OK) Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing or CJ 300   and CJ 310  ; sophomore, junior or senior standing; upper division major status; only open to City Planning, Criminal Justice and Criminolology majors.Assessment of problems confronting administrators of law enforcement agencies and of recent efforts to enhance the capability of agencies to control criminal activity while guarding individual liberties.

CJ 520.course_description: CJ 520 - Prosecutorial Function  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC - Letter (Cr/NC OK) Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing or CJ 300  ; sophomore, junior or senior standing; upper division major status; only open to City Planning, Criminal Justice and Criminology, and Public Administration majors.Prosecutor’s function at local, state, and federal levels and in selected foreign nations, including appraisal of proposed national standards and goals for prosecutors.

CJ 531.course_description: CJ 531 - Probation and Parole  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC - Letter (Cr/NC OK) Prerequisite(s): CJ 300   or graduate standing; sophomore, junior or senior standing; upper division major status; only open to City Planning, Criminal Justice and Criminology, Public Administration, and Social Work majors.Basic concepts, history, legislation, and practices used in work with juveniles and adults who have been placed on probation or parole; criteria of selection, methods of supervision, and elements of case reporting.

CJ 540.course_name: Applied Planning, Research, and Program Evaluation in Criminal Justice
CJ 540.course_description: CJ 540 - Applied Planning, Research, and Program Evaluation in Criminal Justice  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC - Letter (Cr/NC OK) Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing or CJ 300 ; junior or senior standing; upper division major status; only open to Criminal Justice and Criminology majors; GWAR completion.Application of planning, research, program development, and evaluation principles to field of criminal justice.

CJ 543.course_description: CJ 543 - Community Resources in Criminal Justice  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC - Letter (Cr/NC OK) Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing or CJ 300 ; senior standing; upper division major status; only open to Criminal Justice and Criminology, Interdisciplinary Studies in Three Departments, and Social Work majors.Present and probable roles of public and private agencies and volunteers in criminal justice.

CJ 550.course_description: CJ 550 - Study Abroad: Criminal Justice  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): CJ 301  and upper division standing.Selected topics in comparative criminal justice. Course taught abroad.  May be repeated once with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

CJ 570.course_name: Organized Crime: Domestic and International Perspectives
CJ 570.course_description: CJ 570 - Organized Crime: Domestic and International Perspectives  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC - Letter (Cr/NC OK) Prerequisite(s): CJ 300  or graduate standing; sophomore, junior or senior standing; upper division major status; only open to Criminal Justice and Criminology, Homeland Security, International Security and Conflict Resolution, and Public Administration majors.Interdisciplinary analysis of organized crime’s impact on criminal justice and public policy on both domestic and international levels.

CJ 571.course_description: CJ 571 - Drugs: Domestic and International Perspectives  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC - Letter (Cr/NC OK) Prerequisite(s): CJ 300  or graduate standing; sophomore, junior or senior standing; upper division major status; only open to Criminal Justice and Criminology, Homeland Security, International Security and Conflict Resolution, and Public Administration majors.Interdisciplinary social science analysis of illicit drug use, markets, and trafficking. Comparative assessment of the efforts of state and non-state actors to regulate, counter, and disrupt illicit drug use, markets, and trafficking.

CJ 572.course_description: CJ 572 - Dark Networks, Crime, and Security  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC - Letter (Cr/NC OK) Prerequisite(s): CJ 300  or graduate standing; sophomore, junior or senior standing; upper division major status; only open to Criminal Justice and Criminology, Homeland Security, International Security and Conflict Resolution, and Public Administration majors.Advanced interdisciplinary social science analysis of social networks engaged in criminal activity and intelligence and security policies, as well as the actors that comprise these networks. Social network and structural analysis methods.

CJ 583.course_description: CJ 583 - Cultural Criminology  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC - Letter (Cr/NC OK) Prerequisite(s): CJ 300  and CJ 302  or graduate standing; sophomore, junior or senior standing; upper division major status; only open to Criminal Justice and Criminology, Public Administration, and Social Work majors.Cultural expressions and meanings of law breaking, law enforcement, and law making.

CJ 596.course_description: CJ 596 - Selected Topics in Criminal Justice  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): CJ 300 .Selected current topics in criminal justice.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

CJ 601.course_name: Seminar in the Administration of Criminal Justice
CJ 601.course_description: CJ 601 - Seminar in the Administration of Criminal Justice  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): CJ 301 .Administrative problems of criminal justice systems. Maximum Credits: 3

CJ 602.course_name: Seminar in Comparative Criminal Justice System
CJ 602.course_description: CJ 602 - Seminar in Comparative Criminal Justice System  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): CJ 301 .The criminal justice system as both cause and consequence of social change; nature of institutional change with application to criminal justice system components. Maximum Credits: 3

CJ 603.course_name: Seminar in Community and Restorative Justice
CJ 603.course_description: CJ 603 - Seminar in Community and Restorative Justice  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Community and restorative justice movement from local, national, and international perspectives. Theories, policies, practices, and research associated with community and restorative justice. Maximum Credits: 3

CJ 604.course_name: Seminar in Criminal Justice and Urban Administration
CJ 604.course_description: CJ 604 - Seminar in Criminal Justice and Urban Administration  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): CJ 540 .Influences on crime control and criminal justice process of actions by urban administrators, legislators and private sector in areas such as housing, education, public health and transportation, and urban development policies. Maximum Credits: 3

CJ 605.course_name: Seminar in Juvenile Justice and Youth Violence
CJ 605.course_description: CJ 605 - Seminar in Juvenile Justice and Youth Violence  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing.Juvenile justice system in U.S. and throughout the world. Responses to delinquency and youth violence. History and foundations of juvenile court, juvenile justice reforms, context, causes, and correlates of youth violence and gang involvement, including programs and policies designed to address these problems. Maximum Credits: 3

CJ 696.course_description: CJ 696 - Selected Topics in Criminal Justice  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): CJ 601  or CJ 602 .Analysis of contemporary issues of major import to the administration of criminal justice.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 12Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

CJ 791.course_name: Seminar in Readings in Criminal Justice
CJ 791.course_description: CJ 791 - Seminar in Readings in Criminal Justice  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Six graduate units in criminal justice.Selected readings in the literature of criminal justice. Maximum Credits: 3

CJ 796.course_description: CJ 796 - Internship in Criminal Justice  Units: 3-12 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Students will be assigned to various government agencies and will work under joint supervision of agency heads and the course instructor. Participation in staff and internship conferences. Maximum Credits: 12

CJ 797.course_description: CJ 797 - Research in Criminal Justice  Units: 3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of coordinator of criminal justice.Research in one of the areas of criminal justice administration. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

CJ 798.course_description: CJ 798 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of staff; to be arranged with coordinator and instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

CJ 799A.course_description: CJ 799A - Thesis  Units: 3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): An officially appointed thesis committee and advancement to candidacy.Preparation of a project or thesis for the master’s degree. Maximum Credits: 3

CJ 799B.course_description: CJ 799B - Thesis Extension  Units: 0 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Prior registration in Thesis 799A with an assigned grade symbol of RP.Registration required in any semester or term following assignment of RP in Course 799A in which the student expects to use the facilities and resources of the university; also student must be registered in the course when the completed thesis is granted final approval. Maximum Credits: 0

CJ 799C.course_description: CJ 799C - Comprehensive Examination Extension  Units: 0 Grading Method: Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Completion or concurrent enrollment in degree program courses.Registration required of students whose only requirement is completion of the comprehensive examination for the master’s degree. Registration in 799C limited to two semesters.

DANCE 100D.course_description: DANCE 100D - Dance Activity: Yoga for Dancers  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two hours of activity.Open to all students. Provides physically skilled instruction and knowledge of yoga. Maximum Credits: 3

DANCE 100I.course_description: DANCE 100I - Dance Activity: Beginning Modern Dance  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two hours of activity.Open to all students. Provides physically skilled instruction and knowledge of modern dance forms. Maximum Credits: 1

DANCE 101.course_description: DANCE 101 - Dance Influencers  Units: 3 Foundations - Arts and Humanities - Arts [CSU C1]Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Basic characteristics and functions of dance on social media (TikTok, Instagram, and YouTube)–entertainment, entrepreneurship, self-expression, wellness, community building–by examining global dance influencers in hip hop, fitness, cheerleading, jazz, K-pop, drag, vogue, competition, ballet, Latin, Bollywood, and more.

DANCE 140.course_description: DANCE 140 - Freshman Seminar  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Introduction to concepts, theories, and best current practices of dance as a contemporary art form. Maximum Credits: 1

DANCE 145.course_description: DANCE 145 - Dancemaking Praxis I  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and two hours of activity.Practice of compositional, generative, and performance aspects of dancemaking from classical to contemporary perspectives. Ecosystem of encouragement, learning, and support through shared processes of making dances.

DANCE 153.course_description: DANCE 153 - Performance in Capstone  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two hours of activity.Performers in aesthetic, logistical, procedural, and theoretical considerations. Students admitted through audition will perform in capstone projects. Maximum Credits: 1

DANCE 156.course_description: DANCE 156 - Contact Improvisation I  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two hours of activity.Somatic perspectives on gravity, momentum, weight sharing, and other laws of physics. Duet improvisational skills to include partnering that requires immediacy, responsiveness, and trust. Maximum Credits: 1

DANCE 171.course_description: DANCE 171 - Digital Production Technology for Dancers  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and two hours of activity.Digital media and technical applications as applied to dance production. Maximum Credits: 2

DANCE 181.course_description: DANCE 181 - Introduction to Dance  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Foundations of dance in Western civilization. Dance as art, therapy, fitness, ritual, and social discourse. Analysis of dance in film, video, and live performance with an appreciation for artistic intent, technique, and style. Maximum Credits: 3

DANCE 190.course_description: DANCE 190 - Somatic Movement Practices I  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two hours of activity.Body-mind practices focused on first-person experience of movement. Awareness of sensations and perceptions are cultivated through the practice of somatic systems to include Bartenieff Fundamentals, Body-Mind Centering, and the Feldenkrais Method. Maximum Credits: 3

DANCE 210.course_description: DANCE 210 - Performance Forum  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Dance master classes, workshops, as related to dance performance, style, and repertoire.  May be repeated with consent of instructor.  Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: Six units with consent of instructor.

DANCE 221.course_description: DANCE 221 - Ballet I  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Four hours of activity.Ballet skills for dance majors and minors emphasizing placement, coordination, ballet terminology, and technical principles. Maximum Credits: four units.

DANCE 242.course_description: DANCE 242 - Dance Technique(s) Praxis I  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and two hours of activity.Praxis of classical, contemporary, cultural, and popular dance forms.  May be repeated with new content or consent of instructor.  Maximum Credits: 9Maximum Credit Statement: Nine units with consent of instructor.Note: Limit of 14 units of any combination of DANCE 242, DANCE 243  courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree. See Class Schedule for specific content.

DANCE 243.course_description: DANCE 243 - Applied Dance Techniques  Units: 1 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  Two hours of activity.Application of classical, contemporary, cultural, and popular dance forms. Maximum Credits: 10Note: Limit of 14 units of any combination of DANCE 242 , DANCE 243 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

DANCE 245.course_description: DANCE 245 - Dancemaking II  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Six hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): DANCE 145 .Continued practice of compositional, generative, and performance aspects of dancemaking from classical to contemporary perspectives. Ecosystem of encouragement, learning, and support through shared processes of making dances.Formerly numbered Dance 350, or 353 and 354. Maximum Credits: 3

DANCE 246.course_description: DANCE 246 - Dancemaking Lab I  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): DANCE 145.Focuses on development of content, choreography and performance techniques. Student-led initiatives, creative arts research, technical production elements and dance as a way to express, envision, and enact connection, imagination and social change.   May be repeated with new content or consent of instructor.  Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: Six units with consent of instructor.

DANCE 281.course_description: DANCE 281 - Dance, Popular Culture, and Identity  Units: 3 YesGrading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Psychological, sociocultural, therapeutic functions of dance in popular culture from Hollywood film to Broadway musical, television, YouTube, and global social media. Maximum Credits: 3

DANCE 289.course_description: DANCE 289 - Embodied Anatomy  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): BIOL 100 .Experiential and empirical overview of human anatomy and kinesiology. Movement and awareness practices from contemplative and somatic methodologies facilitating subjective, first-person study. Objective analyses include images, models, and physical demonstrations of basic biomechanics. Maximum Credits: 3

DANCE 290.course_description: DANCE 290 - Body Modalities  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Same As: MUSIC 290 . Two lectures and two hours of activity.Alternative movement theory systems including an introduction to body modalities of yoga, Pilates, ideokinesis, Alexander and Feldenkrais techniques, Laban movement analysis and authentic movement.  May be repeated with consent of instructor.  Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: Six units with consent of instructor.

DANCE 296.course_description: DANCE 296 - Experimental Topics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Selected topics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

DANCE 299.course_description: DANCE 299 - Special Study  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of School of Music and Dance director and instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 9

DANCE 300.course_description: DANCE 300 - Advanced Yoga for Dancer  Units: 1 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  Two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): DANCE 100D  with a grade of C (2.0) or better.Anatomical awareness, breathing and meditation techniques, and use of imagery to integrate functional and creative potential. Maximum Credits: 3

DANCE 345.course_description: DANCE 345 - Dancemaking Praxis III  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): Upper-division standing in dance.Traditional and contemporary methods, practices, and principles of choreography and improvisational dancemaking. Practices and orchestrations of all aspects of composition and dance performance.

DANCE 346.course_description: DANCE 346 - Dancemaking Lab II  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): DANCE 145.Focuses on development of content, choreography and performance techniques. Student-led initiatives, creative arts research, technical production elements and dance as a way to express, envision, and enact connection, imagination and social change.   May be repeated with new content or consent of instructor.  Maximum Credits: 9Maximum Credit Statement: Nine units with consent of instructor.

DANCE 356.course_description: DANCE 356 - Contact Improvisation II  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): DANCE 156  with a grade of C (2.0) or better.Continuing somatic approaches to gravity, momentum, weight sharing, and other laws of physics. Further development to duet improvisational skills to include partnering that requires immediacy, responsiveness, and trust. Maximum Credits: 6

DANCE 365.course_description: DANCE 365 - University Dance Company: Major Performance  Units: 1-2 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit  More than three hours of activity per week.Prerequisite(s): Open only to dance majors. Audition and approval by dance faculty.Practical experience in University Dance Company including concert performances of dance repertory, production of choreographic works, presentation of master classes and workshops, and participation in major production. Students must enroll in a minimum of two semesters. Maximum Credits: six units.

DANCE 371.course_description: DANCE 371 - Video Dance Production  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): DANCE 171 .Technical applications as applied to dance and dance production. Continuation of DANCE 171 . Maximum Credits: 2

DANCE 380.course_description: DANCE 380 - Dance History: contemporary Global Contexts  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): DANCE 181 .History of dance from early twentieth century to present in a global context. Political, economic, and cultural forces that have shaped the development of contemporary dance as an art form. Maximum Credits: 3

DANCE 382.course_description: DANCE 382 - Dance in World Cultures  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Dance in selected cultures; geographic, historical, social, and aesthetic factors which have shaped development and function. Maximum Credits: 3Note: This course satisfies the general education cultural diversity requirement.

DANCE 383.course_description: DANCE 383 - K-pop Dance  Units: 3 Explorations - Humanities and Fine Arts [CSU C Upper Division]Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC An evolution of K-pop dance from the 1980s’ broadcasting backup dancers to the 2020s’ dance influencers and global dance fandom for community building, self-expression, entrepreneurship, fitness, entertainment, and youth activism on social media.

DANCE 385.course_description: DANCE 385 - Dance Pedagogy  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): Upper division standing and passing junior level assessment.Teaching theory and practice as applied to dance for K-12 and adult populations.

DANCE 386A.course_description:
DANCE 386A - Dance Practicum I  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Junior level standing and concurrent registration in DANCE 385.An introduction to the dance teaching profession. Practical field study that integrates technical and conceptual content knowledge with pedagogical content knowledge in dance. The first of four Practicum courses.
  Note: Limit of eight units of DANCE 386A, DANCE 386B, DANCE 486A, DANCE 486B applicable to all Dance degrees.

DANCE 386B.course_description:
DANCE 386B - Dance Practicum II  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Junior level standing and DANCE 386A.Building on the practical application skills and theories studied in DANCE 386A, through field observations and practice. Supervised field study integrates professional studies of technical and conceptual knowledge with pedagogical knowledge for Pre-K through 5th grade. 
  Note: Limit of eight units of DANCE 386A, DANCE 386B, DANCE 486A, DANCE 486B applicable to all Dance degrees.

DANCE 390.course_description: DANCE 390 - Somatic Movement Practices II  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Same As: MUSIC 390   Two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): DANCE 190  and DANCE 290  [or MUSIC 290 ] with a grade of C (2.0) or better in each course.Continuing body-mind practices focused on first-person experience of movement. Increasing awareness of sensations and perceptions cultivated through additional practices of somatic systems to include Bartenieff Fundamentals, Body-Mind Centering, and Feldenkrais Method. Maximum Credits: 3

DANCE 398.course_description: DANCE 398 - Dance Internship  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Upper division standing and consent of dance director. Open only to dance majors and minors.Supervised practical experience in dance studio management and instruction. Maximum Credits: 3

DANCE 410.course_description: DANCE 410 - Performance Forum  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Dance master classes, workshops, as related to dance performance, style, repertoire. Maximum Credits: 4

DANCE 421.course_description: DANCE 421 - Ballet II  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Four hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): DANCE 221 .Ballet skills for dance majors emphasizing turns, jumps, batterie, extended sequences, and movement quality. Maximum Credits: four units.

DANCE 442.course_description: DANCE 442 - Dance Technique(s) Praxis II  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): DANCE 242  with a grade of C (2.0) or better.Advanced praxis of classical, contemporary, cultural, and popular dance forms.   May be repeated with new content or consent of instructor.  Maximum Credits: 9Maximum Credit Statement: Nine units with consent of instructor.

DANCE 443.course_description: DANCE 443 - Applied Dance Techniques II  Units: 1 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  Two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): DANCE 243   with a grade of C (2.0) or better.Application of classical, contemporary, cultural, and popular advanced dance forms. Maximum Credits: 10

DANCE 453.course_description: DANCE 453 - Senior Capstone  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): DANCE 345 .Fulfills the Capstone Requirements for B.F.A. candidates in the Dance major. Areas may emphasize either aspects of performance/choreography, pedagogical research and practice or dance research.

DANCE 471.course_description: DANCE 471 - Digital Media Dance Production  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): DANCE 371 .Lighting, set, multi-media, and design for dance. Study of concert multi-media and production for dance. Maximum Credits: 2

DANCE 481W.course_description: DANCE 481W - Performance Writing  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): DANCE 380. Satisfies Graduation Writing Assessment Requirement for students who have completed 60 units.Examination of contemporary dance through the related perspectives of criticism and aesthetics. This writing-intensive course enhances critical thinking and analytical skills, and develops a vocabulary with which to examine, address, and articulate a fundamentally non-verbal art form. Note: Not open to students with credit in DANCE 481.

DANCE 486A.course_description:
DANCE 486A - Dance Practicum III  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Junior level standing and credit in DANCE 386A and DANCE 386B.Builds on the practical application skills and theories studied in DANCE 386B field observation and field practice. Supervised field study integrates professional studies of technical and conceptual knowledge with pedagogical knowledge in the 6th grade through 8th grade.  
  Note: Limit of eight units of DANCE 386A, DANCE 386B, DANCE 486A, DANCE 486B applicable to all Dance degrees.

DANCE 486B.course_description:
DANCE 486B - Dance Practicum IV  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Junior level standing and DANCE 386A, DANCE 386B, and DANCE 486A.Final Practicum that focuses on student concerns as they begin realistic Early Field Experience in public schools. Emphasis on refining skills, professional ethics, and synthesizing dance knowledge with pedagogical knowledge to prepare for DANCE 453 capstone project.
  Note: Final course in a series of practicum courses that fulfills the required 30 and 45 hours (depending on program) of paid or volunteer fieldwork in a California public school. Limit of eight units of DANCE 386A, DANCE 386B, DANCE 486A, DANCE 486B applicable to all Dance degrees.

DANCE 496.course_description: DANCE 496 - Experimental Topics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Selected topics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

DANCE 499.course_description: DANCE 499 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of the dance director. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6

DANCE 696.course_description: DANCE 696 - Special Topics in Dance  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing.Specialized study of selected topics in dance.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 12Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

DANCE 798.course_description: DANCE 798 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing, consent of school director and instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

DPT 700.course_name: Foundations of Physical Therapy Evaluation I
DPT 700.course_description: DPT 700 - Foundations of Physical Therapy Evaluation I  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and six hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): Admission to the DPT program.Psychomotor skills in observation and evaluation of movement. Maximum Credits: 3

DPT 710.course_name: Foundations of Physical Therapy Evaluation II
DPT 710.course_description: DPT 710 - Foundations of Physical Therapy Evaluation II  Units: 4 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and six hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): DPT 700 , DPT 725  [or BIOL 725 ], and admission to the DPT program.Problem solving and psychomotor skills to perform general physical examination. Concepts, procedures, and techniques required to provide safe and effective patient care. Maximum Credits: 4

DPT 725.course_description: DPT 725 - Clinical Anatomy I  Units: 4 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Same As: BIOL 725 . Three lectures and three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): Admission to the DPT program.Applied anatomy of upper and lower extremities of the human body; joint anatomy and mechanics, anatomical structures to produce articular movement to include muscles, arterial, peripheral nervous systems, and articular and extremity movement patterns. Maximum Credits: 4

DPT 726.course_description: DPT 726 - Clinical Anatomy II  Units: 4 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Same As: BIOL 726 . Three lectures and three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): DPT 725  [or BIOL 725 ].Axial portion of the human body; biomechanics of the spinal column to include head and neck, thorax, related viscera, and abdomino-pelvic region. Maximum Credits: 4

DPT 750.course_name: Concepts in Physiology, Pathophysiology, and Pharmacology
DPT 750.course_description: DPT 750 - Concepts in Physiology, Pathophysiology, and Pharmacology  Units: 4 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to the DPT program or master’s degree program in kinesiology.Normal physiology, diseases, disorders, and injuries. Pathological processes, specific organ system pathology, multisystem pathology, and pharmacological concepts. Maximum Credits: 4

DPT 760.course_description: DPT 760 - Neurosciences  Units: 4 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): DPT 725  [or BIOL 725 ] and DPT 750  .Anatomy and physiology of central nervous system; substrates and processes of movement. Maximum Credits: 4

DPT 780.course_description: DPT 780 - Therapeutic Modalities  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and six hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): Admission to the DPT program.Anatomy, physiology, pathology, mutability of human biological tissues in the rehabilitation process. Maximum Credits: 3

DPT 782.course_description: DPT 782 - Therapeutic Exercise  Units: 4 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and six hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): DPT 710 , DPT 725  [or BIOL 725 ], DPT 750 , DPT 780 , DPT 881 .Therapeutic exercise as it applies to clinical practice of physical therapy. Maximum Credits: 4

DPT 801.course_description: DPT 801 - Clerkship  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Successful completion of all coursework up to Doctor of Physical Therapy 801, Clerkship.Cognitive, psychomotor, and affective skills of physical therapy practice in a clinical setting. Maximum Credits: 3

DPT 802.course_description: DPT 802 - Life Cycle I  Units: 2 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): DPT 801 .Age-related changes from young adulthood to senescence; analysis of resultant functional limitations. Maximum Credits: 2

DPT 803.course_description: DPT 803 - Life Cycle II  Units: 2 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): DPT 802 .Normal and delayed maturation processes from conception through adulthood; nervous, cardiovascular, and musculoskeletal systems. Maximum Credits: 2

DPT 820.course_description: DPT 820 - Musculoskeletal Therapeutics I  Units: 4 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and six hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): DPT 801 .Clinical concepts and principles for the diagnosis, examination, and management of musculoskeletal disorders involving the cranio-cervical region, thoracic region, and upper extremities. Maximum Credits: 4

DPT 821.course_description: DPT 821 - Musculoskeletal Therapeutics II  Units: 4 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and six hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): DPT 820 .Clinical principles and concepts for the diagnosis, examination, and management of musculoskeletal disorders involving the lumbosacral region and lower extremities. Maximum Credits: 4

DPT 822.course_description: DPT 822 - Interventions in Musculoskeletal Therapeutics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): DPT 821 .Analysis of interventions used to treat clients with dysfunctions of the musculoskeletal system. Maximum Credits: 3

DPT 830.course_description: DPT 830 - Cardiopulmonary Therapeutics  Units: 4 Grading Method: CNC - Letter (Cr/NC OK)  Three lectures and three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): DPT 750 .Electrocardiography, exercise testing, and exercise prescription for patient populations suffering from acute or chronic illness.

DPT 835.course_description: DPT 835 - Neurophysiological Therapeutics I  Units: 4 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  Three lectures and three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): DPT 801 .Neurological deficits in adults and children secondary to upper motor-neuron dysfunction. Maximum Credits: 4

DPT 836.course_description: DPT 836 - Neurophysiological Therapeutics II  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): DPT 835 .Scientific theory pertaining to composite impairments of neurologic patients, with application of motor-control theory to neurorehabilitation. Maximum Credits: 3

DPT 837.course_description: DPT 837 - Interventions in Neuromuscular Therapeutics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and six hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): DPT 836 .Interventions used to treat clients with dysfunctions of the neuromuscular system. Maximum Credits: 3

DPT 857.course_description: DPT 857 - Prosthetics and Orthotics  Units: 2 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): DPT 886 .Design, fabrication, and fitting of orthotic and prosthetic devices. Maximum Credits: 2

DPT 868.course_description: DPT 868 - Physical Therapy Organization and Administration  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): DPT 801 .Designing, equipping, and staffing a physical therapy practice or department. Budget development, cost accounting, supervisory functions, evaluation techniques, and quality assurance. Business strategies and skills for practice setting. Local, national, economic, and political pressures on delivery of physical therapy services. Maximum Credits: 3

DPT 875.course_name: Medical Therapeutics in Physical Therapy Practice
DPT 875.course_description: DPT 875 - Medical Therapeutics in Physical Therapy Practice  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): DPT 830 .Contemporary medical interventions for physical therapy practice. Maximum Credits: 3

DPT 878.course_description: DPT 878 - Psychosocial Aspects of Rehabilitation  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to the DPT program.Adjustment to physical disability and terminal illness. Development of communication and ethical decision-making skills. Maximum Credits: 3

DPT 880.course_description: DPT 880 - Differential Diagnosis in Physical Therapy  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): DPT 710 , DPT 725  [or BIOL 725 ], DPT 750 .Musculoskeletal conditions, medical pathological problems, and/or co-morbidities affecting clinical decision-making. Maximum Credits: 3

DPT 881.course_name: Evidence-Based Practice I: Principles and Clinical Applications
DPT 881.course_description: DPT 881 - Evidence-Based Practice I: Principles and Clinical Applications  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to the DPT program.Preparation as a consumer of the professional literature in physical therapy. Maximum Credits: 3

DPT 882.course_description: DPT 882 - Evidence-Based Practice II: Research Applications  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): DPT 881 .Use of evidence in current physical therapy practice. Maximum Credits: 3

DPT 885.course_description: DPT 885 - Evidence-Based Practice III: Case Presentations  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): DPT 801 .Patient case and analysis of evidence from clinical interactions between student and client. Maximum Credits: 3

DPT 886.course_description: DPT 886 - Functional Neuro-Biomechanical Relationships  Units: 4 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to the DPT program or master’s degree program in kinesiology.Structures of the musculoskeletal system and individual functional regions. Forces sustained in normal and pathological conditions. Maximum Credits: 4

DPT 887.course_name: Professional Development in Physical Therapy Practice
DPT 887.course_description: DPT 887 - Professional Development in Physical Therapy Practice  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to the DPT program.Professional physical therapy at individual and societal levels. Maximum Credits: 3

DPT 888.course_name: Evidence-Based Practice IV: Advanced Clinical Reasoning
DPT 888.course_description: DPT 888 - Evidence-Based Practice IV: Advanced Clinical Reasoning  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): DPT 882  and DPT 885 .Integrate evidence, patient values, and clinical expertise to critically analyze clinical decision making for complex patient cases across broad range of practice settings. Maximum Credits: 3

DPT 889.course_description: DPT 889 - Doctoral Project  Units: 2-2 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Admission to the DPT program and completion of all prior DPT coursework.Final paper or project on an in-depth clinical or research problem related to the physical therapy profession, presented to a professional audience. Maximum Credits: 2

DPT 895.course_description: DPT 895 - Clinical Internship  Units: 1-10 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Successful completion of all DPT coursework.Clinical internship in physical therapy. Maximum Credits: 20

DPT 897.course_description: DPT 897 - Doctoral Research  Units: 1 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Admission to the DPT program.Investigation to the general field of the doctoral project. Maximum Credits: 2Maximum Credit Statement: two units applicable to the doctoral degree.

DLE 101.course_description: DLE 101 - American Sign Language I  Units: 4 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Three lectures and one hour of discussion.American Sign Language structure, use, literature, and deaf culture. Introductory level communication competence in ASL. Maximum Credits: 4Note: No credit will be given for Dual Language and English Learner Education 101, DLE 102 , DLE 201  taken out of sequence. Not open to students with credit in DLE 102  or DLE 201 .

DLE 102.course_description: DLE 102 - American Sign Language II  Units: 4 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Three lectures and one hour of discussion.Prerequisite(s): DLE 101 .Continuation of DLE 101 . Beginning level communication competence in American Sign Language.Formerly numbered Speech, Language, and Hearing Sciences 102. Maximum Credits: 4Note: No credit will be given for DLE 101 , 102, DLE 201  taken out of sequence. Not open to students with credit in DLE 201 .

DLE 201.course_description: DLE 201 - American Sign Language III  Units: 4 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Three lectures and one hour of discussion.Prerequisite(s): DLE 102 .Continuation of DLE 102 . Intermediate level communication competence in American Sign Language.Formerly numbered Speech, Language, and Hearing Sciences 201. Maximum Credits: 4Note: No credit will be given for DLE 101 , DLE 102 , 201 taken out of sequence.

DLE 416.course_name: Biliteracy Foundations for Teaching and Learning in Diverse Communities
DLE 416.course_description: DLE 416 - Biliteracy Foundations for Teaching and Learning in Diverse Communities  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division standing.Oral, written, and communicative competencies in Spanish through practical experiences and study of sociopolitical and sociocultural contexts impacting bilingual learners in culturally and linguistically diverse communities.Formerly numbered Dual Language and English Learner Education 415. Maximum Credits: 6

DLE 416L.course_name: Biliteracy Foundations for Teaching and Learning in Diverse Communities Field Experience
DLE 416L.course_description: DLE 416L - Biliteracy Foundations for Teaching and Learning in Diverse Communities Field Experience  Units: 1 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit  Two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): Credit or concurrent registration in DLE 416 , upper division standing, and working fluency in Spanish.Field experience in multilingual (Spanish-English) K-12 schools and communities.Formerly numbered Dual Language and English Learner Education 415. Maximum Credits: 2

DLE 496.course_description: DLE 496 - Experimental Topics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Selected topics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

DLE 499.course_description: DLE 499 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor. Open only to senior and graduate students in education who have shown ability to work independently. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6

DLE 515.course_name: Multilingual Education: Theory and Practice for Biliteracy Teachers
DLE 515.course_description: DLE 515 - Multilingual Education: Theory and Practice for Biliteracy Teachers  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Pedagogical and programmatic practices for addressing linguistic and academic needs of multilingual learners. Historical and theoretical foundations of bilingual education as related to bilingual and dual language programs to include instruction, curriculum, and assessment. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Taught in Spanish and English.

DLE 523.course_name: Psychological Foundations for Biliteracy Teachers in K-6 Classrooms
DLE 523.course_description: DLE 523 - Psychological Foundations for Biliteracy Teachers in K-6 Classrooms  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Major theories of learning and cognition as applied to bilingual students and their relation to child development, first and second language acquisition, and approaches to teaching in bilingual classroom. Maximum Credits: 3

DLE 524.course_name: Psychological Foundations for Biliteracy Teachers in Grades 7-12
DLE 524.course_description: DLE 524 - Psychological Foundations for Biliteracy Teachers in Grades 7-12  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Bilingual learning theory as it affects adolescent growth, individualized instruction, classroom management and discipline, and methods of measuring and evaluating achievement.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 4Note: Taught in Spanish and English. See Class Schedule for specific content.

DLE 532.course_name: Biliteracy Teaching in Language Arts for Elementary Students
DLE 532.course_description: DLE 532 - Biliteracy Teaching in Language Arts for Elementary Students  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): DLE 416  with a grade of C (2.0) or better. Recommended: DLE 515  with a grade of C (2.0) or better.Assessing language proficiency; selecting, designing, and evaluating learning experiences to develop biliteracy in K-6 classrooms in English language arts and language of emphasis (Arabic, Mandarin, or Spanish). Maximum Credits: 3Note: Taught bilingually in language of emphasis and English.

DLE 553.course_name: Language Assessment and Evaluation in Multicultural Settings
DLE 553.course_description: DLE 553 - Language Assessment and Evaluation in Multicultural Settings  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Theories and methods of assessment and evaluation of diverse student populations including authentic and traditional models. Procedures for identification, placement, and monitoring of linguistically diverse students. Theories, models, and methods for program evaluation, achievement, and decision making. Maximum Credits: 3

DLE 585.course_name: Methods in Ethnic Studies Teaching: Decolonial Pedagogies in      K-12 Schools
DLE 585.course_description: DLE 585 - Methods in Ethnic Studies Teaching: Decolonial Pedagogies in      K-12 Schools  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Same As: AFRAS 585 , AMIND 585 , and CCS 585 . Prerequisite(s): DLE 515 , AFRAS 421 , AMIND 480 , CCS 580 , or graduate standing.Approaches, methods, and theories of instruction and assessment to include decolonial, humanizing, and liberatory pedagogies. Development of ethnic studies curricula. Ethnicity, race, and racism. Maximum Credits: 3

DLE 596.course_name: Special Topics in Bilingual and Multicultural Education
DLE 596.course_description: DLE 596 - Special Topics in Bilingual and Multicultural Education  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Selected topics in bilingual, cross-cultural education and policy studies.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 12Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

DLE 600A.course_description: DLE 600A - Foundations of Democratic Schooling  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Analysis of relationships among ideology, culture, and power in educational context; key concepts in critical pedagogy applied to programs, curricula, and school restructuring. Maximum Credits: 3

DLE 600B.course_name: Foundations of Dual Language Programming for Critical Biliteracy Development
DLE 600B.course_description: DLE 600B - Foundations of Dual Language Programming for Critical Biliteracy Development  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Bilingual authorization credential or score of 3 on SDSU Spanish examination.Critical literacy and democratic schooling for dual language program models. Program models that apply to policies and practices that inform literacy curriculum and pedagogy in dual language-biliteracy settings. Maximum Credits: 3

DLE 601.course_description: DLE 601 - Language Policies and Practices  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Formal and informal policies related to education of linguistically diverse students at micro/macro level and in school contexts; analysis of bilingual and cross-cultural issues in cognition and literacy. Maximum Credits: 3

DLE 603.course_name: Community and Schools in a Diverse Society
DLE 603.course_description: DLE 603 - Community and Schools in a Diverse Society  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Linguistic and cultural diversity of school and community. Development of community sociocultural scan; home and school collaboration; effects of home and school collaboration on achievement; responsibility of parent caretaker, stakeholder for student success. Maximum Credits: 3

DLE 604.course_name: Learning and Teaching Language in a Dual Language Setting
DLE 604.course_description: DLE 604 - Learning and Teaching Language in a Dual Language Setting  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Bilingual authorization credential or score of 3 on SDSU Spanish examination.Dual language instructional methods, modeling oral and written grammatical structures. Language acquisition strategies for English and Spanish in K-12 grades. Emphasis on written structures for academic literacy. Maximum Credits: 3

DLE 650.course_name: Curriculum Development for Urban School Communities via Action Research
DLE 650.course_description: DLE 650 - Curriculum Development for Urban School Communities via Action Research  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): DLE 600A , DLE 600B , or graduate standing.Curriculum development through lens of critical theory and action research. Principles of curriculum, instruction, and programs contextualized and with regard to particular educational institutions or work sites from a social justice perspective. Maximum Credits: 3

DLE 651.course_name: Curriculum, Teaching, and Assessment: Designated and Integrated ELD
DLE 651.course_description: DLE 651 - Curriculum, Teaching, and Assessment: Designated and Integrated ELD  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): DLE 915A , DLE 915B , or graduate standing.English language development and delivery of comprehensive instruction for English learners. Strategies for implementing state adopted standards for ELD in language and content areas. Maximum Credits: 3

DLE 652.course_name: Literacy and Language: Critically Examining Curriculum for Teaching and Learning
DLE 652.course_description: DLE 652 - Literacy and Language: Critically Examining Curriculum for Teaching and Learning  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): DLE 650 .Research in literacy and multi-cultural curriculum theories, methods, and teaching connected to community, school, and personal literacies. Literacy practices for educating diverse students; varying definitions of literacy and social-political contexts of literacy curriculum. Maximum Credits: 3

DLE 653.course_name: Language Development in K-12 Multilingual Classrooms
DLE 653.course_description: DLE 653 - Language Development in K-12 Multilingual Classrooms  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to bilingual authorization credential program.Dual language and multilingual classrooms, universals and differences in language structure, transfer, and use (including basic linguistics). First and additional language development; related factors (political/sociocultural aspects of bilingualism). Maximum Credits: 3Note: Taught in English and Spanish.

DLE 686.course_description: DLE 686 - Seminar in Multicultural Education  Units: 1-6 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Topics dealing with current issues in multicultural education. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

DLE 798.course_description: DLE 798 - Special Study  Units: 1-6 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor; to be arranged with department chair and instructor.May involve fieldwork. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

DLE 910.course_description: DLE 910 - Teaching Mathematics to Bilingual Students  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to Bilingual 2042 Multiple Subject credential program.Underlying learning theories for teaching mathematical concepts, computation, and problem-solving skills to bilingual students. Maximum Credits: 3

DLE 911.course_name: Teaching Social Studies to Bilingual Students
DLE 911.course_description: DLE 911 - Teaching Social Studies to Bilingual Students  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to Bilingual 2042 Multiple Subject credential program.Conceptual approaches for teaching bilingual social studies curriculum, incorporating sociocultural characteristics of multicultural community, social concepts, and community social issues. Maximum Credits: 3

DLE 912.course_description: DLE 912 - Teaching Science to Bilingual Students  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to Bilingual 2042 Multiple Subject credential program.Strategies for development of process skills and concept acquisition. Methodology for teaching activity-oriented science class bilingually. Maximum Credits: 3

DLE 915A.course_name: Teaching and Learning in the Content Area: Designated and Integrated English Language Development-Multiple Subject
DLE 915A.course_description: DLE 915A - Teaching and Learning in the Content Area: Designated and Integrated English Language Development-Multiple Subject  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ED 451  with a grade of C (2.0) or better. Admission to Multiple Subject credential program or graduate standing.Teaching strategies in content specific fields from second language acquisition perspective taken concurrently with student teaching or practicum.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

DLE 915B.course_name: Teaching and Learning in the Content Area: Designated and Integrated English Language Development-Single Subject
DLE 915B.course_description: DLE 915B - Teaching and Learning in the Content Area: Designated and Integrated English Language Development-Single Subject  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ED 451  with a grade of C (2.0) or better. Admission to Single Subject credential program or graduate standing.Teaching strategies in content specific fields from second language acquisition perspective taken concurrently with student teaching.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

DLE 925.course_description: DLE 925 - Intern Seminar: Teaching English Learners  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to an internship program in dual language and English learner education, special education, or teacher education.Research-based instruction to meet the needs of diverse language learners in a variety of classroom settings. Maximum Credits: 6

DLE 931.course_name: Skills in Teaching Reading to Bilingual Elementary Students
DLE 931.course_description: DLE 931 - Skills in Teaching Reading to Bilingual Elementary Students  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to Bilingual 2042 Multiple Subject credential program.Teaching reading in English, including methods, strategies, assessment, materials, and techniques of transition for implementing reading programs in the bilingual classroom. Maximum Credits: 3

DLE 933.course_name: Skills in Teaching Reading to Bilingual Secondary Students
DLE 933.course_description: DLE 933 - Skills in Teaching Reading to Bilingual Secondary Students  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division standing. Admission to Bilingual 2042 Single Subject credential program.Methods for developing reading skills in Spanish and English across subject areas. Includes comprehension, academic vocabulary, concept development, reading strategies, and assessment. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Taught in Spanish and/or English.

CS 615.course_description: CS 615 - Spatial Database  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): CS 514 . Recommended: CS 460 .Strategies for databases in which locations are prominent. Access strategies such as quadtrees and R-trees. Topological and other spatial extensions to query languages. Spatial models like non-intersection. Oracle spatial features. Object and object-oriented databases. Maximum Credits: 3

CS 620.course_name: Formal Languages and Syntactic Analysis I
CS 620.course_description: CS 620 - Formal Languages and Syntactic Analysis I  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNO - Letter (No Cr/NC) Prerequisite(s): CS 460  and either CS 320  or CS 420 .Regular, context-free, context-sensitive, and general grammars. Corresponding machine model recognizers. Chomsky and Greibach normal forms. Closure, decidability and undecidability properties.

CS 635.course_description: CS 635 - Advanced Object-Oriented Design and Programming  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Knowledge of an object-oriented programming language and classified graduate standing.Advanced topics in object-oriented programming and design, code reuse, building class libraries, quality of objects, coupling, cohesion, design patterns, distributed objects. Maximum Credits: 3

CS 636.course_description: CS 636 - Management of Software Development  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): CS 532  and classified graduate standing.Managing software projects. Modern software management process models. Project planning, cost estimation, tracking and control, staffing, risk management, and software process improvement. Maximum Credits: 3

CS 645.course_description: CS 645 - Advanced Web Application Development  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): CS 545  and classified graduate standing.XHTML, CSS, JavaScript, client-side and server-side scripting, Java servlets, JSP, Frameworks. Server systems and development tools appropriate for large, complex project. SQL database via JDBC.

CS 646.course_description: CS 646 - Mobile Application Development  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): CS 460 .Design and implementation of applications for smart mobile phones and mobile devices.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 3Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content, including device types.

CS 648.course_name: Advanced Topics in Web and Mobile Applications
CS 648.course_description: CS 648 - Advanced Topics in Web and Mobile Applications  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): CS 545  and classified graduate standing.Advanced technologies, issues, and concepts in Web and mobile software development.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

CS 649.course_description: CS 649 - Big Data Tools and Methods  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNO - Letter (No Cr/NC) Prerequisite(s): CS 577  and either CS 503  or CS 514  with a grade of C (2.0) or better in each course.Analyze, curate, search, and visualize big data. Apache MapReduce and Spark, distributed databases and messaging/streaming, electronic notebooks, NoSQL databases, programming languages, statistics.

CS 653.course_description: CS 653 - Data Mining  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNO - Letter (No Cr/NC) Prerequisite(s): CS 420  or CS 450. Foundations of data mining and knowledge discovery. Diverse methods, algorithms, design techniques and application practice including statistical and Bayesian methods, pattern recognition, clustering, knowledge discovery in data sets, machine learning, neural networks, rough and fuzzy sets.

CS 656.course_description: CS 656 - Advanced Robotics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): CS 556 .Robot kinematics to include Jacobians and velocity. Robot dynamics and joint-space/task-space tracking and control. Genetic algorithms and clustering for inverse kinematics. Trajectory tracking and path planning with mobile robots and articulated rovers. Maximum Credits: 3

CS 657.course_description: CS 657 - Intelligent Systems  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): CS 450  and CS 460 .Genetic and evolutionary algorithms and applications, fuzzy logic and approximate reasoning, rule-based inference engines, intelligent path planning and applications to robotics, dynamic systems and their simulations using Simulink, conventional control and intelligent control, intelligent agents. Maximum Credits: 3

CS 659.course_description: CS 659 - Visual Perception and Learning  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNO - Letter (No Cr/NC) Prerequisite(s): CS 450 or CS 559.Computer algorithms and methods for computer vision. Edge detection, histogram of gradients, image filtering, machine learning, robust matching and model fitting, scale-invariant feature transform, stereo vision and 3D scene reconstruction. Object detection, recognition, and visual tracking.

CS 660.course_description: CS 660 - Algorithm Analysis and Design  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): CS 460 .Algorithm design techniques. Approximation algorithms and reductions among NP-complete problems. Greedy and divide and conquer algorithms. Linear and dynamic programming. Graph algorithms and network flow. NP and computational interactability. Maximum Credits: 3

CS 662.course_description: CS 662 - Theory of Parallel Algorithms  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): CS 460 , and MATH 254 .Models for parallel computation. Parallel algorithms for several common problems including sorting, searching, graph problems, and matrix problems. Complexity of parallel algorithms. Lower bounds on parallel complexity. Maximum Credits: 3

CS 664.course_description: CS 664 - Theory of Computability  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): CS 562  and classified graduate standing.Turing machines and other formal models of computation. Recursive function theory. The Ackermann function. Solvable and unsolvable problems. Maximum Credits: 3

CS 666.course_description: CS 666 - Advanced Distributed Systems  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): CS 480 .Design of distributed systems including abstract models, algorithms, and case studies of real-world systems. Group research related to distributed systems. Maximum Credits: 3

CS 682.course_description: CS 682 - Speech Processing  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing, CS 210 , MATH 254 , STAT 551A .Algorithms and methods for processing of speech. Feature extraction, human speech production and perception, pattern recognition for acoustic and language modeling as applied to automatic speech and speaker recognition. Maximum Credits: 3

CS 696.course_description: CS 696 - Selected Topics in Computer Science  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor and classified graduate standing.Intensive study in specific areas of computer science.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 12Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

CS 705.course_description: CS 705 - Advanced Parallel Computing  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Same As: COMP 705 . Prerequisite(s): CS 605  [or COMP 605 ] and classified graduate standing.Libraries, numerical methodology, optimization tools, visualization of results, MPI and GPU computing models. Applications conducted on CSRC student cluster and NSF XSEDE computing resources. Maximum Credits: 3

CS 790.course_name: Practicum in Teaching of Computer Science
