Fundamentals of electro-mechanical energy conversion; induction motors, synchronous machines and DC machines. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Prerequisites will be enforced in all undergraduate electrical engineering courses numbered 100 through 596. A copy of an official transcript will be accepted as proof. For corequisites, an enrollment confirmation form will be accepted.

E E 380L.course_description: E E 380L - Electrical Energy Conversion Laboratory  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): Credit or concurrent registration in E E 380  with a grade of C- (1.7) or better.Experimental study of DC, single and polyphase AC circuits, transformers, and machines. Maximum Credits: 1Note: Prerequisites will be enforced in all undergraduate electrical engineering courses numbered 100 through 596. A copy of an official transcript will be accepted as proof. For corequisites, an enrollment confirmation form will be accepted.

E E 397.course_description: E E 397 - Discussion: Electrical Engineering  Units: 1 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Concurrent registration in associated course.Discussion and examples of problem-solving techniques in subject area. Weekly writing assignments summarizing material covered in lecture and identifying troublesome topics. Note: Prerequisites will be enforced in all undergraduate electrical engineering courses numbered 100 through 596. A copy of an official transcript will be accepted as proof. For corequisites, an enrollment confirmation form will be accepted. Not applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

E E 410.course_description: E E 410 - Signals and Systems  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): E E 300  and E E 310  with a grade of C- (1.7) or better in each course. File an approved master plan with the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering.Linear time-invariant systems, Fourier analysis, continuous and discrete signals and systems, sampling and Laplace transform techniques. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Prerequisites will be enforced in all undergraduate electrical engineering courses numbered 100 through 596. A copy of an official transcript will be accepted as proof. For corequisites, an enrollment confirmation form will be accepted.

E E 420.course_description: E E 420 - Feedback Control Systems  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): E E 410 .Control systems including servomechanisms by Laplace transform method. System performance and stability; Nyquist, Bode, and root-locus diagrams; elementary synthesis techniques. Practical components and examples of typical designs. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Prerequisites will be enforced in all undergraduate electrical engineering courses numbered 100 through 596. A copy of an official transcript will be accepted as proof. For corequisites, an enrollment confirmation form will be accepted.

E E 420L.course_description: E E 420L - Control Systems Laboratory  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): E E 420 .Analog (op-amp based) and digital (microcontroller) implementation. Design of control systems to include lag, lead, optimal PID and LQR controller design, system identification. Use of sensors and actuators. Maximum Credits: 1Note: Prerequisites will be enforced in all undergraduate electrical engineering courses numbered 100 through 596. A copy of an official transcript will be accepted as proof. For corequisites, an enrollment confirmation form will be accepted.

E E 430.course_name: Analysis and Design of Electronic Circuits
E E 430.course_description: E E 430 - Analysis and Design of Electronic Circuits  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): E E 310  and E E 330  with a grade of C- (1.7) or better in each course.Single and multiple transistor amplifiers, power stages. Frequency response, feedback, stability, and operational amplifier circuits. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Prerequisites will be enforced in all undergraduate electrical engineering courses numbered 100 through 596. A copy of an official transcript will be accepted as proof. For corequisites, an enrollment confirmation form will be accepted.

E E 430L.course_description: E E 430L - Electronic Circuits Laboratory  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): E E 330L  and E E 430 .Design and evaluation of active filters and tuned amplifiers, current mirrors, feedback circuits, single-stage and multistage amplifiers, voltage regulators. Advanced uses of laboratory test equipment. Maximum Credits: 1Note: Prerequisites will be enforced in all undergraduate electrical engineering courses numbered 100 through 596. A copy of an official transcript will be accepted as proof. For corequisites, an enrollment confirmation form will be accepted.

E E 434.course_description: E E 434 - Electronic Materials and Devices  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): E E 330  and E E 340  with a grade of C- (1.7) or better in each course.Crystal properties and growth of semiconductors, quantum mechanics of solids, shot noise and thermal noise, energy band and charge carriers, excess carrier in semiconductors, p-n junctions, solar cells, tunnel diodes, photodetectors. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Prerequisites will be enforced in all undergraduate electrical engineering courses numbered 100 through 596. A copy of an official transcript will be accepted as proof. For corequisites, an enrollment confirmation form will be accepted.

E E 439.course_description: E E 439 - Instrumentation Circuits  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Credit or concurrent registration in E E 430 .Design and analysis of mixed signal, analog/digital, electronic systems. Emphasis on operational amplifier based circuit design with design procedures needed to accommodate amplifier limitations in real world applications. Introduction to digitally controlled, analog signal processing. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Prerequisites will be enforced in all undergraduate electrical engineering courses numbered 100 through 596. A copy of an official transcript will be accepted as proof. For corequisites, an enrollment confirmation form will be accepted.

E E 440.course_description: E E 440 - Electromagnetic Waves  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): E E 310  and E E 340  with a grade of C- (1.7) or better in each course.Time-domain form of Maxwell equations, electromagnetic wave propagation in unbound media, Poynting vector, reflection of plane waves, transmission line theory, Smith chart, different microwave transmission lines, wave propagation in bounded media, waveguides, and introduction to antennas. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Prerequisites will be enforced in all undergraduate electrical engineering courses numbered 100 through 596. A copy of an official transcript will be accepted as proof. For corequisites, an enrollment confirmation form will be accepted.

E E 450.course_description: E E 450 - Digital Signal Processing  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): E E 410 .Discrete-time signals and systems, Sampling, Z-transform, Discrete-time Fourier transform and frequency responses, DFT, FFT, and introduction to IIR and FIR digital filter design.Formerly numbered Electrical Engineering 556. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Prerequisites will be enforced in all undergraduate electrical engineering courses numbered 100 through 596. A copy of an official transcript will be accepted as proof. For corequisites, an enrollment confirmation form will be accepted.

E E 455.course_description: E E 455 - Antenna Theory and Design  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): E E 440 .Wireless communication system. Fundamental antenna parameters, theory and design of different types of antennas (wire, aperture, broadband, array), and techniques for antenna analysis, fabrication and measurement. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Prerequisites will be enforced in all undergraduate electrical engineering courses numbered 100 through 596. A copy of an official transcript will be accepted as proof. For corequisites, an enrollment confirmation form will be accepted.

E E 458.course_description: E E 458 - Analog and Pulse Communication Systems  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): E E 410 .Analog and digital communication systems. Amplitude and frequency modulation, pulse modulation, and PCM. Introduction to information theory. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Prerequisites will be enforced in all undergraduate electrical engineering courses numbered 100 through 596. A copy of an official transcript will be accepted as proof. For corequisites, an enrollment confirmation form will be accepted.

E E 458L.course_name: Communications and Digital Signal Processing Laboratory
E E 458L.course_description: E E 458L - Communications and Digital Signal Processing Laboratory  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): Credit or concurrent registration in E E 458 .Experiments in modulation techniques, effects of noise on system performance, digital filters, and signal processing.Formerly numbered Electrical Engineering 558L. For corequisites, an enrollment confirmation form will be accepted.

E E 480.course_description: E E 480 - Power System Analysis  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): E E 310  and E E 380  with a grade of C- (1.7) or better in each course.Modern power system elements; calculation of load flow, fault currents, and system stability. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Prerequisites will be enforced in all undergraduate electrical engineering courses numbered 100 through 596. A copy of an official transcript will be accepted as proof. For corequisites, an enrollment confirmation form will be accepted.

E E 483.course_description: E E 483 - Power Distribution Systems  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): E E 380  with a grade of C- (1.7) or better.Design and operation of electric power distribution systems. Design of primary and secondary systems, application of one phase and three phase transformer banks, and metering principles and practices. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Prerequisites will be enforced in all undergraduate electrical engineering courses numbered 100 through 596. A copy of an official transcript will be accepted as proof. For corequisites, an enrollment confirmation form will be accepted.

The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): E E 330L, E E 430, COMPE 375 , concurrent registration in E E 420.Develop project plans, work on a team, acquire project management skills, develop and evaluate the forms of communication engineers encounter in their profession. Develop critical reading and writing skills for engineering documents. The importance of professional ethics and ethical practice.Formerly numbered E E 491. Note: Not open to students with credit in E E 491 or E E 492.

E E 492W.course_description: E E 492W - Senior Design B  Units: 2 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): E E 491W.Supervised team-based capstone design project to provide integrative design experience for seniors to demonstrate a working project. Develop critical reading and writing skills by exploring how content contributes to effectiveness in engineering documents.Formerly numbered E E 492. Note: Not open to students with credit in E E 491 or E E 492.

E E 495.course_description: E E 495 - Internship  Units: 1 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Completion of 96 units towards the electrical engineering major with a GPA of 3.0 or better.Internship or practicum experience. Not applicable to a major in the department of Electrical and Computer Engineering. Maximum Credits: 3

E E 496.course_description: E E 496 - Advanced Electrical Engineering Topics  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Modern developments in electrical engineering. Maximum Credits: 9Maximum Credit Statement: nine units for any combination of E E 496 and E E 596 applicable to a bachelor’s degree.Note: Prerequisites will be enforced in all undergraduate electrical engineering courses numbered 100 through 596. A copy of an official transcript will be accepted as proof. For corequisites, an enrollment confirmation form will be accepted. See Class Schedule for specific content.

E E 499.course_description: E E 499 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. Maximum Credits: 6Note: Prerequisites will be enforced in all undergraduate electrical engineering courses numbered 100 through 596. A copy of an official transcript will be accepted as proof. For corequisites, an enrollment confirmation form will be accepted.

The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): E E 330  with a grade of C- (1.7) or better.Recent developments in electronic assistive devices and microcomputers for persons with various disabilities; assessment of disabled persons for suitable technological assistive devices. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Prerequisites will be enforced in all undergraduate electrical engineering courses numbered 100 through 596. A copy of an official transcript will be accepted as proof. For corequisites, an enrollment confirmation form will be accepted.

E E 503.course_description: E E 503 - Biomedical Instrumentation  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): E E 410  and E E 430  (or for Mechanical Engineering majors, E E 204 , M E 330 , and A E 280  with a grade of C- (1.7) or better).Instrumentation systems to monitor, image, control, and record physiological functions. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Prerequisites will be enforced in all undergraduate electrical engineering courses numbered 100 through 596. A copy of an official transcript will be accepted as proof. For corequisites, an enrollment confirmation form will be accepted.

E E 522.course_description: E E 522 - Digital Control Systems  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): E E 420 .Digital controls systems; design algorithms including analoginvariance methods, direct digital techniques, and non-parametric approaches such as fuzzy control, neural networks, and evolutionary systems; implementation considerations. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Prerequisites will be enforced in all undergraduate electrical engineering courses numbered 100 through 596. A copy of an official transcript will be accepted as proof. For corequisites, an enrollment confirmation form will be accepted.

E E 530.course_description: E E 530 - Analog Integrated Circuit Design  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): E E 430  with minimum grade of C-.Advanced treatment of transistor pairs, device mismatches, differential amplifiers, current mirrors, active loads, level shifting, and output stages. Parasitic and distributed device parameters. Economics of IC fabrication and impact on design. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Prerequisites will be enforced in all undergraduate electrical engineering courses numbered 100 through 596. A copy of an official transcript will be accepted as proof. For corequisites, an enrollment confirmation form will be accepted.

E E 540.course_description: E E 540 - Microwave Devices and Systems  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): E E 440 . Recommended: A E 515 .Applications of Maxwell’s equations to wave propagation. Microwave network parameters; guided wave transmission and reflection. Design of filters, couplers, power dividers and amplifiers. Applications in radar and telecommunications systems. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Prerequisites will be enforced in all undergraduate electrical engineering courses numbered 100 through 596. A copy of an official transcript will be accepted as proof. For corequisites, an enrollment confirmation form will be accepted.

E E 558.course_description: E E 558 - Digital Communications  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): E E 458 .Design of baseband digital communication systems; noise characterization, sampling, quantization, matched filter receivers, bit-error performance, inter-symbol interference, link budget analysis. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Prerequisites will be enforced in all undergraduate electrical engineering courses numbered 100 through 596. A copy of an official transcript will be accepted as proof. For corequisites, an enrollment confirmation form will be accepted.

E E 581.course_description: E E 581 - Power System Dynamics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): E E 480 .Three-phase faults, symmetrical components, unsymmetrical faults, protective relay operating principles, economic dispatch of thermal power generation units, power system controls, voltage and power stability. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Prerequisites will be enforced in all undergraduate electrical engineering courses numbered 100 through 596. A copy of an official transcript will be accepted as proof. For corequisites, an enrollment confirmation form will be accepted.

E E 584.course_description: E E 584 - Power Electronics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): E E 380  and E E 430  with a grade of C- (1.7) or better in each course.Design and analysis of power electronic devices. Permanent-magnet and pulse-width modulation ac-to-ac converters, dc-to-ac inverters, power electronics applications, power semiconductor switches, and switch-mode power supplies.Formerly numbered Electrical Engineering 484. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Prerequisites will be enforced in all undergraduate electrical engineering courses numbered 100 through 596. A copy of an official transcript will be accepted as proof. For corequisites, an enrollment confirmation form will be accepted.

E E 584L.course_description: E E 584L - Power Electronics Laboratory  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): Credit or concurrent registration in E E 584 .Experimental design of dc-dc converters (boost, buck, buck-boost), flyback and forward converters, voltage and current mode control design and implementation. Basic photovoltaics and maximum-power-point-tracking (MPPT) design and battery charge control using switched-mode dc-dc converters. Maximum Credits: 1Note: Prerequisites will be enforced in all undergraduate electrical engineering courses numbered 100 through 596. A copy of an official transcript will be accepted as proof. For corequisites, an enrollment confirmation form will be accepted.

E E 586.course_name: Distributed Energy Resources and Smart Grid Technologies
E E 586.course_description: E E 586 - Distributed Energy Resources and Smart Grid Technologies  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Credit or concurrent registration in E E 480 ; Graduate standing.Modeling and control of distributed energy resources (DERs) such as energy storage, fuel cells, photovoltaics, wind turbines, and associated power electronics interfaces. Integration of renewable energy systems into microgrids and the smart grid. Maximum Credits: 3

E E 596.course_description: E E 596 - Advanced Electrical Engineering Topics  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Modern developments in electrical engineering.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: nine units for any combination of E E 496 and 596 applicable to a bachelor’s degree. Maximum Credit Statement: nine units for any combination of E E 496 and  E E 596 applicable to a bachelor’s degree.Note: Prerequisites will be enforced in all undergraduate electrical engineering courses numbered 100 through 596. A copy of an official transcript will be accepted as proof. For corequisites, an enrollment confirmation form will be accepted. See Class Schedule for specific content. Maximum combined credit of six units of E E 496  and 696 applicable to a 30-unit master’s degree. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

E E 600.course_description: E E 600 - Seminar  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.An intensive study in advance electrical engineering.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

E E 601.course_description: E E 601 - Linear System Theory and Design  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): E E 420 .State models and solutions of the state equations, stability, controllability and observability, realizability and minimal realizations, linear state and output feedback control, introduction to linear optimal control. Maximum Credits: 3

E E 602.course_description: E E 602 - Stochastic Signals and Systems  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): E E 410 .Random signals, correlation functions, power spectral densities, the Gaussian process, narrow band processes. Applications to communication systems. Maximum Credits: 3

E E 603.course_description: E E 603 - Engineering Optimization  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing.Unconstrained and constrained optimization problems. Convex sets, functions, analysis, and optimization problems. Least-squares, linear, and quadratic programs. Optimality conditions, duality theory. Maximum Credits: 3

E E 634.course_description: E E 634 - RF Circuit Design  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): E E 540 .RF component and circuit design in frequency domain and scattering parameter terms. Linear amplifiers, stability considerations, unilateralization, matching techniques, low-noise amplifiers, wideband designs, power amplifiers, linearity considerations, oscillators, and mixers. Maximum Credits: 3

E E 641.course_description: E E 641 - RF Wireless Systems  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): E E 440 , E E 558 , E E 602 .Characteristics and performance measures of RF subsystem in wireless communication systems: wireless channel, antenna, modulators and demodulators, low-noise and power amplifiers, oscillators, ADC and DAC; receiver architectures, system-level design of RF front-end. Maximum Credits: 3

E E 645.course_description: E E 645 - Antennas and Propagation  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): E E 440 .Antenna radiation mechanism, antenna types, fundamental antenna parameters, microstrip patch antennas, theory and design of various array and wire antennas, antenna measurement techniques and radio wave propagation in different propagation environments to include mobile communications, multiple input multiple output (MIMO) communications, and satellite communications. Maximum Credits: 3

E E 650.course_description: E E 650 - Modern Communication Theory  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): E E 558  and E E 602 .Wireless digital communication; bandpass modulation and demodulation, multiple access techniques, broadband signaling techniques, spread spectrum techniques; applications include CDMA and OFDM. Maximum Credits: 3

E E 652.course_name: Principles and Applications of Information Theory
E E 652.course_description: E E 652 - Principles and Applications of Information Theory  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): E E 558  and E E 602 .Information measure of data sources; Shannon’s theorem and capacity of communication links; rate-distortion theory and performance of source codes. Maximum Credits: 3

E E 653.course_description: E E 653 - Coding Theory  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): E E 558 .Error control for digital information; arithmetic of Galois fields; block, cyclic, convolutional and turbo encoding and decoding; applications in digital communication and computer systems. Maximum Credits: 3

E E 654.course_description: E E 654 - Adaptive Filter Design  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): E E 450  and E E 602 .Constrained and unconstrained Wiener filters. Performance surfaces and gradient-based search methods. LMS and RLS algorithms. Lattice filters. Applications of adaptive filters in beamforming, channel equalization, echo cancellation, and system modeling. Maximum Credits: 3

E E 655.course_description: E E 655 - Modem Design  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): E E 450  and E E 558 .System level and DSP design of modems for wireless and wireline communications. Study modems for QAM, OFDM, CDMA, and T-1 modulation. Maximum Credits: 3

E E 656.course_description: E E 656 - Multirate Signal Processing  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): E E 450 .DSP techniques for sample rate changes in digital filters. Decimation and interpolation, aliasing as a processing option in resampling filters. Applications in communication and entertainment media systems. Maximum Credits: 3

E E 657.course_description: E E 657 - Digital Image Processing  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): E E 450 .Theory of two-dimensional signals and systems, image transforms, image enhancement, restoration and compression, image analysis and computer vision. Maximum Credits: 3

E E 658.course_description: E E 658 - Advanced Digital Signal Processing  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): E E 450  and E E 602 .Advanced topics in FIR and IIR filter design. Quantization effects in digital filters. Sigma-delta modulation. Signal modeling. Parametric and non-parametric spectral estimation. Frequency estimation. Maximum Credits: 3

E E 660.course_name: High Speed Networks: Design Principles and Recent Advances
E E 660.course_description: E E 660 - High Speed Networks: Design Principles and Recent Advances  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): COMPE 560 .Provides students with knowledge of recent developments in area of computer networks. Current research in high speed computer networks. Maximum Credits: 3

E E 662.course_description: E E 662 - Wireless Sensor Networks  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): COMPE 560 .Sensor platforms, wireless channel characteristics, time synchronization, medium access control, topology control, routing protocols, localization, coverage and placement, detection and tracking, query processing. Maximum Credits: 3

E E 665.course_description: E E 665 - Multimedia Wireless Networks  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): COMPE 560 .Cross-layer protocol design, multimedia QoS-aware 4G, 5G, CRN, WLAN networks; multimedia source and bitstream characteristics, quality of service, and roles of processing capacity and power consumption. Maximum Credits: 3

ECL 576A.course_name: Literary Publishing and Editing Workshop A
ECL 576A.course_description: ECL 576A - Literary Publishing and Editing Workshop A  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Six lower division units in literature and/or creative writing.Survey of literary publishing and editing industry. Practical experience in a variety of publishing and editing skills, interaction with industry professionals, and critical writing.Formerly numbered English 576. Maximum Credits: 3Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

ECL 576B.course_name: Literary Publishing and Editing Workshop B
ECL 576B.course_description: ECL 576B - Literary Publishing and Editing Workshop B  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Six lower division units in literature and/or creative writing or graduate standing.Practical experience in small-press literary publishing. Creating and running a press to publish print and digital texts. Tutorials and guest lectures. Maximum Credits: 3Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

ECL 577.course_description: ECL 577 - Techniques of Screenwriting  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Six lower division units in literature and/or creative writing. ECL 280  or TFM 110  or TFM 510  for television, film, and new media majors.Techniques of screenwriting. Introduction to critical and theoretical literature on screenwriting. Includes a creative writing workshop. Maximum Credits: 3

ECL 579.course_description: ECL 579 - Topics in Creative Writing  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Three lower division units in literature and/or creative writing and ECL 280 .Techniques of creative writing focusing on a specialized genre such as comedy, science fiction, and biography. Study of the critical and theoretical literature on the genre. Includes a creative writing workshop.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

ECL 580.course_description: ECL 580 - Writing of Poetry  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Six lower division units in literature and/or creative writing and ECL 570 .A creative writing workshop in poetry. Continuation of ECL 570 . Maximum Credits: 6

ECL 581W.course_description: ECL 581W - Writing of Fiction  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Three lower division units in literature or ECL 280 . Satisfies Graduation Writing Assessment Requirement for students who have completed 60 units; and completed General Education requirements in Communication and Critical Thinking. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Test scores or verification of exemption; copy of transcript.A creative writing workshop in fiction. Continuation of ECL 571 . Maximum Credits: 6

ECL 584W.course_description: ECL 584W - Writing Informal Essays  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Three lower division units in literature or ECL 280 . Satisfies Graduation Writing Assessment Requirement for students who have completed 60 units; and completed General Education requirements in Communication and Critical Thinking. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Test scores or verification of exemption; copy of transcript.A creative writing workshop in nonfiction, especially the essay as an art form. Maximum Credits: 6

ECL 594.course_name: Topics in Literature and the Arts
ECL 594.course_description: ECL 594 - Topics in Literature and the Arts  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Six upper division units in literature or any of the other arts.Comparative study of literature and other arts such as painting, sculpture, architecture, music, dance, and film.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a bachelor’s degree. Maximum credit six units applicable to the M.F.A. degree in creative writing.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

ECL 595.course_description: ECL 595 - Literature and Aesthetics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Six upper division units in literature or any of the other arts.Theoretical and experiential investigation of relationships between literature and the other arts; literary works in context of an inquiry into aesthetics.  May be repeated with new title and content. Maximum Credits: 3Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

ECL 596.course_description: ECL 596 - Selected Topics in Literature  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Selected topics in literature.Formerly numbered ENGL 596.  May be repeated with new content and approval of instructor. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: Six units of 596 applicable to a bachelor’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

ECL 600.course_description: ECL 600 - Introduction to Graduate Study  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Twelve upper division units in English.Introduction to research methods and critical approaches common in the graduate study of literature and expository writing, with attention to basic reference works, bibliographical techniques, analytical strategies, scholarly frames of reference, and theory. Recommended for first-semester graduate students. Maximum Credits: 3

ECL 604A.course_name: Seminar: Literary Period or Movement: American Literature
ECL 604A.course_description: ECL 604A - Seminar: Literary Period or Movement: American Literature  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): An appropriate upper division or graduate level background course; credit or concurrent registration in ECL 600 .Advanced study, through its literature, of a literary period such as the Renaissance, or a movement such as American modernism.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

ECL 604B.course_name: Seminar: Literary Period or Movement: British Literature
ECL 604B.course_description: ECL 604B - Seminar: Literary Period or Movement: British Literature  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): An appropriate upper division or graduate level background course; credit or concurrent registration in ECL 600 .Advanced study, through its literature, of a literary period such as the Renaissance, or a movement such as American modernism.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

ECL 604D.course_name: Seminar: Literary Period or Movement: Children’s Literature
ECL 604D.course_description: ECL 604D - Seminar: Literary Period or Movement: Children’s Literature  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): An appropriate upper division or graduate level background course; credit or concurrent registration in ECL 600 .Advanced study, through its literature, of a literary period such as the Renaissance, or a movement such as American modernism.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

ECL 606A.course_name: Seminar: A Literary Type: American Literature
ECL 606A.course_description: ECL 606A - Seminar: A Literary Type: American Literature  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Credit or concurrent registration in ECL 600 .Advanced study of a specific literary genre, such as the novel, tragic drama, lyric poetry, the personal essay, autobiography.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

ECL 606D.course_name: Seminar: A Literary Type: Children’s Literature
ECL 606D.course_description: ECL 606D - Seminar: A Literary Type: Children’s Literature  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Credit or concurrent registration in ECL 600 .Advanced study of a specific literary genre, such as the novel, tragic drama, lyric poetry, the personal essay, autobiography.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

ECL 624.course_description: ECL 624 - British Literature  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Twelve upper division units in English.Selected works of an author, period, or subject in English literature.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

ECL 625.course_description: ECL 625 - Literature of the United States  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Twelve upper division units in English, with courses in American literature strongly recommended.Selected works of an author, period, or subject in literature of the United States.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

ECL 626.course_description: ECL 626 - Comparative Literature  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Twelve upper division units in English, comparative literature, or literature in a language other than English.Comparative approaches to literature: study of a theme, geographical region, external relationship, or of selected authors.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

ECL 630.course_description: ECL 630 - Form and Theory of Poetry  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Twelve upper division units in English.Poetry as a literary form.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to an M.F.A. degree in creative writing.

ECL 631.course_description: ECL 631 - Form and Theory of Fiction  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Twelve upper division units in English.Fiction as a literary form.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to an M.F.A. degree in creative writing.

ECL 696.course_description: ECL 696 - Special Topics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Twelve upper division units in English.Intensive study in specific areas of English.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 12Maximum Credit Statement: six units of ENGL 526 applicable to a 30-unit master’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

ECL 700.course_name: Seminar: A Major Author or Authors
ECL 700.course_description: ECL 700 - Seminar: A Major Author or Authors  Units: 3  Prerequisite(s): ECL 600 .Critical study of a major author or authors such as William Shakespeare, Charles Dickens, Edith Wharton, Marcel Proust, Gabriel García Márquez, Toni Morrison and others.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

ECL 724.course_description: ECL 724 - Seminar: Issues in British Literature  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ECL 600 .Advanced study of issues within the development of the novel in Great Britain, colonial literatures in English, the British lyrical tradition and others.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

ECL 725.course_name: Seminar: Issues in Literature of the United States
ECL 725.course_description: ECL 725 - Seminar: Issues in Literature of the United States  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ECL 600 .Advanced study of such issues as postmodernity, regionalism, ethnicity, the urban experience, gender, the political novel.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

ECL 726.course_description: ECL 726 - Seminar: Issues in Comparative Literature  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ECL 600 .Advanced study of an issue such as translation, negritude, cultural studies, semiotics, deconstruction, or literature and censorship.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

ECL 727.course_description: ECL 727 - Seminar: Issues in Children’s Literature  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Six units of approved 500- or 600-level courses.Issues and topics of special interest to children’s literature, such as gender depictions, commodification, cross-over writing, and regionalism. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

ECL 750F.course_description: ECL 750F - M.F.A. Seminar: Fiction Writing  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Open only to students admitted to M.F.A. in creative writing.Advanced seminar in fiction writing. May include readings in contemporary fiction and narrative theory. Students in fiction focus must take course six times, generating new work each time with various instructors. Maximum Credits: 18Maximum Credit Statement: 18 units applicable to a master’s degree.

ECL 750P.course_description: ECL 750P - M.F.A. Seminar: Poetry Writing  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Open only to students admitted to M.F.A. in creative writing.Advanced seminar in poetry writing. May include readings in contemporary poetry and theory. Students in poetry focus must take course six times, generating new work each time with various instructors. Maximum Credits: 18Maximum Credit Statement: 18 units applicable to a master’s degree.

ECL 784.course_description: ECL 784 - Seminar: Creative Non-Fiction  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Six units of graduate level creative writing courses.Advanced approach to writing book reviews and short critical essays. Professional focuses necessary for these forms. Emphasis on writing, reading, research, and direct function of these processes. Maximum Credits: 3

ECL 790.course_description: ECL 790 - Seminar: Portfolio/Examination Preparation  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Twenty-four units of graduate coursework that count toward the M.A. in English.Student must be in final semester of study for the master’s degree. Preparation, with close faculty supervision, of scholarly essays for portfolio assessment and oral defense. Advanced study of critical approaches, development of sophisticated research methodology, and close attention to scholarly writing. Maximum Credits: 3

ECL 791A.course_description: ECL 791A - Seminar in M.F.A. Manuscript: Poetry  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Completion of two years of study in the M.F.A. program.Techniques of manuscript construction from a poet’s point of view. Students work on draft of a manuscript of poetry to include discussion of first books by major authors and a creative writing workshop. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units in English 791A applicable to a master’s degree.

ECL 791B.course_description: ECL 791B - Seminar in M.F.A. Manuscript: Fiction  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Completion of two years of study in the M.F.A. program.Techniques of manuscript construction from a fiction writer’s point of view. Students work on draft of a manuscript of fiction to include discussion of first books by major authors and a creative writing workshop. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units in English 791B applicable to a master’s degree.

ECL 796.course_description: ECL 796 - Internship  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Advancement to candidacy for the Master of Arts degree in English and comparative literature or admission to the Master of Fine Arts program and consent of the graduate adviser and supervising professor.Work experience with a practicing professional or company in the community, such as working as editorial assistant or teacher intern. Maximum Credits: 3Maximum Credit Statement: nine units applicable to an M.F.A. degree with approval of graduate adviser.

ECL 797.course_description: ECL 797 - Thesis Research  Units: 3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Advancement to candidacy in the M.F.A. degree in creative writing.Independent work in general field of candidate’s thesis project. Maximum Credits: 3

ECL 798.course_description: ECL 798 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of staff; to be arranged with department chair and instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

ECL 799A.course_description: ECL 799A - Thesis  Units: 3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): An officially appointed thesis committee and advancement to candidacy.Preparation of a thesis for the master’s degree. Maximum Credits: 3

ECL 799B.course_description: ECL 799B - Thesis Extension  Units: 0 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Prior registration in Thesis 799A with an assigned grade symbol of RP.Registration required in any semester or term following assignment of RP in Course 799A in which the student expects to use the facilities and resources of the university; also student must be registered in the course when the completed thesis is granted final approval.

ECL 799C.course_description: ECL 799C - Comprehensive Examination Extension  Units: 0 Grading Method: Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Completion or concurrent enrollment in degree program courses.Registration required of students whose only requirement is completion of the comprehensive examination for the master’s degree. Registration in 799C limited to two semesters.

ENV E 101.course_description: ENV E 101 - Environmental Engineering Seminar  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and one hour of seminar.Air and water pollution control, environmental justice, new technologies to protect the environment, remediation of contaminated sites and groundwater, solid waste treatment and disposal.

ENV E 296.course_description: ENV E 296 - Experimental Topics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Selected topics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

ENV E 320.course_description: ENV E 320 - Designing Solutions for Environmental Problems  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division standing and completion of the General Education requirement in Foundations of Learning, II.A. Natural Sciences and Quantitative Reasoning. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Human interaction with the land, water and air environment; environmental pollution; role of engineering in solving environmental problems. Maximum Credits: 3

ENV E 355.course_description: ENV E 355 - Environmental Engineering  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): CHEM 202  (or CHEM 200 ). Approved upper division engineering major, minor, or another major approved by the College of Engineering. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Change of major form or other evidence of acceptable major code.Causes and effects of environmental problems and engineering methods to control them. Maximum Credits: 3

ENV E 356.course_description: ENV E 356 - Environmental Chemistry for Engineers  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): CHEM 130  and ENV E 355 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Underlying principles of chemistry needed to solve environmental problems and covers the fundamentals of quantitative water and wastewater analysis, to include statistical analysis. Environmental applications in physical, equilibrium, organic, colloidal, and biochemistry concepts. Maximum Credits: 3

ENV E 363.course_description: ENV E 363 - Environmental Engineering Laboratory  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): ENV E 355 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Analysis of natural waters and wastewaters. Sampling and analysis of hazardous environmental pollutants. Techniques to analyze solid waste. Maximum Credits: 3

ENV E 445.course_description: ENV E 445 - Water and Wastewater Treatment Systems  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ENV E 355  and credit or concurrent registration in CIV E 444 .Basic water chemistry, water quality criteria and standards, water usage and distribution. Biological, chemical, and physical processes to treat wastewater. Design of water and wastewater treatment unit processes. Potable and non-potable water reuse. Wastewater collection. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Not open to students with credit in ENV E 441  and ENV E 442 .

ENV E 496.course_description: ENV E 496 - Advanced Environmental Engineering Topics  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Modern developments in environmental engineering. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units for any combination of ENV E 496, ENV E 499 and ENV E 596.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

ENV E 499.course_description: ENV E 499 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor. Individual study in the area of environmental engineering.  Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units for any combination of ENV E 496, ENV E 499 and ENV E 596.

ENV E 554.course_description: ENV E 554 - Process Fundamentals of Environmental Systems  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ENV E 355  with a grade of C (2.0) or better, A E 340 , CIV E 444 , and M E 350 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Equilibrium and kinetics of chemical and biological reactions of environmental systems. Considerations of mass-transfer and fluid dynamics in water quality management and air pollution control. Maximum Credits: 3

ENV E 555.course_description: ENV E 555 - Sustainable Water and Sanitation Systems  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and two hours of technical activity and laboratory.Prerequisite(s): ENV E 355 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Design and selection of technologies for water delivery, reuse, sanitation, and treatment in developed and developing communities. Maximum Credits: 3

ENV E 556.course_description: ENV E 556 - Air Pollution Engineering  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Senior standing and Environmental Engineering 355. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Sources of air pollutants. Transportation, dispersion, and transformation of pollutants in the atmosphere. Measurement and control of air pollution. Maximum Credits: 3

ENV E 558.course_description: ENV E 558 - Solid and Hazardous Waste Engineering  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Senior standing and ENV E 355 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Municipal solid and hazardous solid wastes from an environmental engineering perspective, including waste minimization and recycling. Engineered volume reduction through composting, incineration, mechanical compaction, and other methods. Ultimate disposal, landfill design and legislative regulations. Maximum Credits: 3

ENV E 560.course_name: Assessment of Treatment System Performance and Monitoring Data
ENV E 560.course_description: ENV E 560 - Assessment of Treatment System Performance and Monitoring Data  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): CIV E 160  or STAT 250 .Correlation and regression, data management, descriptive statistics, establishing and evaluating compliance, hypothesis testing, kinetics and hydraulics, monitoring program design, numerical methods, removal efficiencies recognizing symmetry and asymmetry in monitoring data, water and mass balances. Maximum Credits: 3

ENV E 596.course_description: ENV E 596 - Advanced Environmental Engineering Topics  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Modern developments in environmental engineering.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units for any combination of ENV E 496, ENV E 499 and ENV E 596 applicable to a bachelor’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

ENV E 637.course_name: Process Design for Industrial and Hazardous Waste Treatment
ENV E 637.course_description: ENV E 637 - Process Design for Industrial and Hazardous Waste Treatment  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ENV E 647  and ENV E 648 .Process design of physical, chemical, and biological methods for treatment of hazardous and industrial waste. Maximum Credits: 3

ENV E 645.course_description: ENV E 645 - Aquatic Chemistry for Environmental Engineers  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Chemistry of natural and polluted water. Process chemistry for water and wastewater treatment. Maximum Credits: 3

ENV E 646.course_description: ENV E 646 - Microbiological Principles of Environmental Engineering  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing.Relationships and significance of microorganisms to organic matter decomposition, mineral transformations, and environmental quality. Applied study in natural (water, sediments, wetlands) and disturbed ecosystems (landfills, contaminated sediments, and groundwater). Maximum Credits: 3

ENV E 647.course_name: Physical and Chemical Processes of Water Pollution Control
ENV E 647.course_description: ENV E 647 - Physical and Chemical Processes of Water Pollution Control  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ENV E 554  and ENV E 645 .Engineering principles and design of physical and chemical processes used in water and wastewater treatment. Maximum Credits: 3

ENV E 648.course_description: ENV E 648 - Biological Processes and Bioremediation Engineering  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ENV E 554 .Engineering principles and design of biological processes used in wastewater and bioremediation treatment technologies. Maximum Credits: 3

ENV E 696.course_description: ENV E 696 - Advanced Topics in Environmental Engineering  Units: 2-3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Intensive study in specific areas of environmental engineering.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 12Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

ENV E 797.course_description: ENV E 797 - Independent Research  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of graduate adviser.Independent research in civil and environmental engineering. Maximum Credits: 3Maximum Credit Statement: three units applicable to a master’s degree.

ENV E 798.course_description: ENV E 798 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of staff; to be arranged with department chair and instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 3Maximum Credit Statement: three units applicable to a master’s degree.

ENV E 799A.course_description: ENV E 799A - Thesis or Project  Units: 3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): An officially appointed thesis committee and advancement to candidacy.Preparation of a project or thesis for the master’s degree. Maximum Credits: 3

ENV E 799B.course_description: ENV E 799B - Thesis or Project Extension  Units: 0 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Prior registration in Thesis or Project 799A with an assigned grade symbol of RP.Registration required in any semester or term following assignment of RP in Course 799A in which the student expects to use the facilities and resources of the university; also student must be registered in the course when the completed thesis or project is granted final approval. Maximum Credits: 0

ENV E 799C.course_description: ENV E 799C - Comprehensive Examination Extension  Units: 0 Grading Method: Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Completion or concurrent enrollment in degree program courses.Registration required of students whose only requirement is completion of the comprehensive examination for the master’s degree. Registration in 799C limited to two semesters.

ENV S 100.course_description: ENV S 100 - Environmental Sciences  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Same As: SUSTN 100  The earth as an ecosystem composed of biological, chemical, and physical systems and how these systems interact with one another and the human population. Maximum Credits: 3

ENV S 299.course_description: ENV S 299 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of program director and instructor. Individual study.

ENV S 301.course_description: ENV S 301 - Energy and the Environment  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Completion of the General Education requirements in Communication and Critical Thinking and Foundations of Learning II.A., Natural Sciences and Quantitative Reasoning.Fundamental physical concepts underlying energy, its conversion, and impact on the environment. Maximum Credits: 3

ENV S 302.course_description: ENV S 302 - Climate Change Solutions  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Completion of the General Education requirements in Communication and Critical Thinking and Foundations of Learning II.A., Natural Sciences and Quantitative Reasoning.Carbon-neutral societies, human-nature harmonious communities, and optimal applications of climate and natural resources. Climate change actions, data visualization, governance, mitigation policies, narrative, and technologies. Locally and globally scalable solutions for climate changes. Maximum Credits: 3

ENV S 496.course_description: ENV S 496 - Selected Topics in Environmental Science  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Selected topics in environmental and related sciences.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 4Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

ENV S 498A.course_description: ENV S 498A - Senior Seminar in Environmental Sciences  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Senior standing in the environmental sciences major.Research projects related to an environmental issue in the San Diego and California region. Maximum Credits: 3

ENV S 498B.course_description: ENV S 498B - Senior Seminar in Environmental Sciences  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Senior standing in the environmental sciences major.Research projects related to an environmental issue in the San Diego and California region. Maximum Credits: 3

ENV S 544.course_description: ENV S 544 - Terrestrial Ecosystems and Climate Change  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Same As: BIOL 544  Prerequisite(s): BIOL 354 .Controls on fluxes and stocks of nutrients within terrestrial ecosystems, ecosystem responses, feedbacks to climate change. Climate systems, water transport, production and decomposition, nutrient cycling, stable isotopes, spatial and temporal integration. Maximum Credits: 3

ENV S 596.course_description: ENV S 596 - Advanced Topics in Environmental Science  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Advanced special topics in environmental sciences.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 4Maximum Credit Statement: six units of 596 applicable to a bachelor’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

EUROP 101.course_description: EUROP 101 - Introduction to European Studies  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Europe: The land, the people, their artistic, intellectual and cultural movements, including art, architecture, languages and literatures. Maximum Credits: 3

EUROP 160.course_name: European Reflections on Science and Technology
EUROP 160.course_description: EUROP 160 - European Reflections on Science and Technology  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC European authors at the intersection of arts, science, and technology. Major innovations and debates across time and place. Maximum Credits: 3

EUROP 296.course_description: EUROP 296 - Experimental Topics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Selected topics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

EUROP 301.course_description: EUROP 301 - Contemporary Europe  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Prerequisite(s) recommended: EUROP 101 .Contemporary Europe, emphasizing artistic, intellectual, and cultural trends, as well as contemporary issues. Maximum Credits: 3

EUROP 320.course_description: EUROP 320 - Food Culture in Europe  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Recommended: EUROP 101 .Regional distinctions and traditions. Food consumption, distribution, preparation, sourcing, and sustainability. Maximum Credits: 3Note: This course satisfies the general education cultural diversity requirement.

EUROP 424.course_description: EUROP 424 - European Cinema  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): Prerequisite(s) recommended: EUROP 101 .Issues and themes in European culture as seen through its films.  May be repeated with new title and content. Maximum Credits: six units.

EUROP 430.course_description: EUROP 430 - Muslim Experience in Europe  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Prerequisite(s) recommended: EUROP 101 .Cross-cultural connections between the Muslim and Judeo-Christian worlds in Europe. Socio-cultural, ethnicity, race, and gender issues from the Middle Ages to the present day, using historical accounts, art works, literature, and film. Maximum Credits: 3

EUROP 435.course_name: Culture and Identity in Post-Communist Europe
EUROP 435.course_description: EUROP 435 - Culture and Identity in Post-Communist Europe  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Social, economic, and cultural transformations in Europe after the collapse of communism. Daily life under communism and the impact of the collapse of this political system on language, individual identity, space, and community. Maximum Credits: 3

EUROP 440.course_description: EUROP 440 - Human Trafficking in Europe  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Human trafficking in context of migration, human rights, society, culture, and gender discourses in Europe. Historical accounts of trafficking, scholarly articles, literature, film, and primary documents from advocacy organizations and governmental institutions. Maximum Credits: 3

EUROP 495.course_description: EUROP 495 - European Studies Internship  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Upper division standing in the major and consent of instructor.Practical work experience in a field related to European studies. Work done under joint direction of activity sponsor and instructor. Approved international internships may count towards international experience requirement for major. Maximum Credits: 3

EUROP 496.course_description: EUROP 496 - Experimental Topics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Selected topics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

EUROP 499.course_description: EUROP 499 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6

EUROP 501.course_description: EUROP 501 - European Life and Culture  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Undergraduate: EUROP 301 .Specialized study of topics such as European union, European women, or European art.  May be repeated with new title and content. Maximum Credits: 6Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

EUROP 596.course_description: EUROP 596 - Topics in European Studies  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): EUROP 301  for majors and minors; upper division standing for all others.Specialized topics in contemporary European culture.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units of 596 applicable to a bachelor’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

ENS 104A.course_description: ENS 104A - Beginning Weight Training  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Maximum Credits: 1

ENS 104B.course_description: ENS 104B - Intermediate Weight Training  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Maximum Credits: 1

ENS 108A.course_description: ENS 108A - Beginning Basketball  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Formerly numbered Exercise and Nutritional Sciences 108. Maximum Credits: 1

ENS 108B.course_description: ENS 108B - Intermediate Basketball  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Maximum Credits: 1

ENS 109A.course_description: ENS 109A - Beginning Soccer  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Maximum Credits: 1

ENS 109B.course_description: ENS 109B - Intermediate Soccer  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Maximum Credits: 1

ENS 109C.course_description: ENS 109C - Advanced Soccer  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Maximum Credits: 1

ENS 110A.course_description: ENS 110A - Beginning Volleyball  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Formerly numbered Exercise and Nutritional Sciences 110. Maximum Credits: 1

ENS 110B.course_description: ENS 110B - Intermediate Volleyball  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Maximum Credits: 1

ENS 116A.course_description: ENS 116A - Golf  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Maximum Credits: 1

ENS 116B.course_description: ENS 116B - Golf  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Maximum Credits: 1
