The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC The nature of language. Sound, meaning, and grammar. Language history and change. Dialects and variation. Language acquisition. Animal communication. Language and the brain. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Not open to students with credit in upper division linguistics courses, excluding LING 305W .

LING 200.course_description: LING 200 - Advanced English for International Students  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Satisfaction of the SDSU Written Communication Assessment requirement; and LING 100B . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Test scores or verification of exemption; copy of transcript.Further practice in mastering conventions of standard academic writing, with emphasis on strategies for research in writing papers. Focus on language issues specific to non-native speakers of English. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Not open to students with credit in AFRAS 200 , AMIND 225 , CCS 200 , or RWS 200  [or ECL 200 ].

LING 243.course_description: LING 243 - Invented Languages - Klingon and Beyond!  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): RWS 100 .Invented languages such as Klingon and Esperanto are the medium for engaging linguistic theory and diversity. The art, ideas, and goals behind invented languages will be explored using diverse current and historical sources from literature, the Internet, film, and video games. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 250.course_description: LING 250 - Directed Language Study  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Directed independent study of a language other than English (excluding languages taught in other departments) with aim of acquiring a developing competency in the language.  May be repeated with approval of undergraduate adviser. Maximum Credits: 8Note: May include speaking, listening, reading, writing, and grammar.

LING 251.course_description: LING 251 - Dialects of English  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Regional and social diversity of English dialects in the United States and elsewhere to include differences in grammar, pronunciation, and vocabulary. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 252.course_description: LING 252 - Language Across the Lifespan  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Cognitive benefits of bilingualism. Effect of normal and pathological aging on language knowledge and use. Language learning in cognitively impaired individuals. Native and second language acquisition and use in childhood and adulthood. Sociological factors affecting language use. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 253.course_description: LING 253 - Grammar and Usage for Writers  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Same As: RWS 253  Prerequisite(s): Satisfaction of the SDSU Written Communication Assessment requirement.Instruction in sentence structure with attention to integrating sentences into their logical and rhetorical contexts. Identifying and understanding source of sentence-level writing problems. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 270.course_description: LING 270 - Elementary Statistics for Language Studies  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Introductory statistics and probability using language data to illustrate statistical ideas and facilitate analyses of quantitative language data. Measures of central tendency and dispersion, correlation, mixed models, regression, and significance. Probabilistic explanation in linguistics. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Students with credit or concurrent registration in the following lower division statistics courses will be awarded a total of four units for two (or more) courses: Linguistics 270, ARP 201 , BIOL 215 , CIV E 160 , ECON 201 , POL S 201 , PSY 280 , SOC 201 , STAT 119 , STAT 250 .

LING 281.course_name: Academic Reading and Writing for Second Language Learners and International Students
LING 281.course_description: LING 281 - Academic Reading and Writing for Second Language Learners and International Students  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Same As: RWS 281  Prerequisite(s): Open only to students who qualify for RWS 280  and whose first language is not English.Academic prose, emphasizing purposes, structures, and styles of academic English writing. Designed to improve students’ ability to plan, draft, revise, and edit essays, as well as to read and analyze complex academic texts. Additional emphasis on grammatical features of English relevant to the second language population. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 296.course_description: LING 296 - Experimental Topics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Selected topics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

LING 299.course_description: LING 299 - Special Study  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6

LING 305W.course_description: LING 305W - Advanced Composition for International Students  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Satisfies Graduation Writing Assessment Requirement for students who have completed 60 units; and completed General Education requirements in Communication and Critical Thinking. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Test scores or verification of exemption; copy of transcript.Advanced expository writing, with practice in the various associated skills (organization, research, presentation, rhetoric). The goal is to enable non-native English speakers to function completely with written English on advanced university levels. This course may not be used toward the major or minor in linguistics. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 350.course_description: LING 350 - Language and Politics  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Linguistics devices used to persuade in politics. Differences between what is literally said and what is actually conveyed in political discourse. How political speakers and writers use grammar, sound structure, and vocabulary to persuade. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 352.course_description: LING 352 - Language and Advertising  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Linguistic devices used to persuade in advertising. Differences between what is literally said and what is actually conveyed in advertisements. How advertisers use the grammar, sound structure, and vocabulary of languages (especially English) to persuade audiences. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 354.course_description: LING 354 - Language and Computers  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Computers, computer programming languages, and “artificial intelligence” viewed from perspective of human language. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 363.course_description: LING 363 - Sociocultural Analysis of Black Languages  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Same As: AFRAS 363   Social and cultural functions of Black languages, verbal and nonverbal, in Afro-American life, and their profound impact on larger society. Also, a probe into issues concerning validity of Black English. Maximum Credits: 3Note: This course satisfies the ethnic studies [ES] requirement.

LING 420.course_description: LING 420 - Linguistics and English  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Introduction to sound and grammatical structure of language, with special attention to English. Language acquisition and variation. Of special interest to prospective teachers. Not open to students with credit in LING 501 . Maximum Credits: 3

LING 430.course_description: LING 430 - English Grammar for Prospective Teachers  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): LING 101  or LING 420  and upper division standing.Core grammatical concepts and facts of English grammar. Parts of speech; grammatical relations; word, sentence, discourse structure. Focus on standard written English. Of special interest to prospective secondary school teachers. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 452.course_description: LING 452 - Language Acquisition  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): LING 420 .Principles of child language development. Sounds and grammar in speech of young children. Acquisition of reading and vocabulary. Relationship between cognitive development and language. Development of language in bilinguals. Second language acquisition. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 454.course_description: LING 454 - Second Language Acquisition  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): LING 101 , LING 420  or SPAN 448 .Basic facts about the acquisition of nonnative languages in adulthood to include beginning and end points, implicit and explicit learning, individual differences, input and output, ordered development, and the role of instruction. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 457.course_description: LING 457 - Community-Based Language Fieldwork  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): Concurrent registration in upper division course requiring term paper on language behavior (e.g. LING 452 ).Fieldwork in language use in community setting. Students observe, keep field notes, analyze language behavior (e.g. speaking, reading, writing, listening). Maximum Credits: 1

LING 460.course_description: LING 460 - American Indian Languages  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Same As: AMIND 460  and ANTH 460   Structures of American Indian languages. Language families of North America, history, and present circumstances. Interdependence of language and culture, differences in ways of speaking. Issues of language endangerment, language death, language maintenance, and language revitalization. Maximum Credits: 3Note: This course satisfies the ethnic studies [ES] requirement.

LING 496.course_description: LING 496 - Experimental Topics in Linguistics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Specialized study of a selected topic in linguistics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

LING 499.course_description: LING 499 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6

LING 501.course_description: LING 501 - Fundamentals of Linguistics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division standing.Principles of modern linguistics, with attention to English phonetics, phonology, morphology, syntax, semantics and pragmatics; universals and typology. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 502.course_description: LING 502 - Language in Mind and Society  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): LING 501 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Child language acquisition, adult language production/comprehension and sociolinguistics. Dialects, language variation, and standardization. Bilingualism and language change. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 503.course_description: LING 503 - Functions of Language  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): LING 501 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Empirical methods in linguistics. Phonological structure of English and other languages. Functional and discourse related approaches to language patterns. Connections between morphosyntactic concepts and functional/discourse concepts to conduct text analysis. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 505.course_description: LING 505 - Writing for Graduate Students  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Conditional or classified admission to an SDSU graduate program or undergraduates with consent of instructor.Conventions of scholarly writing appropriate for student papers, theses, or academic journal articles. Development of research questions and literature reviews as appropriate for students’ disciplines. Revision of current or previous course papers according to disciplinary conventions. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 521.course_description: LING 521 - Phonology  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): LING 420  or LING 501 .Theoretical principles of transformational-generative phonology. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 522.course_description: LING 522 - Syntax  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): LING 420  or LING 501 .Theoretical principles of transformational-generative syntax. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 523.course_description: LING 523 - Morphology  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): LING 420  or LING 501 .Theoretical principles of words structure, including inflection, derivation, and compounding; organization of the lexicon; structure of inflectional paradigms; morphophonological and morphosyntactic alterations; and computational applications. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 525.course_description: LING 525 - Semantics and Pragmatics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): LING 420  or LING 501 .Advanced semantic theory; systematic analysis of the interaction of sequences of language with real world context in which they are used. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 526.course_description: LING 526 - Discourse Analysis  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): LING 420  or LING 501 .Theories of discourse structure. Text and context. Frameworks for analyzing written and spoken discourses such as genre analysis, conversation analysis, critical discourse analysis, discourse and grammar, speech act theory, and corpus linguistics. Applications of discourse analysis such as cross-cultural misunderstanding. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 530.course_description: LING 530 - English Grammar  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Six upper division units in linguistics.English morphology, syntax, and discourse structure, including simple and complex sentence structure; lexical categories and subcategories; discourse functions of selected constructions. Problems and solutions in teaching English grammar. Maximum Credits: 12

LING 550.course_name: Theory and Practice of English as a Second Language
LING 550.course_description: LING 550 - Theory and Practice of English as a Second Language  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): LING 101 , LING 420 , or LING 501 .The nature of language learning; evaluation of techniques and materials for the teaching of English as a second language. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 551.course_description: LING 551 - Sociolinguistics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): A course in introductory linguistics.Investigation of the correlation of social structure and linguistic behavior. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 552.course_description: LING 552 - Psycholinguistics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): LING 420  or LING 501 .Psychological and mental processes related to comprehension, production, perception, and acquisition of language in adults and children. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 553.course_description: LING 553 - Bilingualism  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): LING 420 , LING 501 , SPAN 448 , or SLHS 300 .Bilingualism in society and in schools. Cognition, language processing, and representation in bilinguals. Research methods in the study of bilingualism. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 555.course_name: Practical Issues in Teaching English as a Second Language
LING 555.course_description: LING 555 - Practical Issues in Teaching English as a Second Language  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Credit or concurrent registration in LING 550 .Practical approaches to applications of the theory of English as a Second Language (ESL) and methodology for speaking, reading, listening, writing; techniques for facilitating growth of communicative competence. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 556.course_name: Computer Assisted Language Learning and Teaching
LING 556.course_description: LING 556 - Computer Assisted Language Learning and Teaching  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Credit or concurrent registration in LING 550 .Theory and practice of computer assisted language learning and language teaching. Hands-on experience with pedagogical aspects of using technology in the language classroom. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 571.course_description: LING 571 - Computational Corpus Linguistics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division standing.Practical introduction to computation with text corpora and introduction to Python. Tokenizing, part-of-speech tagging, and lemmatizing (stemming) large corpora. Writing of Python programs required. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 572.course_description: LING 572 - Python Scripting for Social Science  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Same As: BDA 572 . Prerequisite(s): Upper division or graduate standing.Python scripting for social science data. Statements and expressions. Strings, lists, dictionaries, files. Python with unformatted data (regular expressions). Graphs and social networks. Spatial data and simple GIS scripts. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 581.course_description: LING 581 - Computational Linguistics  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC - Letter (Cr/NC OK) Same As: CS 581 . Prerequisite(s): CS 420  or CS 320  and LING 571  or LING 572  or BDA 572 .Basic concepts in computational linguistics including regular expressions, finite-state automata, finite-state transducers, weighted finite-state automata, and n-gram language models. Applications to phonology, orthography, morphology, syntax. Probabilistic models. Statistical techniques for speech recognition.

LING 583.course_description: LING 583 - Statistical Methods in Text Analysis  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): LING 571  or LING 572  [or BDA 572 ]; and STAT 550  or STAT 551A .Statistical methods for analysis of large texts to include Bayesian classifiers, Markov models, maximum entropy models, neural nets, and support vector machines. Data collection and annotation. Applications to annotation, relation detection, sentiment analysis, and topic modeling. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 596.course_description: LING 596 - Selected Topics in Linguistics  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division standing.Advanced study of selected topics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

LING 597.course_description: LING 597 - Research Practicum  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor and a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or better.Participation in a specific research activity under faculty supervision. Maximum credit three units toward the major and minor in linguistics. Maximum Credits: 3Maximum Credit Statement: Maximum combined credit of three units of LING 597 and LING 797 toward the master’s degree in linguistics

LING 600.course_description: LING 600 - Professional Development in Linguistics  Units: 1 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Introduction to the profession and to the skills and knowledge necessary for a professional in Linguistics and in English Language Teaching. Students engage in presentations by professionals and in a series of focused workshops.

LING 602.course_name: Advanced Study of Language in Mind and Society
LING 602.course_description: LING 602 - Advanced Study of Language in Mind and Society  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): LING 502 Language acquisition, psycholinguistics, and sociolinguistics. Mental and social influences on language learning and representation. Cognitive models of language production and processing. Rational speech acts and other social models of language comprehension. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 610.course_description: LING 610 - Topics in Historical Linguistics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Three upper division units in linguistics, preferably Linguistics 410, LING 501 , or LING 521 .Methods and principles used in historical study of language; processes of language change in phonology, syntax, and semantics; linguistics reconstruction; origin of language; language families; development of writing. Analysis of Indo-European, Old English, or Middle English.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

LING 620.course_description: LING 620 - Advanced Formal Syntax  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): LING 522 .Advanced study of formal syntactic theory. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 621.course_description: LING 621 - Advanced English Phonology  Units: 3  Prerequisite(s): LING 521 .English phonetics, phonemics, and phonological rules. Phonological differences among American English dialects. Survey of contemporary approaches to phonology.

LING 622.course_description: LING 622 - Discourse and Syntax  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): LING 503 , LING 522 , or LING 530 .Functional and discourse-oriented approaches to syntax and syntactic approaches to discourse. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 623.course_description: LING 623 - Immigrant Languages  Units: 3  Prerequisite(s): LING 420  or LING 501 .Contrastive structure of selected languages representing significant immigrant populations in San Diego; emphasis on phonological, orthographic, morphological, lexical and syntactic features.

LING 626.course_description: LING 626 - Pragmatics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): LING 525  and six additional units of linguistics courses numbered 501 or higher (excluding LING 505 ).Gricean and neo-Gricean approaches to pragmatics; relevance theory; reference; presupposition; speech acts; information structure. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 650.course_description: LING 650 - Materials Development in Applied Linguistics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): LING 550 .Materials development and adaptation for teaching English as a second language and a language other than English. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 651.course_name: Seminar in Sociolinguistic Research in the Speech Community
LING 651.course_description: LING 651 - Seminar in Sociolinguistic Research in the Speech Community  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): LING 551 .Methods to include the collection of sociolinguistic data through interviews. Analysis of those data to address questions pertaining to language variation and change. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 652.course_description: LING 652 - Second Language Acquisition  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): LING 501 .Analyses of theories of second language acquisition; theoretical and empirical bases of current second language teaching methodologies. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 653.course_description: LING 653 - ESL Reading and Writing  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): LING 550 .Application of discourse and reading theory to the teaching and testing of ESL reading and writing. Issues of coherence, process-product, genre studies. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 654.course_description: LING 654 - Language and Cognition  Units: 3  Prerequisite(s): LING 552 .Language production, comprehension, and acquisition, as these relate to human cognition.

LING 655.course_name: English for Specific Purposes and Content-Based Instruction
LING 655.course_description: LING 655 - English for Specific Purposes and Content-Based Instruction  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): LING 550 .Theory, practice, and history of these two related approaches to ESL/EFL. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 656.course_name: Quantitative Research Methods in Language Studies
LING 656.course_description: LING 656 - Quantitative Research Methods in Language Studies  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): LING 420  or LING 501 .Research design and quantitative research methods for linguistic applications. Critical evaluation of published research studies; empirical research project. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 657.course_description: LING 657 - Foundations of Language Assessment  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): LING 550 .Fundamental principles and goals of language assessment and language assessment research: characteristics of assessment methods; analyzing test tasks; designing test items; describing test scores; approaches to estimating reliability; validity and validation; authenticity and impact. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 696.course_description: LING 696 - Advanced Topics in Linguistics  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Advanced study in specific areas of linguistics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 12Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

LING 740.course_name: Internship in English as a Second Language and Foreign Language Teaching
LING 740.course_description: LING 740 - Internship in English as a Second Language and Foreign Language Teaching  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): LING 550 .Internship in teaching English as a second language and English as a foreign language, offering work experience with practicing professionals. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 795.course_description: LING 795 - Seminar in Linguistics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Completion of three units of 600- and 700-numbered courses in the master’s program for linguistics.Research in linguistics, course content varying according to instructor.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

LING 797.course_description: LING 797 - Advanced Research Practicum  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Approval of graduate adviser.Participation in a specific research activity under faculty supervision. Maximum combined credit of three units of LING 597  and LING 797. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 798.course_description: LING 798 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of staff; to be arranged with department chair or instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

LING 799A.course_description: LING 799A - Thesis  Units: 3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): An officially appointed thesis committee and advancement to candidacy.Preparation of a project or thesis for the master’s degree. Maximum Credits: 3

LING 799B.course_description: LING 799B - Thesis Extension  Units: 0 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Prior registration in Thesis 799A with an assigned grade symbol of RP.Registration required in any semester or term following assignment of RP in Course 799A in which the student expects to use the facilities and resources of the university; also student must be registered in the course when the completed thesis is granted final approval. Maximum Credits: 0

LING 799C.course_description: LING 799C - Comprehensive Examination Extension  Units: 0 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Completion or concurrent enrollment in degree program courses.Registration required of students whose only requirement is completion of the comprehensive examination for the master’s degree. Registration in 799C limited to two semesters. Maximum Credits: 0

MGT 160.course_name: Entrepreneurial Approaches to  Problem Identification in Soci
MGT 160.course_description:
MGT 160 - Entrepreneurial Approaches to  Problem Identification in Soci  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Applications of entrepreneurial processes to problem identification. Includes differences between fixed and growth mindsets, components of entrepreneurial ecosystems, use of qualitative and quantitative data for drawing inferences, design thinking methodologies for clarifying problems worth solving and alternative pathways to entrepreneurship. 
  Maximum Credits: 3

MGT 296.course_description: MGT 296 - Experimental Topics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Selected topics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

MGT 352.course_description: MGT 352 - Human Resource Management  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Approved upper division business major, business minor, or another major approved by the Fowler College of Business. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Acquisition, development, maintenance, and termination of human resources in accordance to goals of the organization. Maximum Credits: 3

MGT 353.course_description: MGT 353 - Creativity and Innovation  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 350 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Managing creativity, including selling creative ideas to others, scanning for new opportunities, taking creativity to the marketplace, and creating an organizational culture for innovation. Maximum Credits: 3

MGT 357.course_description: MGT 357 - Multinational Business and Comparative Management  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 350 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Context of international business, environment, institutions, and business practices. Cultural awareness, sensitivity, interpersonal, and leadership skills needed in an international context. Maximum Credits: 3

MGT 358.course_description: MGT 358 - Fundamentals of Entrepreneurship  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Approved upper division business major, business minor, or another major approved by the Fowler College of Business. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Process of initiating, expanding, purchasing, and consolidating businesses. Concepts, theories, and techniques of managerial innovation and implementation. Maximum Credits: 3

MGT 401.course_description: MGT 401 - Management Internship  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): B A 350  and consent of faculty adviser. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Internship with business firms, government agencies, or nonprofit organizations. Under joint supervision of intern organization and course instructor. Activities for advancing career readiness, applying principles of managing organizations, enhancing leadership skills, and supporting professional development. Maximum Credits: 3

MGT 403.course_description: MGT 403 - Global Business & Diplomacy  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Approved business major, business minor, or instructor consent.The impact of international affairs and public policy on business strategy and operations. Political and economic diplomacy. Maximum Credits: 3

MGT 420.course_description:
MGT 420 - Entrepreneurial Opportunity Recognition and Evaluation  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Credit or concurrent registration in Management 358. Proof of completion of prerequisite required: Copy of transcript.Core concepts and key elements of recognizing and evaluating new business opportunity to include customer discovery process, design thinking, industry and market analysis, lean startup methodology, market trends, problem-solution validation, and value proposition design.
  Maximum Credits: 3

MGT 422.course_description: MGT 422 - International Entrepreneurship  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Approved upper division business major, business minor, or another major approved by the Fowler College of Business. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Launching and managing an international entrepreneurial venture. Search and identification of opportunities in foreign markets, logistics of international business expansion, cross-cultural business communication, and international networking.Formerly numbered MGT 355. Maximum Credits: 3Designated Global Learning Course (GLC).

MGT 434.course_description: MGT 434 - Business Negotiation  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 350 .Origins and strategies of abstract and theoretical approaches to bargaining and negotiation in business situations faced by managers and leaders. Maximum Credits: 3

MGT 444.course_description: MGT 444 - Business Ethics and Corporate Governance  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 300 , B A 350 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Corporate social responsibility, stakeholder theory, morality of capitalism, and corporate governance. Ethical theory and its application to ongoing issues and current events within the business context. Maximum Credits: 3

MGT 452.course_description: MGT 452 - Family Business Management  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MGT 358 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Managing a family owned business. Succession planning, governance, strategy and family dynamics of mixing family and business roles, non-family employees, and culture. Maximum Credits: 3

MGT 455.course_description: MGT 455 - Social Entrepreneurship  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MGT 358 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Entrepreneurial skills to craft innovative responses to social needs. Social mission, launching and building a social venture and developing social returns to an enterprise. Maximum Credits: 3

MGT 459.course_description: MGT 459 - Franchise Management  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MGT 358 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Franchising presented as a viable alternative path to entrepreneurship. Nature and role of franchisor and franchisee including challenges of becoming a franchisee of an existing system and of becoming a franchisor. Maximum Credits: 3

MGT 460.course_description: MGT 460 - Business Model Design and Development  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MGT 358  and MGT 420 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Core concepts and key elements of producing a business plan for a new entrepreneurial opportunity to include designing experiments to validate critical business model assumptions and assess product-market fit. Maximum Credits: 3

MGT 461.course_description: MGT 461 - Human Resource Selection  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MGT 352 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Employee selection and placement issues in organizations including strategic, legal, and measurement issues. Roles of recruitment, job analysis, and human resource planning in human resource selection process. Maximum Credits: 3

MGT 462.course_description: MGT 462 - Compensation  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MGT 352 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Wage and salary administration in organizations. Determinants of general wage and salary levels and structures. Total compensation systems, interrelationship among employee performance, intrinsic and extrinsic rewards, pay equity, and employee pay satisfaction. Maximum Credits: 3

MGT 463.course_description: MGT 463 - Performance Management  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MGT 352 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Definition, measurement, and evaluation of employee performance, development of employee skills, and implementation of a performance management system. Maximum Credits: 3

MGT 464.course_description: MGT 464 - Legal Issues in Managing Employees  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MGT 352 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Statutes, case law, and legal issues relevant to managers, including recruitment, hiring, wages and hours, discrimination, sexual harassment, occupational safety and health, firing and post-termination. Focus on California and federal laws that managers need to know. Maximum Credits: 3

MGT 466.course_description: MGT 466 - International Human Resource Management  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MGT 352 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Human resource issue facing multinational corporations including staffing, training and development, performance management, expatriation and repatriation, and compensation. Maximum Credits: 3

MGT 467.course_description: MGT 467 - Diversity Issues  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MGT 352 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Managing employees in a diverse workforce. Policy development for managing diversity. Legal issues in diversity. Maximum Credits: 3

MGT 468.course_description: MGT 468 - Human Resource Analytics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MGT 352 .Human Resource (HR) metrics and analytics. Introduction to the principles of applied research for evidence-based decision-making in organizations including data collection, research design, and statistical testing using actual data sets and analytics. Maximum Credits: 3

MGT 470.course_description:
MGT 470 - Venture Launch  Units: 3 Grading Method: Letter (No Cr/NC) Prerequisite(s): Credit or concurrent registration in MGT 460 . Proof of completion of prerequisite required: Copy of transcript.Engage in real world entrepreneurial activities. Start a venture or examine the business potential of technology developed by faculty and/or students at SDSU.
  Maximum Credits: 3Note: MGT 470 is not a subsititute for MGT 401 .

MGT 475.course_description: MGT 475 - Leadership in Organizations  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 350 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Leadership, communicating vision, initiating changes and innovation, and developing leadership competencies through self-assessment. Maximum Credits: 3

MGT 483.course_name: Lean Startup Applications to National Security Challenges
MGT 483.course_description: MGT 483 - Lean Startup Applications to National Security Challenges  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division standing.Applications of the Lean-Startup methodology to assessing problems posed by national security agencies such as the U.S. Department of Defense. To include problem / solution fit, market analysis, and business model development using the Mission Model Canvas framework. Note: Prior military experience is a plus but not a requirement for participation in this course.

MGT 496.course_description: MGT 496 - Selected Topics in Management  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of department chair.Selected areas of concern in management.  May be repeated with new content with consent of department chair. Maximum Credits: 6Note: Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree. See Class Schedule for specific content.

MGT 498.course_description: MGT 498 - Investigation and Report  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Senior standing and consent of instructor.A comprehensive and original study of a problem connected with management under the direction of one or more members of the management staff.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6

MGT 499.course_description: MGT 499 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6

MGT 596.course_description: MGT 596 - Advanced Topics in Management  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Six upper division units in management. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Advanced special topics in management.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units. No more than three units may be applied to the major.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

MGT 696.course_description: MGT 696 - Seminar in Selected Topics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Intensive study in specific areas of management.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

MGT 710.course_description: MGT 710 - Seminar in World Business Environment  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC - Letter (Cr/NC OK) Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing.Nature, dimensions and motives of international business. Impact of environmental factors. Nature of multinational corporation, importance of national and multilateral controls and policies for international business management.   Designated Global Learning Course (GLC).

MGT 721.course_name: Seminar in Group Processes and Leadership
MGT 721.course_description: MGT 721 - Seminar in Group Processes and Leadership  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 673 .Perceptions and processes in work groups. Experience in interpersonal networks, influence and rewards, stereotypes; managing differences and conflicts. Maximum Credits: 3

MGT 722.course_name: Seminar in Business Ethics and Social Institutions
MGT 722.course_description: MGT 722 - Seminar in Business Ethics and Social Institutions  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 673 .Ethical and social aspects of current issues in business and society. Changing role of stakeholders including consumers, shareholders, and employees. Assessment of operation, functioning and regulation of the market system. Maximum Credits: 3

MGT 724.course_description: MGT 724 - Entrepreneurship  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC - Letter (Cr/NC OK) Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing.Examination of the entrepreneurial approach; concepts, theory and techniques of managerial innovation and implementation; analysis of entrepreneurial skills.

MGT 729.course_description: MGT 729 - Seminar in Organizational Issues  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 673 .Issues in organizations in modern society: organization design, environmental interface, and political processes. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

MGT 744.course_name: Seminar in Managing the Growing Firm
MGT 744.course_description: MGT 744 - Seminar in Managing the Growing Firm  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): M.B.A. core or admission to degree curriculum for M.S. degree business administration.Problems and issues confronting entrepreneurs beyond start-up of a new venture. Focus on issues from both entrepreneur and investor perspectives. Maximum Credits: 3

MGT 746.course_description: MGT 746 - Seminar in Corporate Governance  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Roles and interrelationships among members of corporate governance triad: managers, directors, and shareholders. History and theories of corporate governance, ethical obligations underlying the three roles, and case studies. Maximum Credits: 3

MGT 747.course_description: MGT 747 - Seminar in Managing Technology Commercialization  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing.Assessment of future commercialization potential of early stage technologies. Technology commercialization process including technology and market assessments, business models, revenue streams, licensing, and protection of intellectual property. Maximum Credits: 3

MGT 748.course_name: Seminar in International Entrepreneurship and Business Development
MGT 748.course_description: MGT 748 - Seminar in International Entrepreneurship and Business Development  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC - Letter (Cr/NC OK) Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing.Challenges and issues confronting entrepreneurs seeking to develop international business opportunities. Concepts, theory, and techniques of international entrepreneurship. Drivers of entrepreneurship and assessment of entrepreneurial conditions around the world.   Designated Global Learning Course (GLC).

MGT 797.course_description: MGT 797 - Research  Units: 3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Advancement to candidacy.Research in the area of management. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

MIS 180.course_description: MIS 180 - Principles of Information Systems  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Fundamentals of information systems in business. Integration of information technology, e-commerce, systems analysis, database management systems, networking, security, and collaboration. Application of concepts through developing solutions to business problems using spreadsheets, database management systems, and web development tools/languages. Maximum Credits: 3

MIS 299.course_description: MIS 299 - Special study  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of department chair and instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 9

MIS 301.course_description: MIS 301 - Statistical Analysis for Business  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MIS 180 ; MATH 120 ; STAT 119  or ECON 201 . Approved upper division business major, business minor, or another major approved by the Fowler College of Business. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Statistical methods applied to business decision making. Maximum Credits: 3

MIS 305.course_description: MIS 305 - Business Processes, ERP, and Analytics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MIS 180 . Approved upper division business major, business minor, or another major approved by the Fowler College of Business. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Fundamental business processes and Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems. Utilizing an ERP to run a business. How analytics are used by organizations to improve decision making. Maximum Credits: 3

MIS 306.course_description: MIS 306 - Information Systems Analysis and Design  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MIS 180 . Approved upper division business major, business minor, or another major approved by the Fowler College of Business. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Systems development life cycle concept, with emphasis on analysis of requirements using structured methodology. Acquisition strategies, application design alternatives, architecture design, feasibility study, implementation plans, needs assessment, and prototyping.

MIS 315.course_description: MIS 315 - Business Applications Programming  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MIS 180 . Approved upper division business major, business minor, or another major approved by the Fowler College of Business. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Computer programming for business applications. Appropriate data structures, control structures and program structures. Languages widely used in business applications. Maximum Credits: 3

MIS 380.course_description: MIS 380 - Data Management Systems  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MIS 180 . Approved upper division business major, business minor, or another major approved by the Fowler College of Business. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Methodology for applying data base management systems in design of information systems. Analysis of data base applications from perspectives of system users and systems analysts. Maximum Credits: 3

MIS 383.course_description: MIS 383 - Networks and Data Communications  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MIS 180 . Approved upper division business major, business minor, or another major approved by the Fowler College of Business. Proof of completion of prerequisites required: Copy of transcript.Fundamental data communications concepts, including voice communications and carrier service offerings, communications hardware, and network design. Global, enterprise, workgroup, and local area networks. Protocols and network operating systems. Network security and control.Formerly numbered Management Information Systems 483. Maximum Credits: 3

MIS 396W.course_description: MIS 396W - Reporting Techniques for Business Professionals  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): RWS 290 . Satisfies Graduation Writing Assessment Requirement for students who have completed 60 units; and completed General Education requirements in Communication and Critical Thinking. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Test score or verification of exemption; copy of transcript. Must be admitted to the upper division major in business.Advanced preparation of oral and written reports used in business and other organizations. Individualized study of reports in student’s career field. Maximum Credits: 3

MIS 401.course_description: MIS 401 - Business Intelligence and Analytics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MIS 301 .Using diagnostic, predictive, prescriptive, and visual analytics to solve business problems and make data-informed decisions at operational, strategic, and tactical levels. Maximum Credits: 3

MIS 406.course_description: MIS 406 - Information Systems Design  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MIS 306 , MIS 315 , MIS 380 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Business information systems design, installation, and implementation as part of the systems development life cycle, with emphasis on structured design methodology. Maximum Credits: 3

MIS 420.course_description: MIS 420 - Cloud Services, Architecture and Security  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MIS 315, MIS 383.Gain knowledge and understanding of the fundamental concepts and foundations related to cloud services, cloud architecture and design, cloud security, cloud economics, and cloud operations and support.

MIS 429.course_description:
MIS 429 - Contemporary Issues in Information Systems  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Approved upper division business major or other major approved by the Fowler College of Business.
 Practices, techniques, and theories of systems that create value with information. See Class Schedule for specific content. May be repeated for a maximum of nine units with new content.
  Maximum Credits: 9

MIS 455.course_description: MIS 455 - Digital Entrepreneurship and Innovation  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MIS 306 .Innovative digital technologies. Communicate value creation, capture, and delivery. Monetization and commercialization, prototype new products and services, and strategize financing. Maximum Credits: 3

MIS 460.course_description: MIS 460 - Project Management  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Credit or concurrent registration in B A 360 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Management of small and large projects. Work breakdown structure milestones, project cost estimating and reporting, and single and multiple resource allocation/leveling. Computerized project management software. Maximum Credits: 3

MIS 481.course_description: MIS 481 - E-Business/Web Development  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MIS 306 , MIS 315 , MIS 380 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Issues and tools related to developing Internet-based applications with database integration through hands-on projects. Developing complex sets of Web pages by linking front-end Web browser languages and databases via back-end server languages, database queries, and middleware. Maximum Credits: 3

MIS 482.course_description: MIS 482 - Information Technology Projects  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Completion of at least 18 units of upper division management information systems courses. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Contemporary technologies in a business context to include artificial intelligence, cloud computing, data science tools, Internet of things, mobile programming, and robotics. Implementation with client organizations and/or in-depth research analysis resulting in proof of concept and applications. Maximum Credits: 3

MIS 492.course_description: MIS 492 - Digital Transformation Leadership  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MIS 306.  Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Roles of information systems managers and executives in digital transformation for business processes and outcomes. Strategy and techniques in development and deployment of information systems for sustainable competitive advantage. Ethical, organizational, social opportunities and challenges inherent in information systems management.

MIS 495.course_description: MIS 495 - Management Information Systems Internship  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Upper division business major approved by the Fowler College of Business.Internship with business firm, government agency, or nonprofit organization under joint supervision of internship organization and course instructor. Career readiness, fundamentals of management information systems, and professional development.  Repeated once with consent of instructor for a maximum of 6 credits in total.  Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: Up to six units applicable to a bachelor’s degree for management information systems majors.

MIS 496.course_description: MIS 496 - Selected Topics in Information Systems  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of department chair.Selected areas of concern in information systems.  May be repeated with new content with consent of department chair. Maximum Credits: 6Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

MIS 498.course_description: MIS 498 - Investigation and Report  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Senior standing and consent of instructor.A comprehensive and original study of a problem connected with information systems under the direction of one or more members of the information systems faculty.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6

MIS 499.course_description: MIS 499 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6

The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MIS 315  or knowledge of one computer programming language. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Object-oriented programming as applied to business applications. Use of object-oriented classes, features, inheritance, and subclasses for modeling and processing of business information. Maximum Credits: 3

MIS 585.course_description: MIS 585 - Fundamentals of Cybersecurity Management  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MIS 383  or MIS 687 .Cybersecurity risks, threats, and vulnerabilities. Technologies, procedures, and techniques to assess, control, detect, and remediate threats and vulnerabilities. Maximum Credits: 3

MIS 596.course_name: Contemporary Topics in Management Information Systems
MIS 596.course_description: MIS 596 - Contemporary Topics in Management Information Systems  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Business major approved by the Fowler College of Business and consent of instructor.Contemporary topics in management information systems.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

MIS 649.course_description: MIS 649 - Business Analytics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Same As: B A 649 .  Prerequisite(s): B A 642  . Business analytics techniques for predictive modeling and customer segmentation. Applications include churn management, business experiments, cluster segmentation, and market basket analysis.Formerly numbered MIS 749. Maximum Credits: 3

MIS 680.course_description: MIS 680 - Information Systems Hardware and Software  Units: 3  Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Computer architecture, programming languages, programming systems, and operating systems.

MIS 686.course_description: MIS 686 - Enterprise Database Management  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Database management technologies to host, secure, and manipulate enterprise data, information, and knowledge assets to create business value. Modeling tools for analyzing and specifying data requirements. Maximum Credits: 3

MIS 687.course_name: Secure Enterprise Networking and Mobile Technologies
MIS 687.course_description: MIS 687 - Secure Enterprise Networking and Mobile Technologies  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Deployment and management of technologies for integrating resources within and between organizations through distributed networks, Internet of things (IoT) networks, and secure enterprise systems. Maximum Credits: 3

MIS 688.course_name: Information Systems and Strategies in Organizations
MIS 688.course_description: MIS 688 - Information Systems and Strategies in Organizations  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Managing information to create business value. Planning, organizing, and leading information systems initiatives. Relationship of data, information, and knowledge to strategic and operational decision making. Global aspects and ethical uses of information systems. Maximum Credits: 3

MIS 690.course_description: MIS 690 - Cloud Computing: Fundamentals, Architecture and Security  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MIS 687.The principle concepts and foundations of Cloud computing and architectures, as well as the security principles to secure cloud environments and protect the information they contain.

MIS 691.course_description: MIS 691 - Decision Support Systems  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Completion of M.B.A. core or M.S. prerequisites.Design, implementation, and integration of computerized decision support systems into business management. Problem representation, modeling, and simulation. Maximum Credits: 3

MIS 695.course_description: MIS 695 - Business Systems Analysis and Design  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Secure information systems to solve problems and exploit opportunities. Development strategies, process and data modeling, requirements definition, and security modeling for information systems. Maximum Credits: 3

MIS 696.course_description: MIS 696 - Seminar in Selected Topics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Intensive study in specific areas of information systems.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 12Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

MIS 697.course_description: MIS 697 - Project Planning and Development  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Project development, planning, execution, and control for information systems. Information project development life cycle, structure project planning methodology, theories, techniques, and utilization of project management technologies. Maximum Credits: 3

MIS 705.course_description: MIS 705 - Communication Strategies  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Development of advanced written, oral, and interpersonal communication strategies for the business environment. Maximum Credits: 3

MIS 720.course_name: Electronic Business and Big Data Infrastructures
MIS 720.course_description: MIS 720 - Electronic Business and Big Data Infrastructures  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 642 .Advanced data analysis and information technology concepts associated with e-business infrastructure and systems architecture.Formerly numbered MIS 620. Maximum Credits: 3

MIS 727.course_description: MIS 727 - Seminar in Scientific Method  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Scientific method as an integrated body of philosophical logic to include applied science and engineering, experimental, exploratory, and theoretical research through multi-methodological and multidisciplinary lenses. Maximum Credits: 3

The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 628 .Lean principles and Six Sigma methodology for managing agility and quality in operations and projects. Lean tools, managerial frameworks, process improvement, statistical methods. Maximum Credits: 3

MIS 748.course_description: MIS 748 - Time Series Analysis for Business Forecasting  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 642 .Forecasting methods in business, finance, and marketing to include ARMA models and multivariate time series models. Data visualization; model diagnostics, identification, and selection. Maximum Credits: 3
