The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 628 .Managing projects and programs to implement business strategies. Project selection, programs, and portfolios; project organization; resource conflict and resolution; stakeholder management; project team management; project risk assessment and mitigation. Maximum Credits: 3

MIS 752.course_name: Seminar in Supply Chain and Enterprise Resource Planning
MIS 752.course_description: MIS 752 - Seminar in Supply Chain and Enterprise Resource Planning  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 628 .Methodology, theory, and systems to plan and control supply chain and enterprise resources. Integrated processes of sales and operations planning, corporate accounting, materials requirement, procurement, capacity planning, and warehouse management in a simulated enterprise environment. Maximum Credits: 3

MIS 753.course_description: MIS 753 - Global Supply Chain Analytics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Advanced concepts, method, and implementation of global supply chain strategies and management; global sourcing and supplier development; global logistic network and management; information technology and e-business for supply chain; supply chain design and optimization; performance metrics and measurements. Maximum Credits: 3

MIS 754.course_description: MIS 754 - Seminar in Operations Strategy  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 628 .Strategic issues in operations and their integration with other functional areas. Includes operations strategy, product and process planning, experience curves, productivity measurements, and information technology implementation. Maximum Credits: 3

MIS 755.course_description: MIS 755 - Information Systems Security Management  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Information systems management. Focus on creation of a security plan for an organization to include risk analysis, security issues, security design, security plan, disaster recovery/business continuity, and threat analysis. Maximum Credits: 3

MIS 760.course_name: AI/Machine Learning for Cyber Intelligence and Defense
MIS 760.course_description: MIS 760 - AI/Machine Learning for Cyber Intelligence and Defense  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MIS 585.Technical topics in AI security and privacy, including intrusion detection, malware detection, differential privacy, privacy-preserving machine learning, federated learning, blockchain, and adversarial machine learning.

MIS 790.course_name: Culminating Experience in Management Information Systems
MIS 790.course_description: MIS 790 - Culminating Experience in Management Information Systems  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Advancement to candidacy.Preparation for the comprehensive examination for students. Maximum Credits: 3

MIS 797.course_description: MIS 797 - Research  Units: 3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Advancement to candidacy.Research in the area of management information systems. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

MIS 798.course_description: MIS 798 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of staff; to be arranged with department chair and instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

MKTG 371.course_description: MKTG 371 - Consumer Behavior  Units: 4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 370  with a minimum grade of C (2.0). Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Consumer behavior concepts and theories for developing, implementing, and assessing marketing strategy. Psychological, social, and environmental factors in understanding of needs, wants, preferences, and decision making related to consumption behaviors. Maximum Credits: 4

MKTG 372.course_description: MKTG 372 - Retail Marketing Methods  Units: 4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 370  with a minimum grade of C (2.0). Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Retailing industry and retailer strategy to include online retailers, multi-channel retailing, consumer behavior, retail market strategy, site selection, locations, human resource management, merchandise management, pricing, marketing communications strategy, store layout, design, and management. Maximum Credits: 4

MKTG 373.course_description: MKTG 373 - Integrated Marketing Communications  Units: 4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 370  with a minimum grade of C (2.0). Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Communication theory in context of integrating marketing communication tools to include advertising; digital, social, nontraditional media; sales promotion; public relations. Media planning and strategy, budgeting, effectiveness measurement, social/ethical issues, regulation of advertising and promotion. Maximum Credits: 4

MKTG 376.course_description: MKTG 376 - Global Marketing Strategy  Units: 4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 370  with a minimum grade of C (2.0). Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.International marketing concepts. Assessing organization internationalization potential, external environmental analysis for global market segmentation, target country market selection, entry strategies, international product, pricing decisions, analysis of international distribution systems, developing international advertising and promotion programs. Maximum Credits: 4

MKTG 377.course_description: MKTG 377 - Selling Strategy and Practices  Units: 4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 370  with a minimum grade of C (2.0). Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Marketing and sales process. Theories, approaches, techniques used in selling process, development of sales presentations, and use of partnering/relationship selling and technology in professional selling. Maximum Credits: 4

MKTG 380.course_description: MKTG 380 - Direct Marketing Methods  Units: 4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 370  with a minimum grade of C (2.0). Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Direct marketing as part of a company or organization’s marketing program. Major direct marketing media and methods to include direct mail, broadcast and print advertising, Internet and interactive media, catalogs, and telemarketing. Data base creation and management and effectiveness measurement for direct marketing programs. Maximum Credits: 4

MKTG 381.course_name: Introduction to Business Tools for Data Analysis and Visualization
MKTG 381.course_description:
MKTG 381 - Introduction to Business Tools for Data Analysis and Visualization  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Approved upper division major.
 Tools for organizing data and interpreting results. Creating, editing, and interacting with spreadsheets. Development of advanced tables, charts, data views, and dashboards. Use of data visualization to communicate insights.
  Maximum Credits: 3

MKTG 402.course_description: MKTG 402 - Marketing and Sales Internship  Units: 4 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 370  with a grade of C (2.0) or better.Internship with business firms, government agencies, or nonprofit organizations. Under joint supervision of intern organization and course instructor. Fundamentals of sales and marketing in a real-world context. Maximum Credits: 6

The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Completion of lower division courses in the major or minor. B A 370  with a grade of C (2.0) or better and MIS 301  with a grade of C- (1.7) or better. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Marketing research process. Research design and data collection principles for qualitative and quantitative research techniques in marketing practice. Analysis, data visualization, and reporting of primary and secondary marketing research. Maximum Credits: 4

MKTG 472.course_description: MKTG 472 - Advanced Integrated Marketing Communications  Units: 4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MKTG 373  with minimum grade of C; MKTG 371  and MKTG 470  with minimum grade of C or an average of 2.0 in both courses. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Management of marketing communications function with emphasis on integration and coordination of all activities. Planning, implementation, and coordination of marketing communications activities. Development, implementation, and program evaluation of an integrated marketing communications project. Maximum Credits: 4

MKTG 473.course_description: MKTG 473 - Sales Management  Units: 4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 370  with a minimum grade of C (2.0). Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Management of recruitment, training, motivation, and compensation of the sales personnel of a company. Policies and procedures used for organization, evaluation, and control of the sales force. Maximum Credits: 4

MKTG 474.course_description: MKTG 474 - Business Marketing  Units: 4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 370  with a minimum grade of C (2.0). Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Marketing strategy and practices designed for organizational customers. Purchasing practices of organizational buyers and development of marketing programs for enterprise customers and markets, both domestic and global. Maximum Credits: 4

MKTG 476.course_description: MKTG 476 - Internet/Interactive Marketing  Units: 4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 370  with a minimum grade of C (2.0). Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Impact of networked, cloud, mobile and contextual technologies on consumer behavior, business and marketing practice. Marketing communication and strategy leveraging the Internet to include search optimization, user experience design, social media, contextual advertising, pricing, distribution, commerce, and analytics. Maximum Credits: 4

MKTG 478.course_name: Marketing and Sales for Social Impact
MKTG 478.course_description: MKTG 478 - Marketing and Sales for Social Impact  Units: 4 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MKTG 371  with a grade of C (2.0) or better.Marketing and sales planning to solve social or environmental issues. Management of marketing and sales functions to address pressing needs at the base of the economic pyramid, underserved communities, or markets affected by environmental problems. Maximum Credits: 4

MKTG 479.course_description: MKTG 479 - Strategic Marketing Management  Units: 4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MKTG 371  and MKTG 470  with a minimum grade of C (2.0) or an average of 2.0 in both courses. Completion of lower division courses required in the major or minor. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Marketing concepts and decision tools for analyzing and solving marketing problems; marketing strategy and plans; problem identification, evaluation of alternatives, strategic and tactical recommendations. Maximum Credits: 4

MKTG 480.course_description: MKTG 480 - Marketing Analytics  Units: 4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 370  with a grade of C (2.0) or better and MIS 301  with a grade of C- (1.7) or better.Analysis and interpretation of large, complex data sets (Big Data). Theory, analytical approaches to solve marketing problems, utilizing software tools for marketing and sales decision making. Maximum Credits: 4

MKTG 496.course_description: MKTG 496 - Selected Topics in Marketing  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of department chair.Selected areas of concern in marketing.  May be repeated with new content with consent of department chair. Maximum Credits: 6Note: Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree. See Class Schedule for specific content.

MKTG 498.course_description: MKTG 498 - Investigation and Report  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Senior standing and consent of instructor.A comprehensive and original study of a problem connected with marketing under the direction of one or more members of the marketing staff.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6

MKTG 499.course_description: MKTG 499 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6

MKTG 515.course_description: MKTG 515 - Cause Selling and Fundraising  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 370  with a grade of C (2.0) or better or B A 645 .Cause selling strategies and tactics. Integration of cause selling and marketing through relationship management, planning and delivery of donor presentations, the use of technology and analytics, and trust-building techniques to engage prospects. Maximum Credits: 6

MKTG 696.course_description: MKTG 696 - Seminar in Selected Topics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Intensive study in specific areas of marketing.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 12Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

MKTG 729.course_name: Contemporary Issues in Marketing Theory and Practice
MKTG 729.course_description: MKTG 729 - Contemporary Issues in Marketing Theory and Practice  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 627 .Issues in marketing theory and practice: examination and application of contemporary theories and techniques in relation to changes in marketing environment. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

MKTG 761.course_description: MKTG 761 - Product Innovation Management  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 627 .New product development and issues related to overall management of product innovation in context of entrepreneurial opportunity, start-up ventures and existing organizations. Focus on planning, design, and implementation of marketing strategy. Maximum Credits: 3

MKTG 762.course_description: MKTG 762 - Seminar in Integrated Marketing Communication  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 627 .Theory and application of integrated marketing communication to advertising, promotions, public relations/publicity, personal selling and direct marketing (including Internet). Maximum Credits: 3

MKTG 763.course_description: MKTG 763 - Seminar in Sales Management  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 627 .Sales management and personal selling decisions and strategies in business organizations. Maximum Credits: 3

MKTG 766.course_description: MKTG 766 - Seminar in Marketing Research  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 642  and B A 627 .Research methods and analysis for consumer and business marketing. Research design and implementation, use of secondary data sources, qualitative research, survey research, experimentation, and data analysis using statistical software, such as SPSS. Maximum Credits: 3

MKTG 767.course_description: MKTG 767 - Sales and Marketing Analytics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 642 .Communicating, reporting, and visualizing analytics to inform decision making. Descriptive, predictive, prescriptive modeling of data to address sales and marketing problems. Utilizing market intelligence and consumer response data to inform development. Maximum Credits: 3

MKTG 768.course_name: Seminar in Internet Marketing and E-Business
MKTG 768.course_description: MKTG 768 - Seminar in Internet Marketing and E-Business  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 627 .Theory and application of marketing utilizing the Internet and associated issues of electronic commerce. Maximum Credits: 3

MKTG 769.course_description: MKTG 769 - Seminar in International Marketing  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 627 .The impact of cultural, social, political, economic, and other environmental variables on international marketing systems and the decision-making process of multinational marketing operations. Maximum Credits: 3

MKTG 772.course_description: MKTG 772 - Strategic Brand Management  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 627 .Planning, managing, and evaluating brand strategies. Theories, models, concepts, and techniques used to build, measure, and manage brand equity. Marketing decisions faced by an organization in managing brands for long-term profitability. Maximum Credits: 3

MKTG 779.course_description: MKTG 779 - Advanced Marketing Strategy  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): B A 627  and advancement to candidacy.Development, implementation and evaluation of marketing strategy and planning. Role of marketing planning in overall corporate strategic planning process. Use of contemporary techniques and models in strategic planning process. Maximum Credits: 3

MKTG 797.course_description: MKTG 797 - Research  Units: 3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Advancement to candidacy.Research in the area of marketing. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

MKTG 798.course_description: MKTG 798 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of staff; to be arranged with department chair and instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

MALAS 585.course_name: Seminar in the Histories and Cultures of Skateboarding
MALAS 585.course_description: MALAS 585 - Seminar in the Histories and Cultures of Skateboarding  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): CCS 275 , HIST 114 , or graduate standing.Culture and practice of skateboarding around the world. How skateboarding intersects with art, athleticism, class, commerce, gender, music, race, and space. Maximum Credits: 3

MALAS 600A.course_name: Interdisciplinary Study in Liberal Arts and Sciences: Cultural Studies
MALAS 600A.course_description: MALAS 600A - Interdisciplinary Study in Liberal Arts and Sciences: Cultural Studies  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing.MALAS seminars are divided into four general areas with content that varies semester to semester.  Each course may be repeated once with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

MALAS 600B.course_name: Interdisciplinary Study in Liberal Arts and Sciences: Science and Society, Environmental Studies
MALAS 600B.course_description: MALAS 600B - Interdisciplinary Study in Liberal Arts and Sciences: Science and Society, Environmental Studies  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing.MALAS seminars are divided into four general areas with content that varies semester to semester.  Each course may be repeated once with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

MALAS 600C.course_name: Interdisciplinary Study in Liberal Arts and Sciences: Globalization, Technology, Future Studies
MALAS 600C.course_description: MALAS 600C - Interdisciplinary Study in Liberal Arts and Sciences: Globalization, Technology, Future Studies  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing.MALAS seminars are divided into four general areas with content that varies semester to semester.  Each course may be repeated once with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

MALAS 600D.course_name: Interdisciplinary Study in Liberal Arts and Sciences: Media Studies, Fine Arts, Transformative Arts
MALAS 600D.course_description: MALAS 600D - Interdisciplinary Study in Liberal Arts and Sciences: Media Studies, Fine Arts, Transformative Arts  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing.MALAS seminars are divided into four general areas with content that varies semester to semester.  Each course may be repeated once with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

MALAS 601.course_description: MALAS 601 - Seminar in Interdisciplinary Thinking  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing.Nature of interdisciplinary thinking. Ways of knowing and schools of thought in multiple disciplines. Interdisciplinary methods to analyze social issues. Maximum Credits: 6Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

MALAS 795.course_name: Studies in Liberal Arts and Sciences
MALAS 795.course_description: MALAS 795 - Studies in Liberal Arts and Sciences  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing.Individual preparation for comprehensive examination for students taking the Master of Liberal Arts and Sciences under Plan B. Maximum Credits: 6

MALAS 798.course_description: MALAS 798 - Special Study  Units: 3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing. Individual study on a given topic through interdisciplinary perspectives.  Maximum Credits: 6

MALAS 799A.course_description: MALAS 799A - Thesis or Project  Units: 3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): An officially appointed thesis committee and advancement to candidacy.Preparation of a project or thesis for Master of Arts degree in Liberal Arts and Sciences. Maximum Credits: 3

MALAS 799B.course_description: MALAS 799B - Thesis or Project Extension  Units: 0 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Prior registration in Thesis or Project 799A with an assigned grade symbol of RP.Registration required in any semester or term following assignment of RP in 799A in which the student expects to use the facilities and resources of the university; also student must be registered in the course when the completed thesis or project is granted final approval. Maximum Credits: 0

MALAS 799C.course_description: MALAS 799C - Comprehensive Examination Extension  Units: 0 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Completion or concurrent enrollment in degree program courses.Registration required of students whose only requirement is completion of the comprehensive examination for the master’s degree. Registration in 799C limited to two semesters. Maximum Credits: 0

MATH 110.course_description: MATH 110 - Mathematics for Life  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Mathematical problem solving pertinent to daily life. Exponential and logarithmic functions; conversion, estimation, and measurements; personal finance; probability and statistics. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 110X.course_description: MATH 110X - Mathematics for Life Support  Units: 1 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit  Three hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): Concurrent registration in MATH 110 . Required for students who have not satisfied the SDSU Mathematics/Quantitative Reasoning Assessment requirement.Required support course for MATH 110 . Credit in this course satisfies the SDSU Mathematics/Quantitative Reasoning Assessment requirement. Maximum Credits: 1

MATH 118.course_description: MATH 118 - Topics in Mathematics  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Topics selected from algebra, analysis, geometry, logic, probability, or statistics, designed to give student insight into structure of mathematical theories and their applications. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 120.course_description: MATH 120 - Calculus for Business Analysis  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Matrix algebra. Calculus including differentiation and integration. Graphing and optimization. Exponential and logarithmic functions. Multivariable calculus. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Not open to students with credit in MATH 150 .

MATH 124.course_description: MATH 124 - Calculus for the Life Sciences  Units: 4 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Three lectures and three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): Knowledge of algebra, geometry, and trigonometry as demonstrated by either (1) satisfactory completion of MATH 141  with a grade of C (2.0) or above; or (2) qualification on the Mathematics Placement Assessment. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required. Basic concepts of calculus with life science applications. Topics from differential and integral calculus and an introduction to elementary differential equations. Computer applications to biological problems. Maximum Credits: 4Note: Not open to students with credit in MATH 150 .

MATH 140.course_description: MATH 140 - College Algebra  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Solution of equations and inequalities, graphs and attributes of functions (domain, end behavior, range, transformations), linear and quadratic functions.Formerly numbered Mathematics 105. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Not open to students with credit in MATH 120 , MATH 124 , MATH 141 , or MATH 150 .

MATH 140X.course_description: MATH 140X - College Algebra Support  Units: 1 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit  Three hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): Concurrent registration in MATH 140 . Required for students who have not satisfied the SDSU Mathematics/Quantitative Reasoning Assessment requirement.Required support course for MATH 140 . Credit in this course satisfies the SDSU Mathematics/Quantitative Reasoning Assessment requirement.Formerly numbered Mathematics 105X. Maximum Credits: 1

MATH 141.course_description: MATH 141 - Precalculus  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): Knowledge of algebra as demonstrated by (1) satisfactory completion of MATH 140  with a grade of C (2.0) or better; or (2) qualification on the Mathematics Placement Assessment. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required.Rational, trigonometric, exponential and logarithmic functions; conic sections; parametric equations. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Not open to students with credit in MATH 124 , or MATH 150 .

MATH 141S.course_description: MATH 141S - Precalculus Support  Units: 1 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit  Three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): Concurrent registration in MATH 141 .Structured support course to assist students in achieving success in precalculus by engaging in the habits and learning activities that develop student success. Formerly numbered MATH 141A. Note: Not open to students with credit in MATH 141A.

MATH 150.course_description: MATH 150 - Calculus I  Units: 4 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Three lectures and two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): Knowledge of algebra, geometry, and trigonometry as demonstrated by either (1) satisfactory completion of MATH 141  with a grade of C (2.0) or better; or (2) qualification on the Mathematics Placement Assessment. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required. Algebraic and transcendental functions. Continuity and limits. The derivative and its applications. The integral and the fundamental theorem of calculus. Maximum Credits: 4

MATH 150S.course_description: MATH 150S - Calculus I Support  Units: 1 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit  Three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): Concurrent registration in MATH 150 .Structured support course to assist students in achieving success in Calculus I by engaging in the habits and learning activities that develop student success. Formerly numbered MATH 150A Note: Not open to students with credit in MATH 150A.

MATH 151.course_description: MATH 151 - Calculus II  Units: 4 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Three lectures and two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): MATH 150  with a grade of C (2.0) or better. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required. Techniques and applications of integration. Improper integrals. Differential equations. Infinite series. Conic sections. Curves in parametric form, polar coordinates. Maximum Credits: 4

MATH 210.course_description: MATH 210 - Number Systems in Elementary Mathematics  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Number sense, operation concepts, estimation, mental arithmetic, algorithms, problem solving, whole, rational, real numbers, ratio, and number theory. This course or its equivalent is required for students working toward a multiple subject credential in elementary education. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 210X.course_name: Number Systems in Elementary Mathematics Support
MATH 210X.course_description: MATH 210X - Number Systems in Elementary Mathematics Support  Units: 1 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit  Three hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): Concurrent registration in MATH 210 . Required for students who have not satisfied the SDSU Mathematics/Quantitative Reasoning Assessment requirement.Required support course for MATH 210 . Credit in this course satisfies the SDSU Mathematics/Quantitative Reasoning Assessment requirement. Maximum Credits: 1

MATH 211.course_description: MATH 211 - Geometry in Elementary Mathematics  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 210 .Two and three dimensional shapes and interrelationships, congruence, similarity and proportional reasoning, measurement of length, angle size, area, volume, metric system, and problem solving. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 237.course_description: MATH 237 - Elementary Differential Equations  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 151  and credit or concurrent registration in MATH 254  with a grade of C (2.0) or better in each course.Solving of first-order differential equations, numerical solutions of differential equations, existence and uniqueness, two-dimensional systems of differential equations, homogeneous and non-homogeneous second order equations, Laplace transform methods, series solutions. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 245.course_description: MATH 245 - Discrete Mathematics  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 124  or MATH 150  with a grade of C (2.0) or better. Recommended: MATH 151 .Logic, methods of proof, set theory, number theory, equivalence and order relations, counting (combinations and permutations), solving recurrence relations. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 252.course_description: MATH 252 - Calculus III  Units: 4 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 151  with a grade of C (2.0) or better.Functions of several variables. Vectors. Partial derivatives and multiple integrals. Line integrals and Green’s Theorem. Maximum Credits: 4

MATH 254.course_description: MATH 254 - Introduction to Linear Algebra  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 151  with a grade of C (2.0) or better.Matrix algebra, Gaussian elimination, determinants, vector spaces, linear transformations, orthogonality, eigenvalues, and eigenvectors. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 296.course_description: MATH 296 - Experimental Topics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Selected topics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

MATH 299.course_description: MATH 299 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6

MATH 302.course_description: MATH 302 - Transition to Higher Mathematics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 141  or MATH 150 .Selected topics in mathematics to emphasize proof writing and problem solving. Intended for those planning to teach secondary school mathematics. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 303.course_description: MATH 303 - History of Mathematics  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 141  or completion of the General Education requirement in Foundations of Learning IIA., Natural Sciences and Quantitative Reasoning for nonmajors. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Major currents in the development of mathematics from ancient Egypt and Babylon to late nineteenth century Europe. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 312.course_name: Topics from Elementary Mathematics: Statistics and Probability
MATH 312.course_description: MATH 312 - Topics from Elementary Mathematics: Statistics and Probability  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 211  and satisfactory performance on Liberal Studies Mathematics Proficiency Assessment. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Topics from statistics and probability. Enrollment limited to future teachers in grades K-8. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 313.course_name: Topics in Elementary Mathematics: Algebra of Change
MATH 313.course_description: MATH 313 - Topics in Elementary Mathematics: Algebra of Change  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 211  and satisfactory performance on Liberal Studies Mathematics Proficiency Assessment. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Capstone course for prospective K-8 teachers. Advanced topics in mathematics selected from algebra, number systems, transformation geometry, and problem solving. Enrollment limited to future teachers in grades K-8. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 320.course_description: MATH 320 - Abstract Algebra  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 245  and MATH 254  with a grade of C (2.0) or better in each course. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Elementary number theory and rings to include ideals, polynomial rings, quotient rings, ring homomorphisms and isomorphisms. Introduction to basic aspects of group theory.Formerly numbered Mathematics 521A. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 330.course_description: MATH 330 - Advanced Calculus I  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 245  and either MATH 254  or MATH 342A  with a grade of C (2.0) or better in each course. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Completeness of the real numbers and its implications, sequences of real numbers, and continuity and differentiability of functions of one real variable.Formerly numbered Mathematics 534A. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 336.course_description: MATH 336 - Introduction to Mathematical Modeling  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 254  with a grade of C (2.0) or better. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Models from the physical, natural, and social sciences including population models and arms race models. Emphasis on classes of models such as equilibrium models and compartment models. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 340.course_description: MATH 340 - Programming in Mathematics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 151  and MATH 245  with a grade of C (2.0) or better in each course. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Introduction to programming in mathematics. Modeling, problem solving, visualization. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Not open to students with credit in MATH 242.

MATH 341.course_description: MATH 341 - Mathematics Software Workshop  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 150 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Lesson plan design using teacher-based technologies.Formerly numbered Mathematics 241. Maximum Credits: 1

MATH 342A.course_description: MATH 342A - Methods of Applied Mathematics I  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 252 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Vector analysis, divergence and Stokes’ theorem and related integral theorems. Matrix analysis, eigenvalues and eigenvectors, diagonalization. Introduction to ordinary differential equations. Computer software packages for matrix applications, solving, and graphing differential equations. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 342B.course_description: MATH 342B - Methods of Applied Mathematics II  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 342A  with a grade of C (2.0) or better. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Second order ordinary differential equations, power series methods, Bessel functions, Legendre polynomials. Linear partial differential equations, separation of variables, Fourier series, Sturm-Liouville theory, orthogonal expansions, Fourier Transforms. Use of computer software packages for symbolic algebra and solution of differential equations. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 413.course_description: MATH 413 - Mathematics for the Middle Grades  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 313 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Teacher-level look at mathematics taught in middle grades, to include proportional reasoning, rational and real numbers, probability, and algebra. Intended for those planning to teach mathematics in middle grades; cannot be used as part of major or minor in mathematical sciences with exception of major for single subject teaching credential. Students in the SSTC major must receive instructor permission. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 414.course_description: MATH 414 - Mathematics Curriculum and Instruction  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Senior standing and 12 upper division units in mathematics. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Historical development of mathematics and mathematics curriculum. Principles and procedures of mathematics instruction in secondary schools. For secondary and postsecondary teachers and teacher candidates. Course cannot be used as part of the major or minor in mathematical sciences with exception of major for the single subject teaching credential. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 496.course_description: MATH 496 - Experimental Topics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Selected topics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

MATH 499.course_description: MATH 499 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor and at least one 300-level mathematics course with a grade of C (2.0) or better. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units. No more than three units may be applied to the major.

MATH 508.course_description: MATH 508 - Dynamical Systems and Modeling  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 254  or graduate standing. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Differential equations using analytical, graphical, and numerical representations. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 509.course_description: MATH 509 - Computers in Teaching Mathematics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): MATH 252  with a grade of C (2.0) or better. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Solving mathematical tasks using an appropriate computer interface, and problem-based curricula. Intended for those interested in mathematics teaching. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 510.course_name: Introduction to the Foundations of Geometry
MATH 510.course_description: MATH 510 - Introduction to the Foundations of Geometry  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 151  and MATH 302  with a grade of C (2.0) or better in each course. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.The foundations of Euclidean and hyperbolic geometries. Highly recommended for all prospective teachers of high school geometry. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 520.course_description: MATH 520 - Algebraic Structures  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 320  with a grade of C (2.0) or better or graduate standing. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Continuation of MATH 320 . Group theory to include finite Abelian groups, group homomorphisms and isomorphisms, normal subgroups, quotient groups, and Sylow theorems. Selected advanced topics to include field extensions or integral domains.Formerly numbered Mathematics 521B. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 522.course_description: MATH 522 - Number Theory  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 245  and MATH 254  with a grade of C (2.0) or better in each course. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Theory of numbers to include congruences, Diophantine equations, and a study of prime numbers; cryptography. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 524.course_description: MATH 524 - Linear Algebra  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 245  and either MATH 254  or MATH 342A  with a grade of C (2.0) or better in each course. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Vector spaces, linear transformations, orthogonality, eigenvalues and eigenvectors, normal forms for complex matrices, positive definite matrices and congruence. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 525.course_description: MATH 525 - Algebraic Coding Theory  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 254  with a grade of C (2.0) or better. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Linear codes, perfect and related codes, cyclic linear codes, BCH codes, burst error-correcting codes. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 530.course_description: MATH 530 - Advanced Calculus II  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 330  with a grade of C (2.0) or better or graduate standing. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Formal definitions and analysis within the framework of single variable functions. Advanced concepts in analysis.Formerly numbered Mathematics 534B. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 531.course_description: MATH 531 - Partial Differential Equations  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 252 ; and either MATH 237 , or  MATH 342A , or A E 280  with a grade of C (2.0) or better in each course. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Boundary value problems for heat and wave equations: eigenfunction expansions, Sturm-Liouville theory and Fourier series. D’Alembert’s solution to wave equation; characteristics. Laplace’s equation, maximum principles, Bessel functions. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 532.course_description: MATH 532 - Functions of a Complex Variable  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 252  with a grade of C (2.0) or better. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Analytic functions, Cauchy-Riemann equations, theorem of Cauchy, Laurent series, calculus of residues, and applications. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 537.course_description: MATH 537 - Ordinary Differential Equations  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 237 , or MATH 330 , or A E 280  with a grade of C (2.0) or better. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Theory of ordinary differential equations: existence and uniqueness, dependence on initial conditions and parameters, linear systems, stability and asymptotic behavior, plane autonomous systems, series solutions at regular singular points. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 538.course_description: MATH 538 - Discrete Dynamical Systems and Chaos  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 237 , or MATH 330 , or MATH 340 , or MATH 342A , or A E 280  with a grade of C (2.0) or better. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.One- and two-dimensional iterated maps, equilibria and their stability, sensitive dependence on initial conditions, Lyapunov exponents, horseshoe maps, period doubling, chaotic attractors, Poincare maps, stable/unstable manifolds, bifurcations. Applications in biology, chemistry, physics, engineering, and other sciences. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 542.course_name: Introduction to Computational Ordinary Differential Equations
MATH 542.course_description: MATH 542 - Introduction to Computational Ordinary Differential Equations  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 340 ; and either MATH 237 , or MATH 342A , or A E 280  with a grade of C (2.0) or better in each course. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Initial and boundary value problems for ordinary differential equations. Runge-Kutta, linear multi-step, predictor-corrector, adaptive, hybrid, shooting, and general linear methods. System, stiffness, and non-linear problems. Iterative methods. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 543.course_description: MATH 543 - Numerical Matrix Analysis  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 340 ; and either MATH 254 , MATH 342A , or A E 280  with a grade of C (2.0) or better. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Singular value decomposition. Projections, QR-factorization, orthogonalization, conditioning and stability, Gaussian Elimination, LU-Factorization, pivoting strategies, Cholesky Factorization. Iterative methods for diagonalization and eigensystem computation. Tridiagonal, Hessenberg, and Household matrices. The QR algorithm. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 579.course_description: MATH 579 - Combinatorics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 245  and MATH 254  with a grade of C (2.0) or better in each course. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Permutations, combinations, generating functions, recurrence relations, inclusion-exclusion counting. Polya’s theory of counting, other topics and applications. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 595.course_description: MATH 595 - Mathematical Biology and Biomedicine  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 254 ; and either MATH 237 , or MATH 342A , or A E 280  with a grade of C (2.0) or better in each course. Proof of completion of prerequisites required: Copy of transcript.Mathematical and computational modeling techniques to include difference and differential equations; probabilistic and statistical models. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 596.course_description: MATH 596 - Advanced Topics in Mathematics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Selected topics in classical and modern mathematical sciences.  May be repeated with the approval of the instructor. Maximum Credits: 6Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

MATH 600.course_description: MATH 600 - Chaos and Fractals  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 330  with a grade of C (2.0) or better.Non-linear dynamics to include Cantor sets, fixed and periodic points, fractal dimensions, fractals, iterative processes, orbit diagrams, orbits, period doubling, and self-similarity. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 601.course_description: MATH 601 - Topics in Algebra  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Mathematics 320 and 330.Unique factorization domains, rings and ideals, groups, algebraic field extensions. A course designed for secondary school teachers. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 602.course_description: MATH 602 - Topics in Analysis  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Mathematics 320 and 330.Topics in analysis, including the real number system, convergence, continuity, differentiation, the Riemann-Stieltjes integral, complex analysis, designed to give the secondary teacher a broad understanding of the fundamental concepts. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 620.course_description: MATH 620 - Groups, Rings, and Fields  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 320  and either MATH 520  or MATH 522  or MATH 525  with a grade of C (2.0) or better in each course.Group theory to include finite Abelian groups, isomorphism theorems, matrix groups, and permutation groups. Ring theory to include ideals, principal ideal domains, and unique factorization. Field theory to include field extensions and finite fields. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 621.course_description: MATH 621 - Advanced Topics in Algebra  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 620  with a grade of C (2.0) or better.Topics in advanced algebra. Typical courses to include algebra-geometry dictionary, commutative algebra, groups, fields, and Galois theory.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

MATH 625.course_description: MATH 625 - Algebraic Coding Theory  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 525  and MATH 520  or MATH 522  with a grade of C (2.0) or better in each course.Algebraic theory of error correction codes and decoding algorithms used in modern communications systems. Reed-Solomon codes and algebraic decoding algorithms. Code duality, MacWilliam’s identities and the linear programming bound. Probabilistic decoding of convolutional codes, low-density parity-check codes and turbo codes. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 626.course_description: MATH 626 - Cryptography  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 320  and MATH 522  with a grade of C (2.0) or better in each course.Design of secure cryptosystems with applications. Classical and public key cryptosystems. Primality testing, factoring, discrete log problem, and knapsack problem. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 630.course_description: MATH 630 - Applied Real Analysis  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 330  with a grade of B- (2.7) or better. Recommended: MATH 530  with a grade of B- (2.7) or better.Lebesgue measure and integration, metric spaces, Banach spaces, Hilbert spaces.Formerly numbered Mathematics 630A. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 633.course_description: MATH 633 - Advanced Topics in Analysis  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 630 . Recommended: MATH 668 .Specific topics in analysis to include Lebesgue and Sobolev spaces and spectral theory. Investigation of new theoretical tools and their applications. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 635.course_description: MATH 635 - Pattern Formation  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 337  or MATH 531  and MATH 254  or MATH 342A , MATH 342B .Linear stability, marginal stability curves, classification. One dimensional patterns, bifurcations. Two dimensional patterns, square and hexagonal patterns, spirals, defects. Diffusion driven instability, Turing patterns. Spatio-temporal chaos. Applications in biology, chemistry, and physics. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 636.course_description: MATH 636 - Mathematical Modeling  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 254  and MATH 337  or MATH 342A  and MATH 342B  or A E 280  with a grade of C (2.0) or better in each course.Advanced models from the physical, natural, and social sciences. Emphasis on classes of models and corresponding mathematical structures. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 638.course_description: MATH 638 - Continuous Dynamical Systems and Chaos  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 337  or MATH 537  and MATH 254  or MATH 342A , MATH 342B  with a grade of C (2.0) or better in each course.Nonlinear systems of differential equations, potential fields, periodic solutions, Lyapunov functions. Chaos in differential equations, Lyapunov exponents, chaotic attractors, Poincare maps. Lorenz and Rossler attractors, forced oscillators, Chua’s circuit, stable manifolds. Bifurcations. Applications in science and engineering. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 639.course_description: MATH 639 - Nonlinear Waves  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 531  or MATH 537  with a grade of C (2.0) or better.Linear waves, dissipation, dispersion. Conservation laws. Water waves. KdV equation, solitary waves, cnoidal waves. Scattering and inverse scattering. Perturbation theory. Nonlinear Schroedinger equation, dark and bright solitons, vortex solutions. Variational techniques, modulational instability, stability. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 667.course_description: MATH 667 - Mathematical Aspects of Systems Theory  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 524  and MATH 537  with a grade of C (2.0) or better in each course.Linear and nonlinear systems, nonlinear differential equations, equilibrium equations. Linearization, state transition matrix, stability theory, feedback control systems. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 668.course_description: MATH 668 - Applied Fourier Analysis  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 330 , MATH 524 ; MATH 530  or MATH 532  with a grade of C (2.0) or better in each course.Discrete and continuous Fourier transform methods with applications to statistics and communication systems. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 693A.course_description: MATH 693A - Advanced Numerical Methods: Computational Optimization  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 340  and MATH 524  and with a grade of C (2.0) or better in each course.Numerical optimization: Newton, Truncated-Newton, and Quasi- Newton methods for unconstrained optimization; with applications to nonlinear least squares, orthogonal distance regression, and nonlinear equations. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 693B.course_name: Advanced Numerical Methods: Computational Partial Differential Equations
MATH 693B.course_description: MATH 693B - Advanced Numerical Methods: Computational Partial Differential Equations  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MATH 340  and MATH 531  and with a grade of C (2.0) or better in each course.Methods for hyperbolic, parabolic, and elliptic partial differential equations: consistency, stability, convergence. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 695.course_description: MATH 695 - Communication in Interdisciplinary Applied Mathematics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing.Analysis of research publications. Communication skills for interdisciplinary mathematics. Development of a grant proposal and outreach item. Maximum Credits: 3Maximum Credit Statement: three units applicable to a master’s or doctoral degree.

MATH 696.course_description: MATH 696 - Selected Topics in Mathematical Sciences  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing.Intensive study in specific areas of mathematical sciences.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 12Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

MATH 720.course_description: MATH 720 - Seminar  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.An intensive study in advanced mathematics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

MATH 780.course_description: MATH 780 - Seminar in Communicating Mathematical Research  Units: 1 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing.Practice in effectively communicating mathematical ideas in various scenarios to include colloquia, poster presentations, seminars, and thesis defenses. Maximum Credits: 1

MATH 790.course_description: MATH 790 - Practicum in Teaching of Mathematics  Units: 1 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Award of graduate teaching associateship in mathematics.Supervision in teaching mathematics. Lecture writing, style of lecture presentation and alternatives, test and syllabus construction, and grading system. Not applicable to an advanced degree. Required for first semester GTA’s.

MATH 797.course_description: MATH 797 - Research  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Six units of graduate level mathematics.Research in one of the fields of mathematics. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

MATH 798.course_description: MATH 798 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of staff; to be arranged with department chair and instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

MATH 799A.course_description: MATH 799A - Thesis or Project  Units: 3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): An officially appointed thesis committee and advancement to candidacy.Preparation of a project or thesis for the master’s degree. Maximum Credits: 3

MATH 799B.course_description: MATH 799B - Thesis or Project Extension  Units: 0 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Prior registration in Thesis or Project 799A with an assigned grade symbol of RP.Registration required in any semester or term following assignment of RP in Course 799A in which the student expects to use the facilities and resources of the university; also student must be registered in the course when the completed thesis or project is granted final approval. Maximum Credits: 0

MATH 799C.course_description: MATH 799C - Comprehensive Examination Extension  Units: 0 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Completion or concurrent enrollment in degree program courses.Registration required of students whose only requirement is completion of the comprehensive examination for the master’s degree Registration in 799C limited to two semesters. Maximum Credits: 0

M S E 801.course_description: M S E 801 - Faculty Research  Units: 1 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Admission to doctoral program in Mathematics and Science Education.Issues of learning with reference to how they are addressed by doctoral faculty. Students will interview and write a one-page statement of research interests for each of eight doctoral faculty members. Maximum Credits: 1

M S E 802.course_description: M S E 802 - Orientation Practicum  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Admission to doctoral program in Mathematics and Science Education.Experience with research programs will introduce students to a variety of research questions and approaches. One research program per unit; minimum three units required in program.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 4Maximum Credit Statement: four units applicable to an advanced degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

M S E 805.course_name: Supervised Teaching of Teacher Preparation Courses
M S E 805.course_description: M S E 805 - Supervised Teaching of Teacher Preparation Courses  Units: 3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to doctoral program in Mathematics and Science Education.Students will plan and teach, under supervision, a course that prepares prospective teachers to teach mathematics or science at either the elementary or secondary level.

M S E 806.course_description: M S E 806 - Supervised School Practicum  Units: 3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to doctoral program in Mathematics and Science Education.School-based project focusing on inservice of teachers or on curriculum development, or work with a school district administrator or mathematics or science.

M S E 807.course_description: M S E 807 - Specially Designed Practicum  Units: 3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to doctoral program in Mathematics and Science Education.Practical experience to assist students in gaining experience in career they have selected.

M S E 810.course_description: M S E 810 - Seminar in Research Design  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to doctoral program in Mathematics and Science Education; PSY 670A , and consent of instructor.Issues such as analysis of protocols, problems of measurement in evaluation of learning, development, and assessment of cognitive models in learning in mathematics and science. Maximum Credits: 3

M S E 820.course_description: M S E 820 - Research Project  Units: 3-6 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to doctoral program in Mathematics and Science Education.Participation in an ongoing research project and development of a related study.

M S E 830.course_description: M S E 830 - Research Seminar  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Successful completion of qualifying examination.Students and faculty present ongoing research for discussion and critique. Maximum Credits: 12

M S E 897.course_description: M S E 897 - Doctoral Research  Units: 1-15 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): M S E 820 .Independent investigation in general field of the dissertation.

M S E 898.course_description: M S E 898 - Doctoral Special Study  Units: 1-8 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): An officially constituted doctoral committee and advancement to candidacy. Individual study in the field of specialization.

M S E 899.course_description: M S E 899 - Doctoral Dissertation  Units: 1-15 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): An officially constituted dissertation committee and advancement to candidacy.Preparation of the dissertation for the doctoral degree. Enrollment is required during the term in which the dissertation is approved.

MTHED 212.course_description: MTHED 212 - Children’s Mathematical Thinking  Units: 1-2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Credit or concurrent registration in MATH 210 .Children’s mathematical thinking and in-depth analyses of children’s understanding of operations (addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division) and place value. Students will observe individual children solving mathematics problems. Real, compact disc, and/or web-based experience included. Maximum Credits: 2

MTHED 600.course_name: Teaching and Learning Mathematics in the Early Grades (Pre-K to 4)
MTHED 600.course_description: MTHED 600 - Teaching and Learning Mathematics in the Early Grades (Pre-K to 4)  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MTHED 603  or MTHED 604  and K-12 teaching experience.Research in teaching and learning mathematics in preschool through grade four. Innovative early childhood mathematics curricula, promising instructional practices. Assessment techniques to guide instruction. Maximum Credits: 3

MTHED 601.course_name: Teaching and Learning Mathematics in the Middle Grades
MTHED 601.course_description: MTHED 601 - Teaching and Learning Mathematics in the Middle Grades  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MTHED 604  and K-12 teaching experience.Research on teaching and learning mathematics in grades five through eight. Innovative middle grades mathematics curricula, promising instructional practices. Assessment techniques to guide instruction. Maximum Credits: 3

MTHED 603.course_name: Seminar on Learning Theories in Mathematics Education
MTHED 603.course_description: MTHED 603 - Seminar on Learning Theories in Mathematics Education  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor or graduate adviser.Application of several major learning theories (e.g. behaviorism, structuralism, radical constructivism, information processing, and sociocultural perspectives) to research on the learning and teaching of mathematics. Maximum Credits: 3

MTHED 604.course_name: Seminar on Teaching Issues in Mathematics
MTHED 604.course_description: MTHED 604 - Seminar on Teaching Issues in Mathematics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor or graduate adviser.Mathematics education research pertaining to teaching of mathematics. Readings chosen to bridge theory and practice divide. Maximum Credits: 3

MTHED 605.course_description: MTHED 605 - Algebra in the 7-14 Curriculum  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor or graduate adviser.Curricular change in algebra, with attention to experimental curricula, to research on learning of algebra, and to influences of technology. Implications for instruction. Maximum Credits: 3

MTHED 606.course_description: MTHED 606 - Selected Topics in 7-14 Mathematics Curriculum  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor or graduate adviser.Curricular change in school mathematics, to include geometry, probability, and statistics, with attention to contemporary curricula, to research on learning and teaching in those areas, and to the influences of technology. Implications for instruction. Maximum Credits: 3

MTHED 607.course_name: Seminar on Research in Undergraduate Mathematics Education
MTHED 607.course_description: MTHED 607 - Seminar on Research in Undergraduate Mathematics Education  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor or graduate adviser.Research in undergraduate mathematics education and its implications for teaching. Topics include research on student thinking on concepts from calculus through abstract algebra and the teaching and learning of proof. Maximum Credits: 3

MTHED 608.course_description: MTHED 608 - Equity in STEM Education  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing.Inclusion, social justice, and systemic inequities in STEM education. Application of theory to classroom practice and policy. Maximum Credits: 3

M E 101.course_description: M E 101 - Solid Modeling I  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Six hours of laboratory.Introduction to 3-D computer-aided mechanical design. Creation of basic to intermediate solid parts, assemblies, and drawings to include orthographic, pictorial, section, and detail views. Dimensioning, dimensional tolerancing, and thread notation per ASME Y14.5M-1994. CREO and SolidWorks software. Maximum Credits: 2
