M E 102.course_description: M E 102 - Solid Modeling II  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Six hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): M E 101 .Continuation of 3-D computer-aided mechanical design. Creation of advanced solid parts, assemblies, and drawings. Standard fits and geometric tolerancing per ASME Y14.5M-1994. CREO and SolidWorks software. Finite element analysis of mechanical components using CREO and SolidWorks simulation software. Computer numerical controlled manufacturing using HSMWorks software. Maximum Credits: 2

M E 190.course_description: M E 190 - Computer-Aided Design  Units: 2 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and three hours of laboratory.Introduction to 3-D computer-aided mechanical design. Creation of basic to intermediate solid parts, assemblies, and drawings to include orthographic, pictorial, section, and detail views. Dimensioning, dimensional tolerancing, and thread notation per ASME Y14.5M-2009. SolidWorks software. Maximum Credits: 2Note: Not open to students with credit in M E 102 .

M E 200.course_description: M E 200 - Statics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Same As: A E 200   Prerequisite(s): MATH 150  and PHYS 195  with a grade of C (2.0) or better in each course. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Force systems, equilibrium, structures, distributed forces, friction, virtual work, moments of inertia, vector algebra. Maximum Credits: 3

M E 202.course_description: M E 202 - Computer Programming and Applications  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and three hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): MATH 151 .Principles of programming using Matlab. Syntax topics to include arrays, control flow, data types, functions, and loops. Numerical methods to include curve fitting, Gauss reduction, interpolation, matrix operations, Newton-Raphson, numerical differentiation, and numerical integration. Matlab implementations. Application areas in mechanical engineering to include dynamic systems, finite element analysis, graphical user interfaces, and image analysis. Maximum Credits: 3

M E 220.course_description: M E 220 - Dynamics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Same As: A E 220   Prerequisite(s): M E 200  [or A E 200 ] and MATH 151  with a grade of C (2.0) or better in each course. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Kinetics of a particle; central force motion; systems of particles; work and energy; impulse and momentum; moments and products of inertia; Euler’s equations of motion; vibration and time response; engineering applications. Maximum Credits: 3

M E 230.course_description: M E 230 - Basics of Mechatronics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): MATH 151 , PHYS 196 , PHYS 196L , with a minimum grade of C (2.0) in MATH 151 and PHYS 196.Introductory mechatronics. Basic DC and AC circuits, breadboarding, capacitors, inductors, circuit components, integrated circuit amplifiers, filters, with applications to mechanical engineering. Ohm’s Law. Laboratory topics include measurement techniques using function generator, multimeter, oscilloscope, and computer simulation using circuit analysis software.

M E 240.course_description: M E 240 - Introduction to Engineering Materials  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): CHEM 202  (or CHEM 200 ). Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Atomic and molecular structure of materials utilized in engineering. Analysis of the relationships between structure of materials and their mechanical, thermal, electrical, corrosion, and radiation properties. Examples of material structure relevant to civil, electrical, aerospace, and mechanical engineering applications. Maximum Credits: 3

M E 241.course_description: M E 241 - Materials Laboratory  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): M E 240 .Experimental methods used to characterize engineering materials and their mechanical behavior. Maximum Credits: 1

M E 296.course_description: M E 296 - Experimental Topics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Selected topics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

M E 304.course_description: M E 304 - Mechanics of Materials  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): M E 200  [or A E 200 ] or CIV E 225  with a grade of C (2.0) or better.Concepts of stress and strain. Generalized Hooke’s law. Formulations for axial, shear, bending, torsion, and combined stresses applied to tension members, pinned joints, beams, and shafts. Euler buckling criteria for columns. Energy methods. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Not open to students with credit in CIV E 301 .

M E 314.course_description: M E 314 - Engineering Design: Mechanical Components  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): M E 190 , M E 202 , M E 241 , M E 304  (or CIV E 301 ). Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Application of mechanics, physical properties of materials, and solid mechanics to the design of machine elements. Student design projects. Maximum Credits: 3

M E 330.course_description: M E 330 - Mechatronics Laboratory  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): M E 202 , M E 220  [or A E 220 ], M E 230 ; A E 280 , PHYS 196L . Proof of completion of prerequisites required for all Mechanical Engineering 300-, 400-, and 500-level courses: Copy of transcript.Actuating devices, data acquisition systems, hardware controllers, machine and process control applications, sensors and transducers, transducer signal processing and conditioning. Maximum Credits: 3

M E 350.course_description: M E 350 - Thermodynamics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): M E 200  [or A E 200 ] or CIV E 225 ; MATH 252 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Basic concepts and principles of thermodynamics with emphasis on simple compressible substances. First and second law analysis, entropy, exergy analysis and state relations.

M E 360.course_description: M E 360 - Fluids Engineering  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): M E 220  [or A E 220 ] andA E 280 .Fluid mechanics with applications to mechanical engineering systems. Statics and dynamics of fluids. Conservation laws of mass, momentum and energy analysis in control volume and differential form. Real life applications of these fundamental concepts and systems to include turbomachinery. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Not open to students with credit in A E 340 .

M E 420.course_description: M E 420 - Fundamentals of Manufacturing  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): M E 314 .Applications of mechanics of materials and systems in product design and fabrication. Design challenges and constraints of various fabrication technologies. Fabrication technologies and processes. Maximum Credits: 9

M E 430.course_description: M E 430 - System Modeling and Analysis  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): M E 330 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript. System-level lumped parameter modeling of dynamic systems using first principles. Predict performance of engineered systems based on its dynamic response. Feedback control to achieve closed loop stability and specified system performances. Maximum Credits: 3

M E 450.course_description:
M E 450 - Applications of Thermodynamics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): M E 350 . Air-conditioning, combustion, exergy analysis, gas power systems, heat pumps, power plant cycles, psychrometrics, refrigeration; thermoeconomics.
  Maximum Credits: 3

M E 452.course_description: M E 452 - Principles of Heat Transfer  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): M E 350  and M E 360 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Analytical and numerical solutions of steady and transient one- and two-dimensional conduction problems, forced and natural convection in external and internal flows, and thermal radiation. Applications. Maximum Credits: 3

M E 490W.course_description: M E 490W - Engineering Design: Senior Project  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and six hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): M E 304 (or CIV E 301), M E 314, M E 330, M E 452. Every mechanical engineering student must have a master plan on file before enrolling in M E 490W. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Applications of engineering principles and design techniques to design, build, and test an engineering system taking into consideration societal impact and ethical issues. Developing skills to effectively communicate orally and in writing with audiences within and outside the discipline. Note: Not open to students with credit in M E 490A.

M E 491.course_description: M E 491 - Engineering Design: Senior Project  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and six hours of guided design activities.Prerequisite(s): M E 490W  , M E 495 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Applications of principles and design techniques of an engineering system. Part two of a single project is completed two-course sequence and is completed upon presentation of oral and written report. Issues related to ethics and engineering practice are discussed.Formerly numbered M E 490B

M E 495.course_description: M E 495 - Mechanical and Thermal Systems Laboratory  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): M E 330  and M E 452 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Data acquisition theory, instrumentation, sensors, data reduction, statistical and uncertainty analysis, and design of experiments. Experience in designing, performing, and reporting experiments on mechanical and thermal systems, mechanisms, vibrations, structures, thermodynamics, heat transfer. Maximum Credits: 2

M E 496.course_description: M E 496 - Advanced Mechanical Engineering Topics  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Modern developments in mechanical engineering. Maximum Credits: 9Maximum Credit Statement: nine units for any combination of M E 496, M E 499 and M E 596.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

M E 499.course_description: M E 499 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 9Maximum Credit Statement: nine units for any combination of M E 496, M E 499 and M E 596.

M E 520.course_description: M E 520 - Introduction to Mechanical Vibrations  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): M E 304  (or CIV E 301 ) and M E 330 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript. Analysis of mechanical vibration; single- and multi-degree of freedom systems; free and forced vibrations; vibration isolation; vibration absorbers. Theory of vibration measuring instruments. Maximum Credits: 3

M E 530.course_description: M E 530 - Automatic Control Systems  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): M E 330 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript. Dynamic characteristics of control components and systems. Stability and response of closed loop systems. Design of control systems. Maximum Credits: 3

M E 532.course_description: M E 532 - Robot Modeling and Control  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): M E 330 .Analysis, computer programming, modeling, motion planning, and design of control systems for robots. Maximum Credits: 3

M E 535.course_description: M E 535 - Mechanics of Composite Structures  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Same As: A E 535   Prerequisite(s): A E 280  and A E 310  or M E 314 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript. Micro- and macro-mechanics of composite materials, classical lamination theory, initial failure prediction and progressive failure analysis of laminates, analysis of beam and plate structures, stiffness and strength based design of composites. Maximum Credits: 3

M E 540.course_description: M E 540 - Mechanics of Polymers  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): M E 314 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Polymeric materials, mechanics, and properties. Mechanical mechanics and properties essential for design. Stress-Strain behavior theories and models to include hyperelasticity and viscoelasticity. Design and analysis methodologies and techniques. Maximum Credits: 3

M E 543.course_description: M E 543 - Powder-Based Manufacturing  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): M E 240  and M E 314 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript; or graduate standing.Manufacturing of micro and nano-structured engineering components and composites starting with metal and/or ceramic powders. Powder production methods, characterization, powder shaping and compaction, sintering, hot consolidation, design considerations, and finishing operations. Maximum Credits: 3

M E 552.course_description: M E 552 - Heating, Ventilating, and Air-Conditioning  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s):  M E 452 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Fundamentals of air conditioning processes, psychrometrics, and building cooling load calculations. Design and analysis of HVAC systems. Equipment selection. Design codes and standards. Computerized cooling load calculations. Maximum Credits: 3

M E 554.course_description: M E 554 - Automotive Power  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): M E 452 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Conventional and emerging energy conversion devices for automotive applications to include fuel-cell, hybrid, and internal combustion engines. Alternative fuels to include biofuels, cleaner fossil fuels, hydrogen, and natural gas. Well-to-wheel energy and cost analysis of prime mover designs/fuels. Maximum Credits: 3

M E 555.course_description: M E 555 - Thermal Systems Analysis and Design  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): M E 452 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Analysis, design, and optimization of thermal systems using microcomputers. Modeling of thermal systems and components. Thermal system component characteristics and their effect on overall system performance. Relationship among thermal sciences in design process. Introduction to thermoeconomic optimization. Maximum Credits: 3

M E 556.course_description:
M E 556 - Solar Energy Conversion  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): M E 452 . Proof of completion of prerequisite required: Copy of transcript.
 Application of thermodynamics, fluid mechanics and heat transfer to the thermal design of solar energy conversion systems. Computer simulations utilized.

M E 580.course_description: M E 580 - Biomechanics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): M E 304  (or CIV E 301 ) and M E 360 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Application of engineering methodologies for quantitative understanding of biological/physiological phenomena. Continuum mechanics principles. Cardiovascular system and its components viewed from a mechanistic standpoint. Maximum Credits: 3

M E 582.course_description:
M E 582 - Introduction to Nanobiotechnology  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): M E 350,  M E 360 .
 Introduction to the application of nanotechnology in biology and medicine. How the ability to manipulate, observe, and synthesize materials at the nanoscale has advanced our understanding of the biological world and is driving the development of new medical technologies.

M E 585.course_description: M E 585 - Fundamentals of Micro-Electro-Mechanical Systems (MEMS)  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and four hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): For aerospace engineering majors: M E 220  [or A E 220 ], E E 204 , M E 240  and A E 310 . For electrical engineering majors: E E 330  and M E 240 . For mechanical engineering majors: M E 240 , M E 220  [or A E 220 ] and M E 314 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript; or graduate standing.Microfabrication techniques, microsensors and microactuators, and scaling laws. A design project of a micro-device including schematic creation, test of performance, layout generation, and layout versus schematic comparison. Maximum Credits: 3

M E 596.course_description: M E 596 - Advanced Mechanical Engineering Topics  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Modern developments in mechanical engineering.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: nine units for any combination of M E 496, M E 499 and 596 applicable to a bachelor’s degree. Maximum Credit Statement: nine units for any combination of M E 496, M E 499 and M E 596 applicable to a bachelor’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

M E 610.course_name: Finite Element Methods in Mechanical Engineering
M E 610.course_description: M E 610 - Finite Element Methods in Mechanical Engineering  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): A E 280  with a grade of C or better.Development of finite elements and an introduction to solution methods. Problems from various fields of study in mechanical engineering such as stress analysis, vibrations and heat transfer. Introduction to finite element programs such as NASTRAN. Maximum Credits: 3

M E 640.course_description: M E 640 - Nanomaterials  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): M E 543 .Nanomaterials compared with conventional materials. Nanomaterials synthesis, characterization, properties, and applications. Maximum Credits: 3

M E 645.course_description: M E 645 - Mechanical Behavior of Engineering Materials  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): M E 314  and M E 350 .Elastic and plastic deformation of monolithic engineering materials and composites. Dislocation theory and plasticity of crystalline solids. Linear elastic and elastic-plastic fracture mechanics. Failure analysis of engineering components. Design optimization based on materials and service environment variables. Maximum Credits: 3

M E 646.course_description: M E 646 - Mechanics of Sintering  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Practical aspects and conceptual models and mechanisms associated with sintering of ceramic and metal powders. Maximum Credits: 3

M E 651.course_description: M E 651 - Advanced Thermodynamics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): A E 280  with a grade of C or better and M E 351 .Advanced concepts of macroscopic thermodynamics are developed including entropy generation, irreversibility, effectiveness, exergy, and chemical exergy of fuels. Concepts applied to power and refrigeration cycles using computer software. Maximum Credits: 3

M E 653.course_description: M E 653 - Combustion  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): M E 351 .Thermodynamics of combustion, chemical equilibrium, chemical kinetics, combustion of gaseous, liquid and solid fuels, and their application. Maximum Credits: 3

M E 656.course_description: M E 656 - Conduction Heat and Transfer  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): M E 452  and A E 515 .Conduction heat transfer analysis of multi-dimensional and transient processes using both classical analysis and numerical methods. Maximum Credits: 3

M E 657.course_description: M E 657 - Convection Heat Transfer  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): M E 452  and A E 515 .Convection heat transfer processes under laminar and turbulent conditions. Mass transfer. Scaling arguments, analytical and numerical modeling. Maximum Credits: 3

M E 658.course_description: M E 658 - Radiation Heat Transfer  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): M E 452  and A E 515 .Radiation heat transfer processes. Radiative properties of surfaces and gases. Absorption, emission, and scattering phenomena. Numerical modeling. Maximum Credits: 3

M E 661.course_description: M E 661 - Gas Dynamics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): M E 350 , M E 360 , M E 452 .Thermodynamics of high velocity compressible fluid flow. Adiabatic and diabatic flow; shock phenomena; imperfect gases; multidimensional flow. Applications to the propulsive duct and turbomachinery.

M E 681.course_description: M E 681 - Biomaterials  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): M E 240  and M E 580 .Structure and properties of metallic, ceramic, and polymer biomaterials. Chemical interaction with physiological environment. Thrombosis and hemostasis on synthetic surfaces. Sterilization and packaging. Ethics and regulatory approval process. Applications discussed in cardiovascular, pulmonary, renal, orthopedic and dental medicine. Maximum Credits: 3

M E 683.course_description: M E 683 - Design of Medical Devices  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): M E 314  and M E 580 .Device design, including biomaterials, human factors engineering, reliability, and manufacturing. Topics relevant to industry reviewed include regulatory, documentation, quality, and legal. Maximum Credits: 3

M E 685.course_description: M E 685 - Micro-Electro-Mechanical Systems (MEMS) Design and Applications  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Same As: E E 685 . Prerequisite(s): M E 585 .Design and manufacturing technology for micro- and nano-scale devices. Topics include solid state transducers, microscale physics, biomedical microelectronics, microfluidics, biosensors, and hybrid integration of microfabrication technology. Emphasis on biomedical applications. Maximum Credits: 3

M E 688.course_description: M E 688 - Tissue Engineering  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Introduction to the interdisciplinary field of tissue engineering. Application of knowledge of systems engineering, mechanics and materials towards controlling, enhancing, and understanding the performance of biological tissues. Maximum Credits: 3

M E 696.course_description: M E 696 - Advanced Topics in Mechanical Engineering  Units: 2 or 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Intensive study in specific areas of mechanical engineering.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 12Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

M E 797.course_description: M E 797 - Research  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of graduate adviser and advancement to candidacy.Research in engineering. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

M E 798.course_description: M E 798 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of graduate adviser; to be arranged with department chair and instructor. Individual study or internship.  Maximum Credits: 3Maximum Credit Statement: three units applicable to a master’s degree.

M E 799A.course_description: M E 799A - Thesis or Project  Units: 3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): An officially appointed thesis committee and advancement to candidacy.Preparation of a project or thesis for the master’s degree. Maximum Credits: 3

MUSIC 260.course_description: MUSIC 260 - Electro-Acoustic Music Composition I  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): MUSIC 160 .Sound sampling, musique concrete, subtractive synthesis, physics of sound and basic digital audio theory. Emphasis on application of techniques and theoretical knowledge to produce original musical compositions. Maximum Credits: 2

MUSIC 262.course_description: MUSIC 262 - Intermediate Recording and Sound Reinforcement  Units: 2 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and two hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): MUSIC 162  with a grade of C (2.0) or better.Continuing study of physical and theoretical technologies applied to sound recording and live sound reinforcement. Maximum Credits: 2

MUSIC 266.course_description: MUSIC 266 - Elements of Jazz II  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MUSIC 166 .Harmonic analysis of standard and bebop repertoire, less common modes and dominant scales, solo transcription, analysis, and ear-training. Maximum Credits: 2

MUSIC 290.course_description: MUSIC 290 - Body Modalities  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Same As: DANCE 290  One lecture and two hours of activity.Alternative movement theory systems including an introduction to body modalities of yoga, Pilates, ideokinesis, Alexander and Feldenkrais techniques, Laban movement analysis and authentic movement. Maximum Credits: 4

MUSIC 291.course_name: Yoga and Mindfulness for the Musician
MUSIC 291.course_description: MUSIC 291 - Yoga and Mindfulness for the Musician  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Designed to assist musicians with stress management, performance anxiety, and self-regulation of practice routines. Throughout the semester, students will practice three different styles of yoga to assist with focus, concentration, and injury prevention.  May be repeated with consent of instructor.  Maximum Credits: 4Maximum Credit Statement: May be repeated up to four times with consent of instructor; maximum up to 4 units allowed for 291 and 591.Note: Open to B.A. or B.M. Music Majors only.

MUSIC 296.course_description: MUSIC 296 - Experimental Topics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Selected topics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

MUSIC 299.course_description: MUSIC 299 - Special Study  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Consent of School of Music and Dance director, and instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 3

MUSIC 301.course_description: MUSIC 301 - Recitals  Units: 1 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Preparation for individual solo performances and attendance at a minimum of 12 concerts or recitals in accordance with music requirements. Maximum Credits: 4

MUSIC 305A.course_description: MUSIC 305A - Comprehensive Musicianship  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MUSIC 205B  with a grade of C (2.0) or better. Concurrent registration in MUSIC 308A .Music theory, harmony, composition, counterpoint, and analysis. Continuation of MUSIC 205B . Open to music majors and minors only. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Not open to students with credit in MUSIC 305B , MUSIC 405A , MUSIC 405B .

MUSIC 305B.course_description: MUSIC 305B - Comprehensive Musicianship  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MUSIC 305A  with a grade of C (2.0) or better. Concurrent registration in MUSIC 308B .Music theory, harmony, composition, counterpoint, and analysis. Continuation of MUSIC 305A . Open to music majors and minors only. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Not open to students with credit in MUSIC 405A  or MUSIC 405B .

MUSIC 308A.course_name: Music History I: Medieval, Renaissance, and Baroque
MUSIC 308A.course_description: MUSIC 308A - Music History I: Medieval, Renaissance, and Baroque  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MUSIC 151 .European art music from ancient Greece through the Baroque. Evolution of musical style in a historical and cultural context. Interrelationships of music, politics, technology, economics, and ideology. Open to music majors and minors only. Maximum Credits: 3

MUSIC 308B.course_name: Music History II: Classical and Romantic
MUSIC 308B.course_description: MUSIC 308B - Music History II: Classical and Romantic  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MUSIC 151 .European art music from 1750 to beginning of 20th century. Evolution of musical style as a response to historical and cultural context. Interrelationships of music, politics, technology, economics, and ideology. Open to music majors and minors only. Maximum Credits: 3

MUSIC 343.course_description: MUSIC 343 - Music Literature for Children  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MUSIC 102  or MUSIC 205B .Analytical study of music suitable for children of all ages. Background information, musical structure and functions of this music in the lives of children. Maximum Credits: 3

MUSIC 345.course_description: MUSIC 345 - Music Cultures of the World  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Art, folk, popular, and sacred music case studies drawn from Africa, Asia, Europe, Latin America, and the United States with attention to the relationship between culture, history, and music. Concert attendance required in Fall and Spring semesters. Maximum Credits: 3

MUSIC 346.course_description: MUSIC 346 - Practicum in Music Education III  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): MUSIC 110B  and MUSIC 246B  with a grade of C (2.0) or better.Practical teaching applications. Students will develop and teach model lessons evaluated by students, faculty, and master teachers. Students choose a primary area of specialization and a master teacher in preparation for the final semester of the practicum series. Maximum Credits: 2

MUSIC 347.course_description: MUSIC 347 - Conducting  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MUSIC 205B  with a grade of C (2.0) or better.Basic techniques of conducting. Baton technique, conducting patterns, score reading, elements of performance and interpretation. Practical experience in typical conducting situations. Maximum Credits: 1

MUSIC 349.course_description: MUSIC 349 - Instrumental Conducting  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MUSIC 347  with a grade of C (2.0) or better.Elements of baton technique and development of skills common to instrumental conducting. Representative literature and techniques for instrumental organizations studied and performed. Practical experience in typical conducting situations. Maximum Credits: 1

MUSIC 351.course_description: MUSIC 351 - Music and Culture  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Significant music literature of various historical and cultural periods with emphasis on stylistic characteristics through directed listening.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units from Music 351, 351C, and 351D of which three units may be applicable to General Education.Note: Not open to music majors. See Class Schedule for specific content.

MUSIC 360.course_description: MUSIC 360 - Electro-Acoustic Music Composition II  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): MUSIC 260 .Concepts, terminology, and history combined with composition and recording projects introducing analog electro-acoustic music with multi-track recording and analog synthesizers; or digital electro-acoustic music using digital synthesizers and computer software.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 4

MUSIC 364A.course_description: MUSIC 364A - History of Jazz  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Jazz style and forms as they have evolved historically. Classroom playing experience in jazz styles as a part of study. Designed for music majors and minors. Maximum Credits: 2

MUSIC 364B.course_description: MUSIC 364B - History of Jazz  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Jazz style and forms as they have evolved historically. Classroom playing experience in jazz styles as a part of study. Designed for music majors and minors. Maximum Credits: 2

MUSIC 366.course_description: MUSIC 366 - Elements of Jazz III  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MUSIC 266 .Post bop repertoire, altered modes and scales, solo transcription, analysis, and ear-training. Maximum Credits: 2

MUSIC 370.course_description: MUSIC 370 - Chamber Music  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Three hours. Four hours for opera.Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Sections for string, woodwind, brass, piano, vocal, and mixed ensemble groups of three or more players.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: four units. Note: The performance group courses are devoted to the study in detail and the public performance of a wide range of representative literature for each type of ensemble, and designed to provide students with practical experience in rehearsal techniques. See Class Schedule for specific content.

MUSIC 371.course_description: MUSIC 371 - Experimental Music Ensemble  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two hours of activity.Ensemble exploring diverse, under-recognized elements of music-making. Performance, integrating historical and interdisciplinary study. Applied musical research through exploratory listening and musical practices. Collaborative group composition. Maximum Credits: 8

MUSIC 374.course_description: MUSIC 374 - Concert Band  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Five hours.Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Study and public performance of representative literature for ensemble. Practical experience in rehearsal techniques. Maximum Credits: four units. Note: The performance group courses are devoted to the study in detail and the public performance of a wide range of representative literature for each type of ensemble, and designed to provide students with practical experience in rehearsal techniques.

MUSIC 375.course_description: MUSIC 375 - Marching Band  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  More than six hours.Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Study and public performance of representative literature for the ensemble. Practical experience in rehearsal technique. Maximum Credits: maximum combined credit for MUSIC 175 and 375 eight units. Maximum Credit Statement: eight units maximum combined credit for MUSIC 175 and MUSIC 375.Note: The performance group courses are devoted to the study in detail and the public performance of a wide range of representative literature for each type of ensemble, and designed to provide students with practical experience in rehearsal techniques.

Maximum Credits: 4Note: The performance group courses are devoted to the study in detail and the public performance of a wide range of representative literature for each type of ensemble, and designed to provide students with practical experience in rehearsal techniques.

MUSIC 384.course_description: MUSIC 384 - Opera Theatre  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Six or more hours per week.Interpretation and characterization of light and grand opera. Specific work in coordination of opera ensemble. Maximum Credits: eight units. Note: The performance group courses are devoted to the study in detail and the public performance of a wide range of representative literature for each type of ensemble, and designed to provide students with practical experience in rehearsal techniques.

MUSIC 389.course_description: MUSIC 389 - Jazz Ensemble  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  More than three hours.Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Study and public performance of representative literature for ensemble. Practical experience in rehearsal techniques. Maximum Credits: four units. Note: The performance group courses are devoted to the study in detail and the public performance of a wide range of representative literature for each type of ensemble, and designed to provide students with practical experience in rehearsal techniques.

MUSIC 390.course_description: MUSIC 390 - Somatic Movement Practices II  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Same As: DANCE 390  Two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): MUSIC 290  [or DANCE 290 ] and DANCE 190  with a grade of C (2.0) or better in each course.Continuing body-mind practices focused on first-person experience of movement. Increasing awareness of sensations and perceptions cultivated through additional practices of somatic systems to include Bartenieff Fundamentals, Body-Mind Centering, and Feldenkrais Method. Maximum Credits: 3

MUSIC 405A.course_description: MUSIC 405A - Comprehensive Musicianship: Orchestration, Arranging  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Credit or concurrent registration in MUSIC 305A . Orchestration and arranging techniques for comprehensive musicianship composition and arranging projects. Open to music majors and minors only. Maximum Credits: 3

MUSIC 405B.course_description:
MUSIC 405B - Comprehensive Musicianship: Counterpoint  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MUSIC 305A  with a grade of C (2.0) or better.
 Counterpoint in the sixteenth (the Renaissance) and eighteenth (Classical era) centuries. Two-voice counterpoint, fugues, inventions. Open to music majors and minors only. Maximum Credits: 3

MUSIC 408A.course_description: MUSIC 408A - Music History III: 20th and 21st Centuries  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MUSIC 151  and MUSIC 308B .Art music from beginning of 20th century to present. Evolution of musical style in a historical and cultural context. Interrelationships of music, politics, technology, economics, and ideology. Open to music majors and minors only. Maximum Credits: 3

MUSIC 408B.course_name: Music History IV: Jazz History and Improvisation
MUSIC 408B.course_description: MUSIC 408B - Music History IV: Jazz History and Improvisation  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and two hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): MUSIC 151  and MUSIC 305B .Historical and theoretical overview of jazz art music tradition. Rhythmic, harmonic, and melodic components. Analytical score study. Practical experience in modal and tonal jazz improvisation. Open only to music majors and minors. Maximum Credits: 2

MUSIC 446.course_description: MUSIC 446 - Practicum in Music Education IV  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): MUSIC 205B , MUSIC 210A , MUSIC 346 , MUSIC 347  with a grade of C (2.0) or better.Early field experience. Students will complete a minimum of 45 hours of public school teaching in their area of specialization. Master teachers will provide on-site guidance and evaluation. Field experience and increased effectiveness discussed. Maximum Credits: 2

MUSIC 460.course_description: MUSIC 460 - Art of Recording  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and three hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): MUSIC 360 .Creation of audio recordings of artistic merit. Vocal/instrumental microphone techniques for classical, jazz, rock; recording audio design, construction; acoustical properties, theories, mathematics. Maximum Credits: 3

MUSIC 466.course_description: MUSIC 466 - Elements of Jazz IV  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MUSIC 366 .Atonal and aeromedical theories and philosophy, research paper, solo transcription, analysis, and ear-training. Maximum Credits: 2

MUSIC 496.course_description: MUSIC 496 - Experimental Topics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Selected topics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

MUSIC 499.course_description: MUSIC 499 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of School of Music and Dance director. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6

MUSIC 507.course_description: MUSIC 507 - Composition Laboratory  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and two hours of activity. Prerequisite(s): MUSIC 207  with a grade of C (2.0) or better and consent of instructor.Continuation of MUSIC 207 .  May be repeated with new content or consent of instructor.  Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: Six units with consent of instructor.

MUSIC 515.course_description: MUSIC 515 - Professional Orientation for Music Performers  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): Twelve units of upper division or graduate standing in B.M. or M.M. degree. Others by consent of instructor.Conditions met in professional music world as well as opportunities available. Auditions, contracts, legal and tax responsibilities, media and press promotion, grants, professional management, apprenticeships. Maximum Credits: 2

MUSIC 516.course_description: MUSIC 516 - Performance Practice Forum  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Musical style, repertoire, presentation, and evaluation as embodied in a musical performance. Maximum Credits: 4

MUSIC 518.course_description: MUSIC 518 - Community Performance Practicum  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and two hours of activity.Practicum for performers, educators, administrators, researchers, or clinicians intending to develop and implement performing arts outreach programs in the community. Maximum Credits: 2

MUSIC 530.course_description: MUSIC 530 - Music Internship  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit  Two hours of activity per unit.Prerequisite(s): Upper division or graduate standing in a music degree program.Work with approved music professionals and agencies off-campus to include education, performance, production, and administration under the combined supervision of agency personnel and instructor. Maximum Credits: 6

MUSIC 541.course_description: MUSIC 541 - Performance Studies Pedagogy  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Teaching strategies for beginning and intermediate applied music. Survey and evaluation of teaching materials. Observation of individual or group lessons. Maximum Credits: 3Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

MUSIC 542.course_description: MUSIC 542 - Performance Studies Laboratory  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): MUSIC 541  with grade of C (2.0) or better.Practical experience in teaching of individual or group lessons. Maximum Credits: 2Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

MUSIC 543.course_description: MUSIC 543 - Diction II  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MUSIC 243 .Principles of pronunciation and enunciation. Application to song and opera in Spanish, German, and French. Maximum Credits: 1

MUSIC 554.course_description: MUSIC 554 - Music Literature  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MUSIC 205B  with a grade of C (2.0) or better.Study of music literature. Analysis of scores and recordings.  May be repeated with new course content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a bachelor’s and master’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

MUSIC 560.course_description: MUSIC 560 - Music and Visual Media  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and three hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): MUSIC 460 .Techniques and aesthetics of combining music/sounds and visual elements, including contemporary film scoring techniques, sound design for installations and performance art, video game scoring and experimental immersive 3-D virtual reality. Maximum Credits: 3

MUSIC 561.course_description: MUSIC 561 - Area Studies: Ethnomusicology  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MUSIC 305B  with a grade of C (2.0) or better.Music of a specific culture.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

MUSIC 562.course_description: MUSIC 562 - Psychology of Music  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MUSIC 305A or graduate standing.A study of the physiological, sensory, and organizational processes involved in the perception and cognition of musical sound and in music learning. Topics covered include musical acoustics, hearing physiology, sonic mental representation, sound localization, and auditory stream segregation.

MUSIC 565.course_description: MUSIC 565 - Techniques of Film Scoring  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): MUSIC 305B  and MUSIC 360 ; consent of instructor; or graduate standing. Required for Global Composition, B.M. majors. Maximum Credits: 2

MUSIC 566A.course_description: MUSIC 566A - Jazz Arranging and Composition  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MUSIC 305B  with a grade of C (2.0) or better.Analysis of jazz compositions and arrangements; arranging and composing for large and small jazz ensembles. Maximum Credits: 2

MUSIC 566B.course_description: MUSIC 566B - Jazz Arranging and Composition  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. Maximum Credits: 2

MUSIC 570.course_description: MUSIC 570 - Advanced Chamber Music  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Three hours.Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Study and public performance of established repertory as well as new compositions. Sections for string, woodwind, brass, piano, vocal, and mixed ensemble groups of three or more players.  May be repeated with new course content. Maximum Credits: four units. Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

MUSIC 571.course_description: MUSIC 571 - Experimental Music Ensemble  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two hours of activity.Ensemble exploring diverse, under-recognized elements of music-making. Performance, integrating historical and interdisciplinary study. Applied musical research through exploratory listening and musical practices. Collaborative group composition. Maximum Credits: 4

MUSIC 576.course_description: MUSIC 576 - Wind Symphony  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Five hours.Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Study and public performance of representative literature for the ensemble. Practical experience in rehearsal techniques. Maximum Credits: four units.

Maximum Credits: 4

MUSIC 584.course_description: MUSIC 584 - Opera Theatre  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Six or more hours per week.Prerequisite(s): By audition.Interpretation and characterization of light and grand opera. Specific work in coordination of opera ensemble. Maximum Credits: eight units of which six units are applicable to a master’s degree.Maximum Credit Statement: eight units of which six units are applicable to a master’s degree.

MUSIC 585.course_description: MUSIC 585 - Concert Choir  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. Maximum Credits: 9

MUSIC 591.course_name: Yoga and Mindfulness for the Musician
MUSIC 591.course_description: MUSIC 591 - Yoga and Mindfulness for the Musician  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Designed to assist musicians with stress management, performance anxiety, and self-regulation of practice routines. Throughout the semester, students will practice three different styles of yoga to assist with focus, concentration, and injury prevention.  May be repeated with consent of instructor.  Maximum Credits: 4Maximum Credit Statement: May be repeated up to four times with consent of instructor; maximum up to 4 units allowed for 291 and 591.Note: Open to BA/BM and MA/MM students in Music only.

MUSIC 595.course_description: MUSIC 595 - Stylistic Composition in Contemporary Media  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): MUSIC 305B  with a minimum grade of C (2.0) or better or graduate standing.Composing in a wide range of genres and styles of music found in film and other media. Required for and restricted to global composition undergraduates and master’s students in composition. Maximum Credits: 2

MUSIC 596.course_description: MUSIC 596 - Special Topics in Music  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC A specialized study of selected topics from the several areas of music.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units of 596 applicable to a bachelor’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

MUSIC 598.course_description: MUSIC 598 - Music Review: History, Analysis, and Aural Skills  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Admission to the graduate program.Review basic concepts of music theory, aural skills, and music history required for full candidacy in the graduate music program. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Not applicable to the master’s degree in music.

MUSIC 613.course_description: MUSIC 613 - Seminar in Music Theory  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. Maximum Credits: 9Maximum Credit Statement: nine units applicable to a master’s degree.

MUSIC 614.course_name: Seminar in Music Theory: Conceptual Analysis of the Jazz Idiom
MUSIC 614.course_description: MUSIC 614 - Seminar in Music Theory: Conceptual Analysis of the Jazz Idiom  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. MUSIC 641.course_description: MUSIC 641 - Piano Pedagogy: Adolescent to Adult  Units: 3   Two lectures and three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing.Study of music through the piano for adolescent to adult with analysis and application of appropriate teaching procedures and learning theories. Analysis of literature with corresponding techniques, musical skills, and creativity. Supervised teaching.

Maximum Credits: 3

The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): MUSIC 690 Professional music activities in academia. Prepare music graduate students for careers in higher education. Teaching and professional growth to include professional activities, ethics, professionalism, teaching practices, academic presentation, and publishing as related to discipline of music. Maximum Credits: 9

MUSIC 696.course_description: MUSIC 696 - Special Topics in Music  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing.Intensive study in specific areas of music.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

MUSIC 760.course_description: MUSIC 760 - Qualifying Recital  Units: 1 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Successful completion of one semester in the artist diploma advanced certificate program.Theoretical analysis and historical study of chosen scores. Recital program of at least 45 minutes in length before a graduate committee of music department faculty completed prior to second year of artist diploma advanced certificate program. Maximum Credits: 1

MUSIC 766.course_description: MUSIC 766 - Graduate Lecture Recital  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Advancement to candidacy. Consent of school director.For students in M.A. in Music, Plan B. A graduate presentation that may include elements of lecture and/or performance. Approximately one hour in length, the presentation is based upon a written document dealing with a musical problem in history, theory, pedagogy or ethno- musicology showing evidence of original research. Public presentation and an examination before a graduate committee of music faculty. Maximum Credits: 3

MUSIC 767.course_description: MUSIC 767 - Graduate Recital  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Advancement to candidacy. Consent of school director.Selection of literature for recital program of at least one hour in length; theoretical analysis and historical study of scores chosen; preparation and public performance; and examination before a graduate committee of music department faculty. Conductors must conduct a public performance. Maximum Credits: 3

MUSIC 798.course_description: MUSIC 798 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of staff; to be arranged with school director and instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

MUSIC 799A.course_description: MUSIC 799A - Thesis or Project  Units: 3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): An officially appointed thesis committee and advancement to candidacy.Preparation of a project or thesis for a master’s degree. Maximum Credits: 3

MUSIC 799B.course_description: MUSIC 799B - Thesis or Project Extension  Units: 0 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Prior registration in Thesis or Project 799A with an assigned grade symbol of RP.Registration required in any semester or term following assignment of RP in Course 799A in which the student expects to use the facilities and resources of the university; also student must be registered in the course when the completed thesis or project is granted final approval. Maximum Credits: 0

MUSIC 799C.course_description: MUSIC 799C - Comprehensive Examination Extension  Units: 0 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Completion or concurrent enrollment in degree program courses.Registration required of students whose only requirement is completion of the comprehensive examination for the master’s degree. Registration in 799C limited to two semesters. Maximum Credits: 0

N SCI 100.course_description: N SCI 100 - Physical Science  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Conceptual approach to major issues in physics and chemistry, including principles of motion and energy and structure and properties of matter. Effects of physical science and technology on individuals and human society. Maximum Credits: 3

N SCI 596.course_description: N SCI 596 - Special Topics in Natural Science  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Minimum 10 units of natural science.Selected topics in natural science for preservice and inservice elementary and secondary teachers and candidates for the M.A. in education.  May be repeated with consent of instructor. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units of 596 applicable to a bachelor’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

N SCI 798.course_description: N SCI 798 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of staff; to be arranged with coordinator and instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

NAV S 101.course_description: NAV S 101 - Introduction to Naval Science  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and two hours of activity.Structure, principles, and practices; lines of command and control; logistical organizations; functions and services of major components of the Navy and Marine Corps; shipboard organization; ethics and basic leadership skills. Maximum Credits: 3

NAV S 102.course_description: NAV S 102 - Naval Engineering  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Ship characteristics and types including hull, electrical, auxiliary systems, stability and damage control. Operation advantages and disadvantages of steam, gas turbine, and diesel propulsion engines receive in-depth study. Leadership topics in an engineering setting. Maximum Credits: 3

NAV S 201A.course_description: NAV S 201A - Naval Leadership and Management I  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): NAV S 101  and NAV S 102 .Ethics and integrity, progressing through management theory and practical functions of management, culminating with module on leadership. Exposure to complex ethical, managerial, and leadership issues. Maximum Credits: 3

NAV S 202.course_description: NAV S 202 - Sea Power and Maritime Affairs  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Sea power and maritime affairs; general concept of sea power including Merchant Marine; role of naval warfare components used to support the Navy’s mission; sea power as an instrument of national policy; comparative study of US and Soviet strategies. Maximum Credits: 3

NAV S 301.course_description: NAV S 301 - Navigation  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Piloting, navigation, maneuvering, rules of nautical road. Use of charts, visual and electronic aids, operation of magnetic and gyro compasses, relative motion vector analysis, formation tactics, and ship employment. Tides, currents, wind, weather, navigation instruments, and characteristics of electronic navigation. Maximum Credits: 3

NAV S 302.course_description: NAV S 302 - Naval Operations  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): NAV S 301 .Naval operations and operations analysis, ship handling, and afloat communications. Case analyses stress practical application of skills. Leadership traits in themes of communication counseling and conflict resolution applicable to naval operations. Maximum Credits: 3

NAV S 310.course_description: NAV S 310 - Evolution of Strategic Operations  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Forms of warfare through history to formulate sense of historical continuity in evolution of warfare, to develop a basic sense of strategy and alternative military actions, and to explore impact of historical precedent on military thought and actions. Maximum Credits: 3

NAV S 401A.course_description: NAV S 401A - Naval Weapons  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): NAV S 302 .Develop working foundation and understanding of diversity and complexity of Navy and Marine Corps weapons systems including target detection and tracking, radar, sonar, electronic warfare systems, weapons warheads, fuzing, propulsion, guidance, launching, and fire control systems. Maximum Credits: 3

NAV S 402.course_description: NAV S 402 - Naval Leadership and Ethics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): NAV S 201A .Naval leadership and management with emphasis on military justice administration, naval personnel management, material management, and administration of discipline. Maximum Credits: 3

NAV S 412.course_description: NAV S 412 - Fundamentals of Maneuver Warfare  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Current military developments, modern tactical principles, and warfare. Historical influences on operational, strategic, and tactical levels of maneuver warfare practices in current and future operating environments.Formerly numbered Naval Science 410. Maximum Credits: 3

NURS 202.course_description: NURS 202 - Client Assessment  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  One-and-one-half hours of lecture and 4.5 hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): Admission to nursing program and concurrent registration in NURS 206 .Determining and measuring variables relevant to assessment of psychosocial and physical functioning. Maximum Credits: 3

NURS 206.course_description: NURS 206 - Fundamentals of Nursing Practice  Units: 5 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Three lectures and six hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): Admission to nursing program and concurrent registration in NURS 202 .Basic nursing skills and integration of diagnosis, planning, and implementation of nursing care. Application of nursing process. Maximum Credits: 5

NURS 208.course_description: NURS 208 - Pathophysiology  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): BIOL 212  and credit or concurrent registration in BIOL 261 .Pathophysiologic processes as they apply to nursing care of patients. Maximum Credits: 3

NURS 219.course_description: NURS 219 - Information Management for Professional Relationships  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to the School of Nursing.Information management in patient care, research, evidence-based practice, outcomes and practice management. Patient/family-provider communication, privacy, security, and ethical decision making on patient care, research, and quality management. Maximum Credits: 2

NURS 221.course_description: NURS 221 - Professional Formation A  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC History of health care and changing roles of nurses in relation to other health professions. Social, cultural, regulatory agencies, and policy affecting patient care. Maximum Credits: 1

NURS 253.course_description: NURS 253 - Stress and Human Health  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Impacts and potential sources of stress. Methods to manage, prevent, and relieve stress. Relationships between stress and disease. Maximum Credits: 3

NURS 296.course_description: NURS 296 - Experimental Topics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Selected topics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

NURS 300.course_name: Nursing Care of the Acute and Chronically Ill Adult and Gerontologic Patient I
NURS 300.course_description: NURS 300 - Nursing Care of the Acute and Chronically Ill Adult and Gerontologic Patient I  Units: 8 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Three lectures and 15 hours clinical per week.Prerequisite(s): NURS 206 , NURS 208 , and credit or concurrent registration in NURS 304 .Psychological, social, and physiologic stressors affecting acute and chronic illness and health of adults. Appropriate nursing care and interventions. Maximum Credits: 8Note: Not open to students with credit in Nursing 252.

NURS 304.course_description: NURS 304 - Clinical Pharmacology in Nursing Practice  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): BIOL 212 , CHEM 102 , and credit or concurrent registration in BIOL 261 .Major classifications of drugs; pharmacological and toxicological activity; clinical applications. Role of nurse in assessment, intervention, and patient education. Maximum Credits: 2

NURS 307W.course_name: Research, Evidence Based Practice, and Writing for Nurses
NURS 307W.course_description: NURS 307W - Research, Evidence Based Practice, and Writing for Nurses  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Mathematics/Quantitative Reasoning General Education.Development of critical reading and writing skills by exploring how research and evidence-based practice contributes to quality and meaning in nursing knowledge development and practice. Composition of presentations and writing for a range of nursing audiences, purposes, and settings.  Note: Not open to students with credit in NURS 307.

NURS 312.course_description: NURS 312 - Concepts in Professional Nursing  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to the RN to BS program.Concepts in professional nursing. Differentiation of professional practice with emphasis on stress theory, therapeutic communication, values clarification, and legal aspects. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Not open to generic students.

NURS 316.course_description: NURS 316 - Psychiatric-Mental Health Nursing  Units: 5 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Three lectures and six hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): Admission to the School of Nursing.Theory and clinical laboratory in application of nursing process to care of clients evidencing maladaptive responses to psychosocial stressors. Presentation of theories describing and explaining maladaptive behaviors and application of nursing interventions in a variety of treatment modalities.Formerly numbered Nursing 416. Maximum Credits: 5

NURS 320.course_name: Health Assessment and Health Promotion for RN to BS
