NURS 320.course_description: NURS 320 - Health Assessment and Health Promotion for RN to BS  Units: 4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and six hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): Admission to the RN to BS program.Expands the registered nurse’s ability to measure and interpret physical, physiologic, and psychosocial functioning. Clinical presentation of disease and disability. Evidence-based practice guidelines for health promotion and disease management. Maximum Credits: 4Note: Not open to students with credit in NURS 501  and NURS 501L .

NURS 321.course_description: NURS 321 - Professional Formation B  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): NURS 221 .Virtue ethics, California Nurse Practice Act, and American Nurses Association Code of Ethics. Societal expectations, obligations, professional requirements, legal decisions, and clinical realities. Maximum Credits: 1

NURS 350.course_description: NURS 350 - Women’s Health Across the Lifespan  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Explores health issues women face across their lives. Focus on developing knowledgeable users of research on causes of and risk factors for health problems. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Not applicable to nursing majors.

NURS 351.course_description: NURS 351 - Exploring Healthcare in America  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Evolution of federal and state programs and private insurance. Roles of consumer decision-making, corporate influence, and lobbying on health service use. Ethical and social imperatives. Maximum Credits: 3

NURS 354.course_name: Nursing Care of the Childbearing Family
NURS 354.course_description: NURS 354 - Nursing Care of the Childbearing Family  Units: 5 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two-and-one-half hours of lecture and 7.5 hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): NURS 206 , NURS 208 , and NURS 304 .Family-centered focus encompassing adaptive and maladaptive responses to stressors in the maternity cycle and their effect on the neonate. Clinical laboratory focuses on the application of nursing theory and process in providing preventive, supportive, and restorative care to mothers and neonates. Maximum Credits: 5

NURS 356.course_description: NURS 356 - Pediatric Nursing  Units: 5 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two-and-one-half hours of lecture and 7.5 hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): NURS 206 , NURS 208 , and NURS 304 .Stressors affecting the child on health-illness continuum. Nursing theory and laboratory focuses on application of nursing process in providing preventive, supportive and restorative therapeutic modalities in a variety of settings. Emphasis on the child in the family and the necessary intervention to promote adaptation of the child to attain, maintain or regain an optimum level of health. Maximum Credits: 5

NURS 397.course_description: NURS 397 - Preparation for Clinical Practice  Units: 1 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit  Two hours per week of supervised practice.Prerequisite(s): Admission to the School of Nursing.Supervised practice of nursing skills and techniques. Course is elective for students. Credit earned in this course not applicable to bachelor’s degree.

NURS 400.course_name: Nursing Care of the Acute and Chronically Ill Adult and Gerontologic Patient II
NURS 400.course_description: NURS 400 - Nursing Care of the Acute and Chronically Ill Adult and Gerontologic Patient II  Units: 3.5 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): NURS 300  and concurrent registration in NURS 400L .Theory in care of adults of all ages who have acute and chronic health concerns leading to complex and high acuity health problems. Maximum Credits: 3.5Note: Not open to students with credit in Nursing 452 or 454.

NURS 400L.course_name: Nursing Care of the Acute and Chronically Ill Adult and Gerontologic Patient II Laboratory
NURS 400L.course_description: NURS 400L - Nursing Care of the Acute and Chronically Ill Adult and Gerontologic Patient II Laboratory  Units: 2.5 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Nine hours of clinical practice.Prerequisite(s): NURS 300  and concurrent registration in NURS 400 .Clinical care of adults of all ages who have acute and chronic health concerns leading to complex and high acuity health problems. Maximum Credits: 2.5Note: Not open to students with credit in Nursing 452 or 454.

NURS 410.course_description: NURS 410 - Gerontological Nursing  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): NURS 300 , NURS 304 .Theory and selected laboratory experience focusing on stressors affecting elderly on health-illness continuum. Gerontologic nursing in a variety of settings. Maximum Credits: 3

NURS 415.course_description: NURS 415 - Community Health Nursing  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): NURS 300 , NURS 304 , and concurrent registration in NURS 415L .Assessment and utilization of community health care concepts and delivery with emphasis on promotion of health, prevention of illness and individual and group teaching techniques. Consideration given to cultural aspects of health care. Maximum Credits: 3

NURS 415L.course_description: NURS 415L - Community Health Nursing Laboratory  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Six hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): NURS 300 , NURS 304 , and concurrent registration in NURS 415 .Laboratory experience in care of clients in the community and nursing of community as client. Maximum Credits: 2

NURS 421.course_description: NURS 421 - Professional Formation C  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): NURS 321 .Current and emerging roles in nursing leadership. Practice environments, expectations of society in these environments, role of health policy and advocacy in leadership, methods to remain current in professional practice. Maximum Credits: 1

NURS 437.course_name: Care Management of People with Complex Health Needs
NURS 437.course_description: NURS 437 - Care Management of People with Complex Health Needs  Units: 6 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Three-and-one-half hours of lecture and five hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): NURS 307 , NURS 312 , NURS 320  with a grade of C (2.0) or better in each course. Admission to the RN to BS program.Theory and clinical practice in the care management of people of all ages who have complex health concerns that require coordination of care across disciplines and transitions between care settings. Maximum Credits: 6

NURS 458.course_description: NURS 458 - Nursing Management and Leadership  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): NURS 316 , NURS 415 , NURS 415L ; concurrent registration in NURS 458L .Theories and functions of nursing management and leadership within health care system. Economics of health care. Maximum Credits: 3

NURS 458L.course_description: NURS 458L - Nursing Management and Leadership Laboratory  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Six hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): Concurrent registration in NURS 458 .Laboratory experience in nursing management and leadership. Maximum Credits: 2

NURS 496.course_description: NURS 496 - Experimental Topics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Selected topics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

NURS 498.course_description: NURS 498 - Cooperative Education Supervised Practice  Units: 2-6 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit  Seminar: Two hours biweekly. Clinical hours arranged by student and employer.Prerequisite(s): NURS 300 .Supervised practice in application of previously learned knowledge and skills in selected clinical agencies. Professional interaction with other health care workers to strengthen professional nursing identity. Work under supervision of registered nurse preceptor and faculty coordinator.  May be repeated. Maximum Credits: six units.

NURS 499.course_description: NURS 499 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): NURS 300  and consent of instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: six units.

NURS 501.course_description: NURS 501 - Advanced Health Assessment  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of School of Nursing graduate adviser; concurrent registration in NURS 501L .Expands knowledge and skills in physical and psychosocial assessment, differentiation of normal and pathological findings, and health promotion strategies for adult and geriatric populations. Maximum Credits: 3

NURS 501L.course_description: NURS 501L - Advanced Health Assessment Laboratory  Units: 1-2 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  Six hours of laboratory per week. Prerequisite(s): Consent of School of Nursing graduate adviser; concurrent registration in NURS 501 . Laboratory experience in advanced health assessment.

NURS 596.course_description: NURS 596 - Special Topics in Nursing  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Completion of 30 upper division units in nursing or graduate status; 3.0 grade point average.Selected topics in the practice of nursing.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units of 596 applicable to a bachelor’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

NURS 601.course_name: Assessment and Health Promotion of Children and Adolescents
NURS 601.course_description: NURS 601 - Assessment and Health Promotion of Children and Adolescents  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): Admission to the master’s degree program in nursing or school nurse services credential.Assessing physical, emotional, psychosocial and mental health of children and adolescents from birth to 19 years in hospital and community settings. Strategies for individual and group assessment. Age-appropriate interview techniques. Health promotion modalities. Maximum Credits: 3

NURS 604.course_name: Theoretical and Research Basis of Advanced Nursing Practice
NURS 604.course_description: NURS 604 - Theoretical and Research Basis of Advanced Nursing Practice  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Integration, evaluation, and use of theory and quantitative & qualitative research analysis, design, ethics, and measurement are covered. Development of scholarly skills for healthcare research and application for practice. Maximum Credits: 3

NURS 608.course_description: NURS 608 - Issues and Policies in Healthcare  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Explores evolving health care issues and policies through analysis of ethical and political perspectives. The responsibility of healthcare professionals as advocates for patients, populations, and self. Maximum Credits: 3

NURS 610.course_name: Advanced Pathophysiology in Adult and Geriatric Populations
NURS 610.course_description: NURS 610 - Advanced Pathophysiology in Adult and Geriatric Populations  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of graduate adviser.Concepts of advanced physiologic alterations associated with acute and chronic illnesses in the adult and geriatric populations as a basis for disease prevention, illness, and management. Maximum Credits: 3

NURS 620.course_description: NURS 620 - Foundations of Nursing Leadership  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Leadership concepts and theories with a focus on change, communication, innovation and building collaborative relationships across nursing and organizational systems. The development of self for professional leadership roles. Maximum Credits: 3

NURS 622.course_name: Process Improvement and Evidence Based Practice in Healthcare
NURS 622.course_description: NURS 622 - Process Improvement and Evidence Based Practice in Healthcare  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Theory, methods, and tools of process improvement and evidence-based practice within healthcare organizations. Accreditation standards, professional standards, and organizational assessment programs are applied to healthcare settings. Performance  excellence within systems thinking. Maximum Credits: 3

NURS 624.course_description: NURS 624 - Healthcare Systems and Personnel Management  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Concepts, strategies, and tactics related to personnel issues in healthcare organizations, including recruiting, hiring, orienting, retaining, evaluating, coaching, counseling, and terminating employees. The development of relationships and trust across the healthcare system. Maximum Credits: 3

NURS 631.course_description: NURS 631 - Community Health Nursing Practicum  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  Nine hours per week.Experience working with individuals and families of a selected community group applying theoretical knowledge within framework of nursing process. Maximum Credits: 3

NURS 636.course_name: Women’s Health Assessment and Management I
NURS 636.course_description: NURS 636 - Women’s Health Assessment and Management I  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): NURS 501L , NURS 501 , NURS 610 , NURS 658 . Concurrent registration in NURS 637 .Comprehensive assessment and management of ambulatory care for women throughout childbearing cycle. Pregnancy, prenatal care, fetal physiology, and development. Maximum Credits: 3

NURS 637.course_description: NURS 637 - Women’s Health/Nurse-Midwifery Clinical Practicum I  Units: 2-6 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  Six to 18 hours per week in consultation with adviser.Prerequisite(s): Concurrent registration in NURS 636 .Laboratory and clinical experiences providing obstetrical, gynecological, primary, and well woman care throughout lifespan. Maximum Credits: 6

NURS 638.course_description: NURS 638 - Nurse-Midwifery Intrapartum/Newborn Assessment and Management  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): NURS 636  and NURS 637 .Assessment and management of women with emphasis on labor and birth, postpartum, and normal newborn. Maximum Credits: 3

NURS 639.course_description: NURS 639 - Women’s Health/Nurse-Midwifery Clinical Practicum II  Units: 4 or 6 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  Twelve to 18 hours per week in consultation with adviser.Prerequisite(s): Concurrent registration in NURS 638 .Clinical experiences in one or more of the following settings: gynecological, well women/family planning, primary care, obstetrics/prenatal, intrapartum, post-partum, and newborn care. Maximum Credits: 6

NURS 654.course_name: Advanced Practice Nursing for Adult and Geriatric Populations: Nurse Practitioner Primary Care I
NURS 654.course_description: NURS 654 - Advanced Practice Nursing for Adult and Geriatric Populations: Nurse Practitioner Primary Care I  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): NURS 501 , NURS 501L , NURS 610 , NURS 658 , NURS 684 . Credit or concurrent registration in NURS 655A .Primary care management of adult and geriatric populations. The role of the nurse practitioner in health promotion. Prevention and treatment of acute and chronic illness in primary care and specialized settings. Maximum Credits: 3

NURS 655A.course_name: Advanced Practice Nursing for Adult and Geriatric Populations: Primary Care Practicum I
NURS 655A.course_description: NURS 655A - Advanced Practice Nursing for Adult and Geriatric Populations: Primary Care Practicum I  Units: 3-6 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  Eighteen hours of clinical practice per week. Prerequisite(s): NURS 501 , NURS 501L , NURS 604 , NURS 608 , NURS 610 , NURS 622 , NURS 658 ; concurrent registration in NURS 654 .Supervised clinical experiences in diverse clinical settings providing primary and specialized care to adults and geriatric populations with an interprofessional team.Formerly numbered NURS 655.

NURS 655B.course_name: Advanced Practice Nursing for Adult and Geriatric Populations: Primary Care Practicum I
NURS 655B.course_description: NURS 655B - Advanced Practice Nursing for Adult and Geriatric Populations: Primary Care Practicum I  Units: 5 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  Fifteen hours of clinical practice per week.Prerequisite(s): NURS 654 , NURS 655A .Supervised clinical experiences in diverse clinical settings providing primary and specialized care to adult and geriatric populations with an interprofessional team.

NURS 656.course_name: Advanced Practice Nursing for Adult and Geriatric Populations: Nurse Practitioner Primary Care II
NURS 656.course_description: NURS 656 - Advanced Practice Nursing for Adult and Geriatric Populations: Nurse Practitioner Primary Care II  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): NURS 654  and NURS 655A . Concurrent registration in NURS 657 .Advanced role development for the Nurse Practitioner in primary care health promotion and management of acute and chronic illness. The integration of clinical expertise in managing comprehensive health of adult and geriatric populations. Maximum Credits: 3

NURS 657.course_name: Advanced Practice Nursing for Adult and Geriatric Populations: Primary Care Practicum II
NURS 657.course_description: NURS 657 - Advanced Practice Nursing for Adult and Geriatric Populations: Primary Care Practicum II  Units: 6 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  Eighteen hours of laboratory per week.Prerequisite(s): NURS 654  and NURS 655A . Concurrent registration in NURS 656 .Supervised advanced clinical experiences in the nurse practitioner role within a diverse clinical setting providing primary and specialized care to adults and geriatric populations with an interprofessional team. Maximum Credits: 6

NURS 658.course_name: Clinical Pharmacology for Advanced Practice Nursing
NURS 658.course_description: NURS 658 - Clinical Pharmacology for Advanced Practice Nursing  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of graduate adviser.Knowledge and skills in pharmacology for advanced practice nursing in clinical settings. Emphasis on factors affecting drug therapy, including selection. Parameters for monitoring drug effectiveness. Rationale for continuing, modifying or discontinuing pharmacologic therapy. Maximum Credits: 3

NURS 670.course_description: NURS 670 - School Nursing Management Practices  Units: 3  Prerequisite(s): Admission to master’s degree program in nursing or health services credential.Management of school health services program; designed for school nurse with emphasis on professional and organizational systems.

NURS 672.course_name: Primary Health Care of the School Aged Child
NURS 672.course_description: NURS 672 - Primary Health Care of the School Aged Child  Units: 3  Prerequisite(s): NURS 501  and NURS 501L .Primary health care of the child and adolescent with emphasis on common health problems, chronic illness, drugs, behavioral problems, and the battered child.

NURS 674.course_description: NURS 674 - Health Education for School Nurses  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): NURS 501  and NURS 501L .Prepares school nurse to be an active participant in school health education with emphasis on planning and presentation of health instructional material focused on disease prevention and health promotion. Maximum Credits: 3

NURS 684.course_name: Clinical Information Systems for Healthcare Practice
NURS 684.course_description: NURS 684 - Clinical Information Systems for Healthcare Practice  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Clinical information systems and information management theory and tools within healthcare organizations. The role of clinicians in a digitized healthcare environment. Maximum Credits: 3

NURS 696.course_name: Seminar in Selected Topics in Nursing
NURS 696.course_description: NURS 696 - Seminar in Selected Topics in Nursing  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Intensive study in specific areas of nursing.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 12Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

NURS 724.course_description: NURS 724 - Healthcare Leadership Practicum  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  Nine hours of laboratory.Observation and guided administrative experience specific to the role and function of the healthcare leader. The application of leadership concepts and principles within the contexts of healthcare. Maximum Credits: 3

NURS 725.course_description: NURS 725 - Healthcare Finance  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Healthcare budget planning, economics, financial analysis, and management skills in the current healthcare systems. The development of business analytical skills. Maximum Credits: 3

NURS 726.course_description: NURS 726 - Advanced Healthcare Leadership Practicum  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  Nine hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): NURS 724 .Advanced observation and guided administrative experience specific to the role and function of the healthcare leader. The application of advanced leadership principles and concepts within the contexts of healthcare. Maximum Credits: 3

NURS 741.course_description: NURS 741 - Integrated Women’s Health/Nurse-Midwifery Clinical Practicum  Units: 2-6 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): NURS 637  and NURS 638 .Supervised laboratory and clinical experiences (off campus) providing obstetrical, intrapartum, newborn, gynecological, primary and well women care for adolescent and adult women throughout the lifespan in diverse clinical settings. Maximum Credits: 6

NURS 744.course_name: Women’s Health/Nurse-Midwifery Assessment and Management III
NURS 744.course_description: NURS 744 - Women’s Health/Nurse-Midwifery Assessment and Management III  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): NURS 638 . Concurrent registration in NURS 745 .Theoretical concepts and principles applied to management of pathophysiological and psychological issues in women’s healthcare. Contemporary issues in well women, gynecological, and primary care. Maximum Credits: 3

NURS 745.course_description: NURS 745 - Women’s Health/Nurse-Midwifery Clinical Practicum III  Units: 4-6 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  Twelve to 18 hours per week in consultation with adviser.Prerequisite(s): Concurrent registration in NURS 744 .Clinical experiences in one or more of the following settings: gynecological, well women/family planning, primary care, obstetrics/prenatal, intrapartum, post-partum, and newborn care. Maximum Credits: 6

NURS 751A.course_name: Clinical Nurse Specialist for Adult and Geriatric Populations in Acute and Critical Care- Patient Sphere
NURS 751A.course_description: NURS 751A - Clinical Nurse Specialist for Adult and Geriatric Populations in Acute and Critical Care- Patient Sphere  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): NURS 501 , NURS 501L , NURS 604 , NURS 608 , NURS 610 , NURS 622 , NURS 658 , NURS 684 . Concurrent enrollment in NURS 753A .Advanced practice nursing role as a Clinical Nurse Specialist (CNS) in the acute/critical care settings. Impact of CNS practice with emphasis on research-based interventions, expanding technology on direct patient outcomes within the patient sphere of the CNS role.Formerly numbered NURS 751.

NURS 751B.course_name: Clinical Nurse Specialist for Adult and Geriatric Populations in Acute and Critical Care - Nurse and Organization Sphere
NURS 751B.course_description: NURS 751B - Clinical Nurse Specialist for Adult and Geriatric Populations in Acute and Critical Care - Nurse and Organization Sphere  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR - Letter (No Cr/NC): Only letter grades may be assigned; students cannot elect Cr/NC. Standard mode for graduate courses. Prerequisite(s): NURS 751A  and NURS 753A .  Concurrent enrollment in NURS 753B .Advanced practice nursing role as a Clinical Nurse Specialist (CNS) in acute/critical care settings. Impact of CNS practice with emphasis on research-based interventions, expanding technology on direct patient outcomes within the patient sphere of the CNS role.

NURS 753A.course_name: Clinical Nurse Specialist for Adult and Geriatric Populations in Acute and Critical Care Practicum I
NURS 753A.course_description: NURS 753A - Clinical Nurse Specialist for Adult and Geriatric Populations in Acute and Critical Care Practicum I  Units: 3-6 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  Eighteen hours of clinical practice per week. Prerequisite(s): NURS 501 , NURS 501L , NURS 604 , NURS 608 , NURS 610 , NURS 622 , NURS 658 , NURS 684 . Concurrent enrollment in NURS 751A .Supervised clinical practicum focused on the advanced practice nursing role as an Adult-Gerontology Clinical Nurse Specialist (CNS) in acute/critical care settings. Impact of the CNS on patient outcomes within the three spheres of CNS practice: Patient, Nurse and Organization.Formerly numbered NURS 753.

NURS 753B.course_name: Clinical Nurse Specialist for Adult and Geriatric Populations in Acute and Critical Care Practicum II
NURS 753B.course_description: NURS 753B - Clinical Nurse Specialist for Adult and Geriatric Populations in Acute and Critical Care Practicum II  Units: 6 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): NURS 751A, NURS 753A. Concurrent enrollment in NURS 751B.Clinical experiences in the advanced practice nursing role developing independent/collaborative practice as an Adult-Gerontology Clinical Nurse Specialist (CNS). Impact of the CNS on patient outcomes within the CNS practice: Patient, Nurse and Organization.

NURS 797.course_description: NURS 797 - Research  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Advancement to candidacy.Independent research in a specialized subject. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

NURS 798.course_description: NURS 798 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor. Independent study.  Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree. For students using Plan B, Comprehensive Examination is limited to three units.

NURS 799A.course_description: NURS 799A - Thesis  Units: 3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): An officially appointed thesis committee and advancement to candidacy.Preparation of a project or thesis for the master’s degree. Maximum Credits: 3

NURS 799B.course_description: NURS 799B - Thesis Extension  Units: 0 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Prior registration in Thesis 799A with an assigned grade symbol of RP.Registration required in any semester or term following assignment of RP in Course 799A, in which the student expects to use the facilities and resources of the university; also student must be registered in the course when the completed thesis is granted final approval. Maximum Credits: 0

NURS 799C.course_description: NURS 799C - Comprehensive Examination Extension  Units: 0 Grading Method: Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Completion or concurrent enrollment in degree program courses.Registration required of students whose only requirement is completion of the comprehensive examination for the master’s degree. Registration in 799C limited to two semesters.

NUTR 200.course_name: Foods and Nutrition: Overview and Opportunities
NUTR 200.course_description: NUTR 200 - Foods and Nutrition: Overview and Opportunities  Units: 1 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Curriculum, research, and practice areas in foods and nutrition.

NUTR 201.course_description: NUTR 201 - Fundamentals of Nutrition  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): BIOL 100 ; CHEM 100  or CHEM 200 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Role of nutrition in health promotion and disease prevention. Current concepts, controversies, and dietary recommendations from a scientific perspective. Maximum Credits: 3

NUTR 203.course_name: Cultural Aspects of Food and Nutrition
NUTR 203.course_description: NUTR 203 - Cultural Aspects of Food and Nutrition  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Completion of a General Education course in 1) Oral Communication, 2) Written Communication, or 3) Critical Thinking.Food habits and health beliefs about foods and nutrition. Regional and ethnic influences. Maximum Credits: 2

NUTR 205.course_description: NUTR 205 - Introduction to Science of Food  Units: 4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and six hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): Grade of C (2.0) or better in Chemistry 100. Credit or concurrent registration in Chemistry 130.Composition, preparation, preservation, sensory and consumer evaluation of foods. Maximum Credits: 4

NUTR 296.course_description: NUTR 296 - Experimental Topics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Selected topics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

NUTR 302.course_description: NUTR 302 - Advanced Nutrition  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): NUTR 201 ,BIOL 336 , and one course in biochemistry. Concurrent registration in NUTR 302L . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Integration of cellular, physiological, and biochemical relationships with human nutrient requirements. Maximum Credits: 3

NUTR 302L.course_description: NUTR 302L - Advanced Nutrition Laboratory  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Six hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): NUTR 201 , BIOL 336 , and one course in biochemistry. Concurrent registration in NUTR 302 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Application and evaluation of techniques used to assess nutritional status, including basic methods, experimental animal and human studies. Maximum Credits: 2

NUTR 303.course_description: NUTR 303 - Quantity Food Production  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): NUTR 205  or B A 360 .Quantity food production service delivery systems. Skills for food safety, recipe standardization, menu planning, purchasing, production operations, and quality standards. Intended for majors in foods and nutrition and hospitality and tourism management. Maximum Credits: 2

NUTR 304.course_description: NUTR 304 - Nutrition Throughout the Life Span  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): NUTR 201 .Factors affecting nutrient needs and ways to meet nutrient requirements across the life span. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Not open to students with credit in Nutrition 208.

NUTR 313.course_description: NUTR 313 - Contemporary Nutrition  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Food and nutrient classifications, functions, requirements, and recommendations. Relationship of nutrition to health, fitness, performance, and disease. Menus and recipes, food packaging labels, nutrition literature. Maximum Credits: 3

NUTR 398.course_description: NUTR 398 - Supervised Field Experience  Units: 1-3   Three hours per week for 15 weeks per unit of course credit.Prerequisite(s): Upper division standing; limited to foods and nutrition majors.Supervised practical experience in areas of food and nutrition. Maximum Credits: 6

NUTR 401.course_description: NUTR 401 - Advanced Science of Food  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): NUTR 205  and BIOL 211 , BIOL 211L . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Physical, chemical, nutritional, and functional properties and quality attributes of foods and food additives; food handling, changes and interactions of food components induced by processing and storage; food laws, regulations, legislation, and food safety issues.Formerly numbered Nutrition 301. Maximum Credits: 3

NUTR 404.course_description: NUTR 404 - Food Systems Management  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): NUTR 303 .Managerial functions in food service systems. Maximum Credits: 3

NUTR 405.course_name: Experimental Food Science and Technology Laboratory
NUTR 405.course_description: NUTR 405 - Experimental Food Science and Technology Laboratory  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Six hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): Credit or concurrent registration in NUTR 401 .Application of principles and methods of physical and sensory evaluation and food component analysis to conventional and fabricated foods; effects of additives and ingredient variations; project studies; data interpretation and report writing. Maximum Credits: 2

NUTR 406.course_description: NUTR 406 - Medical Nutrition Therapy I  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): NUTR 302  and NUTR 302L . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Nutrition assessment, diagnosis, pathophysiology, and medical nutrition therapy for chronic diseases. Maximum Credits: 3

NUTR 407.course_description: NUTR 407 - Medical Nutrition Therapy I Laboratory  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): Admission to SDSU Didactic Program in Dietetics, NUTR 302 , NUTR 302L , and concurrent registration in NUTR 406 .Required for Didactic Program in Dietetics competencies established by the Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics. Builds multi-level skills for dietetic practice to assess nutritional status and to develop care plans for patients. Maximum Credits: 1

NUTR 408.course_description: NUTR 408 - Medical Nutrition Therapy II  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): NUTR 406 .Concepts and principles of disease pathophysiology, nutrition assessment and medical nutrition therapy for specific diseases and conditions. Maximum Credits: 3

NUTR 409.course_description: NUTR 409 - Medical Nutrition Therapy II Laboratory  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): Admission to SDSU Didactic Program in Dietetics, NUTR 406  and credit or concurrent registration in NUTR 408 .Advanced practical experience in food service and medical nutrition therapy for future dietitians. Maximum Credits: 1

NUTR 496.course_description: NUTR 496 - Experimental Topics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Selected topics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

NUTR 499.course_description: NUTR 499 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6

NUTR 510.course_description:
NUTR 510 - Community Nutrition  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures.Prerequisite(s): A grade of C (2.0) or better in NUTR 203  , NUTR 302  , NUTR 302L  , NUTR 304 .
 Nutritional problems in the community with consideration of their resolution. Maximum Credits: 2

NUTR 511.course_description: NUTR 511 - Nutrition Education and Counseling  Units: 1 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  Three hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): A grade of C (2.0) or better in NUTR 203 , NUTR 302 , NUTR 302L , NUTR 304 .Nutrition education and counseling. Maximum Credits: 1

NUTR 512.course_description: NUTR 512 - Nutrition for Athletes  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): NUTR 201  or admission to the M.S. in Athletic Training program.Influence of exercise on nutritional status and dietary requirements. Current theories and practices related to nutrition and athletic performance.Formerly numbered Nutrition 312. Maximum Credits: 3

NUTR 596.course_description: NUTR 596 - Advanced Studies in Nutrition  Units: 1-6 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Nine upper division units in nutrition.Advanced study of selected topics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: nine units of 596.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree. No more than six units of 596 may be applied to a bachelor’s degree. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

NUTR 600.course_description: NUTR 600 - Seminar: Foods and Nutrition  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Nutrition 301, NUTR 302 , and NUTR 302L .Introductory seminar of research and research publications in foods and nutrition. Maximum Credits: 3

NUTR 607.course_description: NUTR 607 - Child Nutrition  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): NUTR 302  and NUTR 302L .Nutrition, health, and biochemical growth in children. Conditions leading to malnutrition, prevention, and correction. Maximum Credits: 3

NUTR 608.course_description: NUTR 608 - Geriatric Nutrition  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): NUTR 302  and NUTR 302L .Biomedical and psychosocial aspects of aging that affect food habits, nutritional status, and nutrient needs of elders. Maximum Credits: 3

NUTR 610.course_description: NUTR 610 - Nutrition and Energy  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): NUTR 302  and NUTR 302L .Methods for measurement of energy intake and expenditure assessment, factors which control food intake and energy expenditure, and examination of normal and specialized needs of energy requirements. Maximum Credits: 3

NUTR 700.course_description: NUTR 700 - Seminar in Nutrition  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): NUTR 302  and NUTR 302L .Reading and analyses of basic and applied research in nutrition. Maximum Credits: 3

NUTR 798.course_description: NUTR 798 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of staff; to be arranged with the instructor and approval of graduate program adviser. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

NUTR 799A.course_description: NUTR 799A - Thesis  Units: 3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): An officially appointed thesis committee and advancement to candidacy.Preparation of a thesis for the master’s degree. Maximum Credits: 3

NUTR 799B.course_description: NUTR 799B - Thesis Extension  Units: 0 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Prior registration in Thesis 799A with an assigned grade symbol of RP.Registration required in any semester or term following assignment of RP in NUTR 799A  in which the student expects to use the facilities and resources of the university; also, student must be registered in the course when the completed thesis is granted final approval. Maximum Credits: 0

NUTR 799C.course_description: NUTR 799C - Comprehensive Examination Extension  Units: 0 Grading Method: Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Completion or concurrent enrollment in degree program courses.Registration required of students whose only requirement is completion of the comprehensive examination for the master’s degree. Registration in 799C limited to two semesters.

OCEAN 100.course_description: OCEAN 100 - The Ocean Planet  Units: 4 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Three lectures and three hours of laboratory.Physical, chemical, geological, and biological foundations of the global ocean system, with emphasis on science as a process and its role in environmental issues from global climate change to local pollution. Maximum Credits: 4

OCEAN 320.course_description: OCEAN 320 - Oceans of Change  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): One introductory college course in a life science and one in a physical science.Scientific, socioeconomic, and geopolitical perspectives on human impacts upon the global ocean system to include ocean warming and acidification, regional fisheries depletion, and local coastal issues. Maximum Credits: 3

OCEAN 496.course_description: OCEAN 496 - Experimental Topics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Selected topics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

PERS 101.course_description: PERS 101 - Elementary Modern Persian I  Units: 4 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Introduction to modern Persian and Persian writing system. Development of speaking, listening, and reading skills using multimedia materials. Vocabulary for everyday topics and develop culturally appropriate discourse strategies for everyday situations. Maximum Credits: 4Note: Not open to students with credit in PERS 102 , PERS 201 , PERS 202 , PERS 301 , or a higher-numbered Persian course. Taught in Persian. Native speakers of Persian will not receive credit for taking lower division courses in Persian except with advance approval from the department. No credit will be given for PERS 101, PERS 102 , PERS 201 , and PERS 202  taken out of sequence.

PERS 102.course_description: PERS 102 - Elementary Modern Persian II  Units: 4 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): PERS 101  or two years of high school Persian.Continuation of PERS 101 . Development of speaking, listening, and reading skills using multimedia materials. Vocabulary for everyday topics and develop culturally appropriate discourse strategies for everyday situations. Maximum Credits: 4Note: Not open to students with credit in PERS 201 , PERS 202 , PERS 301 , or a higher-numbered Persian course. Taught in Persian. Native speakers of Persian will not receive credit for taking lower division courses in Persian except with advance approval from the department. No credit will be given for PERS 101 , PERS 102, PERS 201 , and PERS 202  taken out of sequence.

PERS 201.course_description: PERS 201 - Intermediate Persian I  Units: 4 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): PERS 102 .Further development of speaking, reading, listening, and writing skills, with emphasis on language of everyday conversation. Integrated approach to learning Persian to include awareness and appreciation of Persian culture. Maximum Credits: 4Note: Not open to students with credit in PERS 202 , PERS 301 , or a higher-numbered Persian course. Taught in Persian. Native speakers of Persian will not receive credit for taking lower division courses in Persian except with advance approval from the department. No credit will be given for PERS 101 , PERS 102 , PERS 201, and PERS 202  taken out of sequence.

PERS 202.course_description: PERS 202 - Intermediate Persian II  Units: 4 GEGrading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): PERS 201 .Intermediate level students achieve further proficiency in speaking, listening, reading, and writing; produce language needed for daily routines and work related discourse. Maximum Credits: 4Note: Not open to students with credit in PERS 301  or a higher-numbered Persian course. Taught in Persian. Native speakers of Persian will not receive credit for taking lower division courses in Persian except with advance approval from the department. No credit will be given for PERS 101 , PERS 102 , PERS 201 , and PERS 202 taken out of sequence.

PERS 296.course_description: PERS 296 - Experimental Topics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Selected topics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree. Taught in Persian. Native speakers of Persian will not receive credit for taking lower division courses in Persian except with advance approval from the department.

PERS 301.course_description: PERS 301 - Advanced Persian I  Units: 4 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): PERS 202 .Oral expression and writing for practical purposes; exposure to various dialects through newspaper and media; elements of literary and classical language. Maximum Credits: 4Note: Taught in Persian. No credit will be given for PERS 301 and PERS 302  taken out of sequence.

PERS 302.course_description: PERS 302 - Advanced Persian II  Units: 4 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): PERS 301 .Writing complex literary and expository texts. Reading modern and classical texts to include complicated media. Producing, understanding debates and speeches. Maximum Credits: 4Note: Taught in Persian. No credit will be given for PERS 301  and PERS 302 taken out of sequence.

PERS 400A.course_name: Iranian Life and Culture through Literature
PERS 400A.course_description: PERS 400A - Iranian Life and Culture through Literature  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): PERS 302 .Iranian life and culture as represented through literature. Iran’s cultural, political, and social trends. History and the study of cross-cultural encounters. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Taught in Persian.

PERS 400B.course_name: Iranian Life and Culture through Contemporary Film
PERS 400B.course_description: PERS 400B - Iranian Life and Culture through Contemporary Film  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): PERS 302 .Current cultural and social issues in Iran through study of representative films. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Taught in Persian.

PERS 496.course_description: PERS 496 - Topics in Persian Studies  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Topics in Persian language, literature, culture, and linguistics. May be taught in English.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 8Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree. Taught in Persian.

PHIL 100.course_description: PHIL 100 - Introduction to Philosophy: Global Philosophies  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Introduction to African, indigenous American, Asian, European, and Latinx philosophies. Exploration of how can diverse philosophies across the globe help address crises like climate change, social injustice, and military conflicts or are reflected in social, economic, and political institutions. Maximum Credits: 3

PHIL 101.course_description: PHIL 101 - Introduction to Philosophy: Ethics  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Philosophical inquiry, with emphasis on problems of moral value. Students are encouraged to think independently and formulate their own tentative conclusions concerning a variety of vital contemporary issues facing individuals and society. Maximum Credits: 3

PHIL 102.course_name: Introduction to Philosophy: Knowledge and Reality
PHIL 102.course_description: PHIL 102 - Introduction to Philosophy: Knowledge and Reality  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Introduction to philosophical inquiry with emphasis on problems of knowledge and reality. Students are encouraged to think independently and formulate their own tentative conclusions. Maximum Credits: 3

PHIL 120.course_description: PHIL 120 - Introduction to Logic  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Introduction to deductive and inductive logic. Logic and language. Analysis of fallacies. Uses of logic in science and in daily life. Maximum Credits: 3

PHIL 140.course_description: PHIL 140 - Technology and Human Behavior  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Consequences of technology on our lives as integrated physiological, psychological, and social beings. Environmental problems associated with rapid development of technology. Responses to problems by various philosophers and writers. Maximum Credits: 3

PHIL 200.course_description: PHIL 200 - Critical Thinking and Composition  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Satisfaction of the SDSU Written Communication Assessment requirement and AFRAS 120  or AMIND 120  or CCS 111B  or LING 100B  or RWS 100  [or ECL 100  or POL S 100 ] or RWS 105B . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Test scores or verification of exemption; grade report or copy of transcript.Introduction to critical thinking and writing. Evaluation and development of correct reasoning and effective style and organization in argumentative writing. Correct deductive and inductive reasoning. Fallacies. Critical appraisal of evidence. Construction of rebuttals and counter-arguments.Formerly numbered Philosophy 110. Maximum Credits: 3

PHIL 296.course_description: PHIL 296 - Experimental Topics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Selected topics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

PHIL 299.course_description: PHIL 299 - Special Study  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of department chair and instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 3

PHIL 310.course_description: PHIL 310 - Philosophy and Human Nature  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Concept of human nature. Descriptive and normative aspects of major theories of human nature. Maximum Credits: 3

PHIL 312.course_description: PHIL 312 - Women and Philosophy  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Exploration of women’s contributions to philosophy, both present and historically. Concepts relating to women and femininity, both by the philosophical canon and by more recent feminist philosophers. Maximum Credits: 3Note: This course satisfies the general education cultural diversity requirement.

PHIL 315.course_description: PHIL 315 - Philosophy and Literature  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Study of literature of philosophical significance and of philosophical problems of literature.Formerly numbered Philosophy 334. Maximum Credits: 3

PHIL 325.course_description: PHIL 325 - A Major Philosophical Topic  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC General introduction to a major philosophical topic (e.g. cosmopolitan justice, freedom of the will, the nature and existence of God, theory and evidence). Maximum Credits: 6

PHIL 328.course_description: PHIL 328 - Philosophy, Racism, and Justice  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division standing.Philosophical concepts and theories of racism and racial justice. Arguments for and against such theories. Maximum Credits: 3Note: This course satisfies the general education cultural diversity requirement.

PHIL 329.course_description: PHIL 329 - Social Ethics  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Ethical issues of contemporary life. Individualism vs. collectivism; democracy vs. dictatorship; ethical problems arising in law, medicine, business, government and interpersonal relationships. Maximum Credits: 3

PHIL 330.course_description: PHIL 330 - Biomedical Ethics  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Value judgments upon which medicine is based and the ethical issues which medicine faces. Maximum Credits: 3

PHIL 332.course_description: PHIL 332 - Environmental Ethics  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Same As: SUSTN 332  Development of traditional values concerning the natural environment. Reasons for altering values in light of modern changes in relationship of human beings to the environment. Application of ethical principles to actions affecting the environment. Maximum Credits: 3

PHIL 333.course_description: PHIL 333 - Ethics-Food  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division standing.Ethics of what we eat to include fair-trade food sourcing, food rituals, shaming, waste; use of GMOs, veganism, and vegetarianism. Maximum Credits: 3

PHIL 335.course_description: PHIL 335 - Philosophy of Business Ethics  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division standing.Moral status of business practices; arguments and theories regarding ways to run businesses and corporations; issues that arise in everyday practices of businesses. Maximum Credits: 3Note: May not be taken in place of MGT 444 , required of Fowler College of Business majors.

PHIL 336.course_name: Philosophy, Human Behavior, and the Internet
PHIL 336.course_description: PHIL 336 - Philosophy, Human Behavior, and the Internet  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Completion of the General Education requirement in Foundations of Learning II.C., Humanities. Investigate the kinds of questions raised by the development of internet-driven culture; supply the conceptual tools necessary to make critical value judgments about the internet and society; and develop a practice of approaching the internet with philosophically rigorous inquiry.

PHIL 340.course_description: PHIL 340 - Morality of War and Peace  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Historical and contemporary arguments regarding morality of war, pacifism, and terrorism, with contemporary applications. Maximum Credits: 3

PHIL 341.course_description: PHIL 341 - Logic and the Law  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Logic in legal contexts. Inductive reasoning methods applied to legal briefs, case studies, and LSATs. Construction, presentation, and evaluation of written and oral arguments, using historical and contemporary legal decisions. Maximum Credits: 3

PHIL 342.course_description: PHIL 342 - Morality and the Law  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Understanding and application of the law via contemporary moral controversies in case law and legal practice. Maximum Credits: 3

PHIL 343.course_description:
PHIL 343 - Ethics Bowl  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Interdisciplinary, case-study approach to contemporary ethical issues. Creative, critical thinking skills and theoretical ethical frameworks;
present and defend positions in team debate. Required participation in mock competitions. Selected students participate in Intercollegiate Ethics Bowl California Regional Competition (possibly also National Intercollegiate Ethics Bowl). Maximum Credits: 6

PHIL 344.course_description: PHIL 344 - Global Justice  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Current debates in political philosophy concerning the justification, content, and scope of duties of global justice to include distributive justice, nationalism vs. cosmopolitanism, morality of immigration controls, justification of human rights, and limits of sovereignty. Maximum Credits: 3

PHIL 351.course_description: PHIL 351 - Chinese Philosophy  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Same As: ASIAN 351   Philosophical traditions which have shaped the intellectual life and culture of China. Emphasis on foundational texts surviving from pre-Han China. Maximum Credits: 3Note: This course satisfies the general education cultural diversity requirement.

PHIL 353.course_description: PHIL 353 - Buddhist Philosophy  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Intellectual traditions within Buddhism, both ancient and contemporary, including key areas of metaphysics, epistemology, and axiology. Maximum Credits: 3Note: This course satisfies the general education cultural diversity requirement.

PHIL 360.course_description: PHIL 360 - Contemporary Brazilian Philosophers  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Contemporary Brazilian philosophers and their relevance to Brazilian culture and politics. Maximum Credits: 3

PHIL 401A.course_name: History of Philosophy: Pre-Socratic through Medieval
PHIL 401A.course_description: PHIL 401A - History of Philosophy: Pre-Socratic through Medieval  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC From Pre-Socratic through Medieval. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Not open to students with credit in Philosophy 411 and 412.

PHIL 401B.course_name: History of Philosophy: Renaissance and Early Modern
PHIL 401B.course_description: PHIL 401B - History of Philosophy: Renaissance and Early Modern  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Renaissance and early modern philosophy. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Not open to students with credit in Philosophy 412 and 413.

PHIL 496.course_description: PHIL 496 - Experimental Topics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Selected topics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

PHIL 499.course_description: PHIL 499 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Six upper division units in philosophy and prior arrangements with a supervising instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6

PHIL 505.course_description: PHIL 505 - Nineteenth-Century European Philosophy  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division or graduate standing.Major European philosophers of the nineteenth century. May include Hegel, Kierkegaard, Marx, Mill, Nietzsche, and Schopenhauer.Formerly numbered Philosophy 414. Maximum Credits: 3

PHIL 506.course_description: PHIL 506 - Twentieth-Century Continental Philosophy  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division or graduate standing.Major figures and movements in European philosophy from Husserl to the present. Maximum Credits: 3

PHIL 508.course_description: PHIL 508 - Existentialism  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division or graduate standing.The philosophical aspects of existentialism. Major emphasis is on the diversity of thought within a common approach as this is shown in individual thinkers. Maximum Credits: 3

PHIL 509.course_description: PHIL 509 - Theory of Ethics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division or graduate standing.Advanced topics in ethical theory, including normative ethics and meta-ethics. May include historical or contemporary readings or both. Issues may include content of moral value, nature of moral judgment, and accounts of virtue and right action.Formerly numbered Philosophy 528. Maximum Credits: 3

PHIL 510.course_description: PHIL 510 - Philosophy of Law  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division or graduate standing.Philosophical and ethical investigation into the nature of law, rights, liberty, responsibility, and punishment. Maximum Credits: 3

PHIL 512.course_description: PHIL 512 - Political Philosophy  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division or graduate standing.Selected aspects of the political structures within which we live, such as law, power, sovereignty, justice, liberty, welfare. Maximum Credits: 3

PHIL 514.course_description: PHIL 514 - Philosophy of Art  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division or graduate standing.The nature of aesthetic experience. Principal Western theories of art in relation to actual artistic production and to the function of art in society.Formerly numbered Philosophy 542. Maximum Credits: 3

PHIL 515.course_description: PHIL 515 - Philosophy of Film  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division or graduate standing.Investigation into metaphysical, aesthetic, and epistemological dimensions of film. Narration, authorship, cognitive and emotional engagement, social and philosophical ramifications. Maximum Credits: 3

PHIL 516.course_description: PHIL 516 - Global Aesthetics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division or graduate standing.How cultures beyond Amero-Eurocentric traditions developed aesthetic theories complementing, challenging, or expanding more often taught theories. Historical and contemporary works representing a spectrum of philosophies around the globe. Maximum Credits: 3

PHIL 521.course_description: PHIL 521 - Deductive Logic  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): PHIL 120 .Principles of inference for symbolic deductive systems; connectives, quantifiers, relations and sets. Interpretations of deductive systems in mathematics, science and ordinary language. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Not open to students with credit in MATH 523 .

PHIL 523.course_description: PHIL 523 - Theory of Knowledge  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division or graduate standing.Philosophical analysis of knowledge, including conceptions of belief, justification, and truth. Maximum Credits: 3

PHIL 530.course_description: PHIL 530 - Metaphysics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division or graduate standing.Prominent theories of reality, e.g., realism and nominalism, materialism and idealism, teleology and determinism.Formerly numbered Philosophy 525. Maximum Credits: 3

PHIL 534.course_description: PHIL 534 - Philosophy of Language  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division or graduate standing.An introduction to theories of meaning for natural languages and formal systems; concepts of truth, synonymy and analyticity; related epistemological and ontological problems.Formerly numbered Philosophy 531. Maximum Credits: 3

PHIL 535.course_description: PHIL 535 - Philosophy of Religion  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division or graduate standing.Philosophical analysis of the nature and existence of God. Maximum Credits: 3

PHIL 536.course_description: PHIL 536 - Philosophy of Mind  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division or graduate standing.Prominent theories and arguments regarding relation between mind and body. Varieties of dualism considered along with major materialist rivals. Maximum Credits: 3

PHIL 537.course_description: PHIL 537 - Philosophy of Science  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division or graduate standing.The basic concepts and methods underlying contemporary scientific thought. Contributions of the special sciences to a view of the universe as a whole. Maximum Credits: 3

PHIL 538.course_description: PHIL 538 - Neuroethics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division or graduate standing.Morally salient features of brain science and development and application of neurotechnology. Maximum Credits: 3

PHIL 544.course_description: PHIL 544 - Queer Theory  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Same As: WMNST 544 . Prerequisite(s): Upper division or graduate standing.Philosophical aspects of queer theory. Sexualized identity intersections with ability, nationality, race, and other categories. Desire, gender, sex, sexuality; affect, embodiment, identity, and temporality. Maximum Credits: 3

PHIL 555.course_description: PHIL 555 - Empirical Perspectives of Buddhism  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division or graduate standing. Recommended: PHIL 353 .Historical and contemporary Buddhist scholarship and practice. Maximum Credits: 3

PHIL 565.course_description: PHIL 565 - Asian Philosophies  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division or graduate standing.Dimensions of Asian philosophies, past and present. Encounter between Buddhism and post-modern science, contemporary Asian philosophers (“global gurus”) and their impact on non-Asian cultures, enigmatic notion of emptiness (sunya, wu).  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Note: See Class Schedule for specific topic.

PHIL 575.course_description: PHIL 575 - A Major Philosopher  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division or graduate standing.The writings of one major philosopher.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to the major, six units applicable to a master’s degreeNote: See Class Schedule for specific content.
