RUSSN 100B.course_description: RUSSN 100B - Beginning Russian 2  Units: 5 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): RUSSN 100A  or two years of high school Russian.Continuation of RUSSN 100A . Maximum Credits: 5Note: Taught in Russian. Native speakers of Russian will not receive credit for taking lower division courses in Russian except with advance approval from the department. No credit will be given for lower division courses taken after successfully completing any upper division Russian course taught in Russian. No credit will be given for RUSSN 100A , RUSSN 100B, RUSSN 200A , RUSSN 200B , RUSSN 301  taken out of sequence.

RUSSN 110.course_description: RUSSN 110 - Slavic Legends and Tales  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Introduces fairy tales, folk epics and legends and examines aesthetic, social, and psychological values they reflect. Cultural influence of Slavic folklore in literature, music, painting, film. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Taught in English. Native speakers of Russian will not receive credit for taking lower division courses in Russian except with advance approval from the department. No credit will be given for lower division courses taken after successfully completing any upper division Russian course taught in Russian.

RUSSN 200A.course_description: RUSSN 200A - Intermediate Russian 1  Units: 5 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): RUSSN 100B  or three years of high school Russian.Practical application and review of the basic principles of Russian. Oral practice, reading of cultural material in Russian. Maximum Credits: 5Note: Taught in Russian. Native speakers of Russian will not receive credit for taking lower division courses in Russian except with advance approval from the department. No credit will be given for lower division courses taken after successfully completing any upper division Russian course taught in Russian. No credit will be given for RUSSN 100A , RUSSN 100B , RUSSN 200A, RUSSN 200B , RUSSN 301  taken out of sequence.

RUSSN 200B.course_description: RUSSN 200B - Intermediate Russian 2  Units: 5 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): RUSSN 200A .Continuation of RUSSN 200A . Maximum Credits: 5Note: Taught in Russian. Native speakers of Russian will not receive credit for taking lower division courses in Russian except with advance approval from the department. No credit will be given for lower division courses taken after successfully completing any upper division Russian course taught in Russian. No credit will be given for RUSSN 100A , RUSSN 100B , RUSSN 200A , RUSSN 200B, RUSSN 301  taken out of sequence.

RUSSN 250.course_name: Russian Culture in a Digital World
RUSSN 250.course_description: RUSSN 250 - Russian Culture in a Digital World  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC New media’s impact on social, cultural, and political development of Russian society. Russian art, values and ideologies, state power, nationalism, and democracy. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Taught in English. Native speakers of Russian will not receive credit for taking lower division courses in Russian except with advance approval from the department. No credit will be given for lower division courses taken after successfully completing any upper division Russian course taught in Russian.

RUSSN 301.course_description: RUSSN 301 - Advanced Grammar and Composition  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): RUSSN 200B . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript. Not open to students who graduated from schools where Russian is the primary language of instruction.Advanced grammar and stylistics; intensive writing practice; reports based on outside reading. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Taught in Russian. No credit will be given for lower division courses taken after successfully completing any upper division Russian course taught in Russian. No credit will be given for RUSSN 100A , RUSSN 100B , RUSSN 200A , RUSSN 200B , RUSSN 301 taken out of sequence.

RUSSN 303.course_description: RUSSN 303 - Russian for Business Communication  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): RUSSN 301 .Russian business communication to include business letters, reports, presentations. Topics include banking, business etiquette, international trade, marketing. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Taught in Russian. No credit will be given for lower division courses taken after successfully completing any upper division Russian course taught in Russian.

RUSSN 305A.course_name: Heroes and Villains: Russian Literature of the Nineteenth Century
RUSSN 305A.course_description: RUSSN 305A - Heroes and Villains: Russian Literature of the Nineteenth Century  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Nineteenth century Russian literature in translation. Prose fiction in cultural and historical context of Russian Empire to include works by Dostoevsky, Pushkin, Tolstoy, Turgenev. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Taught in English with readings in English.

RUSSN 305B.course_name: Russian Literature of the Twentieth Century
RUSSN 305B.course_description: RUSSN 305B - Russian Literature of the Twentieth Century  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Twentieth century Russian literature including works by Zamyatin, Pasternak, Akhmatova, Solzhenitsyn. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Taught in English with readings in English.

RUSSN 310.course_description: RUSSN 310 - Russian and East European Cinema  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Through study of films from 1950s to post-Soviet times, major concerns of East Europeans are addressed through cinema. Interrelationships among cinematic traditions of Russia, Poland, Hungary, Czechoslovakia, and former Yugoslavia/Balkans. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Taught in English.

RUSSN 311.course_description: RUSSN 311 - Russian Through Media  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): RUSSN 200B .Russian stylistics and discourse grammar in context. Emphasis on communicative skills: listening, speaking, reading, and writing. Students work with Internet materials, newspapers, magazines, and excerpts from Russian and Soviet films. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Taught in Russian. No credit will be given for lower division courses taken after successfully completing any upper division Russian course taught in Russian.

RUSSN 430.course_description: RUSSN 430 - Russian Civilization  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): RUSSN 200B ; upper division standing for majors. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Russian civilization through literary texts, visual art, music, and film. Relationships between art and politics, art and national identity, art of the fantastic and doublespeak, art of postcommunism and postmodernism. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Taught in Russian. No credit will be given for lower division courses taken after successfully completing any upper division Russian course taught in Russian.

RUSSN 435.course_name: Russian and East European Jewish Culture
RUSSN 435.course_description: RUSSN 435 - Russian and East European Jewish Culture  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division standing for majors.Russian and East European Jewish culture from 1900s to present. How literature written in Russian, Polish, Czech, Lithuanian, German by writers of Jewish origin as well as visual arts and cinema reflect changing problem of Jewish national identity. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Taught in English. This course satisfies the general education cultural diversity requirement.

RUSSN 441.course_description: RUSSN 441 - Structure of Modern Russian  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): RUSSN 301 .Linguistic structure of current standard Russian. Topics include Russian phonology, phonetics and intonation, verbal and nominal morphology, syntax. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Taught in Russian. No credit will be given for lower division courses taken after successfully completing any upper division Russian course taught in Russian.

RUSSN 495.course_description: RUSSN 495 - Russian Internship  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Upper division standing in major and consent of instructor.Practical work experience in a field related to Russian studies. Work done under joint direction of activity sponsor and instructor. Approved international internships may count towards international experience requirement for major. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Taught in Russian. No credit will be given for lower division courses taken after successfully completing any upper division Russian course taught in Russian.

RUSSN 499.course_description: RUSSN 499 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Fifteen upper division units in the major with an average of B (3.0) or better and consent of instructor. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6Note: Taught in Russian. No credit will be given for lower division courses taken after successfully completing any upper division Russian course taught in Russian.

RUSSN 501.course_description: RUSSN 501 - Translation  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): RUSSN 301 .Comparison of Russian and English through translation of a variety of texts from Russian to English and from English to Russian. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Taught in Russian. No credit will be given for lower division courses taken after successfully completing any upper division Russian course taught in Russian.

RUSSN 570.course_name: Issues in Russian Literary and Cultural Studies
RUSSN 570.course_description: RUSSN 570 - Issues in Russian Literary and Cultural Studies  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): RUSSN 301  and RUSSN 305A  or RUSSN 305B .Themes within literary, intellectual, and cultural movements in Russian literature of the nineteenth to twenty-first centuries.  May be repeated with new title and content. Maximum Credits: 6Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Taught in Russian. No credit will be given for lower division courses taken after successfully completing any upper division Russian course taught in Russian.

RUSSN 596.course_description: RUSSN 596 - Topics in Russian Studies  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): RUSSN 305B  (for literary topics). Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Topics in Russian language, literature, or linguistics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser. Taught in Russian. No credit will be given for lower division courses taken after successfully completing any upper division Russian course taught in Russian.

RUSSN 696.course_description: RUSSN 696 - Topics in Russian Studies  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Intensive study in specific areas of Russian.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 12Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

RUSSN 798.course_description: RUSSN 798 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Eighteen upper division units in Russian and consent of staff; to be arranged with department chair and instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

SCI 101.course_name: Seminar: Introduction to the College of Sciences
SCI 101.course_description: SCI 101 - Seminar: Introduction to the College of Sciences  Units: 1 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Advising, careers, departments, fields of study, high impact practices, and skills for success. Connect with administrators, advisers, faculty, students, and other members of the College of Sciences community. Maximum Credits: 1

SCI 200.course_name: Introduction to Campus Activities and Networking
SCI 200.course_description: SCI 200 - Introduction to Campus Activities and Networking  Units: 1 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Provides upper class mentors for freshman and community college transfer students. Mentors assist students in locating campus resources, linking them with departmental advisers, identifying tutors in science courses and encouraging students to participate in workshops. Maximum Credits: 2

SCI 250.course_name: Informal Learning and Instruction of Mathematics and Science
SCI 250.course_description: SCI 250 - Informal Learning and Instruction of Mathematics and Science  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Same As: TE 250  Two lectures and two or more hours of activity.Theories of learning and instruction through the lens of informal mathematics and science activities. Qualitative research skills while working in after school mathematics and science programs. Design and Implementation of informal education in a service-learning environment. Maximum Credits: 9

SCI 296.course_description: SCI 296 - Experimental Topics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Selected topics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

SCI 350.course_description: SCI 350 - International Experience  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division standing.Study abroad experience.  May be repeated with new content and approval of major adviser. Maximum Credits: 3Maximum Credit Statement: three units applicable to a bachelor’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content and geographic location.

SCI 496.course_description: SCI 496 - Experimental Topics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Selected topics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

SCI 510.course_description: SCI 510 - Careers in the Sciences  Units: 1 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Upper division or graduate standing.Science career opportunities in biotechnology, diagnostic, informatics, and high technology industries. Maximum Credits: 1

SCI 596.course_description: SCI 596 - Experimental Topics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Selected topics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Maximum Credit Statement: six units of 596 applicable to a bachelor’s degree Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

STS 301.course_name: Concepts and Ideas in Science and Technology Studies
STS 301.course_description: STS 301 - Concepts and Ideas in Science and Technology Studies  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Frameworks, history, key concepts, and methods. Scientific and technological assumptions and practices. Engaging people, policies, and practices in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics disciplines.Formerly numbered Arts and Letters 301 Maximum Credits: 3

STS 580.course_name: Science and Technology Topics in Society
STS 580.course_description: STS 580 - Science and Technology Topics in Society  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division or graduate standing.Advanced systematic study of a topic in science, society, and technology.Formerly numbered CAL 580.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

STS 590.course_name: Capstone in Science, Technology, and Society
STS 590.course_description: STS 590 - Capstone in Science, Technology, and Society  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): STS 301 .Culminating capstone experience. Synthesis and integration of academic work and professional preparation to include major-specific coursework and high-impact practices. Formal research paper and formulation of action plan for post-baccalaureate aspirations.Formerly numbered CAL 590. Maximum Credits: 3

SOCSI 300.course_description: SOCSI 300 - Social Science Approaches and Concepts  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Only open to social science majors or premajors. Completion of the General Education requirement in Foundations of Learning IIB, Social and Behavioral Sciences.Exploration of core concepts in social science and the controversies surrounding them. Examination of how social scientists conduct research as well as methodological debates within and across disciplines. Maximum Credits: 3

SWORK 110.course_description: SWORK 110 - Social Work Fields of Service  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Fields of services in which social workers perform professional roles. Focus on social work approach to intervention in practice and policy arenas. Maximum Credits: 3

SWORK 120.course_name: Introduction to Social Work and Social Welfare
SWORK 120.course_description: SWORK 120 - Introduction to Social Work and Social Welfare  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and three hours of fieldwork.Orientation to field of social work. Develop understanding of social work principles, goals, values, and methods through readings and class discussion. An unpaid assignment in an agency setting is required. Scheduling is flexible. Maximum Credits: 3

SWORK 296.course_description: SWORK 296 - Experimental Topics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Selected topics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

SWORK 350.course_description: SWORK 350 - Cultural Pluralism  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Understanding of the American society as a culturally pluralistic social process and an understanding of social work as a culturally directed profession with emphasis on the concept of cultural identities created by one’s values, ideologies, knowledge and behavior. Maximum Credits: 3Note: This course satisfies the general education cultural diversity requirement.

SWORK 360.course_name: Perspectives on Human Behavior and the Social Environment
SWORK 360.course_description: SWORK 360 - Perspectives on Human Behavior and the Social Environment  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Interdisciplinary, comparative, and critical approach to explanatory theories of human behavior. Focus on interrelatedness of factors that affect the nature and quality of human life with linkage to the social welfare of individuals, families and communities. Maximum Credits: 3

SWORK 361.course_name: Human Behavior Across the Life Span
SWORK 361.course_description: SWORK 361 - Human Behavior Across the Life Span  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Social work major and junior standing.Psycho-social, biological, cultural and environmental influences on individual growth and development and how knowledge is utilized by social work generalist practitioners in assessment and intervention. Maximum Credits: 3

SWORK 370.course_description: SWORK 370 - Social Policies and Social Issues  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): SWORK 110  and SWORK 120 .Major social forces and institutions as they relate to and determine social policy emphasizing social welfare services in an industrialized society. Maximum Credits: 3

SWORK 381.course_description: SWORK 381 - Practice Skills Micro  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Completion of social work or gerontology preparation for the major. SWORK 382  or consent of instructor.Micro skills utilizing motivational interviewing within overall generalist practice framework. Written and verbal communication, interviewing, and assessment with individuals. Maximum Credits: 3

SWORK 382.course_description: SWORK 382 - Practice Skills Macro  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Completion of social work preparation for the major.Development of social work practice skills at macro level. Written and verbal communication needs assessment and resource development with organizations and communities. Maximum Credits: 3

SWORK 391.course_description: SWORK 391 - Methods of Social Work Research  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Definition and purpose of research in social welfare and social work. Formulation of research problems, selecting a design and methodology; techniques of collecting, organizing, interpreting, and analyzing data. Maximum Credits: 3

SWORK 400.course_description: SWORK 400 - Social Work Practice: Child Welfare  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): SWORK 370 .Problems of children and supportive, supplementary and substitute social services which have been developed to meet these needs. Maximum Credits: 3

SWORK 410.course_description: SWORK 410 - Social Work Practice: Family Issues  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): SWORK 370 .Issues relative to social work intervention with families, including major social work and interpersonal family problem situations. Family practice methods and social service provisions, and social policy issues around family needs. Maximum Credits: 3

SWORK 430.course_name: Alcohol and Other Drug Problems: Prevention and Intervention
SWORK 430.course_description: SWORK 430 - Alcohol and Other Drug Problems: Prevention and Intervention  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division standing.Alcohol and other drug issues related to individuals, groups, and society. Concepts include preventive methods, secondary prevention, self-help groups, models of treatment, prevention strategies in communities, and overview of alcohol and drug policies. Maximum Credits: 3

SWORK 483A.course_description: SWORK 483A - Generalist Social Work Practice I  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Completion of social work preparation for the major, 300-level courses required for major, and concurrent registration in SWORK 489A .Integration of social work theory, principles, and practice techniques across micro and mezzo social work populations to include families and groups. Maximum Credits: 3

SWORK 483B.course_description: SWORK 483B - Generalist Social Work Practice II  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): SWORK 483A , SWORK 489A , and concurrent registration in SWORK 489B .Integration of social work theory, principles, and practices with emphasis on mezzo and macro generalist practice social work populations and settings. Maximum Credits: 3

SWORK 489A.course_description: SWORK 489A - Field Experience in Social Work  Units: 4-8 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Completion of all 300-level social work courses; SWORK 381  and SWORK 382  with a grade of C (2.0) or better and consent of instructor; arrangements made during prior semester with director of undergraduate field education. Concurrent registration in SWORK 483A .A minimum of eight units (four in Social Work 489A and four in SWORK 489B ) is required. Students spend 16 hours per week per semester in practice field assignments in selected social work agencies or settings. Maximum Credits: 9

SWORK 671.course_description: SWORK 671 - Generalist Foundation of Social Work Practice, Policy, and Human Behavior  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. Students with credit or concurrent registration in the following lower division statistics courses will be awarded a total of four units for the two (or more) courses: Sociology 201; ARP 201 ; BIOL 215 ; CIV E 160 ; ECON 201 ; LING 270 ; POL S 201 ; PSY 280 ; STAT 119 , STAT 250 . Maximum Credits: 3

The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing.Morphology, phonology, syntax of Spanish in historic and regional varieties. Qualitative and quantitative research related to sociolinguistics and pragmatics of Spanish, language acquisition, bilingualism, contact varieties. Spanish in teaching and translation. Maximum Credits: 3

SPAN 603.course_description: SPAN 603 - Early Modern Hispanic Literature  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): SPAN 601 .Philosophic, political, and aesthetic ideas in early modern Hispanic literature. Spanish and Spanish American texts spanning from fifteenth to eighteenth centuries. Maximum Credits: 3

SPAN 604.course_name: Spanish Literature: Eighteenth to Twentieth Century
SPAN 604.course_description: SPAN 604 - Spanish Literature: Eighteenth to Twentieth Century  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): SPAN 601 .Philosophical, political, and aesthetic ideas in literature of neoclassicism, romanticism, realism, and modernism from eighteenth through twentieth centuries. Maximum Credits: 3

SPAN 606.course_name: Spanish American Literature: Independence to Present
SPAN 606.course_description: SPAN 606 - Spanish American Literature: Independence to Present  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): SPAN 601 .Spanish American literature in its artistic and ideological tendencies from age of independence to present. Literary movements include romanticism, Modernismo, criollismo, and indigenismo. Maximum Credits: 3

SPAN 611.course_description: SPAN 611 - Advanced Topics in Spanish Linguistics  Units: 3-6 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): SPAN 602 .Specific aspect of Spanish descriptive, historical, or theoretical linguistics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

SPAN 612.course_description: SPAN 612 - Seminar in Spanish Discourse Analysis  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): SPAN 602 .Analysis of oral discourse in Spanish. Basic readings in field and strategies to collect and analyze data. Maximum Credits: 3

SPAN 631.course_description: SPAN 631 - Spanish Women Writers  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): SPAN 601 .Feminist and cultural studies approach to works of Spanish women writers. Analysis of issues on gender, class, race.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

SPAN 661.course_name: Issues in the Study of Spanish Bilingualism
SPAN 661.course_description: SPAN 661 - Issues in the Study of Spanish Bilingualism  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): SPAN 602  Theories and research on bilingualism with special emphasis on Spanish/English. Definitions of bilingualism. Bilingual typologies. Acquisition of bilingual abilities. Bilingualism and testing. Intersection of bilingualism and translation/interpreting studies. Individual and societal bilingualism. Maximum Credits: 3

SPAN 696.course_description: SPAN 696 - Selected Topics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Intensive study in specific areas of Spanish.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 12Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

SPAN 750.course_description: SPAN 750 - Seminar in Spanish American Literature  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): SPAN 601 .A genre or movement of Spanish American literature.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

SPAN 751.course_description: SPAN 751 - Seminar in Realism  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): SPAN 601 .Theoretical and historical underpinnings of literary realism. Examines key realist texts from variable periods in Spain or Latin America. Topics include the picaresque novel, naturalism, regional novel, thesis novel, and magical realism.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

SPAN 755.course_name: Seminar in Spanish American Culture, Film, and Society
SPAN 755.course_description: SPAN 755 - Seminar in Spanish American Culture, Film, and Society  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): SPAN 601 .Works of representative authors and cultural production of Spanish America.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

SPAN 760.course_name: Seminar in Reading in the Transatlantic Imaginary
SPAN 760.course_description: SPAN 760 - Seminar in Reading in the Transatlantic Imaginary  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): SPAN 601 .Exploration and critical analysis of texts produced by authors who lived and wrote between Spain and Spanish-America. Relationship between a cultural text and its place of origin. Maximum Credits: 3

SPAN 770.course_description: SPAN 770 - Applied Spanish Linguistics for Teachers  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): SPAN 602 .The application of linguistic theory to the teaching of Spanish at the secondary and college levels. Maximum Credits: 3

SPAN 781.course_description: SPAN 781 - Spanish Language Testing  Units: 3  Prerequisite(s): SPAN 602 .Theories and research on language testing with emphasis on Spanish. Types and purposes of language measurement instruments. Characteristics of tests: practicality, instructional value, validity, reliability, test difficulty. Overview of test formats/methods and their consequences.

SPAN 792.course_description: SPAN 792 - Spanish Language and Society  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): SPAN 602 .Basic notions of relationship between language and society in Spanish-speaking world. Methodologies applied to data from monolingual and bilingual speech communities. Variationism, ethnography of communication, and sociology of language in Spanish-speaking world. Maximum Credits: 3

SPAN 798.course_description: SPAN 798 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of staff, to be arranged with department chair and instructor.Individual study. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

SPAN 799A.course_description: SPAN 799A - Thesis  Units: 3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): An officially appointed thesis committee and advancement to candidacy.Preparation of a project or thesis for the master’s degree. Maximum Credits: 3

SPAN 799B.course_description: SPAN 799B - Thesis Extension  Units: 0 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Prior registration in Thesis 799A with an assigned grade symbol of RP.Registration required in any semester or term following assignment of RP in Course 799A in which the student expects to use the facilities and resources of the university; also student must be registered in the course when the completed thesis is granted final approval. Maximum Credits: 0

SPAN 799C.course_description: SPAN 799C - Comprehensive Examination Extension  Units: 0 Grading Method: Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Completion or concurrent enrollment in degree program courses.Registration required of students whose only requirement is completion of the comprehensive examination for the master’s degree. Registration in 799C limited to two semesters.

SPED 450.course_description: SPED 450 - Classroom Adaptations for Special Populations  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Historical, legal, and philosophical aspects of special education. Instructional and assessment support for access to general education curriculum. Meets requirements for preliminary multiple, single subject, and education specialist teaching credentials. Maximum Credits: 3

SPED 496.course_description: SPED 496 - Selected Topics in Special Education  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Instructional sequences focusing on a single topic or competency dealing with special education. Topics differ each semester to adjust to current literature in the field, training needs, and resource availability.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

SPED 499.course_description: SPED 499 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor. Open only to senior and graduate students in education who have shown ability to work independently. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6

SPED 501.course_description: SPED 501 - Typical and Atypical Learning Processes  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Credit or concurrent registration in SPED 450 ; concurrent registration in SPED 502 .Theory, research, and processes in learning in relation to individuals with disabilities. Foundations of learning, development, and intervention.

SPED 502.course_name: Field Experiences in General and Special Education
SPED 502.course_description: SPED 502 - Field Experiences in General and Special Education  Units: 1 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit  Three hours of observation/participation per week.Prerequisite(s): Concurrent registration in SPED 501 .Observation and participation in general and special education classrooms and related school activities for students with disabilities. Maximum Credits: 1

SPED 505.course_name: Educational Services for Students with Serious Emotional Disturbance
SPED 505.course_description: SPED 505 - Educational Services for Students with Serious Emotional Disturbance  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to credential program.Educational needs and services for students with serious emotional disturbance. Classroom interventions and procedures. Maximum Credits: 1

SPED 524.course_name: Characteristics of Students with Mild/Moderate Disabilities
SPED 524.course_description: SPED 524 - Characteristics of Students with Mild/Moderate Disabilities  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): SPED 450 .Historical and philosophical perspectives of programs related to students with mild/moderate disabilities. Research on educational programs, curricular approaches, and characteristics.

SPED 525.course_name: Characteristics of Students with Moderate/Severe Disabilities
SPED 525.course_description: SPED 525 - Characteristics of Students with Moderate/Severe Disabilities  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): SPED 450 .Historical and philosophical perspectives of programs related to students with moderate/severe disabilities. Research on educational programs, curricular approaches, and characteristics with emphasis on services in context of school reform.

SPED 526.course_name: Characteristics and Education of Students with Physical, Health, and Sensory Impairments
SPED 526.course_description: SPED 526 - Characteristics and Education of Students with Physical, Health, and Sensory Impairments  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): SPED 450  with grade of C (2.0) or better and admission to credential program.Characteristics, needs, and supports for individuals with physical, health, and sensory impairments in educational, home, and community settings. Implications of health concerns for programming. Maximum Credits: 3

SPED 527.course_name: Special Education in a Pluralistic Society
SPED 527.course_description: SPED 527 - Special Education in a Pluralistic Society  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division or graduate standing.Historical and philosophical perspectives of cultural pluralism in special education and programs related to diverse students with disabilities. Research on curricular approaches and instructional needs. Sociocultural aspects related to disability, race, ethnicity, gender, and language. Maximum Credits: 3

SPED 528.course_name: Young Children with Disabilities and Their Families
SPED 528.course_description: SPED 528 - Young Children with Disabilities and Their Families  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Credit or concurrent registration in SPED 450 . Characteristics, needs, and educational programs and services for infants, toddlers, and preschoolers with disabilities and their families. Legislative requirements, models of service delivery, recommended practices, and family diversity. Maximum Credits: 3

SPED 530.course_description: SPED 530 - Issues in Autism  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to credential program.Definition, etiology, assessment, and instructional practices used to address autism. Historical and current issues. Maximum Credits: 3

SPED 534.course_name: Classroom Assessment of Students with Mild/Moderate Disabilities
SPED 534.course_description: SPED 534 - Classroom Assessment of Students with Mild/Moderate Disabilities  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to credential program.Classroom assessment in general and special education for students with mild/moderate disabilities. Curriculum-based data collection strategies. Influences of cultural and linguistic diversity, and implications for curricular and instructional adaptations. Maximum Credits: 3

SPED 535.course_name: Assessment for Students with Extensive Support Needs
SPED 535.course_description: SPED 535 - Assessment for Students with Extensive Support Needs  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to credential program. SPED 450  with a grade of C (2.0) or better.Models of assessment emphasizing observation and interviewing, performance-based approaches, transdisciplinary teaming, family-professional collaboration, and adaptations for specific disabilities, cultural, and linguistic diversity for students with extensive support needs. Communicating and using assessment data for individualized program planning.Formerly numbered SPED 635. Maximum Credits: 3

SPED 543.course_name: Educational Programs and Services for Young Children with Disabilities: Preschoolers
SPED 543.course_description: SPED 543 - Educational Programs and Services for Young Children with Disabilities: Preschoolers  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to credential program and concurrent registration in approved fieldwork.Developing, implementing, and evaluating educational programs and services for young children with disabilities. Selecting and adapting curriculum and instructional approaches, collaborating with families from diverse cultural/linguistic backgrounds, and monitoring program effectiveness.Formerly numbered Special Education 643A. Maximum Credits: 3

SPED 545.course_name: Issues in Curriculum and Instruction for Students with Extensive Support Need
SPED 545.course_description:
SPED 545 - Issues in Curriculum and Instruction for Students with Extensive Support Need  Units: 2-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC 
  Prerequisite(s): SPED 450  with a grade of C (2.0) or better and admission to credential program.Practical strategies for working with children and adolescents with extensive support needs in a variety of learning environments. Collaboration with other professionals in the field and involve families as partners in the educational process.Formerly numbered Special Education 645. Maximum Credits: 3

SPED 547.course_name: Special Education Adaptations of Basic Skills Instruction
SPED 547.course_description: SPED 547 - Special Education Adaptations of Basic Skills Instruction  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to credential program. SPED 450  with a grade of C (2.0) or better.Language arts and development, mathematics, and reading for students with disabilities. Ability, cultural, and linguistic differences.Formerly numbered SPED 647. Maximum Credits: 3

SPED 548.course_description: SPED 548 - Advanced Special Education Adaptations  Units: 2-3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): SPED 547 . Advanced adaptations in curriculum and instruction in content areas, study skills, organizational strategies, and social and transition skills. English-as-a-second language approaches for students with disabilities. Research and practices related to linguistic, cultural, and ability differences.Formerly numbered SPED 648. Maximum Credits: 3

SPED 553.course_name: Behavioral Strategies and Supports for Students with Disabilities
SPED 553.course_description: SPED 553 - Behavioral Strategies and Supports for Students with Disabilities  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to credential program.Positive behavioral supports for students with disabilities in general and special education settings. Current theories and programs in functional assessment and behavioral change. Applications in educational and community environments with diverse students. Maximum Credits: 3

SPED 557.course_name: Facilitating Transition Across Environments in Special Education
SPED 557.course_description: SPED 557 - Facilitating Transition Across Environments in Special Education  Units: 2 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to credential program. SPED 450  with a grade of C (2.0) or better.School to adult life transitions for individuals with disabilities. Whole student approaches to include community experiences, employment preferences, friends and extended family, home and school life, and postsecondary goals. Formerly numbered SPED 657. Maximum Credits: 2

SPED 560.course_name: Applications of Technology for Individuals with Disabilities
SPED 560.course_description: SPED 560 - Applications of Technology for Individuals with Disabilities  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to credential program.Educational applications of current technologies for learners with disabilities. Selection, modification, and classroom use of technologies to improve or bypass physical, sensory, communicative, learning, and social limitations. Maximum Credits: 3

SPED 562.course_name: Collaboration, Legislation, and Educational Planning in Special Education
SPED 562.course_description: SPED 562 - Collaboration, Legislation, and Educational Planning in Special Education  Units: 2 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to credential program and credit or concurrent registration in Special Education 980.Collaboration, legislation, and individualized special education program planning skills for working with community resources, parents, and school personnel. Goals, interpersonal processes, legal and ethical issues, listening and questioning techniques, objectives, outcomes, and team functions focused on developing and implementing an individualized education plan.Formerly numbered Special Education 662. Maximum Credits: 2

SPED 596.course_description: SPED 596 - Selected Topics in Special Education  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Specialized study of selected topics in special education. May be offered as either a workshop or lecture/discussion.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

SPED 600.course_description: SPED 600 - Classroom Adaptations for Special Populations  Units: 2 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Preliminary multiple or single subject credential.Strategies for adapting curriculum, differentiating instruction, meeting social and behavioral needs. Modifying assessments for students with disabilities and students with gifts and talents in general education classrooms. Applicable to Induction Program for the California Professional Clear Credential. Maximum Credits: 2

SPED 605.course_description: SPED 605 - Advanced Behavioral and Health Supports  Units: 1 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to clear credential or M.A. program in special education or related area.Advanced approaches to dealing with behavioral crises and health issues in classroom, to include working with mental health specialists and school nurses. Maximum Credits: 1

SPED 643B.course_name: Educational Programs and Services for Young Children with Disabilities: Infants/Toddlers
SPED 643B.course_description: SPED 643B - Educational Programs and Services for Young Children with Disabilities: Infants/Toddlers  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to credential program and concurrent registration in approved fieldwork.Developing, implementing, and evaluating educational programs and services for young children with disabilities. Selecting and adapting curriculum and instructional approaches, collaborating with families from diverse cultural/linguistic backgrounds, and monitoring program effectiveness. Maximum Credits: 3

SPED 644.course_name: Working with Gifted and Talented Students and Their Families
SPED 644.course_description: SPED 644 - Working with Gifted and Talented Students and Their Families  Units: 3  Research-based instructional strategies to promote higher level and creative thinking; counseling approaches; services to families; issues in differentiating learning experiences.

SPED 649.course_name: Curriculum Models for Students Who Are Gifted and Talented
SPED 649.course_description: SPED 649 - Curriculum Models for Students Who Are Gifted and Talented  Units: 3  Prerequisite(s): Credit or concurrent registration in SPED 644 .Theory, research, and practice in curriculum design and program implementation for developing high potential.

SPED 650A.course_name: Special Topics in Special Education: Consultant Skills/Multidisciplinary Teams
SPED 650A.course_description: SPED 650A - Special Topics in Special Education: Consultant Skills/Multidisciplinary Teams  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): SPED 450 , SPED 501 .Instructional sequences (mini-courses) focusing on a single topic or competency dealing with special education. Topics differ each semester to adjust to current literature in the field, training needs, and resource availability. Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

SPED 651.course_description: SPED 651 - Legislation, Leadership, and Management  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to clear credential program with a preliminary multiple subject, single subject, or education specialist credential.Design and implementation of individualized learning plans for professional development activities. Leadership approaches for managing school-related services within a multidisciplinary context. Maximum Credits: 3

SPED 653.course_name: Advanced Instruction, Collaboration, and Consultation in Special Education
SPED 653.course_description: SPED 653 - Advanced Instruction, Collaboration, and Consultation in Special Education  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to clear credential or M.A. program in special education or related area.Advanced instruction, collaboration, consultation skills, and strategies for working with students, teachers, paraprofessionals, school personnel, other service providers, parents, and representatives from the community. Maximum Credits: 3

SPED 655.course_description: SPED 655 - Leadership, Supervision, and Management  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to the behavior analysis certificate or M.A. program.Leadership through a behavioral lens. Data-informed decision-making, organization behavior management, and performance feedback. Maximum Credits: 3

SPED 676.course_description: SPED 676 - Advanced Applied Behavior Analysis  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): SPED 553 .Ethical application of research-based strategies based on behavior analysis. Emphasis on arranging learning opportunities to increase student skills and data collection. Maximum Credits: 3

SPED 681A.course_name: Advanced Studies in Special Education: Mild/Moderate Support Needs
SPED 681A.course_description: SPED 681A - Advanced Studies in Special Education: Mild/Moderate Support Needs  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to M.A. program in special education.Educational legislation, theories, philosophies, research findings, issues and trends in area of exceptionality. Application of research to solution of educational problems. Maximum Credits: 3

SPED 681B.course_name: Advanced Studies in Special Education: Autism, Early Childhood Special Education, and Extensive Support Needs
SPED 681B.course_description: SPED 681B - Advanced Studies in Special Education: Autism, Early Childhood Special Education, and Extensive Support Needs  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to M.A. program in special education.Educational legislation, theories, philosophies, research findings, issues and trends in the area of exceptionality. Application of research to solution of educational problems. Maximum Credits: 3

SPED 685.course_description: SPED 685 - Single Case Research Design  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): SPED 553 .Single-case research designs focused on interventions with individuals with disabilities. Maximum Credits: 3

SPED 696.course_description: SPED 696 - Advanced Topics in Special Education  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Twelve units in special education.Intensive study in specific areas of special education.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 12Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

SPED 771.course_description: SPED 771 - Directed Internship: Special Education  Units: 1-6 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Permission of graduate adviser.Application to be made during previous semester. Extensive daily participation or teaching in public schools and preparation for teaching of exceptional individuals.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

SPED 771A.course_description: SPED 771A - Directed Internship: Applied Behavior Analysis  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to the behavior analysis certificate or M.A. program.Integration and application of behavior analysis principles. Participation and coaching in selected programs for students with disabilities. Maximum Credits: 3

SPED 798.course_description: SPED 798 - Special Study  Units: 1-6 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of staff; to be arranged with department chair and instructor.May involve fieldwork. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

SPED 970A.course_name: Practicum: Students with Disabilities in General and Special Education: Mild/Moderate Disabilities
SPED 970A.course_description: SPED 970A - Practicum: Students with Disabilities in General and Special Education: Mild/Moderate Disabilities  Units: 2-4 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit  Fifteen hours of observation/participation per week.Prerequisite(s): SPED 502  and consent of credential adviser.Participation in general and special education programs for students with disabilities; supervised by a special educator. Integration and application of skills and knowledge gained in credential coursework.  May be repeated in other specialties. Maximum Credits: 4Maximum Credit Statement: four units applicable to each credential program.Note: May be taken only once for credit.

SPED 970B.course_name: Practicum: Students with Disabilities in General and Special Education - Moderate/Severe Disabilities
SPED 970B.course_description: SPED 970B - Practicum: Students with Disabilities in General and Special Education - Moderate/Severe Disabilities  Units: 2-4 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit  Fifteen hours of observation/participation per week.Prerequisite(s): SPED 502  and consent of credential adviser.Participation in general and special education programs for students with disabilities; supervised by a special educator. Integration and application of skills and knowledge gained in credential coursework.  May be repeated in other specialties. Maximum Credits: 4Note: May be taken only once for credit.

SPED 980A.course_name: Advanced Practicum in Special Education: Mild/Moderate Disabilities
SPED 980A.course_description: SPED 980A - Advanced Practicum in Special Education: Mild/Moderate Disabilities  Units: 1-12 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Consent of credential adviser.Culminating practicum for Education Specialist Credential. Participation supervised by a special educator.  May be repeated in other specialties. Maximum Credits: 12

SPED 980B.course_name: Advanced Practicum in Special Education: Moderate/Severe Disabilities
SPED 980B.course_description: SPED 980B - Advanced Practicum in Special Education: Moderate/Severe Disabilities  Units: 1-12 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Consent of credential adviser.Culminating practicum for Education Specialist Credential. Participation supervised by a special educator.  May be repeated in other specialties. Maximum Credits: 12

SPED 980D.course_name: Advanced Practicum in Special Education: ECSE: Infant/Preschool
SPED 980D.course_description: SPED 980D - Advanced Practicum in Special Education: ECSE: Infant/Preschool  Units: 1-12 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Consent of credential adviser.Culminating practicum for Education Specialist Credential. Participation supervised by a special educator.  May be repeated in other specialties. Maximum Credits: 12

SPED 985.course_description: SPED 985 - Professional Development: Reflections on Practice  Units: 1 Grading Method: Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Completion or concurrent registration in Clear Professional Induction Specialist Credential coursework.Professional Clear Induction Plans (PCIP); engage in reflective practice including goal setting; prepare portfolio with entries representing Clear Professional Induction Specialist Credential courses and experiences.

SLHS 106.course_name: Introduction to Speech, Language, and Hearing Sciences
SLHS 106.course_description: SLHS 106 - Introduction to Speech, Language, and Hearing Sciences  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Human communication disorders. Fields of audiology and speech-language pathology. Disability, hearing, language, speech, and communication for participation in society. Maximum Credits: 3

SLHS 150.course_description: SLHS 150 - Sign Languages and Deaf Culture  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Introduction to sign languages, deafness and deaf culture. General issues of human language, language learning, and minority societies. Maximum Credits: 3

SLHS 222.course_description: SLHS 222 - Communication as a Human Right  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Human communication disorders and how they influence abilities to engage in various domains of life to include community engagement, education, legal and medical systems, media, and politics. Maximum Credits: 3

SLHS 295.course_description: SLHS 295 - Introduction to Research  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Research methods and tools that can be applied in a variety of research laboratories. Maximum Credits: 6

SLHS 296.course_description: SLHS 296 - Experimental Topics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Selected topics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

SLHS 300.course_description: SLHS 300 - Introduction to Language Science  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Credit or concurrent registration in SLHS 106  and a cumulative GPA of 2.75 or better.Structure, acquisition, processing, and neurological organization of language in typical and disordered communication. Maximum Credits: 3

SLHS 305.course_description: SLHS 305 - Hearing Science  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Credit or concurrent registration in SLHS 106  and a cumulative GPA of 2.75 or better.Concepts of hearing science. Hearing science components to include physical acoustics, anatomy and physiology of auditory system, and psychoacoustics. Maximum Credits: 3

SLHS 320.course_description: SLHS 320 - Phonetics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): Credit or concurrent registration in SLHS 106  and a cumulative GPA of 2.75 or better.Principles of speech production and practical skills in discriminating and transcribing sounds of various dialects in English and other languages, as well as clinical populations. Competency in IPA broad and narrow transcription, classification of speech sounds, and patterns of speech. Maximum Credits: 3

SLHS 321.course_description: SLHS 321 - Anatomy and Physiology of Speech  Units: 4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Three lectures and three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): Credit or concurrent registration in SLHS 106 ; PSY 260 , and a cumulative GPA of 2.75 or better.Anatomy and physiology of respiratory, phonatory, and articulatory systems related to speech. Maximum Credits: 4

SLHS 340.course_description: SLHS 340 - Principles of Audiology  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): SLHS 305  with a grade of C (2.0) or better. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Diagnostic audiology procedures: Pure-tone testing, masking, speech recognition testing and immittance. Integration and interpretation of results from the basic audiological test battery. Maximum Credits: 3

SLHS 496.course_name: Topics in Speech, Language, and Hearing Sciences
SLHS 496.course_description: SLHS 496 - Topics in Speech, Language, and Hearing Sciences  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Study of some problem in speech, language, and hearing sciences. Maximum Credits: 6Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

SLHS 499.course_description: SLHS 499 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6

SLHS 510.course_description: SLHS 510 - Guided Observations  Units: 1 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Upper division or graduate standing.Twenty-five hours of guided observations. Clinical activities and debriefing of therapy and evaluation procedures. Maximum Credits: 6

SLHS 511.course_description: SLHS 511 - Aural Rehabilitation  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s):  SLHS 320 , SLHS 340 . Recommended: SLHS 300 , SLHS 513 .Theoretical, methodological, and technical issues related to facilitating receptive and expressive communication in individuals who are deaf or hard-of-hearing. Emphasizes multidisciplinary case management of children. Maximum Credits: 3

SLHS 512.course_description: SLHS 512 - Phonological Acquisition and Disorders  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): SLHS 320  with a grade of C (2.0) or better. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Phonology, phonological development, and phonological disorders as they relate to basic linguistic theory. Concepts considered through critical thinking and problem-solving. Maximum Credits: 3

SLHS 513.course_description: SLHS 513 - Foundations of Speech-Language: Development  Units: 4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): SLHS 300 , SLHS 320 , SLHS 321 .Speech-language development as related to theories of language acquisition, development, and clinical practice in children from birth to school-age. Maximum Credits: 4

SLHS 514.course_name: Foundations of Speech-Language: Differences and Disorders in Children
SLHS 514.course_description: SLHS 514 - Foundations of Speech-Language: Differences and Disorders in Children  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): SLHS 513 .Speech and language disorders and issues related to assessment of and intervention with children from culturally and linguistically diverse populations. Maximum Credits: 3

SLHS 521.course_description: SLHS 521 - Speech-Language Screening of Children  Units: 1 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit  Three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): Clinic clearance.Screening speech and language of children in various community facilities and settings. Maximum Credits: 1

SLHS 525.course_description: SLHS 525 - Clinical Processes  Units: 1-2 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Clinical issues, policies, and methods in speech-language pathology. Experience in writing lesson plans and clinical reports. Clinical observation to partially fulfill requirements for certification. Maximum Credits: 5

SLHS 539.course_name: Neuroanatomy and Disorders of Speech and Language
SLHS 539.course_description: SLHS 539 - Neuroanatomy and Disorders of Speech and Language  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): SLHS 150 , SLHS 300 , SLHS 305 , and SLHS 321 ; or graduate standing.Structural and functional neuroanatomy and disorders of speech and language resulting from pathology of the nervous system. Maximum Credits: 3

SLHS 546.course_description: SLHS 546 - Clinical Issues in Aural Rehabilitation  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Theoretical, methodological, and technical issues related to the speech-language pathologist’s role in facilitating communication in individuals who are deaf or hard-of-hearing. Maximum Credits: 2

SLHS 570.course_description: SLHS 570 - Dysphagia  Units: 4 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Measurement techniques and research in dysphagia. Assessment and treatment of dysphagia and swallowing problems in children and adults. Maximum Credits: 4

SLHS 580.course_description: SLHS 580 - Communication Processes and Aging  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Twelve upper division units in an appropriate major.Normal and disordered communication processes in the aging. Maximum Credits: 3

SLHS 590.course_name: Seminar in Research Foundations of Speech, Language, and Hearing Sciences
SLHS 590.course_description: SLHS 590 - Seminar in Research Foundations of Speech, Language, and Hearing Sciences  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor and a grade of B+ (3.3) or better in SLHS 305 , SLHS 320 , SLHS 513 . Open only to senior speech, language, and hearing sciences majors. Graduate students may not use this course toward program of study.Specialized study of selected topics in speech, language, and hearing sciences. Maximum Credits: 3

SLHS 595.course_description: SLHS 595 - Research Practicum  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor and a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or better.Participation in a specific research activity under faculty supervision. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: maximum combined credit of six units of SLHS 595 and SLHS 795.

SLHS 596.course_name: Selected Topics in Speech, Language, and Hearing Sciences
SLHS 596.course_description: SLHS 596 - Selected Topics in Speech, Language, and Hearing Sciences  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Twelve units in speech, language, and hearing sciences courses.Specialized study of selected topics from the area of speech-language pathology, audiology, education of the hearing impaired, and speech and hearing science.  May be repeated with new content. Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

SLHS 600A.course_name: Research Methods in Communication Sciences and Disorders
SLHS 600A.course_description: SLHS 600A - Research Methods in Communication Sciences and Disorders  Units: 1 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to the M.A. program in speech, language, and hearing sciences.Methods of investigation in communication sciences and disorders to include research design, basic statistics, principles of evidence-based practice, ethical conduct in research design and work with human participants.Formerly numbered Speech, Language, and Hearing Sciences 600. Maximum Credits: 1

SLHS 600B.course_name: Advanced Research Methods in Communication Sciences and Disorders
SLHS 600B.course_description: SLHS 600B - Advanced Research Methods in Communication Sciences and Disorders  Units: 2 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): SLHS 600A .Principles of evidence-based practice, single-subject design, statistics for single-subject design, statistics used in longitudinal research and scale development; regression and factor analysis.Formerly numbered Speech, Language, and Hearing Sciences 600. Maximum Credits: 2

SLHS 606.course_description: SLHS 606 - Voice, Resonance, and Fluency Disorders  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Normal voice, resonance, and fluency, symptoms and causes of voice, resonance, and fluency disorders and their assessment and management. Maximum Credits: 3

SLHS 607.course_description: SLHS 607 - Phonology and Phonological Disorders  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Characterization of phonological disorders, assessment frameworks, intervention strategies. Theoretical frameworks of phonology as applied to and experimentally evaluated in speech-language pathology. Methodology considered within context of clinical cases studies designed to facilitate critical thinking and problem-solving. Maximum Credits: 3
