SOC 799C.course_description: SOC 799C - Comprehensive Examination Extension  Units: 0 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Completion or concurrent enrollment in degree program courses.Registration required of students whose only requirement is completion of the comprehensive examination for the master’s degree. Registration in 799C limited to two semesters. Maximum Credits: 0

SPAN 101.course_description: SPAN 101 - Introduction to Spanish I  Units: 4 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Four lectures plus laboratory.Pronunciation, oral practice, readings on Hispanic culture and civilization, essentials of grammar. Maximum Credits: 4Note: Not open to students with credit in SPAN 102 , SPAN 201 , SPAN 202 , SPAN 281 , SPAN 282 , SPAN 301 , or a higher-numbered Spanish course. Taught in Spanish. Native speakers of Spanish will not receive credit for taking lower division courses in Spanish except with advance approval from the department. No credit will be given for lower division Spanish language courses taken after successfully completing any upper division Spanish course. No credit will be given for SPAN 101, SPAN 102 , SPAN 201 , SPAN 202 , SPAN 301  taken out of sequence.

SPAN 102.course_description: SPAN 102 - Introduction to Spanish II  Units: 4 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Four lectures plus laboratory.Prerequisite(s): SPAN 101  or two years of high school Spanish.Continuation of SPAN 101 . Maximum Credits: 4Note: Not open to students with credit in SPAN 201 , SPAN 202 , SPAN 281 , SPAN 282 , SPAN 301 , or a higher-numbered Spanish course. Taught in Spanish. Native speakers of Spanish will not receive credit for taking lower division courses in Spanish except with advance approval from the department. No credit will be given for lower division Spanish language courses taken after successfully completing any upper division Spanish course. No credit will be given for SPAN 101 , SPAN 102, SPAN 201 , SPAN 202 , SPAN 301  taken out of sequence.

SPAN 181.course_name: Introduction to Spanish for Heritage Language Learners I
SPAN 181.course_description: SPAN 181 - Introduction to Spanish for Heritage Language Learners I  Units: 3 Foundations - Arts and Humanities - Humanities [CSU C2]Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC First in the sequence of Spanish for Heritage Language Learners track (181, 281, 282, 381). Emphasis on developing listening and speaking skills in the heritage language, understanding and practicing basic grammar, and cultivating positive attitudes towards the heritage language and the heritage culture. Note: Requires exposure to Spanish in the home and neighborhood in the U.S. Not open to native speakers (with high school diploma from a Spanish-speaking country) or students with credit in SPAN 201, SPAN 202, SPAN 211, SPAN 282, SPAN 301, or higher numbered Spanish course. Replaces SPAN 101 and SPAN 102 for Preparation for the Major. Taught in Spanish. Native speakers of Spanish will not receive credit for taking lower division courses in Spanish except with advanced approval from the department. No credit will be given for lower division Spanish language courses taken after successfully completing any upper division Spanish course.

SPAN 201.course_description: SPAN 201 - Intermediate Spanish I  Units: 4 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Four lectures plus laboratory.Prerequisite(s): SPAN 102  or completion of the third year of high school Spanish.First course in Spanish at intermediate level. Grammatical structures presented in beginning Spanish. Culture-centered oral and written language emphasized. Maximum Credits: 4Note: Not open to students with credit in SPAN 202 , SPAN 281 , SPAN 282 , SPAN 301 , or a higher-numbered Spanish course. See enrollment restrictions under AP credit in Spanish. May be taken concurrently with SPAN 211 . It is recommended that heritage speakers of Spanish take SPAN 281  in place of Spanish 201 and SPAN 211 . Taught in Spanish. Native speakers of Spanish will not receive credit for taking lower division courses in Spanish except with advance approval from the department. No credit will be given for lower division Spanish language courses taken after successfully completing any upper division Spanish course. Note: Recommended for students interested in pursuing a career in social science teaching. To include 15 hours of classroom lecture/discussion and 15 hours of activity in the field.

TE 303.course_description: TE 303 - The Teaching Profession: First Clinical Experience  Units: 3-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. TE 350.course_description:
TE 350 - Digital Teaching and Learning  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and two hours of service-learning activity.Prerequisite(s):  
 Introduction to methods and theories of digital teaching and learning through demonstration, simulation, facilitation and performances that integrate the tools of technological knowledge with content and pedagogical knowledge. Hyflex mode of delivery. Support for service-learning tutoring. Maximum Credits: 3Note: The service-learning credit requires 2 hours per week in partnerships with local school sites. Placement in service-learning sites requires a minimum of 2.5 GPA. For more information, direction on placement, TB test and livescan, please contact the SDSU Pathways office at Pathways@sdsu.edu. Enrollment in this section entails participation in experiential learning and/or internshnip. These experiences may occur on-campus or off-campus. Additional requirements may apply. Course contains a service-learning opportunity; contact instructor for details.

Maximum Credits: six units. Designated Global Learning Course (GLC).

TE 462.course_description: TE 462 - Science Fieldwork in Community Settings  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. Physical Sciences, or II.A.2. Life Sciences.Science teaching and learning to include supervised fieldwork in local science classrooms. Maximum Credits: 3

The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Advanced study of the research in curriculum development, construction and evaluation. Maximum Credits: 3

TE 602A.course_description: TE 602A - Seminar: California Clear Teaching Credential  Units: 1 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Preliminary multiple or single subject credential.Develop professional growth plans designed to provide guidance for inquiry and action research. Applicable to Induction Program for the California Professional Clear Credential. Maximum Credits: 1

TE 602B.course_description: TE 602B - Seminar: Formative Assessment  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Preliminary multiple or single subject credential and TE 602A .Advanced professional development to meet the California Standards for the Teaching Profession. Summative assessment applying Plan, Instruct, Assess, Reflect, and Apply (PIARA). Applicable to Induction Program for the California Professional Clear Credential. Maximum Credits: 3

TE 605.course_description: TE 605 - Innovations in Instruction  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Teaching experience.Exploration of innovative instructional practice in the public and private schools, with emphasis on innovative teaching strategies. An evaluation of the motivational effect and structural validity of promising instructional practices. Maximum Credits: 3Maximum Credit Statement: three units applicable to a master’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

TE 610C.course_name: Seminar in Science in Elementary Education
TE 610C.course_description: TE 610C - Seminar in Science in Elementary Education  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Advanced study of the problems of teaching science in the elementary school with emphasis on the literature of science education. Maximum Credits: 3

TE 615.course_description: TE 615 - Teaching Critical Thinking Using Technology  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to Master of Arts in Teaching program.Critical thinking and educational technology. Educating diverse learners. Maximum Credits: 3

TE 620.course_name: Teaching Online: K-12 Curriculum and Instruction
TE 620.course_description: TE 620 - Teaching Online: K-12 Curriculum and Instruction  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC - Letter (Cr/NC OK) Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing.Skills and knowledge for the development and implementation of K-12 curriculum using evidence and research supported pedagogy toward producing high-quality online instruction. To include related research, history, philosophy, controversy, and innovative technologies.

TE 625.course_name: Technology Equity in K-12 Learning Communities
TE 625.course_description: TE 625 - Technology Equity in K-12 Learning Communities  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC - Letter (Cr/NC OK) Prerequisite(s): Admission to the Master of Arts in Teaching (Elementary or Secondary).An examination of pedagogies and practices of equity and access in 21st Century K-12 learning communities.

TE 630.course_name: Seminar in Literacy and Language Arts
TE 630.course_description: TE 630 - Seminar in Literacy and Language Arts  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): ED 690 .Trends in reading instruction to include developmental sequences in reading skills and abilities, reading in the content fields, individual differences and interests. Maximum Credits: 3

TE 631.course_description: TE 631 - Seminar in Language Arts  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Advanced study of problems in teaching language arts. The study of the scientific research and application in the field. Maximum Credits: 3

TE 633.course_description: TE 633 - Leadership in Literacy Education  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): TE 637 .Planning, presenting, and evaluating professional development activities in literacy education for teachers at the K-12 level. Maximum Credits: 3

TE 635.course_name: Assessment of Reading and Language Arts
TE 635.course_description: TE 635 - Assessment of Reading and Language Arts  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Valid teaching credential; course in methods and materials for teaching reading.Theoretical knowledge and practical skill in assessing reading and language arts using both formal and informal measures. Maximum Credits: 3

TE 637.course_name: Instructional Strategies for Reading and Language Arts
TE 637.course_description: TE 637 - Instructional Strategies for Reading and Language Arts  Units: 4 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  Three lectures and two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): Valid teaching credential; course in methods, materials for teaching reading.Supervised teaching experience utilizing instructional activities in individual and small group settings. Maximum Credits: 4

TE 638.course_description: TE 638 - Topics in Reading Education  Units: 1-6 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): California Teaching Credential.A variety of instructional sequences (mini-courses), each focusing on a single topic or competency dealing with reading instruction. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

TE 639.course_description: TE 639 - Literacy and Language  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): TE 930  or TE 933 .Theories of literacy and methods for developing literacy in language, reading and writing. Instructional methods and assessment techniques for children and adults. Maximum Credits: 3

TE 640.course_name: Planning for Teaching and Assessment in Writing
TE 640.course_description: TE 640 - Planning for Teaching and Assessment in Writing  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Teaching experience.Comprehensive writing instruction in context of the interactive language arts. Development of plans for curriculum and instruction in diverse classrooms. Examination of multiple assessments and how they inform instruction in K-12 classrooms. Maximum Credits: 3

TE 642.course_description: TE 642 - Visual-Based Literacy Strategies  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): TE 930  and DLE 931  with a grade B (3.0) in each course.Visual texts to support equitable instructional practices for diverse learners. Theoretical grounding in multiliteracies. Classroom visual-based strategies to scaffold and demonstrate understanding. Maximum Credits: 3

TE 651.course_description: TE 651 - History of Social Studies Reform  Units: 3  Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing.History and current status of social studies curricula in American schools, K-12. Emphasis on issues, controversies, competing philosophies, historical trends, and applications.

TE 655.course_description: TE 655 - Sociocultural Foundations of American Education  Units: 2 or 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to teacher education.Historical and philosophical nature of American schools as it relates to equity, pedagogy, and curriculum. Issues of equity, race, culture, gender, ethnicity, sexual preference, and social issues as they impact the classroom. Maximum Credits: 3

TE 677.course_description: TE 677 - Research-Based Pedagogy for Diverse Learners  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to Master of Arts in Teaching program.Research-based pedagogy for diverse learners. Instructional strategies applicable across disciplines. Maximum Credits: 3

TE 693.course_name: Measuring and Assessing Student Achievement in Schools
TE 693.course_description: TE 693 - Measuring and Assessing Student Achievement in Schools  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to Master of Arts in Teaching program.Development of assessments and tests common in instructional and research contexts. Uses and interpretation of assessment data in given differential social/political contexts. Implications for research and instruction. Maximum Credits: 3

TE 696.course_description: TE 696 - Selected Topics in Teacher Education  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Valid teaching credential.Intensive study in specific areas of teacher education.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 12Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

TE 709.course_description: TE 709 - Inclusive Education  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and four hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing.Research, theory, and practice of inclusive education to include examination of the politics of disability in the public schools and American society. Maximum Credits: 3

TE 779.course_description: TE 779 - Action Research in Learning Environments  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): TE 693  and successful completion of 24 units of Master of Arts in Teaching coursework.Capstone course for Master of Arts in Teaching degree. Action research conducted in students’ own teaching environments. Maximum Credits: 3

TE 790.course_description: TE 790 - Seminar in Teacher Education  Units: 3-6 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Advancement to candidacy.Intensive consideration of selected topics of current importance in teacher education.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 12Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree. For collaborative induction programs with school districts: May be taken prior to advancement to candidacy for six units; up to 12 units applicable to a master’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

TE 798.course_description: TE 798 - Special Study  Units: 1-6 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of staff; to be arranged with department chair and instructor.May involve fieldwork. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

TE 902.course_description: TE 902 - Classroom Management Skills  Units: 1-2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Provisional or complete admission to multiple subject credential program.Skills in interpreting the legal aspects of education, identifying various kinds of school and classroom organization, and using instructional media and verbal stimuli to facilitate learning. Maximum Credits: 2

TE 903.course_description: TE 903 - Secondary School Student Teaching Seminar  Units: 1-2 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): TE 922 , TE 933 , TE 954 , TE 963 . To be taken concurrently with TE 964  or upper division standing in the integrated teacher education program.To plan and organize instruction in relation to all competencies acquired and to be implemented in an on-site, full-time student teaching assignment.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 3Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

TE 910A.course_name: Teaching Mathematics in the Elementary School
TE 910A.course_description: TE 910A - Teaching Mathematics in the Elementary School  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: CNO - Letter (No Cr/NC) Prerequisite(s): Admission to multiple subject credential program, education specialist credential program, or possession of a teaching credential. ITEP students must show admission to multiple subject credential program or education specialist credential program and completion of MATH 312 and/or MATH 313 with a grade of C (2. 0) or better.Instructional methods for development of children’s conceptual understanding, computational, and problem-solving skills in mathematics, including use and development of materials and programs.

TE 910B.course_name: Teaching Social Studies in the Elementary School
TE 910B.course_description: TE 910B - Teaching Social Studies in the Elementary School  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: CNO - Letter (No Cr/NC) Prerequisite(s): Admission to multiple subject credential program or possession of a teaching credential. ITEP students must show admission to multiple subject credential program or education specialist credential program and completion of HIST 411 and/or HIST 413 with a grade of C (2. 0) or better.Developing curriculum, principles and materials of instruction, including instructional media and participation in elementary social studies education.

TE 910C.course_name: Teaching Science in the Elementary School
TE 910C.course_description: TE 910C - Teaching Science in the Elementary School  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: CNO - Letter (No Cr/NC) Prerequisite(s): Admission to multiple subject credential program or possession of a teaching credential. Concurrent ITEP students must show admission to multiple subject credential program and may show concurrent enrollment in PHYS 412.Developing research-based science curriculum, principles and materials of instruction, including instructional media and participation in elementary science education.

TE 914.course_name: Teaching and Learning in the Content Area: Major
TE 914.course_description: TE 914 - Teaching and Learning in the Content Area: Major  Units: 3  Prerequisite(s): Admission to teacher education credential program.Teaching strategies in content specific fields of study taken concurrently with student teaching.  May be repeated with new content. Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

TE 914A.course_description: TE 914A - Instructional Methods for Mathematics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to a teacher education credential program.Teaching strategies and assessment in mathematics. To be taken concurrently with student teaching. Maximum Credits: 3

TE 914B.course_name: Instructional Methods for History and Social Sciences
TE 914B.course_description: TE 914B - Instructional Methods for History and Social Sciences  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to a teacher education credential program.Teaching strategies and assessment in history and social sciences. To be taken concurrently with student teaching. Maximum Credits: 3

TE 914C.course_description: TE 914C - Instructional Methods for Science  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to a teacher education credential program.Teaching strategies and assessment in sciences. To be taken concurrently with student teaching. Maximum Credits: 3

TE 914D.course_name: Instructional Methods for English Language Arts
TE 914D.course_description: TE 914D - Instructional Methods for English Language Arts  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to a teacher education credential program.Teaching strategies and assessment in English Language Arts (ELA). To be taken concurrently with student teaching. Maximum Credits: 3

TE 914E.course_description: TE 914E - Instructional Methods for Physical Education  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to a teacher education credential program.Teaching strategies and assessment in physical education. To be taken concurrently with student teaching. Maximum Credits: 3

TE 914F.course_description: TE 914F - Instructional Methods for Music  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to a teacher education credential program.Teaching strategies and assessment in music. To be taken concurrently with student teaching. Maximum Credits: 3

TE 922.course_name: Behavioral and Psychological Aspects of Teaching
TE 922.course_description: TE 922 - Behavioral and Psychological Aspects of Teaching  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to single subject credential program. To be taken concurrently with TE 954  and TE 963 .Teacher competencies as they relate to learning theories, adolescent growth, self-assessment, measurement and evaluation.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 4Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

TE 923.course_description: TE 923 - Psychological Foundations of Education  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): PSY 101  and admission to multiple subject credential program.Implementing learning process through interactive skills, using instructional principles to facilitate learning and changes in behavior and techniques used in assessing instruction and pupil growth. Maximum Credits: 3

TE 924A.course_description: TE 924A - Advanced Methods in Teaching Mathematics  Units: 2-4 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): TE 914A  with a grade of C (2.0) or better and admission to a single subject credential program.Best practices, evaluation of student work, learning assessments, and pedagogy in secondary mathematics instruction. Maximum Credits: 4

TE 924B.course_name: Advanced Methods in Teaching History/Social Science
TE 924B.course_description: TE 924B - Advanced Methods in Teaching History/Social Science  Units: 2-4 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): TE 914B  with a grade of C (2.0) or better and admission to a single subject credential program.Best practices, evaluation of student work, learning assessments, and pedagogy in secondary history/social science instruction. Maximum Credits: 4

TE 924C.course_description: TE 924C - Advanced Methods in Teaching Science  Units: 2-4 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): TE 914C  with a grade of C (2.0) or better and admission to a single subject credential program.Best practices, evaluation of student work, learning assessments, and pedagogy in secondary science instruction. Maximum Credits: 4

TE 924D.course_name: Advanced Methods in Teaching English Language Arts
TE 924D.course_description: TE 924D - Advanced Methods in Teaching English Language Arts  Units: 2-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): TE 914D  with a grade of C (2.0) or better and admission to a single subject credential program.Best practices, evaluation of student work, learning assessments, and pedagogy in secondary English language arts instruction. Maximum Credits: 4

TE 924E.course_name: Advanced Methods in Teaching Physical Education
TE 924E.course_description: TE 924E - Advanced Methods in Teaching Physical Education  Units: 2-4 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): TE 914E  with a grade of C (2.0) or better and admission to a single subject credential program.Best practices, evaluation of student work, learning assessments, and pedagogy in secondary physical education instruction. Maximum Credits: 4

TE 924F.course_description: TE 924F - Advanced Methods in Teaching Music  Units: 2-4 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): TE 914F  with a grade of C (2.0) or better and admission to a single subject credential program.Best practices, evaluation of student work, learning assessments, and pedagogy in secondary music instruction. Maximum Credits: 4

TE 930.course_name: Teaching Reading and Language Arts in the Elementary School
TE 930.course_description: TE 930 - Teaching Reading and Language Arts in the Elementary School  Units: 1-6 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to multiple subject credential program, education specialist credential program, or possession of a teaching credential.Selecting, designing, and evaluating appropriate learning experiences to assure children’s growth in reading and language arts. Includes nature of reading and language arts as a human behavior, various approaches, materials, and techniques used in teaching reading and language arts.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

TE 933.course_name: Teaching of Literacies in the Secondary School
TE 933.course_description: TE 933 - Teaching of Literacies in the Secondary School  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to a credential program.Teacher competencies and skills to include reading/writing and diagnosing literacy needs in content areas. For students completing a credential at SDSU, this course must be taken concurrently with enrollment in first or second semester single subject credential program. Maximum Credits: 3

TE 954.course_name: Humanistic and Social Aspects of Teaching
TE 954.course_description: TE 954 - Humanistic and Social Aspects of Teaching  Units: 2-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to single subject credential program and concurrent registration in TE 922  and TE 963  or upper division standing in the integrated teacher education program (ITEP-SS).Teacher competencies as they relate to values, awareness, self-concept, rights and responsibilities.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 4Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

TE 960.course_description: TE 960 - Basic Student Teaching Seminar  Units: 1-2 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Admission to multiple subject credential program and concurrent registration in TE 965 .Discussion of immediate problems in student teaching with emphasis on children’s growth and development. Maximum Credits: 2

TE 961.course_description: TE 961 - Advanced Student Teaching Seminar  Units: 1-2 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Satisfactory completion of TE 960 , TE 965 ; and concurrent registration in TE 966 .Discussion of immediate problems in student teaching with emphasis on the influence of philosophical, social and cultural factors on learning. Maximum Credits: 2

TE 963.course_description: TE 963 - Secondary School Student Teaching I  Units: 1-12 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to single subject credential program or upper division standing in an integrated teacher education program. To be taken concurrently with TE 922  and  TE 954 . TE 933  is highly recommended to be taken at this time.On-site, part-time experience to implement teacher competencies developed in TE 170  [or CFD 170 ] or TE 922  and TE 954 . Student must provide own transportation to student teaching site. Maximum Credits: 12

TE 964.course_description: TE 964 - Secondary School Student Teaching II  Units: 1-12 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): TE 922 , TE 933 , TE 954 , TE 963 . To be taken concurrently with TE 903 .On-site, full-day experience to implement teacher competencies as developed from the total professional sequence. Student must provide own transportation to student teaching site. Maximum Credits: 12

TE 965.course_name: Basic Student Teaching in Elementary Schools
TE 965.course_description: TE 965 - Basic Student Teaching in Elementary Schools  Units: 1-12 Grading Method: NOG - Cr/NC (No Letter) Prerequisite(s): Admission to multiple subject credential program and concurrent registration in TE 960 . Before enrolling in TE 965, ITEP students must show elementary subject matter competency as determined by earning a grade of C (2.0) or better in each of the following courses: TE 910A , TE 910B , TE 910C , TE 930 ; ECL 306A , ECL 306W ; HIST 411 , HIST 413 ; LING 420 , LING 452 ; MATH 312 , MATH 313 ; and PHYS 412 ; or successfully passed the Elementary Subject Matter exam (i.e., CSET exam).Day-to-day teaching experiences including selected instructional activities for which a teacher in a classroom is normally responsible. Maximum Credits: 9

TE 966.course_name: Advanced Student Teaching in Elementary Schools
TE 966.course_description: TE 966 - Advanced Student Teaching in Elementary Schools  Units: 1-12 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Satisfactory completion of TE 960 , TE 965 , and concurrent registration in TE 961 .Teaching experiences including all the instructional activities for which a teacher in a classroom is normally responsible. Maximum Credits: 12

TE 967.course_description: TE 967 - Elementary School Student Teaching  Units: 15 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Admission to multiple subject credential program and concurrent registration in TE 960  and TE 961 .On-site, full-day teaching experiences. Two consecutive eight week assignments at two different broad levels of schooling. Each eight week assignment will provide typical responsibilities of teachers through a graduated series of experiences, such as class preparation, instruction of students, maintaining accurate student records, attending faculty meetings and parent conferences.

TE 968.course_description: TE 968 - Secondary School Student Teaching  Units: 15 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Admission to single subject credential program and concurrent registration in TE 903 .On-site, full-day teaching experiences. Two consecutive eight week assignments in single subject content area; one in junior high school and one in senior high school. Each eight week assignment will provide typical responsibilities of teachers through a graduated series of experiences, such as class preparation, instruction of students, maintaining accurate student records, attending faculty meetings and parent conferences.

TE 969.course_description: TE 969 - Clinical Practice for Induction  Units: 2-6 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Admission to College of Education induction program.Mentor-supported field experience for novice teachers in fully- accredited K-12 schools in preparation for a clear multiple subject, single subject, and education specialist credential. Advanced teaching strategies. Evaluation based on outcomes-based assessments.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 24Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

TFM 110.course_description: TFM 110 - Writing for Television and Film  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Satisfaction of the SDSU Written Communication Assessment requirement. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required.Theory and practice in writing for electronic and film media. Introduction to techniques of narrative and documentary writing and scripting. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 160.course_description: TFM 160 - Cinema as Art  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Cinema in its diverse forms. Historical and stylistic influences on aesthetic values and social implications of cinema. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 235.course_name: The Art of Creating Emotion in Movies
TFM 235.course_description: TFM 235 - The Art of Creating Emotion in Movies  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Film production for non-majors. Ways filmmakers deploy formal elements of cinema to generate a genre-related emotion such as fear in the horror genre; love in the romance genre.   May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6

TFM 265.course_description: TFM 265 - Cinema in Africa  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Filmmaking in sub-Saharan Africa after colonization. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 267.course_description: TFM 267 - Independent Cinema  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Filmmaking that has declared independence from mainstream aesthetics, industrial conventions, and the political status quo. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 310.course_name: Film, Television, and New Media Criticism
TFM 310.course_description: TFM 310 - Film, Television, and New Media Criticism  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): TFM 160 .Critical approaches to study of film, television, and new media. Analyses of media perspectives, to include ideology, semiotics, genre, gender, and spectatorship. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 314.course_description: TFM 314 - Film and Video Production  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and three or more hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): Open only to television, film and new media majors with an emphasis in production.Aesthetics and practice of film and video production techniques. Instruction in equipment use combined with consideration of aesthetics, visual storytelling, and craft. Attention to development of creative voice and original work. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 321.course_name: Sound Design for Video and Film
TFM 321.course_description: TFM 321 - Sound Design for Video and Film  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and two hours of activity.Digital audio post-production for video, TV, and film. Includes field acquisition, Foley, editing, and assembling. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 322.course_description: TFM 322 - Cinematography for Television and Film  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): TFM 314 .Basic cinematography to include introduction to filmmaking activities, lighting techniques for film and television, specialized studio and location equipment. Exhibitions to include broadcasts, film festivals, and special screenings. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 327.course_description: TFM 327 - Film and Video Editing  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and four hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): TFM 314  (or consent of instructor).Theory and practice of film and video editing. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 330.course_description: TFM 330 - Cultural Aspects of Media  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): TFM 160 .Cultural dimensions of media. Media structures, uses, and effects at national and international levels in a context of humanities and conceptual arts. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 350.course_name: Staging and Art for Television and Film
TFM 350.course_description: TFM 350 - Staging and Art for Television and Film  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and six hours of activity.Aesthetic considerations and technical practices in staging, lighting, and graphics for television and film. Practical experience in university sponsored productions. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 361.course_description: TFM 361 - Studio Production  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and more than three hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): TFM 314 . Open only to television, film and new media majors with an emphasis in production.Multi-camera television production techniques for studio, sound stage, and remote multi-camera production. Responsibilities of producer, director, and production staff. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 362.course_description: TFM 362 - Intermediate Filmmaking  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and more than three hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): TFM 361 . Open only to television, film and new media majors with an emphasis in production.Single camera techniques in production of narrative fiction. Crew-based location and studio production. Responsibilities of producer, director, and key creative production positions.Formerly numbered Television, Film and New Media 360 [previously Television, Film and New Media 260.] Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 363.course_description: TFM 363 - International Cinema  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Construction of foreign film to history and practice of cinema as an art. Film as an expression of national culture.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units of which three units may be applicable to General Education.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

TFM 364A.course_name: History of Film Classics: Early Developments Through the 1950s
TFM 364A.course_description: TFM 364A - History of Film Classics: Early Developments Through the 1950s  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division standing.Viewing and analysis of American and foreign theatrical films which represent milestones in development of cinema. Maximum Credits: 3Maximum Credit Statement: six units from TFM 364, TFM 364A, and TFM 364B.

TFM 364B.course_name: History of Film Classics: 1960s Through Today’s Cinema
TFM 364B.course_description: TFM 364B - History of Film Classics: 1960s Through Today’s Cinema  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division standing.Viewing and analysis of American and foreign theatrical films which represent milestones in development of cinema. Maximum Credits: 3Maximum Credit Statement: six units from TFM 364, TFM 364A, and TFM 364B.

TFM 365.course_description: TFM 365 - New Media Production  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and three hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): ART 348 .Production and visualization of 3D cinematic environments and characters for immersive story driven and interactive media. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 401.course_name: Business Aspects of Television and Film Production
TFM 401.course_description: TFM 401 - Business Aspects of Television and Film Production  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): TFM 361  or TFM 362 . Usually taken concurrently with TFM 560  or TFM 561 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Financing, preproduction planning, postproduction, and distribution of television and film. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 430.course_description: TFM 430 - History of Television  Units: 3 Explorations - Humanities and Fine Arts [CSU C Upper Division]Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Critical survey of television history, from its origins in radio and film, to its contemporary convergence with digital media and the internet. Topics include regulation, media ownership, technology, aesthetics, genre, authorship, advertising, and audiences, with a focus on sociocultural issues. Maximum Credits: 3

WMNST 596.course_description: WMNST 596 - Topics in Women’s Studies  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor.Advanced topics in women’s studies.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

WMNST 597.course_description: WMNST 597 - Research Project  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Six upper division units in women’s studies and consent of adviser.Individual research project. Maximum Credits: 3

WMNST 598.course_description: WMNST 598 - Women’s Studies Internship  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Three upper division units in women’s studies and consent of instructor.Application of women’s studies theories and scholarship to community service and activism. Internship includes 120 hours of work in local public and private agencies serving women and girls. Maximum Credits: 6

WMNST 601.course_description: WMNST 601 - Foundations of Feminist Scholarship  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Theories, issues, and major paradigms underlying feminist scholarship. Development of women’s studies as a discipline. Emphasis on multicultural approaches and perspectives. Maximum Credits: 3

WMNST 602.course_name: Seminar: Methods of Inquiry in Women’s Studies
WMNST 602.course_description: WMNST 602 - Seminar: Methods of Inquiry in Women’s Studies  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Examination and critique of traditional research methods; methods of critical feminist investigation; designs of research proposals. Maximum Credits: 3

WMNST 603.course_name: Seminar: Topics in Advanced Feminist Theory
WMNST 603.course_description: WMNST 603 - Seminar: Topics in Advanced Feminist Theory  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Variable topics in the analysis of categories of contemporary feminist theory including concepts of identity and difference; theories of subjectivity; feminist discourses, strategies, and practices.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

WMNST 604.course_description: WMNST 604 - Seminar: Gender, Culture, and Representation  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Representations of women, gender, and femininity in literature, art, music, and other cultural productions. Interconnection between representations of gender, race, ethnicity, class, and sexualities.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 3Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

WMNST 605.course_description: WMNST 605 - Seminar: Women and Social Policy  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Laws and social policies impacting women and their families in historical and political context. Theoretical and practical implications to include workplace issues, economic justice, health, reproductive justice, violence, and regulation of sexuality and relationships. Maximum Credits: 3

WMNST 606.course_description: WMNST 606 - Seminar: Narrating Women’s Lives  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Exploration of women’s biographies and autobiographies. Theories of narration, identity construction, and oral and written life histories. Interconnection between self-presentation and social, historical, and multicultural institutions and discourses. Maximum Credits: 3

WMNST 607.course_description: WMNST 607 - Seminar: Privilege and Oppression  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.How gender, culture, ethnicity, class, religion, sexualities, and physical challenges define interplay of privilege and oppression. Theoretical and practical implications discussed. Maximum Credits: 3

WMNST 608.course_description: WMNST 608 - Seminar: Body Politics  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Historical exploration illuminates contemporary and past constructions of female, male, and transgendered sexualities. Facilitates ability to critique “innate” vs. culturally constructed behaviors and identities. Key institutions that control and define the body explored: labor, race, economics, law, and medicine. Maximum Credits: 3

WMNST 609.course_name: Seminar: Topics in Transnational Issues and Gender
WMNST 609.course_description: WMNST 609 - Seminar: Topics in Transnational Issues and Gender  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Variable topics in global trends in culture, economy, and politics with focus on women’s lives. Case studies of effect of transnational processes on women and role of gender in shaping these processes.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

WMNST 610.course_description: WMNST 610 - Seminar in Sexuality  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Sexuality and gender identity in diverse individual, social, political, and cultural contexts. Maximum Credits: 3

WMNST 611.course_description: WMNST 611 - Seminar: Gender and Diaspora  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Historical and interdisciplinary perspectives on gendered impact of forcible migration (African, Asian, Jewish). Scholarly debates concerning influence of men’s and women’s experiences of diaspora on modern political identities, social movements, and cultural production.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 3Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

WMNST 612.course_description: WMNST 612 - Seminar: Feminist Pedagogies  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Feminist and interrelated critical pedagogies and their application in the classroom. Teaching from social justice, intersectional, and transnational approaches. Role of identity, difference, power, and embodiment in teaching and learning. Practical teaching skills and wholistic classroom strategies.

WMNST 692.course_description: WMNST 692 - Proseminar and Writing Workshop  Units: 1 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Argument, norms, and styles in academic writing. Professional norms and skills. Maximum Credits: 3

WMNST 696.course_description: WMNST 696 - Selected Topics in Women’s Studies  Units: 3-6 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Intensive study in specific areas of women’s studies, with emphasis on theoretical and methodological issues.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 12Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

WMNST 797.course_description: WMNST 797 - Research  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Advancement to candidacy and written approval of department graduate adviser.Independent research in a specialized subject in women’s studies. Maximum Credits: 3

WMNST 798.course_description: WMNST 798 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of staff; to be arranged with department chair and instructor. Independent study.  Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

WMNST 799A.course_description: WMNST 799A - Thesis  Units: 3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): An officially appointed thesis committee and advancement to candidacy.Preparation of a project or thesis for the master’s degree. Maximum Credits: 3

WMNST 799B.course_description: WMNST 799B - Thesis Extension  Units: 0 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Prior registration in Thesis 799A with an assigned grade symbol of RP.Registration required in any semester or term following assignment of RP in Course 799A in which the student expects to use the facilities and resources of the university; also student must be registered in the course when the completed thesis is granted final approval. Maximum Credits: 0

WMNST 799C.course_description: WMNST 799C - Comprehensive Examination Extension  Units: 0 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Completion or concurrent enrollment in degree program courses.Registration required of students whose only requirement is completion of the comprehensive examination for the master’s degree. Note: Registration in 799C limited to two semesters.

TFM 465.course_description: TFM 465 - Compositing and Visual Effects  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and three hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): TFM 365 .Computer-generated visual effects to include rendering and compositing techniques used in film, new media, and television. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 470.course_description: TFM 470 - Critical Studies of Gender/Sexuality/Media  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): TFM 310  and TFM 330 . Open to television, film and new media majors and minors in upper division standing.Critical approaches to representation, production, and reception of gender and sexuality in film, television and new media, including video games and the Internet. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 490.course_description: TFM 490 - Internship  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): TFM 314  (or consent of instructor).Work with approved agencies off-campus under the combined supervision of agency personnel and instructor. Maximum Credits: 6

TFM 496.course_description: TFM 496 - Experimental Topics  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Upper division standing and consent of instructor.Experimental topics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

TFM 499.course_description: TFM 499 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): TFM 314  (or consent of instructor). Individual study or project, normally in a research area selected by the student.  Maximum Credits: 6

TFM 506.course_description: TFM 506 - Advanced Film Distribution and Marketing  Units: 3 Grading Method: CNO - Letter (No Cr/NC) Prerequisite(s): TFM 401, or instructor approval.Exposure to the inner workings of industry standard film distribution and marketing strategies, processes, and techniques; advanced knowledge and skills to tactically release indie films to audiences worldwide.

TFM 510.course_name: Advanced Script Writing for Television and Film
TFM 510.course_description: TFM 510 - Advanced Script Writing for Television and Film  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): TFM 314  (or consent of instructor).Scripting of dramatic original and adaptation forms, and documentary.  May be repeated. Maximum Credits: six units.

TFM 521.course_name: Advanced Sound Design for Film and Interactive Media
TFM 521.course_description: TFM 521 - Advanced Sound Design for Film and Interactive Media  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): TFM 321  Aesthetics and advanced techniques for designing sounds for moving image and interactive media. Through laboratories and projects, students will learn auralization, composition, design, and synthesis using contemporary tools: audio programming languages, digital audio workstations, and nonlinear editors. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 522.course_description: TFM 522 - Advanced Film and Television Cinematography  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): TFM 314  (or consent of instructor).Art, craft, and industry of cinematography. Telling visual stories with video and film. Attributes and optics of lenses. Qualities and aesthetics of lighting. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 530.course_name: Selected Topics in Genre Studies for Television and Film
TFM 530.course_description: TFM 530 - Selected Topics in Genre Studies for Television and Film  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): TFM 310  and TFM 330 . Open only to television, film and new media majors and minors in upper division standing.Film and television genres (noir, western, comedy, musical, science fiction, soap opera, etc.) including key media texts, aesthetics, themes, history, and social context.  May be repeated with new course content. Maximum Credits: 6Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

TFM 540.course_description: TFM 540 - Documentary Production  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and three or more hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): TFM 314  and TFM 361 .Hands-on field experiences in documentary production to include research and writing techniques, investigative procedures, interviewing, shooting and editing. Analyze significant documentaries. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 550.course_name: Art Direction for Television and Film
TFM 550.course_description: TFM 550 - Art Direction for Television and Film  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and four hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): TFM 350 ; TFM 361  or TFM 362  for television, film and new media majors, and THEA 440  for theatre majors, and consent of instructor. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Aesthetic, technical, and practical aspects of design for television and film. Experience in scenic design, graphics, set decoration, budgeting, and scheduling. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 551.course_name: Production Design for Television and Film
TFM 551.course_description: TFM 551 - Production Design for Television and Film  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): TFM 350  and credit or concurrent registration in TFM 401 .Theory and analysis of production design concepts for television and film. Development of designs and analysis of technical requirements for fictional and nonfictional productions. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 552.course_description: TFM 552 - 3D Digital Storytelling  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and three hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): TFM 365 .Narrative in animation. Pre-production and production techniques in 3D animated film. Maximum Credits: 9

TFM 558.course_name: Costume Design for Television and Film
TFM 558.course_description: TFM 558 - Costume Design for Television and Film  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): THEA 452  and THEA 530A  or THEA 530B .Advanced studies in costume design. Budgeting and departmental management, character development, design problems, materials, production, rendering layout, script breakdowns. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 559.course_name: Digital Design for Film and Stage
TFM 559.course_description: TFM 559 - Digital Design for Film and Stage  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): TFM 350  or THEA 440 .Theories and applications of commonly used 3D modeling programs in the entertainment industry. Maximum Credits: 6Note: See Class Schedule for specific content.

TFM 560.course_description: TFM 560 - Advanced Film  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and more than three hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): TFM 314  and TFM 362 . Open only to television, film and new media majors with an emphasis in production.Practicum in direction and production of dramatic and nondramatic film. Cameras, lighting, design, sound techniques, experience in university sponsored productions. Completion of a short film. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 561.course_description: TFM 561 - Advanced Television  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and more than three hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): TFM 314 . Open only to television, film and new media majors with an emphasis in production.Production processes and techniques to include producing, critical analysis, directing, digital cinematography, and editing of scripted projects. Experience in individual and university-sponsored productions.

TFM 563.course_description: TFM 563 - Documentary: History and Theory  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): TFM 160  for undergraduate students. Admission to the M.A. in television, film and new media for graduate students.Persuasive concepts, techniques, and forms in documentary film. Major historical works and their impact on society.Formerly numbered Television, Film and New Media 462. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 565.course_description: TFM 565 - Advanced New Media  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and three hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): TFM 552 .Practicum in direction and development of immersive live action and 3D computer-generated passive or interactive productions. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 571.course_description: TFM 571 - Selected Topics in Director Studies  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): TFM 310  and TFM 330 . Open only to television, film and new media majors and minors in upper division standing.Historical significance of and theoretical approaches to major media directors (Welles, Hitchcock, Spielberg, etc.) including breadth of work, cultural and generic contexts, aesthetic innovation, and recurring themes.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Note: See Class Schedule for specific topic.

TFM 573.course_name: Selected Topics in History of Film, TV, and Media
TFM 573.course_description: TFM 573 - Selected Topics in History of Film, TV, and Media  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): TFM 310  and TFM 330 . Open only to television, film and new media majors and minors in upper division standing.Media history including cultural and generic developments, patterns of exhibition, technological influences, significant creative and industrial figures, commercial and social contexts.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Note: See Class Schedule for specific topic.

TFM 590.course_description:
TFM 590 - Directing for Film and Television  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and six hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): TFM 314 . Open only to television, film and new media majors with an emphasis in production.
 Directing fundamentals and production to include script analysis, director’s preparation and directing actors. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 596.course_name: Selected Topics in Television, Film and New Media
TFM 596.course_description: TFM 596 - Selected Topics in Television, Film and New Media  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Twelve units in television, film and new media.Specialized study of selected topics from the areas of television, film and new media.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units of 596 applicable to a bachelor’s degree.Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree. Credit for 596 and 696 applicable to a master’s degree with approval of the graduate adviser.

TFM 601.course_description: TFM 601 - Business Aspects of Film  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to M.F.A. program.Business aspects of independent film production to include television and Internet streaming. Culture and practices of the film industry in context of career development. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 605.course_name: Seminar: Production for Television and Film
TFM 605.course_description: TFM 605 - Seminar: Production for Television and Film  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to M.F.A. program.Film and television production. Lectures and production of two short media projects that link research to artistic process and familiarize students with all aspects of the television, film and new media program. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 607.course_description: TFM 607 - Seminar: Intensive Television and Film  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to the MFA in Screen Writing program.Intensive seminar in cinematography, direction, editing, and sound production for television and film. Tools of production culminating in the presentation and critique of students’ creative work. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 610.course_name: Seminar in Writing for Television and Film
TFM 610.course_description: TFM 610 - Seminar in Writing for Television and Film  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to M.F.A. program.Non-dramatic and dramatic structures as they apply to non-fiction and fiction television programs and films. Writing full length script or scenario. Maximum Credits: 3Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

TFM 612.course_name: Seminar in Writing for New Media
TFM 612.course_description: TFM 612 - Seminar in Writing for New Media  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to the graduate program.Narrative and non-narrative writing for new media to include gaming, interactive media, social media, and transmedia formats. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 621.course_description: TFM 621 - Sound Design for Film  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing.Digital audio production for film, to include automated dialog replacement (ADR), field acquisition, Foley, mixing, sound editing, sweetening. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 625.course_name: Seminar: Writing Short Narrative and Documentary Films
TFM 625.course_description: TFM 625 - Seminar: Writing Short Narrative and Documentary Films  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Classified graduate standing.Creating scripts for short narrative films and documentary productions. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 627.course_description: TFM 627 - Film Editing and Postproduction  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing.Theory and practice of film editing to include color grading, digital post-production workflow, sound and picture cutting. Maximum Credits: 4

TFM 662.course_description: TFM 662 - Scene-Based Film Production  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and six or more hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): Graduate standing.Single camera techniques in production of narrative fiction to include scene construction and production roles. Crew-based location and studio production. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 670.course_description: TFM 670 - Seminar: Midway Review Production  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): TFM 605  and TFM 625 .Development and completion of midway project for presentation before faculty jury. Research, presentation and analysis of related work, and creative engagement with material and subject matter to include retrospective written analysis of the work. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 675.course_name: Seminar: Research and Bibliography in Media Production
TFM 675.course_description: TFM 675 - Seminar: Research and Bibliography in Media Production  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): TFM 670  and six units selected from TFM 470 , TFM 530 , TFM 563 , TFM 571 , TFM 573 , and consent of instructor.Methods of research, critical analysis, and writing in relation to creative work.Formerly numbered Television, Film and New Media 600. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 790.course_description: TFM 790 - Portfolio/Examination Preparation  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): TFM 675  with a grade of B (3.0) or better and advancement to candidacy.Supervised preparation for portfolio review and oral defense. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 792.course_description: TFM 792 - MFA Capstone Project  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to the M.F.A. in Screen Writing program.Preparation of a capstone project for the M.F.A. Plan B option. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 793.course_description:
TFM 793 - Capstone Public Presentation  Units: 1 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Admission to the M.F.A. in Screen Writing program.Presentation based on written thesis to include a problem in history, theory, or pedagogy showing evidence of original research (M.F.A. Plan A); presentation of creative work developed in M.F.A. Capstone Project (MFA Plan B).
  Maximum Credits: 1

TFM 797.course_description: TFM 797 - MFA Research  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Admission to M.F.A. in Screen Writing program.Research in preparation for the thesis or capstone project. Maximum Credits: 4

TFM 798.course_description: TFM 798 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Contract required. Arranged with graduate coordinator in area of study. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6Maximum Credit Statement: six units applicable to a master’s degree.

TFM 799A.course_description: TFM 799A - Thesis or Project  Units: 3 Grading Method: RPC: Available grades are RP, CR or NC Prerequisite(s): An officially appointed thesis committee and advancement to candidacy.Preparation of a project or thesis for the master’s degree. Maximum Credits: 3

TFM 799B.course_description: TFM 799B - Thesis or Project Extension  Units: 0 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): Prior registration in Thesis or Project 799A with an assigned grade symbol of RP.Following assignment of RP in Course 799A, registration in this course is required in any semester in which the student expects to use the facilities and resources of the university; also student must be registered in this course when the completed thesis or project is granted final approval. Maximum Credits: 0

THEA 100.course_description: THEA 100 - The Art of Theatre  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Introduction to theatre as a reflection of society and a contributor to the world of art. Students explore theatre’s continuing relevance to contemporary culture. Attendance at selected theatre events required. Maximum Credits: 3

THEA 111.course_description: THEA 111 - Voice and Movement  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Open to majors in the School of Theatre, Television, and Film only.Project-based preparation of physical and vocal instrument for acting. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Not open to students with credit in Theatre 110.

THEA 115.course_description: THEA 115 - Acting for Nonmajors  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Improvisational exercises (verbal and nonverbal) in sensory awareness, observation, concentration, listening, and response skills with application to other fields. Individual presentation techniques for the preprofessional in other disciplines. Maximum Credits: 3

THEA 120.course_description: THEA 120 - Heritage of Storytelling  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Three lectures and attendance at selected performances.Survey of significant concepts over a wide history of theatre, television, and film. Analysis of classical, contemporary, realistic, and avant-garde examples; exploring influence of historical narrative forms on contemporary storytelling. Maximum Credits: 3

THEA 130.course_description: THEA 130 - Acting I  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Development of individual’s ability to express thought and emotion through effective use of the voice and body. These fundamental concepts may be applied to stage, film, and television acting. Maximum Credits: 3

THEA 205.course_name: American Musical on Stage and Screen
THEA 205.course_description: THEA 205 - American Musical on Stage and Screen  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available.
