The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Shows, films, and performers that trace the evolution of this unique American art form from its origins to contemporary Broadway, film, and pop culture, utilizing live performance and digital media. Maximum Credits: 3

THEA 231.course_description: THEA 231 - Acting II  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): THEA 111  and THEA 130 .Continuation of THEA 130 , emphasizing application of fundamental skills to problems of text analysis, subtext, playing action, characterization, and ensemble work. Maximum Credits: 3

THEA 240.course_description: THEA 240 - Theatre Design and Technology I  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): THEA 120 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required:  Copy of transcript.Design, technical practices, and production organization for the theatre. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Not open to students with credit in Theatre 240A, 240B, or 240C.

THEA 296.course_description: THEA 296 - Experimental Topics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Selected topics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

THEA 299.course_description: THEA 299 - Special Study  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of School of Theatre, Television, and Film director, and instructor. Individual study.

THEA 310.course_description: THEA 310 - Creative Drama I  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Current philosophies, principles, and techniques of creative drama. Development of the individual through use of dramatic play, imagination, improvisation, and theatre games. Applicable to classroom teaching, counseling, recreation, and senior citizen programs. Maximum Credits: 3

THEA 315.course_description: THEA 315 - Theatre for Young Audiences  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Current philosophies and practices in theatre for young audiences. Techniques of selecting and producing plays for and with youth. Theatre styles, script analysis, and functions of the production team. Maximum Credits: 3

THEA 320A.course_name: Advanced Voice and Text for Actors: Select Heightened Speech From the Greeks to Today
THEA 320A.course_description: THEA 320A - Advanced Voice and Text for Actors: Select Heightened Speech From the Greeks to Today  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): THEA 111 , THEA 130 ; or by audition.Techniques of vocal expression in the theatre, primarily in plays with heightened and elevated speech, e.g. Shakespeare and classic Greek drama. Maximum Credits: 3

THEA 325.course_description: THEA 325 - Script Analysis  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): THEA 120   and completion of lower division writing competency requirement. Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Analysis of representative plays with emphasis on plot and character development, dramatic structure, action, and style. Maximum Credits: 3

THEA 332.course_description: THEA 332 - Acting III  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): THEA 130 , THEA 231 , and by audition.Continuation of THEA 130  and THEA 231 , emphasizing analysis of literary text in process of creating characters. Scene study and role preparation of significant texts by modern playwrights.  May be repeated once with consent of instructor. Maximum Credits: 6

THEA 335.course_description: THEA 335 - Stage Management-Theory  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Development of the prompt script, organizational methods, and collaborative personnel interaction. Maximum Credits: 6

THEA 336.course_description: THEA 336 - Stage Management-Practicum  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Six hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): THEA 240 .Practical experience in stage managing department productions. Maximum Credits: 6

THEA 345.course_description: THEA 345 - Theatre Marketing and Publicity  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and four hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): THEA 100 .Practical experience in marketing and publicity for theatres, including PSAs, press releases, layout-graphics for written materials, magazine and newspaper advertisements, marketing strategy and campaign development for a full theatre season. Maximum Credits: 3

THEA 349.course_description: THEA 349 - Theatrical Makeup  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two hours per unit.Prerequisite(s): THEA 240 .Planning and application of makeup for stage, film, and television. Classroom exercises and production-related activities. Maximum Credits: 2

THEA 350.course_description: THEA 350 - Musical Theatre Performance I  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): By audition.Basic performance techniques in musical theatre. Application of acting theory to musical theatre literature. Maximum Credits: 6

THEA 351.course_description: THEA 351 - Musical Theatre Performance II  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): THEA 350  and by audition.Basic performance techniques in musical theatre. Vocal/performance style and vocal production related to period/style musical theatre literature, solo/group/audition presentation. Maximum Credits: six units.

THEA 353.course_description: THEA 353 - Musical Theatre Dance  Units: 2 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC  Two hours of activity per unit.Musical theatre dance techniques to include classic jazz and ballet. Movement vocabulary and choreographic styles utilized in musical theatre production. Maximum Credits: 16

THEA 355.course_description: THEA 355 - Movement for the Theatre I  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two hours of activity per unit.Prerequisite(s): By audition.Activities to develop physical skills of the performer. Links between imagination, movement, and body expression leading to character development. Maximum Credits: 4

THEA 359.course_description: THEA 359 - Directing I  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): THEA 240 , THEA 325 ; or TFM 314 . Proof of completion of prerequisite(s) required: Copy of transcript.Principles and techniques of directing for the stage: play selection, analysis, and interpretation; casting methods; stage composition and movement; and rehearsal procedures. Maximum Credits: 3

THEA 427.course_description: THEA 427 - African American Theatre and Performance  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC An exploration into the historical, political, and social struggles that have inspired the creation of African American Theatre. Students will be encouraged to seek, develop and express their own creative voices. Maximum Credits: 3

THEA 431.course_description: THEA 431 - Workshop in Improvisational Acting  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): THEA 332  and by audition.Theories and principles of improvisational acting. Maximum Credits: 3

THEA 434.course_name: Audition and Business Skills for the Actor
THEA 434.course_description: THEA 434 - Audition and Business Skills for the Actor  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): THEA 332 .Auditioning and interviewing for stage and screen; selecting audition pieces, rehearsing, performing auditions. Business skills of audition process; researching individual marketability, branding, networking to secure auditions and representation. Maximum Credits: 3

THEA 435.course_description: THEA 435 - Acting on Camera  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): THEA 111 , THEA 120 , THEA 130 ; TFM 160 .Director-actor-camera collaborations in rehearsal and performance, using single or multi camera television technique. Techniques for preparing and performing monologues and scenes with practical experience in front of and behind the camera. Maximum Credits: 3

THEA 438.course_description: THEA 438 - Shakespeare Touring Production  Units: 2 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit  Four hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): THEA 100 , THEA 120 ; TFM 160 .Participate in high school outreach touring production. Maximum Credits: 2

THEA 440.course_description: THEA 440 - Scene Design I  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): THEA 240 , THEA 325 .Techniques and procedures in application of design, color, and perspective in designing scenery. Maximum Credits: 3

THEA 442A.course_name: Practicum in Theatrical Production: Scenery Construction
THEA 442A.course_description: THEA 442A - Practicum in Theatrical Production: Scenery Construction  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two hours of activity per unit.Prerequisite(s): THEA 240 .Technical theatre production experience for departmental public performances. Maximum Credits: 2

THEA 442B.course_name: Practicum in Theatrical Production: Costume Construction
THEA 442B.course_description: THEA 442B - Practicum in Theatrical Production: Costume Construction  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two hours of activity per unit.Prerequisite(s): THEA 240 .Technical theatre production experience for departmental public performances. Maximum Credits: 2

THEA 446A.course_description: THEA 446A - Practicum in Performance: Stage Crew  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): THEA 240 .Practical experience in departmental public performances. Maximum Credits: 4

THEA 446B.course_description: THEA 446B - Practicum in Performance: Costume Crew  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  One lecture and two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): THEA 240 .Practical experience in departmental public performances. Maximum Credits: 4

THEA 446C.course_description: THEA 446C - Practicum in Performance: Cast Member  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit  Two hours per unit.Prerequisite(s): By audition.Practical experience in departmental public performances. Maximum Credits: 16

THEA 447.course_description: THEA 447 - Lighting Design I  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): THEA 240 , THEA 325 .Concepts and technologies in lighting for theatre and related performance areas. Emphasis on mechanics of stage lighting, color, instruments, and control. Laboratory and production related activities. Maximum Credits: 3

THEA 448.course_description: THEA 448 - Theatre Technology  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Four hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): THEA 240 .Current materials and practices of theatre technology. Advanced construction techniques; stage machinery design and control; special effects; computer applications for stage operations; budget, research, and management procedures. Maximum Credits: 2

THEA 449.course_description: THEA 449 - Portfolio Preparation and Exit Interview  Units: 1 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Senior standing and THEA 440 , THEA 447 , or THEA 452 .Transition to the industry of design and technology for theatre, television, and film by examining the self-marketing materials required to enter the workforce after graduation. Culmination in exit interview. Maximum Credits: 1

THEA 450.course_description: THEA 450 - Musical Theatre Performance III  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): THEA 351  and by audition.Advanced rehearsal/performance techniques in musical theatre. Performance style, vocal production, and staging relating to musical theatre literature: duet and small group presentation. Maximum Credits: 6

THEA 451.course_description: THEA 451 - Musical Theatre Performance IV  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): THEA 450  and by audition.Advanced rehearsal/performance techniques in musical theatre. Collaboration, performance preparation, acting/singing styles, vocal production, and staging that result in a final performance for an audience. Maximum Credits: 6

THEA 452.course_description: THEA 452 - Costume Design I  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and three hours of laboratory.Prerequisite(s): THEA 240 , THEA 325 .Theory and creative application of principles of costume design for various types of production. Emphasis on concept development, character interpretation, research methods, color organization, and fabric selection. Laboratory and production related activities. Maximum Credits: 3

THEA 459.course_description: THEA 459 - Directing II  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): THEA 359  and consent of instructor.Experience and group evaluation in directing one-act plays before an audience. Attendance at selected public performances required. Maximum Credits: 6

THEA 460A.course_description: THEA 460A - History of the Theatre  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Theatre from ancient times to the present. Special attention given to the theatre as a mirror of the social and cultural background of various countries and periods in which it is studied. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Theatre 460A is not prerequisite to THEA 460B .

THEA 460B.course_description: THEA 460B - History of the Theatre  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Theatre from ancient times to the present. Special attention given to the theatre as a mirror of the social and cultural background of various countries and periods in which it is studied. Maximum Credits: 3Note: THEA 460A  is not prerequisite to Theatre 460B.

THEA 465.course_description: THEA 465 - Theatre of Diversity  Units: 3 GEGrading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): THEA 325  for theatre majors.Racial, ethnic, political, and social diversity of American landscape as reflected in works of major playwrights of diversity. Maximum Credits: 3Note: This course satisfies the general education cultural diversity requirement.

THEA 470.course_name: Facility Operations and Management for Theatre
THEA 470.course_description: THEA 470 - Facility Operations and Management for Theatre  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): THEA 240 .Leadership, managing creative teams, budgeting, scheduling, liability and safety, co-producing, special event and corporate entertainment production management. Front of house operations to include house management, box office operations, ticketing, budgeting and reporting. Maximum Credits: 6

THEA 476.course_name: Event Coordination and the Entertainment Industry
THEA 476.course_description: THEA 476 - Event Coordination and the Entertainment Industry  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and two hours of activity.All aspects of producing special events, including venue designs and planning, managerial roles of entertainment industry, and how venue planning affects business decisions of these various managers. Maximum Credits: 3

THEA 490.course_description: THEA 490 - Theatre Internship  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: CNC: Credit/No Credit Prerequisite(s): THEA 325 ; internship contract must be completed prior to registration.Work with approved theatre organizations off-campus under the combined supervision of theatre personnel and instructors. Maximum Credits: 3

THEA 496.course_description: THEA 496 - Experimental Topics  Units: 1-4 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Selected topics.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 9Note: See Class Schedule for specific content. Limit of nine units of any combination of 296, 496, 596 courses applicable to a bachelor’s degree.

THEA 499.course_description: THEA 499 - Special Study  Units: 1-3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): Consent of instructor. Individual study.  Maximum Credits: 6

THEA 510.course_description: THEA 510 - Creative Drama and Language Arts  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): THEA 310  or THEA 315 .Advanced techniques in using creative drama to teach literature and language. Emphasis on use of drama in teaching of reading and world literature. Practical experience through fieldwork in elementary or middle school classrooms. Maximum Credits: 3

THEA 515.course_description: THEA 515 - Playwriting  Units: 3 Grading Method: LTR: Letter Graded. The class will be offered for letter grade with no option to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): THEA 325  or graduate standing.Writing for the stage and public presentation. Characterization, dialogue, and formal experimentation when writing short plays. Maximum Credits: 3

THEA 525.course_description: THEA 525 - Dramaturgy  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): THEA 325  or graduate standing.Theory and application of various aspects of dramaturgy and theatre literary management. Production-oriented synthesis of advanced text analysis, dramatic theory and criticism, historical research, and dramatic literature. Attendance at select plays required.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6

THEA 530A.course_name: Period Dress and DŽcor: Ancient World Through Eighteenth Century
THEA 530A.course_description: THEA 530A - Period Dress and DŽcor: Ancient World Through Eighteenth Century  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): THEA 240  or graduate standing.Visual survey of relationships and cultural significance of period dress, architecture, and decorative arts as applied to theatrical productions. Emphasis on significant historic periods in dramatic literature. Maximum Credits: 3Note: Theatre 530A is not open to students with credit in Theatre 530.

THEA 530B.course_name: Period Dress and DŽcor: NeoClassical Through Twentieth Century
THEA 530B.course_description: THEA 530B - Period Dress and DŽcor: NeoClassical Through Twentieth Century  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): THEA 240  or graduate standing.Visual survey of relationships and cultural significance of period dress, architecture, and decorative arts as applied to theatrical productions. Emphasis on significant historic periods in dramatic literature. Maximum Credits: 3

THEA 532.course_name: Advanced Topics in Stage and Screen Performance
THEA 532.course_description: THEA 532 - Advanced Topics in Stage and Screen Performance  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Two lectures and two hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): THEA 332  and either THEA 320  or THEA 355 .Theory and practice in performance from theatre, television, and film to include physical theatre, voice and speech, film and theatre performance styles, intercultural theatre, devised work.  May be repeated with new content. Maximum Credits: 6

THEA 533.course_name: Theory and Styles in Acting and Directing
THEA 533.course_description: THEA 533 - Theory and Styles in Acting and Directing  Units: 3 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC Prerequisite(s): THEA 332  and either THEA 320A  or THEA 355 .Acting and directing challenges in theory and style related to the production of plays from great periods in theatre history, with attention to characterization, creative directing, dramatic values, and production approaches.Formerly numbered Theatre 533A Maximum Credits: 9

THEA 535.course_name: Wig Construction and Period Hair Styling
THEA 535.course_description: THEA 535 - Wig Construction and Period Hair Styling  Units: 2 Grading Method: LCR: Letter Grade with Cr/NC available. The grading default for the class will be letter grade, but students can opt to take it for Cr/NC  Four hours of activity.Prerequisite(s): THEA 240   or Graduate standing.Wig construction and period hairstyling for the entertainment industry. History of hairstyles and the social function of follicle aesthetics of various cultures from antiquity through the twenty-first century. Maximum Credits: 6
